GevXVgkLUrPOnZzHb70vpw.text: This has been a favorite place for hubby and I to enjoy a delicious meal on several occasions, so was a little surprised to have a less-than exemplary experience when we took an out of town guest for dinner the other night.   Service was great and ambiance is very nice, but my meal of the chef's seafood special turned out to be just ok with small-ish mussels, a few shrimp, and very little salmon.  I got through my meal and realized it was mostly potatoes, but kept searching for more seafood!   Hubby said his chicken was delish and our guest enjoyed the fish tacos. I didn't want to embarrass or guest by complaining, but I'll stick with their delicious steaks or chicken next time.  Oh, and be warned about heavy garlic with the ceasar salad. I LOVE garlic, but it was a bit much even for me!

nVgmscfIF7EZdUiqx3V-QA.text: Great food nice atmosphere, it gets sooo busy during happy hours so come early. The crowd is generally retirees who stand over you for a seat. However I live their fish tacos and bad ass burger!

eC_UDZiDm3oVaiyg8zqtuA.text: Food was phenomenal. Service was great. Our waiters name was Daryl and he gave us the out of town experience we were looking for. The steak was too kill for!

dWYk6wdqvYsRe38od2ml1Q.text: Great happy hour, good wine list and food is excellent. Perfect for a date night. The bar was so fun and festive. Definitely will go back.

0hRDVeAZ9gxmFXCvLvIHWg.text: Roaring Fork was another Arizona Restaurant Week stop for me. The location is great and parking was easy to find. We were greeted by two friendly hostesses that informed us the dining room was full but we were free to look around the bar or patio. We immediately found a great spot in the bar. I personally like the bar better because it has a lot more of a relaxed atmosphere and I don't feel like I have to be so uptight. I got the tortilla soup as my first course which was very uniquely presented. It came in a bowl with the broth on the side. The soup had tortilla strips, chicken, avocado, corn, and some other tasty things and the broth was poured over everything at the table. No joke, this was probably the best I've ever had! I did not want to share! For my entree I got the sugar crusted duck (cooked rare of course). I love duck. Like, you just can't go wrong with it. The skin was crispy and flavorful and the meat was tender and delicious. It came with green chili mac & cheese which was truly one of the best things I've  had in recent memory.   I have to take a moment to talk about my dining companions steak. He ordered the ribeye medium rare and when I asked him how it was he replied "really good but over cooked just a little bit." Now understand, I am a rare meat eating kind of girl and when I tried it I have to say it was one of the most flavorful steaks I've ever had! We both acknowledged how flavor almost never trumps how a steak is cooked but in this case we didn't even consider sending it back. I'm glad I tried this place through Arizona Restaurant Week and look forward to coming back and trying the rest of the menu!

qSkxZVLLFGNR2lq5a6ZHlw.text: This is probably my favorite restaurant in Scottsdale. The food is delicious and the service is exceptional. We really enjoy happy hour there as you can get some great food and drinks at a reasonable price. Come early as the place fills up fast. There is even a waiting line for happy hour during the weekends. They do have outdoor seating with misters. Our favorite happy hour food is the green chili pork and the big ass burger if we're really hungry. We've been regulars for at least 15 years.

v01cHjxKLgjc_c1PVrYKGw.text: The restaurant was packed on a weekday evening which I took as a good sign.    We sat in the bar and got there just in time for the end of Happy Hour. The restaurant interior (very nice) reminds me of something you'd see in a ski town  (e.g. antler chandeliers).    I had the Tortilla soup and the Rotisserie Chicken Flatbread.     The broth for the soup is actually poured tableside into a bowl piled with chicken and tortilla strips.    The chicken is excellent and the broth was flavorful but it could have been hotter.    The flatbread was very large; I would not order it again.   The cheese had an odd texture as if it wasn't real cheese.  My husband had the Big Burger which he loved but could not finish.   Unfortunately we did not have room for dessert but I'll definitely try something next time.

nNlSp_Qcc2GEqvf45MjAGA.text: I LOVE this place. Whether you are a local or a winter visitor, you can't go wrong with Roaring Fork (RF).    1.  They have THE BEST happy hour.  $10 Big Ass Burger and $8 green chilie pork are the favorites.  Everyone LOVES the HH food - it is top quality.  I do the $5 vodka martini - very generous pour. HH is from 4 - 7 Tues through Sat. HH is all night long on Sun and Mon. 2.  The barendars are THE BEST. George, Stefan, Derek, Christine, and Mark, make every customer feel special. 3. The dinner menu is stellar and have enough variety for your entire party. 4. Based on all the above, the place is PACKED at all times. Plan accordingly.

stGJ9nXutSA4kAxTmvgOEw.text: Had a great experience at Roaring Fork. Nice atmosphere,  subdued lighting,  optional patio, and open kitchen. We had fish tacos and the apple Waldorf salad with a glass of wine and a soda.  Amazing fish tacos,  wonderful flavor and texture. The remoulade was perfect with the fish. The portion was perfect, went well with the assorted bread basket earlier. The salad was loaded with apples and walnuts, flavor,  cheese, avocado, grapes,  egg etc...not lacking! Great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish tacos
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Waldorf salad

Z9NcTu9KYPxrpVBsrcAnuA.text: Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.  Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.i went there had there spit chicken awful and their blackberry lemonade made me choke on the syrup not real blackberry never again

gmnraD5m8C7eoa-vQ4yqDQ.text: Made reservations, then opted to sit on the patio (open seating) because it was such a beautiful weather night. Let the hostess know when we sat down, then took 25 minutes for waitress #1 to come out and give us our menus. Since we had so much time to look over the menu, we ordered right away. 20 minutes after ordering, still no salads. 10 minutes after that, waitress #1 comes out and had no idea we hadn't gotten our first course. Salad comes out, then another 30 minutes to get the main course. Waitress #2 now serving us along with waiter #1. Apparently our waitress #1 went home sick, which is fine, except that she had both handled our food plus not let anyone know she had left. It could have been made up for, however the food was extremely disappointing. Like, 10/10 for description, and 2/10 for actual flavor. Really disappointing, I'd been looking forward to coming here for a long time. Definitely not coming back nor recommending.

7OSOiI8g16KeEU3muhiRAQ.text: My wife and I came here as a staycation dinner night for out 5 year anniversary. Amazing drinks (best margarita I have ever had), incredible food, and the service was impeccable. Our server Shea made our experience the best we have ever had at any restaurant, not even close. The half chicken is amazing and the queso con puerco is delicious! Highly recommend this place for a date night or special occasion when you have the money to splurge!

g7-kw1TlnZLvSQ1D6Q8Zkw.text: The Mahi Mahi fish tacos. Period.  Wow! I loved my fish tacos! I did not expect to find such a thing in the middle of the desert. I went solo and sat in the patio which was pretty nice (closed off in winter with fire going to stay warm). The waitress was attentive and pleasant. The chocolate torte was oh-la-la good! It is at the bottom of an office complex which was hard for me to find at first, but I had no issue with parking when I did (office hours were over).   Apparently this is also supposed to be in Austin, so I plan to try the Austin one on my next trip that way!

HsOtd3O0yb-XtzRsdJfnvg.text: OMG! These people don't play! Came here for happy hour and if was off the chain! Big ass burger and huckleberry margarita were the bombdizzle! They don't skimp on the alchohol! Drink totally worth it! Burger with tender beef, roaster green pepper, homemade fries with yummy aioli ! Heaven!  Ambience : lots of old folks but we came for the food !  Dress code: think tommy banana for guys and for girls... Whateva!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

U8MbC2dN6LuxWwGQL7ARJA.text: love this place...will be there for their Labor Day special, which I have learned need to book in advance... Been there multiple times for HH, the only suggestion that I gave to the manager, that possible have a some sort of barrier, when people wait in line for HH, since people love to cut in, when that cow bell rings....but truly a fantastic place

BdBod3tTZyqCxgsHfcGXkA.text: Awesome Bacon wrapped pork medallions, and nice local beers.  Definitely recommend for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

cu9P3OYipoEixj3z6jKQWw.text: Good ribs and happy hour pork sliders.  At 4 they ring this bell and the herd hurries to the trough. Wierd experience but worth the humiliation. Queso de porque was amazing.

t-L2mUod5JwV7T7sivKjkw.text: There is another one of these in Austin, we went to that one and loved it so we took my parents here in Scottsdale, it was amazing both times. We had the green chili Mac and cheese, the kettle of green chili pork, and all had a "big ass burger". We loved it but my parents burgers were overcooked, the waiter was amazing and not only brought them sides to snack but also removed their food from the bill. That's what you call a great waiter.   Will definitely be coming back!!

qWVe2S53HZYuoslVSE2cdw.text: Can't even get in. The happy hour system is atrocious. Seating isn't done by staff. Essentially, you're allowed to walk through once but then must wait in the lobby. If there's a jerk in the lobby, they'll muscle past you no matter how long you've been waiting. Staff don't help you. Just because you don't pay full price, you should apparently expect a poor experience.

qcTEmSCTSYJl3lbtOYOUJg.text: This is without a doubt one of the best restaurants in Scottsdale. I recommend going on sun/mon and asking for Christian at the bar. The food is exceptional and the service is second to none.

pN0rnkgENKhik-j8plav2w.text: I had never been to Roaring Fork so I was really excited to find out that my boyfriend was taking me to dinner here. We arrived around 7:30 on a Saturday night, without reservations, and of course, all of the seating in the dining room was busy for about another hour, but there was plenty of space in the bar area so we just opted to sit there. The lighting in Roaring Fork is dim, giving it a warm, comfortable yet sophisticated ambiance. Our bartender/waiter was super friendly, along with the other staff that helped us out along the way, we had great conversations with all of them all night.  We started off with the Kettle of Green Chili Pork that comes with super soft and warm tortillas. It also come garnished with a roasted pepper. Now, I thought to myself "I wonder if I can eat this" and proceeded to ask this question out loud to my incredibly thoughtful and caring boyfriend, who respond "yeah, its just a green pepper". Well, guess what, it's not a green pepper, but rather a roasted serrano pepper so I can't really tell you if this appetizer was delicious because my mouth was on fire (I'm also kind of a wuss when it comes to pepper heat). I'm assuming it was because of all the other Yelp reviews and also the fact that the boyfriend finished off the app just fine without me despite laughing hysterically the entire time - dick.   By the time my entree arrived, I started to get feeling back in my mouth and was able to enjoy the Spit Roasted Half Chicken which came with veggies and corn bread Stuffing. Oh my goodness, the chicken was yummy, but that corn bread stuffing was amazeballs that I wish I could order that up as a side dish! So good! The boyfriend ordered the Braised Beef Short Ribs that came with mashed potatoes. He enjoyed his, but was impressed with the corn bread stuffing as well. For desert we opted for their gelato which is made by Talenti. We got the Sea Salt Caramel and Banana gelato which were both so delicious. The Caramel one came with mini chocolate covered sea salt caramel truffles and the Banana came with caramel ribbon swirl and pieces of chocolate. We were both happy we decided to stay here for dessert and would definitely get both gelato options again!  Amazing food, great service, will be back for dinner and would love to try their happy hour!

JVnjr4FlxW_F_z4TiVDTkA.text: Had a great time here. The Kettle of Green Chili Pork is outstanding. Spectacular fresh tortillas served with it. The spinach chicken Waldorf salad was equally as good (very large portion you can split).   The Barramundi fish entree (seasonal special) was just okay, not my favorite; sort of a mix between a halibut and a sea bass, but not as moist as sea bass (like I would have hoped for). For dessert we split the Pecan Pie which was accompanied by dulche de leche ice cream. It's not a big piece but is dense and rich. Scrumptious!   5 star appetizer 5 star first course 2 star entree 5 star dessert 5 star service

7BSRt1zb1RaZJ9aanfd_0Q.text: Scottsdale is our second home so when we have been coming here for the past 20 plus years we always loved dining at Roaring Fork for dinner or sometimes happy hour. This year I was very disappointed in the Roaring Fork. The only few things I can say that I still love about this place is the quality of beef that they serve. It's aged and couldn't be better. Now let's get down to our disappointments this time. The three young girls who were the hostesses was the first sign that things have gone south. When entering any restaurant it's like entering someone's home and the greeting is the first impression. These girls did not smile once they were aloof and rude. They actually did their job right but had very poor people skills. They all need to go to sweet smiling school for sour apples. The lovely porterhouse was ruined by the way the chef cooked it. There was so much grease or butter cooked with the meat that it made a beautiful steak greasy and dripping with too much butter. It was too heavy. This spinach and onion side was so salty we couldn't eat it. The twice-baked potatoes was overcooked and the cheese topping was chewy hard. The service was good and the cocktails were nice but there are so many other restaurants in this town that exceed The Roaring Fork now. They need to get it together. There's a lot of good competition out there.

13lkb8ZAOveFPM7woprqew.text: I booked a dinner for 20 people.  I had a great experience dealing with the reservation as well as dinner that night.  Matt was our waiter and he was excellent - personable, great service, honest suggestions.  With large parties you usually feel ignored, rushed or pushed to order more and more from the bar... we all had a great, tasty dinner (with enough to drink from the bar!).  Sitting on the patio was nice - not too loud and not too hot.

12BaW9KkqhIYA-SYHEx6Ew.text: Went here when I was in Scottsdale last month on a business trip after hearing about it from co-workers.  Needless to say, the Roaring Fork didn't disappoint.  First of all the service was awesome.  Our waitress not only helped me decide on what to order, but her suggestions were spot-on.  My boss and I split the Ahi Tuna Quesadilla and the Green Chile Mac & Cheese.  Mind you, I'm not a huge mac & cheese fan, but this was really good.  If I ate this more often, I could learn to be a fan.  Enjoyed the Boneless Buttermilk Chicken with smashed potatoes and Peppercorn Gravy.  It was delicious.  I wanted the Big Ass Burger, but the Chicken was incredible and I'm happy I ordered it.  My boss ordered the fish taco's which he said were just perfect.

BxuCkMSfVl38uhCZ--aabA.text: My favorite neighborhood restaurant. Food is awesome and the staff is very friendly. Green Chili Pork and the Big Ass Burger are amazing with a Goose Island Belgian Style Ale.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yum, green chili pork and Goose Island Belgian style ale. Awesome.

ZXERIVjCe2fG3fWTQlvVzQ.text: If you live in the Phoenix area, I imagine this would be a good consistent place to eat a nice dinner. If you are visiting, like us, we were a little disappointed. Grant it - the food was good, the service was excellent (although our server did not have much of a personality and made it very transactional), and the ambiance nice. But there was nothing about this restaurant that would make me go again. The food was your average steakhouse food, and although it was all prepared well, there was nothing unique about it. If you are looking for something different, this may not be the place for you.

spoTWMFZFOIZR2kdAk_mkw.text: Ok, so this was my very first time at the RF and I thought it was a blast. Maybe it's because I was brought here on a date and was totally spoiled to the max!   I still give this place a 4-star rating because the overall experience at the end of the night was amazing!   CON:  However, we didn't make reservations and went around 6 p.m., it was Happy Hour and the bar was pact to the brim. We were told that the next reservation open would be at 8:30 p.m. and we didn't want to wait, so the waitress told us  that the bar and patio tables were first-come, first-serve. There were no tables open for us and we couldn't even make it to the bar to put in some drink orders, some customers were rude and it really agitated me and I thought this whole experience was going to suck... EDIT: Also, the waitress, well, we hardly saw her.  PRO: The BF, on the other hand, thought that it would be a better idea to go shopping  and then come back later during the 8:30 reservation time. And boy was he right. What a difference it made to be at the restaurant from a different perspective, no crowd shoving, rude people, etc.  DRINKS: -The BF had several different kinds of beers (I tried a bit of them all), but we were a bit disappointed that they didn't have any on tap.   -I had the "Octoberfest" I don't remember who made it, but the beer tasted a bit sweet, kinda chocalateee' -I also had a "Prickly Pear Mojito" which was very good, but a little too sweet for my taste, oh and the bartender was pretty generous too!   FOOD:  We had a three-course meal!  -For our appetizer they gave us bread and butter, and then we ordered "The New Mexico Fondue Pot Lamb Chops" (three piecesof lamb and some bits of chili pastacio bread, rosemary bruchette and butternut squash) and boy was that tasty. -The BF ordered a the "BIg Ass Burger" and I ordered probably the most expensive thing on the menu, the "Filet Mignon". I ordered it 'blue', my favorite way, and yes, they got it right! (it was just  tad salty, but still really yummy!) -For a side, we shared the "Green Chili Macaroni, which we barely finished, but made for an excellent (thick) late night snack. (microwaved)  - Dor dessert, I ordered a Brownie (Lava cake), a la mode! It went excellent with coffee, especially since it was very sweet and thick (very rich). The BF was way to full to help me eat it, so sadly, a lot of it was left behind.     ATMOSPHERE: Loved, loved, loved the dark warm cozy feel! The antler chandeliers were a nice touch as well :)  PRICE: I would say expenisive, or at least the way I ate! But then again, I didn't get the chance to participate in HH. I suggest that if you plan to do the HH, you get there at 4 p.m. (when the RF opens and when HH starts)

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brownie (Lava)
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. N.M. Fondue Pot
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Filet Mignon

PKIwVP_Sny_wZujDzna1Bw.text: $17 is a lot of money for carnitas and a side. But it's worth it. Beans and I don't mix well, so I subbed them out for green chili pork (no upcharge!) with no trouble. Service was good, food was good, atmosphere was good. There's really not anything I can fault here.

1V2nFp4vZiUXYSeNYB3cZw.text: I wasn't impressed with the Roaring Fork's menu. They don't have a vegetarian entree option.  I ended up getting a side of Mexican Street Corn (which was really well seasoned and cooked), a side of Spinach and Onion, and Mashed Potatoes. Dinner of champions! Everything tasted great, but I found it annoying that there wasn't ONE entree option.  They also give you a great bread basket with out of this world corn muffins. I gave a star just for them.  The decor of the restaurant is really nice and they have a nice patio that is heated/cooled.

i2c7NjRjQOMY9IE4Weodvw.text: Older crowd and older atmosphere.. Overall, it worked out fine.  The food was fine and the drinks were fine.  Ordered the big burger and yes it was big and filling for $10.  The place was crowded.  Service was fine.  Just older overall.

Qj5XEKv1naLqTeax9P8FBA.text: This place is okay.  Food is fair, service fair but slow, drinks ( weak ), price a little high.  I have gone for happy hour a few times and the burger is good but after that very disappointing.  Modeled a little after Houston's that where the comparisons stop.... Food is nowhere near Houston's.  Drinks are all water and they charge you for a double if you order vodka on the rocks... Really!!!  My advise head down to old town.... It is 1 mile south!

7slqwyWUwdRMAmKKeojAdg.text: Wow, where do I start?  This place is incredible.  It's located in a weird spot, and the bathrooms are in the middle of a commercial building, but everything else is 5 stars.   We had the fried chicken, the salmon and the filet, all were epic.  The salmon being the biggest surprise and the best salmon I've ever had.  The Mac and cheese was super good as well.  Excellent place!

30XbcX0k054QaVL5Irdn3Q.text: The duck is always perfect, along with their sides. Always one of my favorites when I come to town. Always satisfied!

5C8DJzQkLWa1YYMeO0cRMQ.text: My husband and I took some clients to dinner here who were from Costa Rica. I chose this place feeling it may be quintessential Arizona, and it didn't disappoint. All 6 of the men ordered the rib eye steaks and each chose a different side since the steaks were a la carte. The sides were all served family style and were very decent portions for sharing. I ordered the carnitas with tortillas and it melted in my mouth! The tortillas were very good as well.  They have a minimal menu, which was OK because what they did offer was delicious. My husband who is a steak  connoisseur , said it was one of the best steaks he has ever had.  The wine list was lacking, but was decent. The happy hour prices are very good and I think the hubby and I will go back for happy hour appetizers and drinks for sure. (the guava mojito was yummy!)  All told for seven of us with multiple alcoholic drinks, hefty meals and desserts, we got out for $600 with the tip, so not too bad. It was an excellent choice to capture Arizona and impressed our clients the way we were hoping to. The food was good, the ambiance nice but not stuffy, and the service was top notch.

nJ6SW47GBufJu7vYJJY1iA.text: The only dish that was really good was the kettle of green chile pork (four stars).  Everything else was average.   Tried the fondue.  When you dip anything in cheese, it should be good.  I've had much better.  I ordered the pork tenderloin wrapped in bacon, it was way too salty and had too much bacon that overpowered the dish.  Everyone that tried a bite said if was very "strong".  My husband got the halibut special, it was a little dry.  Friend got the fried chicken, she thought it was ok.  Fried chicken should be golden brown and this was a little over fried.  Other friend ordered the filet mignon medium....came out well done but she said it had a nice flavor even though it was over cooked.  Overall, was expecting more from this place.

nn9vCMD_S-rB11Gx-h8Fuw.text: Probably my most memorable experience. We sat outside in the outdoor patio which is covered. Food was amazing. The chicken flatbread, the mac and cheese, all the way to the salmon. Our server was also very personable, charismatic, and great. Good service throughout.

ttbJYRxn4AUkRs9LgKWPWA.text: I ate at Roaring Fork during a recent business trip to the Scottsdale area.  We were quite a large party - 10 people, but the service was very good.  We were all served promptly and the waiters were friendly and helpful.  I had the roasted chicken with cornbread stuffing which was very good - the flavor and crispy skin on the chicken was really nice and the stuffing was delicious.  Many of our group had the Big Ass Burger which looked really good, and everyone seemed to enjoy it as well.  If I was looking for a casual dinner in the Scottsdale area in the future, Roaring Fork would definitely be on my list.

r3l-0CWnN9TRSJ4lScqUUA.text: Came here for the first time for a family birthday. The ambience was nice, the wine selection was fair, and the bread was tasty. I was thoroughly disappointed by the entree, however. My salmon was lacking in flavor, barely cooked on the outside, and totally raw on the inside. I understand that some people like it this way, but when you stress that you'd like it "well done", you expect it to not be a giant lump of sashimi.   The two stars were for our very pleasant server.

mKvzJdo3q2VMGrbwXVsIgA.text: Incredible happy hour!  Value and selection of both food and drink were exceptional!  Cool altmosphere and it lasts until 7pm.

EsCAThMZXL2IjEJGW1it0A.text: Stay away from the Ahi Tuna, it is way over spiced and will keep you up half the night. No warning on the menu.

ZJIU1g5f_Oydp2rWG0it6g.text: Probably the best happy hour in the PHX area.  Came in on a Sunday night and had the big ASS burger and it is just that! Definitely sharable.   I'm not big on burgers or meat but this burger was amazing and the price is unbeatable. $10   We also had the green chile pork kettle and it was really good. Pretty spicy! I highly recommend the huckleberry margarita! $5 during happy hour   Can't wait to go back!  Side note: happy hour is only available at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Big ASS burger

SFluVo6CxOmJvlYf4Zx_Ug.text: We're from the San Francisco Bay Area,,,  this was our 2nd visit to the Roaring Fork,, in Scottsdale AZ.    We returned this visit as we had a craving for the Lamb chop fondue appetizers,,, from our first visit.      Parking was a bit of a struggle,, at 5:30pm.  We were seated after a 10minute wait for our 5:30 reservations made 3months in advance.    Our group of 5 adults were seated at a booth,, a little cramped, could have been an issue with others,, but  "we were fine."    Our waiter was kind,, a little bit of a "dry" personality,, and seemed to lack a bit of the finness for a nice dinning experience,, eg. passing plates of food over our heads.  This did not tarnish our good evening at all.    Our drinks arrived along with two appetizer servings of the lamb chops...  for dinners,,, I had seen the Big Ass Burger while we were walking in,,  I had to have that,,,even though we were in a NICE restaurant.  Also ordered was the trout, the sea bass, filet, and the lamb chop appetizer with a Caesar salad...     my burger was perfectly done,,a challenge to eat, but so delicious with a great beef flavor... all was good, however those who craved the lamb chops,,, all commented that flavor was NOT as good as our first visit,,    desserts:   Pecan pie was a good choice,,, but the Three of us had the Root Beer Floats,,,  3 thumbs UP.     a nice experience,,     but I'm not sure Roaring Fork will rank AS high on our next visit to Scottsdale,, due to the disappointing Lamb chops.   Many other MEAT spots to try.    Note:  perhaps the disappointment may have been by the lack of presentation ,,,  our waiter only lit the candles under one cheese pot,, we had to ask him to light the one ordered as a dinner entree.  They lacked the charred fire pit flavor and were not hot n juicy,,  perhaps sat on the counter too long after they came off the grill.     JMHO.    I was not one of the  three disappointed.

ptPzMcZU40Svvc59yYqVKw.text: Great place..Highly recommend. Everything from the appetizer to the main course and drinks was phenomenal.

o0L__6mhRWYc8iZCyI7AQA.text: Best happy hour in town.  The bartenders Derek and Ace give the best service. And The Big Ass burger is to die for.

FWH9psjarbXh1ZgKxb4nPg.text: Went here to celebrate a birthday. Food, atmosphere and service were great.  We had the Rainbow Trout and the Pork Loin wrapped in Bacon. Delicious!

8ycfovYcagwVjPXtsvcg8Q.text: Roo is a great server! very attentive, and quick when you run low. Great personality, wonderful listening skills, she is a pro! She anticipates your need, before you ask. And brings your food with precision and grace. Thanks for a great experience, Roaring Fork!

DAygWJYngjeNNHVVbDW2NQ.text: Fantastic meal and dinner experience.    Had a very important dinner and wanted to make a lasting impression.  I picked this place based on the Yelp reviews.  Yep, couldn't have been any better.  Top class top notch.  Food was excellent and something for everybody.  Our table there was the Big Ass burger, which it was, Trout, my son loved it, I had the duck awesome perfectly cooked to my liking.    The starters we shared the porco con queso amazing. I must say that I did drop some on my waiter and was tempted to lick it off. But that would have been weird.

dUq06wuTfyQstj-3zMZVLA.text: We were very disappointed in this upscale restaurant. Sitting outside on the patio was nice but it took a very long time to get drinks and food. Our server forgot about our drinks. The 1/2 chicken was a really small 1/2 of a Cornish hen and it was over-cooked and dry. I had to dip it in Ranch to get it down. The filet was tender except for the stringy gristle part but the flavor was lacking. I would not recommend this restaurant and expected a lot better for the price.

VA7dErPH61KXppsMlrBEbw.text: Definitely will return! Staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and prompt. We had a reservation so our table was ready as soon as we arrived. Our server gave us great suggestions on both martini and wine selections. Food was fantastic! I got the red fish with the chipotle cream sauce. It was to die for! A friend got a salad, the dressing was so good I would've bought a bottle to take home. I tried a friends hatch chili macaroni, delicious- again I cannot stress how good everything was from start to finish. We did not do dessert however next time I return I'll have to consider it. Lastly, the atmosphere is very warm, calm, and inviting. Great place to relax and enjoy a good meal with good company.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WLf6XpR5gmPlf-m5Y_QHMA.text: Great location in Scottsdale for happy hour that has a great selection of food with great price ranges depending on what you want to eat. The filet is high quality and well worth the wait. The side selections and apps are also tasty and well done for small or large groups. You would be hard pressed to not find a couple of favorites if visiting more than once.

BxYGJJWXSGThvwwhUVMzvQ.text: Roaring Fork is a fun place, specially in the evenings! They serve a variety of appetizers (try their melted cheese served in a hot little pan). Do not miss their happy hour! A little loud but high energy place. Easy parking and great location in Old Town Scottsdale.

dzskJf8FKg22l2TAvFEpbA.text: Have eaten here probably 5 times in the last 6-7 yrs. It's time that I give a review. The food is consistent and well prepared every time that I can remember. The menu doesn't seem to change and that's likely not a bad thing. This is the second time that I've had the double-cut pork chop. It is one of the best chops that I've had anywhere. I don't care for the mash that the chop comes on. It's just too sweet for my tastes but I'm sure many folks like it sweet. The green chili Mac n cheese is something we order every time. I didn't enjoy it as much as I usually do but I wasn't truly in the mood.  The service is always excellent. Almost too much attention as we are not needy diners and do not need to be checked on frequently.  My only True complaint is that the back area of the restaurant, where we've been seated at least 3 times, is quite hot temperature-wise. Will be back I'm sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Double cut pork chop. Excellent

xpBltD-RYa2l1xgzUFRzkg.text: So we are a large group of girls (10) who try and gather once a month for  birthday celebrations.  We have often discussed finding a place that we would call our go to happy hour place.   We have tried this place for the last four months and every time there is a new restriction.   As much as we love the place we just cannot deal with all of the restrictions that come with it.   The first time we thought well it is just that we are a large group that cannot ALL show up at 3:45 (cuz we have jobs).  The second time it was well maybe we just caught them on an off night.   Unfortunately, the last two times have just been BAD.   Between the Manager and our waitress making us feel like we were a bother, (who wants to feel unwanted???) we have made a group decision that the Roaring Fork is just not a  customer friendly environment.   We will be taking our monthly happy hours elsewhere.

4yL9mdsJNdCmZ-EYSQ6ckg.text: This place gets really busy on weekends.  I would suggest reservations.  Plenty of parking.  Seems like it's conducive for large groups.  They honored our reservation promptly.  Our server was ok.  He was sort of rushing us to place our drink orders.   He brought out the proseco and the glass was dirty.  Literally something stuck to it and he didn't even catch it.  Not cool.  The food was good.  Everyone was pleased.  With a party of four that could be a challenge!  We skipped dessert.  The breads are delicious and warm.  We will go back.

VxuFjEDQQBoT9A2STngDTw.text: We chose this spot after reading reviews on Yelp and looking at their menu. It's a really big and stylish place.   We arrived 5 minutes early for our 6:30 reservations for 2. We were told it would be closer to our reservation time before our table was ready. We were seated about 8 minutes late but the restaurant was very busy.  The menu features a lot of appetizing choices and we had a bit of a hard time choosing. My wife ordered the fish tacos and she really enjoyed them while I got the pork tenderloin wrapped in bacon based on the recommendation from our waiter, Brandon.   It was really good and I was glad I ordered it. The pork was a perfect medium and it was nicely paired with creamy cheesy grits and smoky Mexican corn. We also each had a salad to start (they are perfectly sized for one, which was great as we couldn't agree on what to share). I enjoyed their take on the classic wedge salad with big chewy bits of salty bacon while my wife was fond of the date salad with creamy goat cheese and sweet dares.  I wasn't too excited by the service-maybe 3 stars. To be fair it was super busy but they "failed" my water glass test (how often they refill the glass-something that I've found sets the top restaurants apart). In our case my glass sat empty for well over 5 minutes before being noticed.  Also our server was a bit hard to find when we wanted to order more wine.  All in all the food here was really good, 4 star quality and presentation.  In my book, service is the key determining factor that amplifies good food and turns the experience into a 4 star (or higher) event. So 3+ for the Roaring Fork.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Date salad (the fruit not the outing)
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Blt salad
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rotisseries in the waiting room

R7sK-YRYE8X8xYxIS3RE5g.text: I recently had friends visiting from out of state. We all were craving a good steak dinner. I was deciding between a few different places, but picked roaring fork based on the reviews and the recommendation of a few friends- and I was so glad I did!   For appetizers, we ordered tortilla soups and the mussels and chorizo.  The soup was delicious! I don't eat seafood, but the group all said the mussels and chorizo was amazing!  For entrees, we had braised beef short ribs, filet mignon, ribeye and the blackened redfish. Everyone RAVED about their meals! For a side, I had the twice baked potatoes and they were absolutely heavenly!!!   I would definitely come back here! I've also heard the happy hour here is really good!

C87BojhbPRH7TukN43LHPA.text: Aaah the amazing pecan pie- a must to have if you go there. We did a three course dinner where tortilla soup was served it was nice. Unluckily the steak was a little uncooked even the second time. But overall good service and good food and ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

oc5Qqj8rxcfn1ddPBsDaHw.text: Great green chili its the best and the big ass burger is one of the best burgers in town always good service and consistant food!

T_bU_q6Qtp7LrAsxwzx-Hg.text: The evening started off with a glass of Champaign and two glasses of sparkling water. Matt our waiter was busy, while still attentive.  We shared the mixed green salad. It was fresh but a bit bland. It only had a few walnuts and maybe two cranberries.  My girl had the muscles which were in a nice tomato sauce and were quite fresh. The duck was also prepared well at med-rare. Throughout the night the service was good.   The nice ending to the being was the warm pecan pie. The slide of pie was very deep and despite not being hat hungry we both ending up eating it all. Plus, it balanced out the taste of the nuts with a subtle sweetness.  Overall, the evening was relaxing and as always we enjoy eating here when we're in town. It's a great staple that has great food.  Also, while leaving 2-3 staff said "have a great night" which always adds a nice positive touch to an evening.

ZKSYbK8otmuIjHzRHobQRQ.text: I forget why this place is such a Scottsdale classic. Amazing deals on food and drinks in the good-sized bar area. Good service, attentive but not overly intrusive. Great margaritas and other cocktails. Some of my favorite fish tacos. Just a solid consistent menu, reasonable prices based on the quality and quantity of food. A reasonably large space that still feels comfortable and intimate, not too noisy.

kDWeMjvppCW5mcpMq6EYcQ.text: I love the rustic atmosphere to start with. You walk in and are greeted by an old western type vibe which is great! The service is wonderful prompt and  caring but not overly solicitous. I had the chicken and it was fantastic. My boyfriend was also pleased with his meal and the wine selection was perfect recommended by our waiter. If you are looking for a nice night out that allows for an intimate yet engaging atmosphere this is definitely the place.

zRxML1Op_ySNc5dslvzC4w.text: This place was amazing!  Took our graduation group out to dinner.  This place was perfect!  The menu had something for everyone including the young ones.  Everyone loved their food!  I had the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and it was fantastic.  The green chili Mac-n-cheese is a must get side.  This is my new favorite restaurant!

Ib7AGrxNSVphpagKvl6dgw.text: The Big Ass Burger is a must! The restaurant is absolutely lovely and the waitstaff is always friendly. Sitting at the bar offers a different experience.

H18XrUCRwuEzceMzd75ZRg.text: Our party of 4 adults decided to try this place on a whim... We had originally wanted to go elsewhere but were a little dressed up for that place so we came here instead. They were completely full without a reservation but we were able to find a nice table in the bar. Our server was so friendly and helpful! He suggested many options and in turn made our experience a nice one!  Highly recommend the short ribs and the peach Arnold Palmer! Great drink!

tp5HbmK_r_dsOp-dWElf5w.text: Sunday night just arrived Scottsdale.. didnt get enough time to research restos to go. But of course yelping is the most effective and i must say my go to app for finding the best restaurants. Behold as i scroll the photos.. mouth watering food came out. Fried chicken, corn, steaks, burger and fries.... cant wait to order.  So we go in and ordered the Fried chicken and Bacon wrapped pork medallion. Ahhh sooo good :) Definitely will recommend this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. bacon wrapped pork medallion
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Smoked salmon
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Buttermilk fried chicken

Lh9t-uqN4P0DWcETD2DMLQ.text: Had a great dinner here as they have an open wood burning grill for awesome ribeyes!  The shaved Brussels sprouts were just ok.  The blt and market salads were very good!

Xl8vPCXwVKmM4vva46gz7g.text: Amazing food and service! Brandon was our server and he was on it! I had the buttermilk Fried chicken. My favorite is chicken fried steak. The buttermilk fried chicken will leave you craving more! Great service, great happy hour great food! You have to dine here!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Another great meal fro the Roaring Fork! Thank you Allie and Alex for the welcome and service!!!

IvUClJORa3pBKE6lLBhqJA.text: Incredible food, flavorful and plentiful! The rainbow trout was wonderful and highly recommend the asparagus.

p8_dhJCKQXMiaRID9IjUxg.text: My fiance and I have gone here several times. I am from the south so I had never experienced Roaring Fork up until a few months ago. The food is AMAZING! Everything here is cooked from scratch - even down to the dough they use to make the flat bread with. Tonight we went during happy hour and got the chicken flat bread and queso dip. Both of them were wonderful!! Very tasteful and larger portions. We then got a special dessert called the banana cream pie. It was also wonderful! I'm not sure if the dessert will be there long term but if they have it, do yourself a favor and try it. I also got an alcoholic Arnold Palmer and it was very, very good! This is one of my favorite places to eat in AZ!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana Cream Pie dessert! It was delicious! This dessert was on the lighter side but just enough to do the trick.

GQov1cXOobIplLieu2CZMg.text: From the moment I walked in the first time I was grabbed by the smell. The unbelievably delicious smell of the rotisserie chicken at the door pulled me in. I had to order the chicken because I couldn't get the smell off my mind and I was not disappointed.

hs3IQKmZeHmVtIo6OcYnug.text: Easily one of the better meals I've had in awhile. We went for the start of Restaurant Week and our entire experience was great. Hostess staff was sweet and welcoming, bartender was quick, our server, Matt, was professional and friendly, and most importantly, food was awesome. I left so beyond full, I am still full this morning. Definitely recommend for Restaurant Week (they have one of the best menus/values I saw) and any meal beyond that! Can't wait to go back.

tQE5gqWxeglgRblYMrFCyw.text: Awesome Happy Hour! The Tortilla Soup and the Green Chile Pork is outstanding. Cocktails are strong and very well priced for Happy Hour. I bring all friends and family here when they are in town. Everyone has been impressed!

NXWEM0vVbrp55lPa867r8g.text: Absolutely amazing food. Had the burger with a Caesar salad and a jalapeno margarita. Blair was my waitress and gave me absolutely amazing service, would go back just for her!!

YJtARPDOzUvxWnX-srZl3Q.text: I love both their happy hour and dining experience. For happy hour, I would recommend the Big Ass Burger and the Queso. For dinner, the pork wrapped in bacon is awesome. I love that it comes with grits. Happy hour does get really crowded so I recommend getting there early.

MnuhwuegFhnQacRmjuCFaA.text: This is now my go to spot. Great prices for happy hour. In fact, happy hour is from 4-close all summer. I really like the guava mojito and I don't even drink mojito. Like most people have said, you can't go wrong with the big ass burger. The green chili pork looks great too. I'll have to try that next. The bartender with a beard is really friendly and has great stories. I don't know his name though. Go in before 5pm or wait for the 2nd wave when the dinner crowd leaves. Otherwise, it's super busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Big ass burger sans bun. Yum

0E6K8-hYH7vTx96JL0Tk5A.text: first time and it wont be my last. great food, large portions be sure to share" the big ass burger" excellent service and a real happy hour

2JCWbhoiCHcWF5QziRUw6A.text: Awesome food, and great atmosphere!   Went in to sit at the bar while on the road and thoroughly enjoyed this place.   I had an appetizer steak salad which was incredibly tasty with a generous portion of steak (honestly twice the size or what I expected) and a blackened red fish.   I would give both dishes 5 Stars, as they were delicious!    Bartender was super attentive, and making sure I was taken care of despite a full house.   Highly recommend this spot!

76ZgFfZQh-47CTAaNCqFig.text: I took my family here over the holidays, including my 11 month old baby. My initial impression was that it reminded me of a late 90s country club, you know, where you go with the family to have Sunday brunch?  Don't let the decor fool you! This place is fantastic!  The food is superb and the service is epic. Yes. Epic.   We had appetizers, drinks, entrees and deserts. For a family of four (including an 11 month old who didn't eat) we spent around $200.   Worth every penny.

AZeth4-6jrDUclDBgI4Ziw.text: We have been coming to this place for years and it is consistently excellent. The ambiance is great; beautiful interior, good for both groups of friends or for a romantic night out. The patio is beautiful especially when the weather is nice. Most recently we had the guacamole to start (delicious an so fresh!), rainbow trout (yum!), and he had the bacon wrapped tenderloin which he sad was really good. The cocktails and drinks are always great. We also had the pecan pie for dessert, and it was tasty! The prices are really appropriate for the quantity and quality of the food, and for the consistently great service. Plus they have an awesome happy hour where you can snag a good deal - but be warned it can get pretty busy and can be hard to find a seat.  Definitely a must-visit if you haven't been!

xyrZFlZRTTWlW1360XKQug.text: As always, a great dinner.  Pulled pork appetizer is a must.  Pork tenderloin was perfection and those grits made the dish.

dxOVM2x7wnp0TmBBtRWjOg.text: We've been here several times for special occasions and have left impressed every time.  The drinks are strong, the food is delicious and the service was on point.  The green chile pork appetizer is exceptional.  The location is kinda weird and we almost always come close to driving past it.  Definitely a favorite.

aAWXZ4QIWPSf3QYWTOSezg.text: This was my 2nd dining experience at Roaring Fork and was very impressed (the 2nd time around)!! Our server was very nice and helpful with our drink selection along with our food selection. I must say if you come here and you don't get the Green Chili Pork you are missing out on life!! It is so yummy!!

Usj_cW-2exFwssrOPyIhbg.text: Meh more or less sums up my experience. Crusty waitress who, when asked for a recommendation summed it up as "everything is good on the menu" to fish tacos that had giant fish filets on them and not a great selection of garnish. Even if the garnish selection had been spectacular, the amount of fish over-powered every other flavor.

DSKZO_P5O-CdJGHuoAH_Jw.text: Great happy hour.  The bar is comfortable and serves big portions at a good price during its happy hour.  I haven't had a full dinner here.  Super heavy/rich food. Meat intensive. If you are searching for a meal that involves the adjectives "light" or "healthy" this is not the place for you.

l7qG3dSYo1D4L2KuPAz4cw.text: The food took awhile to come, but it was decent.  We had the Dr. Pepper Short Ribs and the Dr. Pepper Baby Back Ribs.  The meat was cooked well but it was not seasoned well.  The chili macaroni cheese was not very memorable either.  The server was attentive and the manager did drop by to check on the table which was nice.  But we suspect this may be because it was low season.

B4KSPHODeQVKaWlGoEQgRA.text: this place was so busy we had to sit at the bar table and that was on a Friday night so it was not shocking. the food was great, but not in the least bit healthy. I am sure I could have picked better options but the menu has too many beef or pork based temptations to go another way. I had a shrimp with spicy creamy dipping sauce that was insane and the house specialty the Green Chile Pork Stew was an amazing adventure. This stew was simply pork with hot cheese and strips of green hot peppers all cooked together in a small urn that you might have see hanging over a campfire 100 years ago. The atmosphere was fun and lively and the service was very good. I guess there are some desert specialties but we didn't try any- a bakery at the front of the restaurant makes it easy to take home the delicious-looking desserts as well.

6p65cIk7iwufzbHqWYAcNQ.text: You can't go wrong with what you order, but at least once you have to try their "Big Ass Burger". What more can you say when ordering a "Big Ass Burger".  An enormous juicy seasoned all meat patty stacked high garnished with the freshest tomato, lettuce and onion with optional bacon, cheese and  a hot pepper on a toasted bun. It is served with fresh cut french fries. You can also substitute with their famous green chili macaroni and cheese. It is such a hit item on the happy hour menu, that they added it to the main dining room menu.  The bar fills up so fast so early so you still have the option to order the burger in the dining room.  If you get a chance to sit at the bar you can try the homemade beef jerky while you wait.

j9HYd9gPyY7uizzaSaYjBA.text: Atmosphere -4/5  Service- 5/5 -- a nicely dressed manager came around and made sure  everything was okay; the waiter cleared the crumbs from our  table twice. We shared  dishes, they split our plates without us even asking them to.  The service was better than a lot of haute cuisine places we've gone to.   Food-4/5---  we love the "big ass' burger, the cheese grits with jalepeno was surprisingly delish.  We like RF a lot, has one of the best burgers in Phx.  We like to catch the happy hour someday.

oxOdrI7K1WgkdN7bqZGyrw.text: After hearing so many good things about this place, my bf and I decided to try it out since we were in the area.  It's located in an office building off of the main road, which is kinda weird.  Upon entry, we were immediately greeted.  They were having some decent happy hour specials such as cheaper appetizers and $5 drinks.  We managed to grab the last table at the bar area.  Shortly after we seated ourselves, the waiter came over and was prompt with putting our orders in.  My bf loved the margarita, but it was a bit too sour for me.  For our entrees, I got the fried chicken and my bf got the beef ribs tacos.  My fried chicken was very good, but I have to admit the bf got the better entree.  The meat on his tacos were incredibly tender and the flavors were more complex than I imagined for a taco.  My fried chicken had perfectly crispy skin and the gravy was delicious.  The mashed potatoes were a bit runny for my liking, but I do like them thicker.  My bf thought it was a close match between his tacos and the fried chicken.  The food and drinks came out quick.  Service was very professional.  I wouldn't mind returning here.  My only hesitation is that outside of the burger, entrees are kinda pricey since they start at $17.  The food is very good, however.

dmCfBdQ_raUxWothg0V-iw.text: I think I would have liked the food if I actually ate it. Was seated quickly, which was nice, given a great table (booked on open table so was surprised). The salads came quickly, but immediately noticed my lettuce wasn't washed, but no waiter to be found to send back.   A while later, after I noticed other tables getting served that were seated after us, the waiter popped bye and said that our food should be coming up shortly. A while later, the food arrived, and it looked good, but it was way cold, had been sitting for a while, which was a shame. All the food was sent back and we were given our bill for our drinks. Whaaaatttttt??? They wasted an hour of my time to serve me cold food only to drop a check for my drinks? I wouldn't have had the second glass of wine if the food had come in a reasonable amount of time.   I would go to Houston's, better food and a quality wait staff / management.

8MclvPj9-20WhRJxffoitQ.text: Really liked the feel of this place. The food and service were good. Wait staff was helpful with the food selections. We were running late for a Comedy Club and the waiter got us a dessert in a go cup.  This is a large establishment. We will be making another visit. Looked like it would be fun to sit at the bar during happy hour. Cost us $80 for two people, this is probably pretty average. Entrees are mostly $20 - $25 and the sides are all add ons.  Good experience

uGOMge7UyUpVXOH7DHOqGQ.text: Five stars because it's a place were comfort food meets a classy and friendly atmosphere, meets a perfect and very attentive service. The duck breast was spectacular, I'd totally recommend having the duck. It took them longer than expected to bring us the starters and they came separately, and they took them off the bill. We were definitely delighted by great food and a great service.

TRT5O7hegBEHuoKRQnBEMg.text: Very pleased with dinner and happy hour, visited twice over the holidays.  Can get crowded during peak times.  Service is great.

BmfzK0rTN0TTNgbnj0pMQw.text: Food was good, but not great.  Service was fantastic, but atmosphere was only so-so.  Get the Mac and cheese

hRbqWBH6PXJadkp-AF_YUg.text: Ok this place was great...so great I decided to sign up on yelp and contribute to the rave reviews that encouraged me to try it out in the first place. I had the fish tacos happy hour appetizer for dinner and they we cooked and seasoned well. They were really good and I would definitely order again. I was told it is off season in August, but the place was filled with locals; all very welcoming. Everyone knew everyone and if they didn't (like me) it didn't take long to feel like one of the locals. Great service, too. Will definitely go back!

wVIwxMHQpg-GYy1pMBtjZw.text: Happy Hour might be a winner, but the regular dinner is a disappointment.  Our business meal started with the Maitre D' claiming quite arrogantly there was no reservation (it was confirmed the week prior).  After a 20 minute wait our party was disenchanted with spotty service, uninspired food, and ultimately a bill that was well beyond what the meal warranted.  You may not want to diss this place since others speak so highly of Happy Hour.  But when it comes to full priced dinners... go elsewhere.

WoI4PVD8DppnskZMzvjPOA.text: Don't go here if you are trying to eat healthy...too many temptations at every turn. I had amazing scallops for dinner, but only after eating a ridiculous amount of bread.  The hamburgers in the bar looked and smelled incredible.  I like the spicy spin they put on most of the dishes...mac and cheese is KILLER.

QYHgTMXuw4NqhbjyLlA98A.text: Strange location...out of the way of Scottsdale's more touristy strip but it was worth the trip.  The Dr. Pepper shortribs and green chile mac and cheese were outstanding - couldn't keep my friends' paws off my plate!  The duck and fundito were good but I'll take my ribs and mac any day.  Service was attentive.  Definitely would go back!

eyGpgHXLIk-TwF7opvR_kA.text: Took a large group here and it turned out to be one of the food highlights of the trip for us. Loved the pork appetizer, trout, and dr pepper ribs especially. No complaints from anyone.

lUfp8WESYnuu-ymO6ApKHA.text: First of all the service is unmatched. My wife and I are in town for the Barrett-Jackson Auction. A close friend reccommened this place. Robert treated us like close friends.  After the two hours we spent in absolute bliss,  we felt like family. The food is incredible. Breadef oysters,  beet salad, slow roasted pork shoulder carnitas......   to die for.  Dont forget the mac n cheese that is from another planet. We will be back.

QCNlc_7uzqlHU1pK99PIMQ.text: Great location and ambiance.   The food is more in the OK area.  Green chilli pork was really good but the tortilla soup and bad ass burger just OK.  The place seem to be always packed so be patient.  A little price for what you get but a good place to have a couple of drinks, ok food and a good conversation.  Cheers

KUJvKql8pmuHAALLH6yZEg.text: The Roaring Fork is a good steakhouse with a friendly wait staff. The service was very good and the food tasty.  The presentation of the tortilla soup was impressive and the steaks well prepared. The only downside was our reservation was not ready when we arrived.  We had to wait an additional 15 minutes to be seated.

rK60EtIRnjNPsC1H8yuKqg.text: We recently took my parents here. I like the steak house feel. It's very classy spot. Food is fantastic. The bread basket, especially the corn bread is delicious. Everyone loved their food. Definitely will be back. Service excellent.

prN7LjGpEPC0q64bkfn-Mg.text: Had dinner last night.  I have eaten at Roaring Fork many times in the past and this is the first review I have written for them. Everything was just wonderful.  To start with we had fresh guacamole, chips and great margaritas.  The entrees we're amazing....I had fresh halibut and my husband had a huge ny steak.  The fish was wonderful and the steak had the best flavor and cooked just right.  The Green Chili Mac and Cheese was a stand out. Our server Matt was great and the manager Ivars is just the nicest host.  The chef Brian H. Even came by our table. It just made for a very enjoyable dinning experience. Can't wait until we can go again!

TtS6Bm0rPfHX-1qOiIarLg.text: I want to give this place 5 stars but I must confess that I was very excited to try the "big ass burger" but I was left a bit disappointed.  It really is just a bigger sized burger that you could get anywhere, I was not blown away by the quality or taste.  Everything else on the menu is great though.

OIh_e0QLcEH3-se2muoVIQ.text: Found this place on Yelp while visiting Scottsdale and SO glad that I did! We ordered the kettle of green chili pork and it was amazing - honestly some of the best that I have ever had. The fish tacos were also really good! After those two dishes the green chili Mac and cheese didn't quite stack up but it was ok. Their happy hour specials are really good as well - just make reservations first or you might have to wait or stalk out a table!

Yf1IFn4cu7jzxG0xBD7DCw.text: I've been a guest here a bunch of times and far more often than not, the food and the service are on point. They do a great happy hour, which provides a nice excuse to spend an afternoon  relaxing on their back patio.   Dinner prices for entrees might be a tad high ($17-$27) but you'll always get a good meal.  Some highlights: Sugar-cured Duck Breast Buttermilk Fried Chicken Chicken Waldorf Salad Green Chili Pork

Uxh8yXD6F0jrYFZ0uApHhw.text: My wife and I had 4 others meet us on the bar patio for happy hour. We looked at the appetizer menu and I decided to try the BIG ASS BURGER.  This meal was not an appetizer, it was huge. It came with fries and both the burger and the fries were good. It has to be over 1/2lb of beef, I had all I could do to finish it but during happy hour it was $9. Great deal  When dinner (and several drinks) were over, our server started telling us about the deserts and recommended the banana split. This is a banana with chocolate chunks, and caramel wrapped in a tortilla and fried, then rolled in cinnamon and sugar and served with ice cream and sauce.   Ohhh, This was so good and rich, she brought one desert and 6 spoons. We had all we could do to finish it.  The mens room is a hike from the bar patio, infact it is in the middle of the adjoining office building. I was surprised that a place this nice did not have it's own mens room.

45tHRLSCgHjtVwH1eS_etg.text: Come hungry, leave stuffed and much lighter in the wallet, but you definitely get what you pay for and are happy to do so!  Seriously this place was amazing...we shared the chicken flatbread and the pork wings to start with a nice bottle of riesling.  I only got one piece of the flatbread to try (because i had an entire pork wing to myself) and it was super delicious with a lovely pesto flavour from the sauce.  The pork wings were slow roasted so the meat just fell off the bone and the Dr. Pepper bbq sauce was delicious!  For a main course most of us had the sugar-cured duck breast....they were generous with the duck, the 'little cabbages' (aka brussel sprouts) were delicious and i rarely like ones done by anyone other than my mom, and the flavours were just to die for.  The duck skin was incredible and the meat perfectly cooked so it was beautifully juicy.  The bf had the short ribs which turned out to be massive and I got to try a bite - amazing flavour and the meat was super tender so you didn't need a knife at all to pull it apart!  We shared a bowl of the green chili mac and cheese and a plate of the asparagus...definitely sides worth trying but you should plan on sharing them...portions are not tiny!  The green chili mac and cheese was coated in a light dusting of breadcrumbs that just worked with the flavours!  For dessert I tried the deep fried banana split tortilla thing which I somehow managed to down (again, generous with portion sizing) after finishing my red wine, and I don't know how I did it but that was delicious...two scoops of icecream, one chocolate, one vanilla with c hocolate bits, whipped cream, two deep fried banana rolls, and a dusting of cinnamon...yum!  My mother and sister ordered cappuccinos that came with a lovely dusting of cinnamon that i could smell from across the table and two little rock-sugar cubes...if I hadn't been stuffing my face with bananas and icecream I probably would have tried one they smelled so good!  All in all, not cheap but as i said you get what you pay for and the size matches the quality to the point where you don't want to stop eating until you have to roll home...luckily the hotel was just around the corner and across the street...so good we will be back for sure!!

ech14S3PxnDe-0ClPo2nTg.text: I just dinged a star off after finding out there are three additional locations in Texas. The food is MEAT. Huge portions, pricey and delicious. They offered a two for one entree deal for super bowl Sunday so we checked it out.    The restaurant is really cozy and feels like a "grown up", date restaurant. We were seated in the Arizona room which has less ambience. Next time we will opt for the bar or the little tables by the kitchen. It is wood fired cooking so the place smells great walking in.    It always annoys me when the $42.00 rib eye comes ala carte. Yes, know it is organic and quite large but throwing in a small side of mashers or a steamed carrot or two would be a nice gesture. That being said, we ordered the green chili mac as other yelpers recommended and oh my... Outstanding! The Yukon horseradish mashers were a bit overpowering but it did encourage me to try to make them at home. I had a lamb shank which was melt in your mouth divinity. The au jus was perfect to soak up the homemade brioche.    The wine list was fine, nothing special but had a good range of reds and whites and prices. The service was good. We went really early, with the elderly set and loved the 2:1 deal. Yes we will go back, it was a special meal.

oVCbsrLDVV5WECaO9zPKJg.text: We are new to the area, so we opted to try the Roaring Fork (RF) as part of the AZ Restaurant Week promotion for $44 p/p.  It was a good dining experience; however, I agree with the overall Yelp 4-star (ours is a 3.5+ rounded up) rating for RF for a few reasons:  1)  Though the decor/ambiance is casual with antlers, a western theme, 70's music, and a lively bar, the white table cloths and black-attired, formal/stiff servers are inconsistent with the  more modern vibe and moderately-priced menu items.   2) Both of the Delmonico/rib eye steaks we ordered were seasoned PERFECTLY and cooked precisely to our specifications, so kudos to the kitchen; however, the tastiness was almost overshadowed by the chewiness.  The tenderness of the meat is a result of its inherent quality; the chefs can only cook the meat they are given.  We hold management/the meat buyer responsible for selecting a lesser quality cut that was also sliced too thick for it to be easily consumed.  I hope that lesser cuts weren't purchased for the Restaurant Week promotion?  This would be foolhardy because for couples like us who eat out frequently and are new to the area, we were assessing whether we'd return to RF from our initial visit.    My frozen lime margarita was delicious, my husband loved his tortilla soup appetizer and I loved my salad with dried cranberries, candied walnuts, and goat cheese.   The mashed potatoes that accompanied the steaks were also yummy.  I had the chocolate pecan pie with butter pecan ice cream.  It was to die for.... Decadent and outstanding!  My husband's creme brule custard suffered from being too loose under its hard shell with a more dominant vanilla flavor than we are used to.    So, yes, we are qualified fans of the Roaring Fork and intend to try them again in the future.   P.S. We did take our steak leftovers and will enjoy them at home despite the jaw exercise :-).

9Fdcf4uQ8h2IS9A6ppDiow.text: This place is incredible. I came here both on New Years Eve and New Years Day for dinner from out of town. The food was scrumptious, the atmosphere was very warm, and the service was fantastic. They did not rush me or bring all courses together. I was able to have a nice 2.5 hour dinner on both nights, and that is just the way I like it. I ordered the breaded chicken - which was just fantastic - and the fresh guac the first night. Cannot go wrong with either. The second night, I stuck to their lamb appetizers and their mac and cheese. With the first bite, I wasnt sure what all the fuss was all about. Towards the end, I couldn't get enough. The lamb was phenomenal. Despite the fact that the appetizer came with three pieces, the server brought me four just to be nice. I tried two types of dessert as well on these two nights - the creme brulee and the cheesecake. Definitely preferred the cheesecake (as the creme brulee came a bit cold).   All in all, this is a fantastic and affordable place for a nice long relaxing dinner. HIGHLY recommended. Wish they were in California!

e5v6Eh5meswh7gLm9c-Nrw.text: Been here quite a few times with various friends and family. Their menu changes seasonally but in summer time they have Dr. Pepper ribs that my wife loves and a filet mignon that is very tasty. During winter they seem to be more about the fish and chicken entrees.  Their Big Burger isn't to bad either.   Not a big drinker, but when coming here I always get the Arnold Palmer with firefly vodka which seems to be the only place that has this drink, and is probably the best drink I have ever had, besides the pear champagne I had at my wedding.  Appetizer wise I have had and love the guac and chips as well as the tortilla soup.   The last time we went I took my parents out for their birthdays here and my dad being the person that is hard to please was even impressed with pork and my mother loved the carnitas.   The service is excellent and should be a role model of how restaurant service should be, with constant watch over my drinks, NOT bugging me on how the food was immediately after I just received it.   Great place for special occasions or just for a delicious meal.   Overall: I would recommend this place and is quite affordable for a nice night out.   Note: Would recommend making reservations to ensure that seating is available as on weekends they do get busy.

umjjZ-orIdQTMU0js08T2A.text: In from out of town for a Happy Hour and was taken back. The hostess sat us down but stated that we had to be out by a certain time since the table she sat us down at was reserved. Than why not sit us at another table. There were tons of FREE tables and was not impressed by her attitude. I have been to the one in Texas and never received this service. Will not be returning. Our waiter was a doll and the appetizers were great. I think he felt bad that he was having to push us out to the bar.

wvJsC2Ait2FSS0zDow7mUA.text: Took my parents here for dinner while we were in Scottsdale. The place was busy, but we were lucky to snag a table in the bar.   My parents are picky eaters so I went with the Roaring Fork since I remember it being a nice place and hopefully would be "parents approved." They loved the food, service and ambiance.   For those Yelpers from California, the menu is similar to that of a Wood Ranch with a Southwestern flair. They each had the roasted chicken and I ordered the carnitas plate. Both of which were excellent.

KfH2VMf4Jf5qNuNw8JzTNg.text: I like green chile. I like mac and cheese. So, clearly I'm ordering green chile mac and cheese. And luckily I'm enjoying it immensely thanks to Roaring Fork. Other foods I tried included the white bean soup (made with a pork base which made it pretty much delicious) and shrimp and grits. Were these any old grits you ask? Funny you ask because no is the answer. They were corn grits, which sounds odd and is mighty tasty.  The atmosphere here is warm and cabin-y. It seems like a great place to scoot in close to your date and get involved in a romantic dinner. Equally, I saw a few ladies groups there toasting each other with glasses of wine and sharing appetizers. It's one of those places that most groups don't feel out of place in.  Overall, I'd say this is a bit of an upscale place, but not so fancy that you have to save it for special occasions. Unless, you're like me and treat everyday like a special occasion. ;-)

iIlr2Og-OGraKMfpzEIrWg.text: Hands down the best happy hour in Old Town. Amazing food, drinks, and prices. The service is top notch as well. A+

EarjK7RPIAdepsZi5Y5Igg.text: Absolutely amazing! Had the filet and Mac & cheese. Great service and awesome location. If you're in the mood for an amazing meal make a reservation and stop in.

hqUBy-NzcKL_8bMD_-Po9g.text: So good!!!    Green chile pork appetizer, green chile Mac and cheese, fish tacos and short ribs were amazing!!!

OLBlxOnvJ95Nw5zdXrG4yA.text: My husband surprised me with dinner here on our anniversary. The green Chile Mac and cheese was nothing to write home about, but the filet mignon more than made up for it. We both agreed it's the best cut of steak we've ever eaten! The service was great and well explained. The atmosphere was dim and cozy, perfect for a romantic night. Yet it was also casual enough for the couple in jeans and t-shirts at the next table. I'd definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vLRjQTmAky72z5DYrCE_KQ.text: My daughter Christina Moakler loved going here for happy hour! Four years ago unexpectedly she went to heaven. September 10th was her birthday and I decided to have her celebration there with family and friends. Mark Schifino the manager was so accommodating in setting up a special area for us. They were so caring and understanding.  Thank you for wonderful service and food. I know my daughter was watching over us and so happy we were there.  Thank you for your kindness Mark!  Vickie

mgOYQ3nTYCCcGxqcUsJjzg.text: Piling on to all the other reviews.  Perfect go to post spa time at Montelucia or golf when we visit Scottsdale.  The burgers are outstanding, and the wine list is delightful.  It is a fun atmosphere for catching up with old friends or date night night.

XHMi461TUCaHGgNjYkPYpg.text: For some reason, I couldn't check-in through Yelp. Anyway, It was my wife's birthday and this is where she wanted to have dinner.  Our server was on point tonight. He explained everything and so we ordered: Wife had the Sugar Cured Duck Breast; I had the Braised Beef Short Ribs; my daughter had the Slow Roasted Pork Carnitas and her roommate had the The Roaring Fork Big Ass Burger. We also had to order their famous Green Chili Mac & Cheese.  Everything was wonderful. The short ribs was tender and fell of the bone. Another great meal. Everyone was happy. For my wife's birthday, she selected the creme brulee which was on the house.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sugar Cured Roast Duck $26
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Slow Roasted Pork Shoulder Carnitas $18
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Braised Beef Short Ribs $27.50

A87QZ8EL6T42VLxjMM8ObQ.text: This is a "go to" location during any spring training trip or other reason to be in town.  You can go prime cut stakes or other white table cloth options, but keep it simple - The Big Ass Burger.  Winner of the Phoenix New Times ultimate evaluation.  There are plenty of pictures already here,let's stick to the details:  A 12 oz. hunka hunka beef served with a cast iron kettle of fries. It used to be available at the bar only, but is now included on the regular menu.  It's a HUGE burger.  Along with the usual lettuce/tomato/pickle, Roaring Fork's burger includes melted cheese, bacon and a roasted poblano pepper.  I am not a big fan of burgers, but I love the Big Ass at the Roaring Fork!

mSRAXMsmlCX8c2mPFLhZCg.text: Holly was not personable with the female gender but was very friendly with the male gender. She was resentful of customers moving from the bar to the patio. It seemed to upset her enough to not melt the pepper jack cheese onto the guacamole. Service was subpar and angry

XWR09GITSM55-dO3XiIZgg.text: I love this restaurant and bar.  It makes me feel like I have stepped into a very classy Wild West bar.  Probably some or the most important people in the valley meet here to eat.  I want to be here more - to be in this environment.

gIeo4UBQa87hh545tzF7Gg.text: Atmosphere and all the smells when you walk in just does it for me. Kim Crawford.  Mussels. Johnny walker and some porter house. Pecan pie and creme brule!  Ask for Arty he is the best server we have had in years. Attentive and kind. Truly a wonderful experience tonight!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mussels in chorizo mmmmmmm......

79mxMp9vgrcfsXRDye58sg.text: Dang I was looking forward to this place, but it just didn't pan out. It was just average. We had the lamb chop fondue and it was alright. A fun idea, but just didn't knock my socks off. The butternut squash that's cubed and served on the side was fantastic though! My husband's ribeye looked amazing, but it was not that great. Now I am from KC and we have really great beef there so I have high expectations. I had the duck and it was also just ok and a bit overcooked for my taste. We did have the green chili Mac and cheese and it was very good, probably the best thing we had! I was worried it might be too spicy, but it wasn't. Very creamy with a nice crunch from the panko on top. Maybe it was an off night

cFhZOMFZG0Q2ltlp01R7uQ.text: Excellent restaurant we enjoy. Like the ambience. Great menu except for picky eaters like me.  Had green chili pork appetizer to share .. big enough for meal!! Wonderful flavor .. not too spicy.  Husband had award winning duck breast and it was an award winning meal.  I had the buttermilk fried chicken breast over mashed pos.  It was okay but honestly I didn't expect an award winning fried chicken breast... I am just not an adventurous eater.  Service was great and chocolate cake for dessert was amazing. Definitely will go back.

sD3xF1Z3ITRNDyZFgmRqxw.text: This is one of the best spots we had after the great Canyon:) The food was just wonderful and the service is great high level recommended for all who is wondering where to go have a nice dinner!!!

SgeSs-0Tet98rHaMrjlZeQ.text: This place was packed when we got there, so we were seated in outside patio. The weather was good so we were so happy that we decided to sit there.  Food - we got three dishes to share  Green chili pork with tortilla- yum and good for a start  Duck breast - The meat is tender and juicy. The dressing was pretty unique, and add sweetness to the dish  22oz ribeye - to be honest, this dish made my day! I ordered medium at the beginning and I regretted immediately, feeling that I should have ordered medium rare as most of the time you got medium well when you want medium. But they didn't disappoint me.  I would recommend this place to people who want a nice dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 22oz ribeye Delicious and cooked well!
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Duck breast
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kettle of Green Chili Pork

VuAgjY50HWSsuzZDexB5Rg.text: We went here religiously for happy hour when we lined nearby.  Awesome prices , though it's a mad dash for the bar, especially during Feb/March. Older contingent, but solid food, drinks & service.

8SPzlDuVFLt3_gFstG2l4Q.text: Food was amazing, prices average for a place in Scottsdale, service was a little slow, but I believe our waiter was new. We sat on the patio which can be a little loud since it is next to a busy street. I would request to sit inside next time, ambience was much better.

ngfMTna-8Crp1-h9RyqRGA.text: We came here during the happy hour not knowing it was happy hour. It was a packed house, even the bar and high top seats were all full.   We waited around for a few minutes and a table near the bar left so  it worked out perfectly.   The waitress brought us over some menu's. The happy hour menu seemed pretty good and had a wide variety but I was there for steak so  we didn't get main course off the HH menu, just drinks and salad.   The waitress said the burgers and steaks are all cooked on wood fired grill/plank whatever it's called. I ordered a medium rare filet mignon with lobster tail.   The wood fired grill is the real deal! The meat tasted like a campfire.. oddly described but I mean it in the best way possible! Every bite had the wood scent/taste/aroma. It was a little bit overcooked; more of a medium with bright pink center but I wanted medium rare so just warm in the center but it's all good. It still was pretty delicious. It was Prime meat, super tender! The 8oz lobster tail was grilled on wood also; a side of melted butter and wedge of lemon came with it.   Caeser salad is pretty typical, it has 2 strips of anchovies on top.   Spinach side was phenomenal.
