It was lightly seasoned with salt, pepper, garlic, etc. It wasn't over cooked, there were actually some uncooked spinach mixed in the bowl that will cook when you mix it. Enough to share for 2.   Sadly no room for dessert, as per usual, but the selections seemed pretty good!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND! I'll definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 8oz filet mignon, 8oz lobster tail
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy hour Caesar Salad

_KLnmjGj-JENQWqOCCXNGA.text: We were spending a few nights in Scottsdale and our hotel concierge recommended the Roaring Fork.  The restaurant was fully booked for reservations, but we were offered seats in a covered & heated patio area (it was a little chilly out.)   The table was great with a fireplace and multiple heaters.  Unfortunately we waited a few more minutes than expected for a waiter to come to our table.   We got the attention of the first waiter we saw and he immediately apologized.  It was not his table, but he began to take our order anyway.   Within minutes two separate managers came over to apologize for the confusion and the waiter apologized again.  The rest of the service was impeccable and the food was excellent.  The appetizers (guacamole and a Caesar salad) were very good and my wife could not stop commenting on how good the Rainbow Trout was.  My Duck was moist and tasted great (even though I like it a little more well done than usual.).   The Creme Brulee's and Pecan Pie were also very good.  When the check came they had given us a courtesy discount for the initial service error.   This was completely unnecessary because they had more than made up for the minor error with the rest of the meal.    Thanks for an excellent evening.

d5jR9RScofwOt9BshuicyQ.text: I love eating at five star restaurants. From the time you walk in and the smell of delicious food permeates the entryway, you know you've hit the nail on the head. This dinner experience unfolded beautifully for me, a table in the bar was available for me to sit at and had just been cleaned and ready for me to sit down and enjoy my meal. My waitress immediately brought me water and the happy hour menu. Turns out I had looked at the dinner menu before coming to the restaurant and decided on this restaurant because they had excellent price points for their food. When I reviewed the happy hour menu the price points for the food that I wanted were on that menu and even better than the dinner menu. Certainly a bonus in my favor. I had tortilla soup, mixed greens, grilled fish tacos, and huckleberry cheesecake for dessert. I can only say one thing about this meal, it was absolutely outstanding and truly delicious.  You can tell when the chefs care about every detail of the work that they do, and it is certainly prominent in this restaurant. That's all that needs to be said absolutely outstanding! I highly recommend that you try this restaurant in your near future, and I would certainly recommend this to my family, friends, and associates everywhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sounds good to me...

ipsoTPwRFG-Wfwq-sN-3-A.text: The atmosphere was awesome and the service was great but the food was average. I ordered fish and it was too salty and mushy, wasn't a fan. I saw the giant burger go by and it looked delicious. My husband enjoyed his meal and our friends said they loved theirs. I will go back and try something different and maybe then change my rating.

IiHWOwtN2qLzO6S4kitvkw.text: We had reservations for three and ended up having almost a 25 minute wait past our reservation time. It wouldn't have been so bad if the bar wasn't packed, as we couldn't find a place to sit.   We were seated in the back next to what appeared to be a private dining area (not really private as it only had a curtain). There seemed to be quite the loud, drinking group partying it up, which was a distraction to our dining experience. On the other side of us, there was another large 8-person party that was also quite loud - probably trying to talk over the noise of the other party.  That being said, there were three in our party. We ordered the duck breast, the boneless buttermilk fried chicken and the cedar plank salmon. All three were amazing and each of us cleaned our plates. The service was on point and the quality of the meal was perfect for the price point.   I would definitely go back - however I hope if I do, there are no loud large parties thinking they are the only ones in the restaurant.

WRETh2pP_nORSa9Nmsi3CQ.text: My Babe and I came her last week for dinner.  We arrived at 7.00 at got a great booth where we could people watch.   The decor was very trendy and modern.   Very cool.  We started the meal with their famous Green Chile Pork with Tortillas....It was awesome.  This is a must try dish.  For our dinner, we had the Duck Breast and Pork Chop.  Both dishes were excellent.  For desert, we had their Pecan Pie and Warm Chocolate Cake with Ice Cream.  Both were average.  OK, but not outstanding.  The service was excellent.  I can't wait to come back and try more dishes.......no more deserts!

-2VEHpnHP_TtGPMDVbjoTw.text: Went here for the first time last night and it was amazing! Food was bursting with flavor, served at just the right temperature. The portion size was perfect. I highly recommend the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and the Green Chili Mac N Cheese was divine! I could eat buckets of it! I will definitely come back!  The poor building is in need of some TLC. Exposed pipes in the ceiling of a woman's bathroom stall, ceiling tiles looked like spray painted Styrofoam and a lot of them had scratch marks and were uneven. A few of the light bulbs were burnt out. I really like the decor and the theme of the restaurant, just needs some love!  One thing to be fussy over- I'm a germaphobe, and seeing the menus laid on top of the silverware was a little frustrating. Menus are touched by so many people and to lay them on top of the eating utensils made me nervous. Maybe keep the silverware wrapped up in a napkin if you have to put the menu on top..??

CCBK_gMT2dWQZvdXQ0B_6w.text: It's delicious- we had the salmon and the pork tacos. A side of mash potatoes! Absolutely fab. Our waitress April was excellent at caring for our needs. We been here before & we will be back!

B22gumaqkrB3NiMY6h3t_A.text: Happy Hour truly Outstanding! Great Tortilla Soup, wonderful FIS Tacos, good wine, great bartenders, super ambiance.

xrOd2NAG1CXf8a4CYsotBQ.text: First, this restaurant is family friendly. Our family of four had no problem getting a table with no reservation. Probably because it was early in the week.   Second, we ordered a bottle of wine. Our server poured the wine and used bare handed to wipe the drip around the mouth. I would not recommend getting a bottle of wine here as our server thought nothing of it. Very disgusting!   Third, the food was good. Cooked perfect!  I took a 2 stars off for wine service because that was just wrong!  The rest of the evening went well.

9mx13KOhnVjFFdnKyClYFQ.text: We have been here a few times it's generally pretty good. But tonight the fried chicken was just ok and the potatoes not good. Great place but has really slipped

9D-MtERkyjd4VH7SJgnmaA.text: We lucked into restaurant week with great choices and 3 courses with a price fixe menu.   All the food was perfectly portioned, well seasoned and cooked just right.

20-1Y2qDq7JwOco5sfHuLg.text: Happy Hour is incredible, but don't be late, line starts before 4.  My sister and I barely got it after being pushed around by snowbirds who came in after us.  All was good once we had our drinks, I had the sweeter mojito with guava and my sister loved the huckleberry margarita.  Food prices and sizes were plentiful, we had guacamole and queso.  My sister loved the yellowtail tacos and we finished with a creamy huckleberry cheesecake.  We sat on the patio and the weather was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8C_f3Usg8jGpD_bbkv48GQ.text: Great service, great food, great atmosphere, great drinks! Absolutely everything was perfect for our dinner! I had the buttermilk fried chicken with a side of green Chile Mac and cheese, you cannot go wrong with anything on their menu! It was so good!!

-yBGhz_nlcevktPXr5jAKQ.text: Visited the Roaring Fork for Happy Hour in early Sept. This had been our second visit. A year ago, we went with the recommendation of their Big Ass Burger and I have to say, it was the best mouth-watering burger I had ever had. Cooked to perfection and at least a 10 napkin , run down your arm, juicy burger. This year we ordered the same. One medium and one medium rare. The medium rare one came out raw. My son had to dig the entire middle out. The meat had no juiciness to it at all. In fact it was downright dry. Go for the 5.00 Happy Hour drinks, but pick something else for your entree than the burger !

VlZkbaFkQakSXQAhqAbLzQ.text: Ordered the Fish tacos. It was a cut up filet. Very well made, no fishiness there!  Initially I thought $18 for 3 tacos was a bit pricey. They came with a side of guacamole, corn salsa, and a sauce I couldn't get enough of!    A friend ordered the burger. It wasn't anything special.   Another friend ordered the salmon and green beans. She enjoyed it and said the salmon was delicious.

uPBa8dSzpfA7wD9tfEexdQ.text: I just need to start out by saying... BEST HAPPY HOUR ever! Especially in the winter, it is just so cozy! The Big A$$ burger is $10 and absolutely incredible. I DO encourage you to share it because it is MASSIVE (hence the name). I am also a huge fan of their guacamole ($7) and wedge salad ($6). Cocktails and wine are $5 and I highly recommend getting the huckleberry frozen margarita. Two of them will send you off smiling from ear to ear. :) Roaring Fork is one of the best places in town when you're comparing quality, quantity & price! Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delish tortilla soup!
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Big A$$ Burger! Amazing! And I highly recommend sharing, especially for the ladies. :) $10 on happy hour.
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fresh Guacamole $7 on happy hour.. Perfect for sharing!

3E6bLesSzVNCo_ORGVMbew.text: Excellent happy hour deals and service. The burger is phenomenal. Make sure your willing to wait for a spot though because outside patio is seat yourself and is always packed. Parking can also be a struggle on popular nights and peak times.

Tcb8FSiuyNMscIcIZ4bRgg.text: Snapshot: 5/5 Service, 4/5 Quality 3.9/5 Price  A few colleagues and I enjoyed dinner here. The service was exceptional, the food was exquisite and the price was reasonable.  I highly recommend the filet

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tortilla soup

7SHPdK43HlIpveaWodjxSQ.text: They have a fantastic Happy Hour ( that goes until 10:00 PM in summer time) menu.  Good drinks selection at very reasonable prices. Good smaller plates that were plenty for my wife and I.   They only challenge is they offer the Happy Hour menu in the bar area and not the restaurant seating area. The bar area can be packed at certain hours.  They should either offer the menu in the restaurant area or make the bar area larger. Most people go there for the Happy Hour menu anyway.   Winter times the HH ends at 7:00 PM.

upoxklurQUDZqBdsfxdrJw.text: This place always deliver the perfect diner every time. The menu is incredible and diverse

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Soup is so flavorful!
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The bacon wrapped 8 oz was delicious! Everything I wanted and expected!! Perfect evening on the porch.

Pf1RfN4_3QsBdNN6rYFcwA.text: Arrived to a completely booked restaurant but immediately found a table on the patio with the same service as the full inside restaurant.  Ahhh!  The smells if BBQ permeate this hot spot.  Located in the corner ground floor of an office park in Scottsdale, elegance abounds.  It is a steakhouse with Arizona infusion written all over it.  This is a good thing.  Just in time for the end of happy hour, we ordered drinks consisting of margaritas, beer and wine.  Excellent service even though they were really, really busy.  So what to order, hmm, everything looked good.  On the advice of friends, my hubby ordered the carnitas with fresh guac and salsa.  This was drop dead good.  The pork shoulder was BBQ perfectly and arrived whole at table side. The idea is to whittle away at it and build you own taco with the freshly cooked tortillas provided.  Really delicious.  The short ribs were also ordered up and my girlfriend slid a taste my way.  It was bursting with SW sensuous flavors.  Any meat lovers should order this, although the carnitas were almost tied for flavor.  I however deviated from meat and ordered the almond crusted trout.  This was also excellent and given that I did get a small taste of the beef I was completely replete!  Prior to our entrees, salads were also enjoyed.  I had the beet salad.  Really good, fresh and sublime.  In all, I would give this a five star if we were at a better table.  The patio was a little chilly and at first the tables were a bit messy.  Not their fault as the table were turning over quickly and they were slammed. Next time a reservation shall be made.  Two thumbs up.  Hankering for really good BBQ meat, go there without stopping anywhere else!  Reservations highly recommended.  Easy parking, BTW

P12gBhA0yhAlV2EHZEoOcw.text: My wife and I showed up just before opening time and the line was out the door. We almost left, but man I'm glad we stayed! My burger was delicious and my wife really liked the fish tacos. The desserts were amazing. I left way too full, hey that is what you do on vacation right?

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana split.
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seasonal dessert.
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy hour &#34;big ass burger&#34;.

wP-a73fkkM26jy-1sDvpnA.text: Excellent service, great menu, generous portions, reasonable prices and incredibly good food.

of6uX8Wls_ecRNjCpteVBA.text: Great happy hour. Must get there at 4 because there was literally a line out the door at 3:45. Our server Joey was excellent!

MyXYJ7v9UMBylvozVVj3rw.text: I've seen this place for years and never been. I wasn't really sure what to expect but we decided to try it last night. It was me, a girlfriend and my teenage daughter. I liked the vibe right away cool, cozy bar, great patio but also a good dining room. We sat at a high table in the bar. I ordered fried chicken, friend, rotisserie chicken , teen tortilla soup. Everything was good. Flavored and fresh. They do need to get some decent hot sauce for fried chicken all they had was tobasco but other than that food was good. Friend ordered a martini she said thumbs up. Price point was good and portions were generous. I will definitely add this to my list especially since it's 5 minutes from my house. It's a good comfort meal when you feel like that.

TFdfqdWKh_DkkBWUhLElzw.text: Real disappointment. Menu is very limited. Service was terrible. Food was served to us cold and was not very good. Waiter had a snooty attitude. Way too expensive.

hO23z7o_V3teuv23bHhBdQ.text: We made a last minute decision to stop in for dinner here. The inside of the restaurant is beautiful. The wood burning rotisserie in the large host area is custom built and gorgeous. The place was packed on a Thursday night. There are multiple dining areas where guests can watch the cooks on different parts of the line including the wood burning pizza oven, the broiler or saute station, etc. the inside was full, so we were offered a table outside. Unfortunately the outside section was a bit of a let down. It wasn't nearly as exciting and lacked the wonderful sights and sounds and intense aromas that diners were enjoying inside. It was bland and a bit boring, frankly. When our waiter approached us, he was very abrupt and seemed annoyed about something. We guessed that it was because he had been given a small table. Who knows. After all was said and done, the meal was enjoyable. The food was really outstanding, in fact. My only recommendation would be to sit inside, if possible. Don't know if there is much to do about a waiter having a bad day. I wouldn't go so far to say the service was bad, but a couple of sarcastic comments rubbed me the wrong way. I would love to go back, sit inside, and try a lot more of the food, which was sophisticated, elegant, well balanced, and just delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seared scallops
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork rib lollipops
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rotisserie chicken tortilla soup with guacamole and tortilla strips

RZy08LcgvWwVVh1alCwtGA.text: Pleasantly surprised.  Disappointed so many times by restaurants after finding them online, but not this time.  We were staying close by and called 20 min before it opened and got a reservation.  When were got there it was packed already even though it had just opened, but we got right in. Started with the seasonal salad with heirloom tomatoes and apples and it was excellent. Lots of flavor.  My husband got the pork tenderloin and it was delicious. Beautiful presentation. The corn and grits were sweet and delicious. I had the fish tacos. They were also great, a little bit stronger fish than I like, but still really good and the black beans which I normally don't eat were good too. Finished off the meal with pecan pie with Brown butter gelato and fresh whipped cream.  Rich and yummy.  Lots of pecans.  The gelato might have been the star of the dessert. The service was excellent, our water glasses were never empty and empty plates were removed immediately.  Would highly recommend.

su4CLam3jn0-FmbK2709Kg.text: Every time I've been here the food has been great. I have to say though, my most recent trip 4/14, the service was SERIOUSLY lacking. When we told the head hostess we were there for happy hour not dinner, her smile turned to a frown and she quickly told us to seat ourselves. We were still without silverware when our food started coming out and then a server spilled the toppings from our chips all over the table, told us he'd be back to clean it up and never came back. Still have to give it 4 stars though  since this is my first review of this place and past experiences with service weren't this bad.

hU--Loe6OR9Rn2SktvJ2Vg.text: The ambiance of this place would be perfect for a date night or a get together where it is possible to have a conversation. Definitely has an upscale feel but without being pretentious. They take reservations and I would definitely make another one! The food was great and the wait staff all seemed to really enjoy their work, not a single bitter Waffle House waitress in the place. Lots of unique flavors and the Mac and cheese is a must!

AOwGR2sNFV86k6jSFhxZ4A.text: Not going to lie.....the location is kind of hidden. However, the food was glorious! Came in on a Sunday....happy hour was in effect. Great prices. Ordered the pork and green chili in a kettle and the street corn. Guac for the appetizer. Everything was soo flavorful and filling. A little bit older of a crowd but no bad vibes or anything. We sat at a high top table but the bartender sounded like he was engaging the people who were belly up to the bar. Good vibes. Definite yes if you're looking for a new place to drink and be happy.

0KChKxNr_cmaL9pSocgVoA.text: Blah, Blah, Blah. I could go on forever about the GREAT food at the bar during happy hour. Truly yummy. I couldn't get enough of the lamb chops even though they were not part of happy hour and the B.A.B. was better than ever! BUT.... (you knew this was coming)...The two bartenders at happy hour on 5/6/2017 were just HORRIBLE. Hubby, asking for a Bloody Mary with potato vodka, should NOT result in a heavy sigh complete with eye roll. "Well, that's not on the happy hour menu," was the comment he received back. Well, neither were the lambs chops, my friend. I ordered my Chardonnay which was plopped at the far edge of the bar and never poured for me from the decanter. FOOD WAS TERRIFIC (didn't I say that already?) Next round of drinks. Gentlemen to the left and right of us were served. We were ignored, so I started to time how long it would take for them to attend to us. TWELVE MINUTES AND THIRTY-SIX SECONDS later I finally shouted, "Excuse me!! Hello! I've been waiting twelve minutes and thirty six seconds for another round of drinks." Blondie runs right over to HER PARTNER and says, "She's (pointing finger in my direction) timing us." No kidding Sister. Your customer service is atrocious. No smile, no eye contact, I don't appreciate having my drinks slammed on the counter in front of me with a look of disgust. I did buy the gentleman and his lady friend sitting next to me a drink to try and change the vibes at the bar. And YES!, I complained to the night manager. And NO!, I refused any recompense for my issue. I would however, recommend that Roaring Fork FIRE!!!!!!!!!! these two idiots behind the bar or sell the entire restaurant to SAM FOX. HE KNOWS HOW TO RUN AN ESTABLISHMENT!!!! Don't forget, I said I loved the food! NO kidding!!

q0gh2_0b2BbbeaQD6YJcGg.text: This is a GREAT happy hour.  All night every night during the summer.  Gotta love a business that likes to cater to the locals!  They know we need a reason to step out of our air conditioning during these months of hell.  It can get pretty crowded in the lounge area (only place you can get hh) without the patio seating like in chiller months, but since it's also slower, it works.  The huckleberry marg is strong and packs a punch for $5.  All of the other app options are solid.  This one is going into the rotation for sure!

GMHBXvN243pI6YEkFYelJg.text: Found this place on Yelp.  It was hard to find, as it was not right off the road, but in the back of the parking lot. Made reservations, were taken right in.  Server was very attentive. I got the Big Ass Hamburger and I was too full for dessert.  Delicious. Pricy, upscale splurge. The memory of that hamburger may bring me back for more.

zezyjj77gss1rSg6qKTrig.text: Hadn't eaten here in many years, but this last visit confirmed my recollection of their first-rate food. Artful presentation, excellent food, and attentive service make this a near must when visiting Phoenix.

VUqprY4Y8mMpUTUw4xuVIw.text: I will definitely go back.  Went on a Thursday night with a coworker and a client, we chose the Fork because we could actually hear ourselves talk without yelling over the table. Our server, Daryl, was very attentive and had a great personality. Our cocktails came in a good amount of time as did our appetizers and entree. Our client ordered the short ribs which I tasted and they were fall-off-the-bone tender and the sauce was super tasty. I ordered the oven roasted shrimp on a bed of cheese grits. Yum-my! One of my shrimp was only partially deveined but it was no big deal. My coworker ordered the halibut and he said it was perfectly cooked and equally as tasty.  Looks like a great lunch place too. Oh, one more thing, I am a lettuce/salad snob and my caesar salad came crisp and perfectly dressed.

k5W8x9AkZSGCID1Effa14Q.text: One of my favorite happy hour locations -- the food, drinks and bartenders are fantastic. I love that they use a favorite gin in their happy hour martini. The flat bread pizza, pork wings, tortilla soup and the burgers are amazing. You can't go wrong here -- get there early, it' gets crowded!

2xQMPR_ATOn9-TqldFXnPw.text: Not impressed with food. Didn't like sauce on lambchops. Service was great! The bar had crowded tables, hard to manuever around. I will try it another time because it was recommended by friends who go often and enjoy the snapper snd salads. The chocolate torte was rich and pretty good. I wish the RF all the best!

XZkXeg0YDldDb4SN6nfHEw.text: This place was great! Nice secluded location, office building surrounding so not much traffic or noise! The staff was very friendly, from host to server! They were ready to accommodate us at our reservation time, I did not have to wait any longer.   Food was excellent! Most places in Scottsdale are overpriced with no quality in the food, I loved everything from my glass of Pinot noir to my salmon dish. The fresh bread had much variety, from dinner rolls to muffins. We ordered the chicken flatbread appetizer. It was delicious. My salmon was cooked perfectly with a tad bit of BBQ sauce marinated on top, pure perfection. I chose mash potatoes as my side, the gravy was amazing. The presentation of the dinner was very southern and I liked that, very different and unique in Scottsdale.   The decor of the restaurant was very warm and cozy, but elegant and classy! I truly enjoyed my experience and I will refer, recommend and return to roaring fork. Bravo!

OGOFEDDtzvvSeA4q8Uuc5A.text: Happy Hour is the best time to visit and is the best value. Don't miss the "Big Ass" burger or green chili pork. Get there before the 4pm start of happy hour to ensure you get a seat. There's often a line out the door!

AsJhfSjJFMhFMa0qGa9f0w.text: Took my out of town cousins to the place as I know they like to eat.  This place delivers, although at first we had a bad table, next to the outside seating, too drafty, but they did reseat us.  The pork appetizer is very tasty, a bit spicy, good flavors.  The guac is chunky and full of flavor, unlike that of another place I recently panned.  Cousin had short ribs, a generous portion and found it very flavorful.  My fish tacos were quite good as well, and my husband loved the generous portion of trout.  I think almost everything is well prepared with good flavor.  Great for out of town guests.

fpS7DeGecld3hJDVfLykEA.text: Service was and always is amazing. Food here is exceptional. Happy hour here is non stop and always perfect.

JADB18J2HvOWEk2xM6qcOQ.text: My husband enjoyed the boneless chicken. I loved the pork tenderloin!  Great service!!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Anniversary dessert!

dHsQusf5v5021gsCXXjxKA.text: I would say this place is pretty good. Wouldn't get excited about coming here, but wouldn't be opposed to it.  They were very nice about moving us to a booth when we asked, and the service was pretty good. We really liked the bread! The special was a fish dish, and it was pretty good. I ordered a salad with chicken, and it was decent. We were hoping for some good vegetarian options, but they didn't seem to have any.

FQe0VkdiR-2tiFINeZHq0Q.text: Fantastic happy hour and excellent cuisine. It's a great place for both out of town visitors as well as locals!

5Jk7DcZyZ4xFoMTLIgUOsw.text: Roaring Fork is great... Been many times and I've never had a bad experience. Food is always great no matter what I order and service is top notch. They have great happy hour specials where you can get some amazing food for a cheap price. My personal favorite is the lamb shank fondu! Its one of my all time favorite appetizers and I find myself craving it often

3379N-WdXGf4Q6ZU-aYFEw.text: Visiting from out of state and this was our first time at the Roaring Fork. Went on a Monday evening and had dinner in the bar. Very nice place, great service, reasonably priced menu, outstanding food. Will definitely go again when we get back to Scottsdale.

xpotVPHgWw_ZImsyfJdQOA.text: We were a party of 10, celebrating an upcoming wedding. We sat in the covered patio with misters. The ambiance was great and the service exceptional. The scallops were amazing and the corn and mac and cheese sides to accompany steak or fish were outstanding. I hightly recommend this restaurant.

Ws4IKnr8piwel1q_41E7qQ.text: I had the ribs they were great.  The beer selection needs work.  I do not understand why places like this have Bud Light on the menu.  There should be a lot more craft beers on the menu.

6U80y-S9fV5JbAkE6a4UKA.text: Enjoyed the roaring fork so much !  I would suggest better signage for out of towners but that is the only thing I can suggest.   The  green chili pork with fresh tortillas was fabulous .  The pork wings were pretty good but could have been more tender .  The big ass burger was enjoyed by my husband and son and I really enjoyed the fish tacos .  Great service and the ambiance on the patio was just the best !   Enjoy this place ... Too bad I don't live in Scottsdale as I would be a regular !

UaujkOF0zEwkOEnqv6dGHQ.text: I am in love with the Roaring Fork, but only recently tried their Sunday brunch, and I have to say, it was DELICIOUS!  For only $20, you can enjoy an all you can eat buffet of some of the Fork's finest offerings, from eggs benedict, to pork and chile verde, to enchiladas, to pretty much anything else you can imagine!!  And save room for dessert, the bananas foster is heavenly!

F4QwjDwWVnPASzp0cHK9HQ.text: Wow, this place surprised me. From the outside, it looks like any other restauraunt attached to an office building. However, as soon as I walked in the door and saw chickens on a rotisserie I knew I was in for a good meal. Everytime I have been here the service has been outstanding, the food amazing and the drinks strong. They have a great happy hour and a wonderful complimentary bread basket. If you are into mac and cheese you have to try it here.

jZdfsb8cewRVO5-pJCOVPQ.text: Didn't get to sit outside so a little disappointed.  We saw the "big assed burgers" and all decided to get one.  They were great but a bit messy.  Food and service were excellent.  Will try and get back for happy hour

x0azkISGxma48E8KMpNhAQ.text: Sunday brunch was a huge disappointment. The place wasn't all that busy but, they were constantly running out of food and it took ages for them to bring more food out.   They ran completely out of brisket at the carving station and replaced it with a RAW pork loin. It wasn't just undercooked, it was Red in the middle when they cut into it. They took it back and cooked it some more but then brought it back out to the carving station and served it directly on the cutting board where they had just cut the raw pork loin a few minutes earlier.  The fried chicken was like eating leather. We didn't even get to try several of the items because they were out and it took forever for the empty trays to be replaced.  Big disappointment. Will never go back.

vhk_XeVJL5Nj86raDqdEFQ.text: I have been a couple times and already one of my faves!  The rotisserie chicken with bread pudding and vegetables, pork tenderloin and cheese grits, crab cakes, kettle green chile, green chile mac n cheese, and even the bread the serve are all excellent choices!  Also very pleased with the huckleberry margarita:)  Service and ambience very good, nothing bad to say to date.  Can wait to try happy hr!

bfx_t9R7NoLw2nTeLF75SA.text: My first time at Roaring Fork.  I had the baby back ribs.  the portion was huge and I gave part away.  The food was good but the service was a bit slow.    I recommend it.

svm3YdZJslU7-2meWqsZmw.text: i've been there a few times, food has always been delicious, had one service complaint and resolution exceeded expectations.  recommend the pork queso app, and the filet is fantastic

mJccYKUwpXI21aSevruazg.text: Fantastic food + impeccable service = 5 stars, baby.  Let me just say something about Lauren, our server.  She was incredible!  There were ten of us at the table and by the end of the dinner had learned all of our names.  Just absolutely great service.  The food is upscale American classics, like green chile mac & cheese.  Go here when you are in Scottsdale!

g6RzWV_nV7QJRPn-_uxkZQ.text: Big Ass Burger was awesome! Great $5 mojitos. Service was excellent. Best place to go in Scottsdale!

rFMX8AOz8EgPVucU6fw4hA.text: There on a SUNDAY-  all day happy hour.  happy hour prices great!  food awesome!  had BIG ASS burger- we shared a side of the famous mac&cheese (think its chipolte chile mac and cheese) normally never order it , but it was excellent-  everyone at the table loved the food.   busy but managed to get a patio seat- by luck im sure-  had my 7 and 10 year old boys with me-  they were fine and my 7 year old was able to order off the kids menu--which is not in print-  but they do have the basics, kraft mac& cheese, chicken strips, burger.

7fSQL1pjURxS_OHa5aLr4g.text: This restaurant ranks as one of my best dining experiences ever. The wife and I will definitely be back on our next trip to Scottsdale. The ribs were fantastic and the rest of the food plentiful and good.

5iqIRP4iG73bNcOQwBr_Sw.text: Went to happy hour here with some clients and it was great. Three rounds of drinks plus everyone ordered off their appetizer menu and the bill was $85... not bad. The place filled up a lot while I was there, apparently it's a pretty popular happy hour hang out- I will definitely do it again.   Myself and client #1 got the fish tacos (w/ Mahi Mahi), they were great- kind of a build your own deal on the plate which I liked. Client #2 got the green chili pork stew which he liked and I can personally say is awesome.   Service was good and the atmosphere is comfy. Great place, a bit off the beaten path but still near old town.

PP44NFz-sz7pREvKaLW3yg.text: Very good service.  The Adult Arnold Palmer is delicious, both the standard and peach version. Great food as well.  Don't forget to get a side of green chili mac 'n' cheese!

1U3a3NmcQKBkx52XrsVIRA.text: Excellent food and a comfortable atmosphere. We sat in the bar and the service was better than bar service normally is.  After a couple of signature appetizers we had the carnitas.  Excellent!

YqtBvIMX17nYCaqsvb4Vbw.text: great place have to try the pork chile Verde and the happy hr was a great deal

qfkQkEdYjJdnJjLZlSu0PA.text: Mmm mmm... Dr Pepper braised short ribs with cheesy grits and a side of green chile mac and cheese.  Would highly recommend both of those dishes.  I'm getting hungry thinking about it!  Nice outdoor seating area and great bar area inside.

JwP7f79Ma9eUL2tILLQxQg.text: Fantastic happy hour. All of the apps were great and well priced

28tMqN8uDkHsZgqxaDXLcQ.text: Certainly one of my favorite places to dine in Scottsdale.  It's such a cozy location, and seems missed by the typical Snottsdale persona. It's not about the flashy, just the food.  Happy hour has amazing prices, with drinks around $5 and near full meal sized appetizers around $10.  Outside of happy hour, the duck is my fav with out a doubt.  Cooked to perfection, it's juicy and sweet.  Don't forget the green chile Mac and cheese as a side dish!   Wine selection is strong, but not huge.  My only wish is they had more craft beers available.  If you're going to go, make a reservation, they use Open Table.

0kdeAkRD4Ik3JyVIPBjv4Q.text: Solid place! Reservation is definitely needed, as it's popular. And, for good reason! They know how to cook pork probably better than any I've ever had. That enough should justify a 5. But, only thing I'd change would be the environment. It was a bit noisy and the windows were covered up with some decoration that I didn't really prefer. It you don't care about any of that, I'll tell you this is a gem. The clever drinks also hit the spot. Thanks Roaring Fork!

jNv-6ROM9cnddalOLqxXNg.text: Shrimp and Grits = A solid ten!  Beer selection = decent. Had enough choices to be good but nothing to rave about. Both IPA's I had were small batch (Colorado and Oregon) but were in a bottle and can (can which I really enjoyed). Wish they had a selection of craft beers in tap. Also had the fried banana split. Excellent. Would I go back - without question.

I_c-5UJbtWq85DgRGQFg3A.text: It was a our last night in Scottsdale and wanted to end it on a good note. So we ended up having our last dinner at the Roaring Fork. Our hostess was very attentive and the food delicious. The fillet mignon was so tasty and melted in my mouth. Thank you Roaring Fork for making our visit to Scottsdale that much more memorable.

x-Vp0GL9dcWX7tRvOb7E0Q.text: This restaurant is very large, and is located in the bottom of an office building. We ordered the fried chicken and the rotisserie chicken. Both of the meals were fine, and the rotisserie chicken was a bit dry. We sat on the patio, which was huge, but the traffic was very loud on Scottsdale road. Overall, the meal was fine. There wasn't anything to really complain about, and the service was good. It was just pretty average.

2MXpgUCM-Qfr4uAV_Khhlg.text: Great place for happy hour. Only four stars cuz the service is always hit or miss but the food has always been choice..

_wCeezwdRt3Rm9kGhNUbyw.text: Be aware when making reservations that the Arizona Room is outside.  We were never informed of this at anytime even after confirming our reservation. We tried to explain that we were never told that we'd be seated outdoors and the hostess continued to argue that she had confirmed that we would be in the Arizona Room. Who would expect to be seated outside in the summer?   Had we known, we would never have agreed to this.  After some debating we were given a table indoors.  We were there to celebrate our Anniversary and this completely ruined our evening.  Needless to say, they were running a special and very busy. We were told the Manager would come over to our table and that never happened either.  It was extremely disappointing to say the least.  The only highlight was our waitress, Amanda.  She was wonderful and made the evening very pleasant after a very unpleasant beginning.

EIxWXqRYnYWIHu6qlo4cTg.text: I had high expectations for this place after reading all the positive reviews, but I think it's a little overrated. I wouldn't say it was terrible and the service was good, but we have no desire to go back. We took my parents there and they had the same feelings. The guacamole appetizer was ok. Dad had the big ass burger and said it was overdone. I took a bit and totally agree. Mom and wife had the sugar cured duck. It looked and tasted like pork and some had a bit of gristle. It didn't have a whole lot of flavor (I sampled it too). I had a mixed green salad with cranberries and pecans. It was probably the highlight of my meal. I ordered the spot roasted chicken for dinner because it looked and smelled awesome roasting when we walked in. Unfortunately the breast was dry and the thigh was tiny and I've probably had better chicken at Boston Market for a lot cheaper. Dad and wife liked the pecan toffee pie and ice cream. I didn't care for it but I don't like toffee. Overall disappointed and wouldn't really recommend this place unless you have money to burn.

pBGh4NjB7idAVILObvwexA.text: yummy yummy  sat out side.. very nice..  the bread basket is great.   includes corn muffins ..  had the pork tenderloin, perfect!!! $18 (including the mash potato and corn) the filet is perfect too ($34) and doesn't include sides (expect 6-10 for spinach etc. )  downside; music selection for this upscale place stinks, best of duran duran.. ugh.. how about a little frank sinatra   here is the deal, eat at the bar and its happy hour till 10pm..  i'm going back for sure.

ztda6-pU11G7XKFcha4VUw.text: We came early and intended to eat off the happy hour menu.  However, when we walked through the front door and saw (and smelled) the pork roasting on the spit, I knew we were in trouble.  We did have HH drinks and the tortilla soup (which was amazing).  Then we went for the pork carnitas and the pork tenderloin.  Both were excellent, but the carnitas really stold the show.

PeX3mS0Wz0D-H72EGTCiTQ.text: I attended with a large group of over 30. The food was very good. Can't be too hard on the service for a group this size but it was a little slow. The green chili Mac and cheese was unique and very good.

W2MAZgH6Pknq0K-_qR0_ig.text: Love this place! We ate in the bar recently and everything from the food to the service was 5 stars! Our party had several items -the green chili pork appetizer, fried buttermilk chicken, filet, short ribs, and sliders. I wish I could remember the name of our server because she was very attentive and friendly.  Will be back!

u4o-0EiwTF2thhDvMsbK-g.text: Our first visit to the Roaring Fork, and an amazing experience and food.  Our server, Jesse was wonderful, personable, and just playful enough to keep us entertained. My date had duck, best he's ever eaten, I has bacon wrapped shrimp, fabulous!  and the heated pecan pie with gelato,  to die for!  Reasonably prices. Several management figures stopped by to chat.  They truly seem interested in the local patrons, and offering a wonderful experience.  Thank you for a wonderful evening!  and yes, yes, yes,  the Green Chili Mac was the best!

3JlHa-GZDIDxF9Ent6Be3A.text: Heard of this place off its Yelp review. Was not disappointed. Started with Con Queso, which was promptly devoured. My girlfriend and I each had the fried chicken. Cooked to perfection, with an impeccable peppercorn sauce. Service was great as well. Drink menu had a nice mix. Only gave 4 stars because the menu was too meat-oriented.

lwZ2FbQEVArfAbB4bS03fQ.text: One of my fave spots before or after a movie.  Green Chile stew is wicked and Caesar is goood.  The best is the Vanilla Shake with chocolate sprinkles - best in the southwest.  Get a cookie on your way out.

XeSZwsPLq-1ECUrX28f1cw.text: Wow!  What an amazing meal and the entire staff at the restaurnat was unbelievable.  They were very accommodating when we had to push our reservation back a bit, even on a busy Saturday night.  The wait staff was amazing and knowledgeable, the chef was able to cook up some special off menu veggies for my baby and the manager came by each table to ask how everything was.  On top of that - the food is SOOOO good.  Delicious comfort food with a gourmet twist on all the classic favorites that makes it feel upscale.  Definitely a great place for a celebration or special night out.  I can't recommend highly enough.

nmQSwWiVtfFdZnf8xts92w.text: Great atmosphere, the prime rib from the brick oven was especially delicious and tender as was the braised pork.. Green chile mac and cheese seemed to be the big draw, I found that a bit salty and quite filling.  Deserts are very good but nothing amazing

GSafLUNkFNSOuQtS-vkPfg.text: Green chile pork was amazing. And happy hour all summer is awesome.

2GI8OXagPpdTJEypvPXImg.text: Very hard to find, parking was a nightmare, don't go in the garage, Mother's Day brunch, way overpriced buffet at $42, a few ok items, wasn't too impressed, mimosa was tasty with the right amount of champagne, service was good, mediocre at best

Z2AyGukX1JLUtf1oVzRZvg.text: Excellent meal!  I had pork shoulder carnitas with an excellent wine.  They have some interesting cocktails too.. I think my friend had an agave margarita?  Also tried the watermelon salad which was delicious.  Price was just right and the service was very good. Make a reservation for a weekend evening, it tends to get pretty busy.  Very nice patio also!  I'll be back!

sJ70Ij2w1APRwS2NYpR57Q.text: I've only been to Roaring Fork once, but I enjoyed my experience there.   I had a bacon wrapped pork tenderloin that was delicious. My wife had a trout dish that she thought as alright, but she really liked the green chile and pork appetizer. We sat outside on the patio on a cool evening and it made for a really nice ambiance. Service was very attentive and the prices were reasonable considering the quality and portions of the food. I definitely want to return to try their Big Ass burger. I love burgers and with a name like that, I've got to order it at least once.  Location is a little weird, at the bottom of an office building off Scottsdale road, but once you find it you'll be glad you did.

J-b6uNcAbAcE_55gpC1wag.text: Worst restaurant experience ever..!! I would give no stars if I can..  Four stars on Yelp, so who wouldn't give it a try right..?!?! So my girlfriends and I chose this place for our happy hour gig. And so this is how it went. 3 friends first got to the place at 430ish and it was already almost packed at the bar area where the happy hour is only allowed. The 3 girls tried to scout the area where we could sit and enjoy but to no luck because the bar area is a first come first serve basis. They informed the receptionist and were offered that we can stay at the regular dining area but can only stay til 630..because they have reservation...(trying not to write down the girls' reactions to this). 10 girls all together for happy hour and only 2 hours to chat, that's not possible and to be told to have a time limit to eat at a well known restaurant..?!?!? So the receptionists offered to call the manager to settle and accommodate us who never came after 30mins. At this time, most of us already were in the restaurant and eager to sit and start. We were offered again to stay at the regular dining area but can only stay til 730..hmmm..we really wanted to try the place so we gave in, 3 hours will at least be enough..One of us stayed at the front area and insisted on talking to the manager while the rest of us were ushered to our table...all the way to the very far corner of the room..and the entire room is EMPTY..!!! And they have told us the tables are all reserved. We tried to take some deep breaths and still be optimistic with our day. Our friend who insisted on talking with the manager came back and told us of their conversation. She only stated to the manager that we have never heard of such comments (stated above) from restaurants staff ever before and this is what the manager whose name is Ivars Melbardis had told her: "We are already giving you a courtesy by giving you a table at the regular dining area."   Really...?!?! We were all in shock!! We have never experienced anything like it. After hearing that shocking rude comment, we immediately decided to leave the place even though we've already been seated. We were in disbelief on how they treated paying customers like us and to say like we owe them for coming in to their restaurant. Such an arrogant manager!   I know this might be a very rare occasion but there's no excuse to treat customers like that. It is very rude and inappropriate. I hope this never happens to those who wanna try this place or any other place in that matter. My friends and I just want this incident to be out there for awareness.

SWoBUATdzQq8ybdnzEFZNQ.text: it's been a while since we've been back. and i'd have to say since sampling other happy hours, i have to renege my initial "best happy hour in town" excitement. it's a tad pricey for a happy hour menu...10-15 buck apps and drinks for 5 bucks. the fish tacos are tasty, and the ahi tuna was ok, not the best i've had.   we've been here half a dozen times since moving to scottsdale and it's always been a reliable place. especially for a higher priced dinner. i hear the 'big-ass' burger is very good. unfortunately, we'll probably stick to a happy hour that leaves our wallet a little happier somewhere else.

dnfdboVwvatOhrtDerg1LQ.text: Incredible salmon with a delicious sauce, good wine selection, wonderful cocktails, and awesome service. I was very impressed on Saturday night.  Came with a group of ladies and my friend was even treated to a drink for her birthday. All the food was so yummy and the drinks too! Well worth the price.

vdbjM_KoP_fu-hjrkID9fw.text: The quality of their food is amazing and when I received the check I was shocked that it wasn't more expensive. If you are visiting Scottsdale AZ you have to make time for this resturant!

W34ZSse69QqD2sx1yefHRQ.text: Great place, impeccable service, just a wee bit on the pricy side which makes this a special occasion resturant only for us!

TsVqlP4aGE2sRZwsryq4Vw.text: I've passed Roaring Fork multiple times on Scottsdale Road, wasn't until Yelp and the great reviews that we decided to give it a try and head over.  Perfect timing for us too because it was happy hour.  I had a guava mojito (litte sour and wish it had been shaken) but it was still good.  Then we had the green chile pork, tortilla soup, and split a burger.  The food was amazing. Loved the pork. Service was great, we had Ally, very friendly and attentive.  Will go back again and again!

f0LLNIQ0hSwhVDHHj4vcDA.text: Fresh Baked Bread to start! Great Tortilla Soup! A Good "Big Ass" Burger Great Service!

3zQtSguW8UUN__AGtWCX2g.text: If your over 55 and enjoy overpriced "Happy Hour" food then this is your place. It is also cramped and crowded at the bar and I spotted a good number of those fruit fleas swirling around the bar area. Place caters to the well heeled and sweater wearing crowd and although it was Monday Night football, no volume was on the small TV and nobody, but me, was really interested in the game. The least expensive food for HH is 6 bucks and that is bowl of soup. Other dishes that came out looked like the ole tiny portions at HH prices swaperoo. I tried their famous Huckleberry margarita and although not bad, it came out of a machine and a swirl of huckleberry or something similar was put on top of drink. Nothing here at this place warrants a return viisit and they should work on that fruit fly problem beacuse that is a major issue swatting them away sitting at the bar.

b_TEbWuJ2DMOmmIJugn79A.text: Not much I can say that hasn't been covered.  Comfortable upscale - Western decor, well laid out room, and you can count on consistently great service, food and libation.  Definitely dig the happy hour - what a great place to start!  Also dig how perfect the Manhattan was.  It's shocking how many places screw up such a classic (and truly simple) cocktail.    Some friends were in from out of town and really wanted to go here for dinner. Kenneth, our server was flawless!  (And I am not just saying that becuase I recognized him from a restaurant he used to work at and we have friends in common.)  Within our group, we had the pork green chile, fried chicken, salmon, ribs and lamb.  A couple sides of green chile mac, a side of asparagus, and a couple to-go boxes at the end!  All the dishes were fresh, flavorful, and plated beautifully.  Will definitely be back - and I have plans on working my way through the happy hour drink list.  What a wonderful goal! :)

VGeRO8kSD-h9JZqJox0bmA.text: Awesome fish tacos - Happy hour awesome - very tough to get a table bar side - worth the wait! Always good service ...

H0vvz7_IVvKqz8wfpPxygQ.text: Everything is awesome.  Guac.  Their unique version of carne guisada tacos.  Carne con Queso was unique.  Redfish was tasty as well as the filet and Grouper.

1a-x3FKG14zJ2pAMkqCUkw.text: I made a reservation to go here for my sister's 21st birthday, and overall, it was a great experience!  The food was absolutely delicious, and our waitress provided excellent service.  We were sat in the patio/dining area, and it was a great atmosphere.  My sister got to order her first drink, and she thought they were good-- her favorite was the Category 6 Lemonade!  We also ordered a white russian, huckleberry martini Martini, and a Chocolate Martini.   For food, we got the Scallops, Spinach Chicken Waldorf Salad, Lamb Chops & Fondue, and the Green Chili Mac and cheese.  The rest of the table ordered the "Big Ass Burger", which was excellent, and huge!!!  Since it was her birthday, the restaurant allowed me to bring a birthday cake, and they served it after dinner, and lit the candles for us!  Overall, it was an awesome dinner! I would highly recommend going here, and I am sure we will go back for more burgers!!!

uOepnpWeCeH4ydlmr9vEXA.text: Pros:  Delicious food. Hands down.  Overall 5/5.  GREAT happy hour...get the Green Chilli Pork app and the Pork chops!  The atmosphere is dark, fun, and enjoyable.  It is always packed for happy hour so you have to come early or waiting for a first come first serve table at the bar.    Cons:  Service is hit or miss.  80% of the time its been very good for me but last time was a little weird.  The waiter disappeared for about 30min while we were waiting for the check.  The parking lot is ALWAYS almost full.  The avg age of people who go there are probably 30s and up.  I'm in my 20s and still love to go with my friends bc we love great food and a good atmosphere. :)

osQIxr6uepUL-m3SDUQa_g.text: Drove cross town and was not disappointed.  Atmosphere is super comfortable .. pork tenderloin, apps, sides all just right.  Happy hour drinks ($5 Manhattans!) a great deal (beware, bar is crowded.) Highly recommend .. Always.

jrL9tSCejYg44Ok_NHw0pQ.text: Great Happy Hour! Just get there early because the bar fills up fast.  Love the pork green chile.

KbC011QnxJmbZWmRBgSxvg.text: Went with a party of 16 and loved this place.  I had the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin with a side of the green chili mac and cheese and it was excellent.  My wife had fish tacos which were great as well.  Everyone at the table seemed to enjoy what they got.  The carnitas looked good and my friend said he enjoyed them.  His girlfriend had a filet and the one bite I tried of it was excellent.  The location is a little different, as people have said...but once you get in the front door, it's a cool atmosphere and the patio in the back is very nice and spacious.  I highly recommend trying this place out.

f9awwOu-8Vm-PQrsY6fJlQ.text: Grab your AARP card before grabbing a bite at the RF. We used to frequent the RF previous to McGrath selling it. Back so far to the original on Camelback. I miss the RF back in the day. Now the happy hour crowd is blue haired snow birds eating free bread & yapping relentlessly about politics & foods they can't eat anymore. The food portions are smaller & bland (minus the Big ASS burger). The martini glasses are a joke in size and the service sitting at the bar was SLOW. If I were a day older I'm afraid I'd die just waiting for the food. Very disappointed from start to finish. We miss you at the RF Robert. Insert sad faces all around.

335hLuwFgUupps64nhzJUA.text: Everything we ordered between four of us was fabulous. We ordered the filet mignon, salmon, ribeye Delmonico and the redfish. The salads, green chili Mac n cheese and the pot of green chili were also good. The green chili was very flavorful albeit a little salty. They also have a large selection of wines and other alcoholic beverages, bourbons, scotch, etc.. The desserts were also really good as we ordered the creme brulee.  This place is perfect for special occasions and they have lovely personal touches. The staff signed an anniversary card for us as well as have a red rose on the table for me. We will definitely be returning to try some of the other menu items that looked amazing.

Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

jWiFjV5IK6bympYorU8ZWQ.text: Good place for happy hour, the food and drinks are great. The bartenders are not all that friendly, but I still enjoy this spot every once in awhile.

IEv6Om0aZ13HotdgFzAfwg.text: Never been here before and will never go here ever!! Waited at the front desk, never got greeted. The people that work here saw us standing by the front desk and never came to us and told us we can seat ourselves, they ignored us. Some old sobby witches walked right past us and took the last table, so we finally asked a waitress who walked right past us if it was "seat yourself"...... she told us "oh yes you seat yourself,  but sorry there are no seats available". Really dumba** you saw us standing here, but we have to ask you?!!. What did you think that I was just standing there for the hell of it?!! How about you put a freaking sign up that states seat yourself if you're not going to have someone at the front to greet customers that come in.

TsOcrwfFTTix1egHN1YwVg.text: Happy hour is an amazing deal here! I had the burger. It is HUGE! I could only eat a fourth of it. You can definitely split it with someone.

NeLUThPSwhdekS9rzvL1Mw.text: I love their salads with rotisserie chicken. Usually busy so try to get a reservation.

U5HXjw2cCXABOxJvN-vGcw.text: If you are heading here for happy hour, I am about to give you the best Yelp advice ever. Go early and scope out tables that are paying their check, stand there and wrestle any interlopers to the floor in a fight to the death. Why? Because my party was polite and gave our names to wait for a happy hour table as they were all full. We sat there while 20 or so people just barged through the hostess podium and snagged up every seat that was opening up. Being somewhat intelligent, we learned to do the same and finally got a spot in the bar, which is the only place that serves happy hour drinks and specials. I think if you go there by five you may get a seat instantly, otherwise, use my ninja method and you will access the greatness that is The Roaring Fork.   Super vibe, everyone glad to be there. Wait staff is overworked with the crazed happy hour bunch, so if you're having a date night, sit in the upscale dining area that will impress your special someone. People were well-dressed, mainly professionals and quite a few retirees (Area is full of senior neighborhoods).   The happy hour drinks do not skimp on the alcohol. Quite the opposite, so have a DD. The big ass burger is a must, we also got raves on the chili verde pork and salads. Nothing was sub par except the learning curve on figuring out how to get into this place.   My advice to the management would be to actually require the hostess to seat people, so that the rudest, pushiest people do not win. Take names and have your seating be as beautiful a thing as your food. Because those pushy people are also walking around the place like sharks hunting prey and we found that to be very annoying.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bigazz burger
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 5$ margarita
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Which is large?

A-AEhOMEZpHZgLaYnc2Xlg.text: 4 stars are for the lovely ambiance--took one off for the totally disconnected and unengaged staff (from hostess to server). Enter into a warm and inviting space, reminiscent of a Napa winery/restaurant. Wide variety of seating options--patio, bar, high tops, dining tables and booths (large and small). The food is fresh and flavorful--our group had the Blackened Redfish, Salmon, and Double Pork Chop--all our plates were cleaned! Our server literally picked up a napkin that had fallen on the ground and placed it on my husband's lap, lackadaisically threw the glass of Pinot on the table, and just seemed too distracted to be concerned with our dining experience--sad trombones--wah, wah

EZxMUgWdyHLQFn7XtPqs8A.text: Solid happy hour, beautiful atmosphere, and attentive staff. Loved the sliders, beet salad and Category 6 Lemonade.  Definitely going back. HH is the way to go!

TH3RXBHPP9Zez3n0f2IqgQ.text: We had a miserable experience at the Roaring Fork. While the food was fine, except the brussel sprouts side which was awful,  the ambience is horrible. The noise level was so significant,  I could barely hear the couple we were with. We moved once but there was little improvement in the noise level. Granted I am a senior citizen but it boggles my mind that people enjoy a meal surrpunded by a cacophony of sound. I do not recommend the Roaring Fork and its name is appropriate.  Moreover, I would never return.

s_y366GmGG-smH6WhyJYWg.text: Went to this restaurant for my Birthday.   We were seated promptly in a booth and there were 6 people in my party.  Terrible service.  So Slow.  Our appetizers took forever and we literally had to pour our own wine and never cleared the plates till the last minute.    The only time the waitress was interested in pouring any wine was when it was gone and our meal was done and asked do you want another bottle..  Really.   Another member of our party had 1 coke for the whole meal because they never brought another  My husband's soup was cold and the food was over salted. This is not worth the money..  do not waste your time here..

1DbtaO5fzNPGP2EFXygifA.text: Roaring Fork is not perfect but it is pretty close.  I could find no fault with most of the dishes we were served, from the bread to the fig and goat cheese complimentary pre-appetizer to the main courses (trout and blackened redfish).  The sides with the redfish were not only tasty but perfectly complimented the fish.  Only the delicious creme brulee had a tiny problem - it was still too warm and had not completely set -- but we devoured it eagerly anyway.  Add to this that the prices are quite reasonable for what is truly a fine dining (modern style) experience, and Roaring Fork takes a place on my "return to" list.  A few very small issues - our table for two was a bit too small, I didn't care for the music (some sort of raucous jazz I think), and the separation of the happy hour and dining areas was confusing - I should be able to get the happy hour discounts in the dining area.  Thanks for a fine meal, Roaring Fork.

W6A7itsmxixtMOtI0rIn_Q.text: Have I really not written a review for Roaring Fork yet? I guess not. Roaring Fork is one of my favorite restaurants. The food quality is always consistent and delicious. The green chili mac & cheese, salmon, duck, and lamb chop fondue are all delicious. It's usually hard to decide what I want, since I want it all! Make sure you save room for their fried banana dessert, so good! It's definitely large enough to share. It used to come with cinnamon gelato which was delicious (please bring it back?!). The service is always friendly and they're very accommodating for larger parties. I've always gotten a signed card by everyone when coming here for my birthday. I recommend making a reservation. Overall, I love coming here because I know I'm going to leave with a happy belly and be well taken care of the whole time.

5HIVCBZWBHEXGyaboRguyQ.text: It is one of the few third party restaurants within walking distance of the Embassy Suites Scottsdale. The bar area has a happy hour very popular with locals so forget getting a seat at the bar. The main dining area opens at 5. The plus of the place is definitely the service. The food is not outstanding but not bad either. The rotisserie chicken (cooked over a fire) was a bit bland and needed salt, although the portions were generous. The green chile pork was not spicy nor smokey. The Pecan pie was a highlight and the wine list is extensive. As a traveler, convenient  location but otherwise not a must visit has some have suggested.

a-rr0uQIlDIvK_zEXEqKKQ.text: Very disappointed.  Restaurant came recommended. Side dishes came out luke warm and steak came out rare. Had to send back twice to cook properly.  Recooked same steak so it then was very dry. Was comp'ed part of the ticket but didn't make up for the food. Hopefully I just had a bad night for the cook.

ud_AZJE81oR8P2swVlf64g.text: I am always the one who has to plan happy hour with my design team and I have read nothing but great reviews about this place so I thought it would be perfect and it was 7 minutes away from the event we had to go to at Scottsdale Community College.   I made reservation for 13 people. They said all they had available was on the patio, which I love. They also called and confirmed my reservation a few days before. I was a little worried trying to find the place since it's in old town but it was pretty easy after I read all the other yelp reviews on where it is located and at 5pm parking was not a problem, it just wasn't right by the door which is fine. The sign is a little hard to read at that time but it's a metal sign and if your by a bunch of office buildings, your in the right spot.   We got there early for our reservation and they actually sat us early and had our table all set up on the patio. Really nice patio!   We just ordered a bunch of different appetizers from the menu. Oh and we found out once we sat down that the happy hour menu does not apply if you are sitting outside. But all the appetizers we ordered were delicious!!! Guacamole was wonderful ! The chicken flatbread I could not stop eating even though I was full! The queso was very good and a little spicy. I ordered wine , but looking over the drink list, they had some very delicious sounding cocktails.   When we left every one in our group told me they loved the pick of the restaurant! So this was definitely a winner for our group. Thank you Roaring Fork for taking care of our big group ! You guys did it perfect !  I am excited to come back with my boyfriend and sit in the bar and get all the appetizers again! I have already recommended the place to people!

W378V1OgvP6rN-n_gPGS8Q.text: Roaring Fork's inviting upscale ambiance is only surpassed by top notch service and delicious food! One of the best food & drink happy hours in Scottsdale. The portion sizes are great, as we always go home with a little snack for later...

pUXi4atxlOKAfspq91OVUQ.text: The food and service was amazing! A great ambience and value. Will definitely be back! In fact I can't wait. Lol

cRc2EZs4KgSjn76L0n72dQ.text: Such a good happy hour! Their patio is amazing. I love roaring fork, it is nice and intimate.

1PTbhwCeOnmdidXVH1rfFw.text: Definitely recommend for happy hour food! Fall off the bone ribs, tasty salads and a delicious chicken chile flatbread. Pecan pie for dessert was decadent. Our server, Joey, was great-very attentive and helpful when it came to the menu. Will definitely be back for a full course dinner.

4H2PKsL0rB77rLWfcQC8Hw.text: I've been saving my FIVE star reviews for truly amazing places, and well folks, it can't get more amazing than this!!!  I was craving a steak and finally thought to stop by to get my fix, but as we were waiting to place our order I saw one of the Big Ass Burgers pass on by and I was seduced! I'm so glad I changed my mind because it was the perfect burger!!  Now that that's out of the way, here are some other insights:  1) Call ahead and make a reservation - and get there on time! We saw a couple lose their reservation because they were late. The bar gets really full, so be prepared to wait for a table, especially if you're in a group!  2) When we first arrived I thought I was wayyyyy under dressed, but when we were walking to our seats I was surprised by the extremely eclectic types of patrons: from upper middle class/dressed to impress folks, to business people just getting out of the office, to people in work out clothes, and lots of families with little ones. Literally saw it all! So I guess you can dine in whatever attire suits you.  3) The portions are large, we came on empty stomachs and we def got our fill.   4) The food was FRESH... like freaky fresh! It was so good from the wedge salad to the freshly cut fries, down to the veggies on my burger everything tasted amazing and perfectly ripe and delicious!!   5) Our server was great! Danielle was super nice, gave us enough time between courses and was attentive, but not overbearing.   I def recommend for date night, it's a very intimate setting.  We'll be back for that steak!

7XeXos5jt5vtEXxx4R-xrg.text: I have to update my review.  I have a love hate relationship with this restaurant.  The food is hands down the best in town.  They have a great happy hour but it is like the senior hunger games with old people lined up to fight for tables.  Service can be hit or miss, but the dinner menu is awesome!    Third update:  The service has improved in recent years making this my most favorite restaurant!  The food is simple but sooo delicious I crave it!

Z31jbtdJC9hiOSKHD5Tg6Q.text: This is probably one of my favorite happy hours in Scottsdale! HH is from 4-7 every night I believe and all day on Sunday! My parents and I are obsessed with the queso and big ass burger! However, my favorite part of this place is DESSERT! The huckleberry cheesecake is heavenly and just melts in your mouth - I recommend this place every chance I get!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huckleberry cheesecake deliciousness

8Z2yR-PT3guBIgomm1gdQA.text: This is one of my most favorite restaurants and my go to whenever I am Scottsdale. Martinis are shaken and poured at the table, leaving the shaker with just a little bit more! Steaks are fantastic! I recommend the green chili appetizer with flour tortillas. Their green chili mac and cheese is also a must have!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kettle of Green Chili Pork

WqNSwcV0yTQAZPjLRKFnlg.text: I went here for dinner on Saturday night and was pleasantly surprised that they were doing HH all night (I think it's all summer). I had the fish tacos which were really good. The HH portion ($10) is 2 tacos instead of the 3 that comes in the dinner portion. I definitely don't think they are worth the $19 dinner price. I also tried the chicken flatbread and it was really good as well. I had their regular margaritas ($5 for HH) which were really good. Their dinner plates don't come with sides which are all a la carte.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. HH Portion, 2 fish tacos

enxTsrwwb38M86DLqkV-fw.text: Horrible treatment of veterans. My friend , a senior and a Vietnam vet, who sacrificed for us to have our freedoms, was treated like a criminal for simply wanting to have the NBA playoff on the TV. His behavior may have been too angry, but there is a polite way to diffuse a situation and say why you can't switch a channel. The snowflake bartender complained to the snowflake general manager who told my friend he is no longer welcome in this restaurant. You have your jobs because people like my friend sacrificed for you to be free. Thanks for ruining his birthday. There are plenty of other valley restaurants who value our veterans where I will take my business.

7ypFkIaL3wHGbiJ0ImD_OQ.text: Recently went with dear friends visiting from East Coast. They had read a local review on the HH. We planned on an early arrival & glad we did as I had no idea there would be such a line to get in! Oh my hell, when the hostess opened the door, it was the equivalent to The Running of The Bulls Once everyone settled in, we ordered delicious food & shared various dishes. Our waitress said its this crowded daily, so plan ahead!!!

OpM8nfDasSxTun6UTxSmiA.text: Took my wife here for her birthday. Solely based on the reviews. Lil skeptical at 1st though as sits in the bottom corner of some tower. I thought my GPS was acting weird again as it stuck us in that parking lot. I wanted to make this a special night as our day went well. Plus we were double dating with her sister & husband. I wanted to be right on my choice. My anxiety slowly backed down though once I saw the entrance way. Busy night(it was a Friday)was glad I got those reservations, TWO weeks ago. The inside is really nice it's got a western feel to it with a touch of fine dining class. Service was tops and everyone there had a way of making you feel like "you are our guest and its our pleasure to serve you." had there 22 oz ribeye special, two sides, salad & pecan pie.($65). It was so good I didn't care how full I was I was determined to finish it. My party enjoyed their meals and gave me 2 thumbs up for my restaurant choice!

A8zYdg7wVf0JQLucFQ7WtQ.text: Went here on a Saturday night with reservations (can't get in otherwise) Atmosphere was great. Out waitress was amazing. Informative, polite and attentive. Food was delicious. So many menu options.you can spend a ton on a $50 steak or get a reasonably priced rottiserie chicken for $18. Uperscale restaurant that could charge way more for certain menu items if they really want to.

p28lq5wB0zOaDU2RE6UUAA.text: Wonderful restaurant serving some great food inspired by a creative chef. The service was awesome and the food delicious. On the way out we caught a glimpse of a huge burger being served and we were ready to start all over! This place is a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rotisserie Chicken Flat Bread
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Queso con puerco
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Slow Roasted Pork Shoulder Carnitas

N7Bniv3RUVd8Pfp2bYVOLQ.text: This has been a go to happy hour favorite but we went tonight for restaurant week and had the best steak that I've had in the past five years! The Delmonico boneless rib eye was ordered warm pink "medium" and came out a little over but was so juicy and unctuously fatty that it was just perfect! Combined with a bowl of tortilla soup and pecan "pie" that was melting chocolate and accompanied by a scoop of brown butter ice cream and whipped cream, it was a decadent and delicious meal.  Roaring Fork is now my favorite steakhouse in the Valley. Friends had duck, short ribs and the tenderloin and all were pleased with their meals.

TotxIZEHbX7zoRxpSi3gzw.text: I always enjoy this restaurant. The food is always really good.  Decided to take my daughter out for dinner this past Saturday while I was in town (she lives in Anthem). We both agreed on the Roaring Fork. We sat down almost immediately at 5:00. Steve was our waiter and was there quickly to get our drink order. I'd asked for a bourbon that is often rare at most nice restaurant bars. Unfortunately they were out. Steve was very apologetic. Right behind him was the restaurant's general manager with several high end options. We talked for a bit, comparing bourbon thoughts, and was brought a perfect substitute.  The service has always been very exceptional here as well as the menu having great local specialties and excellent signature items.  I can highly recommend the Roaring Fork as one of the "must eat at" restaurants in Scottsdale.

jaeekEMxy_IZIRmE4Tl_tA.text: Went for dinner with a group of friends and everyone had a great time. Our service wonderful, very attentive and got all of our orders right. The atmosphere is warm and comforting, dim lighting but you can see what you're eating without difficulty. The atmosphere goes well with the menu which consists mostly of comfort food. The basket of rolls served with softened butter is amazing! I could have eaten the entire basket myself. The small corn bread muffins with a hint of jalapeno were soft warm and fresh and so delicious as were the dinner rolls that also were soft and warm. My husband and I shared the wedge salad with bacon and ranch dressing and it was big enough to share and very fresh and iceberg nice and cold and crispy. It probably could have used a little more bacon. Several of us ordered the buttermilk fried boneless chicken which was very good, crispy lightly battered chicken breast. I had mine with the French fries instead of mashed potatoes and the French fries were great; seemed like they were cut fresh rather than frozen. Several others had the short rib entree and they all seemed to enjoy it. I tried a piece and it was excellent; very tender and a good sized portion. I also tried the grits with cheese OMG was that good. We were all so full that we couldn't even fit in dessert so we will definitely need to go back.

0YlOaykFaXNDu96689UCwg.text: Absolutely 100% 5 stars...  Amazing service on a busy Friday night. We had a reservation on the back patio for 7 hungry golfing guys and man we were not disappointed.   Bar service was superb. Wait staff were awesome. Greeted by drinks, more drinks, breads, guacamole, apps, and it was awesome...  Everyone got some version of steak. All the cuts were perfectly cooked...everyone raved about their meals. My bone-in ribeye was massive and so well cooked throughout just medium rare enough and delicious. We got a few sides to share and there was a ton of food.   Our server was hilarious...great personality and the right amount of attention.   I was surprised by how reasonable the tab was at the end...I mean 7 guys at a steakhouse in LA and you're looking at a grand almost with apps, food, booze, etc...our bill was half that!    Location was interesting in what looked to be an office building cluster but we found it via Uber easily.   This place is a must in Scottsdale...no doubt about it. 5 star food, 5 star staff, 5 star value...

bG1mY2N4Cd0fY1rn6jtMug.text: My husband took me here for my birthday. We both got cocktails and they were pretty good. I got the category 6 and it was tart and strong. We ordered the lamb fondue for the appetizer. It was good but it took forever to arrive. We decided to split the big ass burger and that also took forever. Overall it was a very underwhelming experience.

bzVtKt2mm7UhNNChMQbNGQ.text: You'll never be disappointed coming here for happy hour or any time for the matter. Greet cocktails, delicious food and brilliant service by all the staff. I wish I lived closer. Get here early if you are wanting to do happy hour. As a matter of fact get here late as hell so I don't have to worry about a seat

uRAlEI3CpIDAsRDLVXKopg.text: Every single bite was wow. Get there at the beginning of Happy Hour. 4PM. If you wait even 30 minutes, the place fills up. It's popular for a reason. They serve the real deal southwest cuisine. For starters, the tortilla soup. From the presentation, where they bring out a bowl with avocado, shredded chicken, cilantro, cotija, and tortilla strips (fresh made), and then fill the bowl in front of you with the soup base... to the very last bite; fantastic. The soup is so perfectly seasoned, I even commented how surprising it was to not want to salt or pepper it. The fish tacos are amazing. If that's your jam, get them, you won't be disappointed. But this review isn't going to highlight them (they're super good), because the green chili kettle with fresh buttered flour tortillas is on another freaking level! We ordered two. For three of us. However, the serving of this happy hour appetizer is filling for two people! There's enough of this green chili infused, melted gooey cheese masterpiece to go around man! And the tortillas, everything you'd expect from fresh made. Soft. Sturdy, the perfect adornment for this epic pot de wonder. I could eat this like probably every other day, just because I wouldn't want it to get old. But wait there's more! Save room for dessert ya'll! Spoiler alert, it's all amazing, but the pecan pie, my oh my! They make a browned butter pecan gelato to pair with it it. Plus a caramel drizzle. Plus whipped cream. The pie itself is a serving for two. It's highlights are the filling (with a surprise ingredient of chocolate chips!), and the crust, which is flaky, soft and delicious.  Dang it! Go there already! Just go! I'll be back every time in in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pecan pie. With the fresh brown butter gelato. OMG!
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yum yum. Green chili pork on a fresh flour tortilla.
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Look at the cheese people! The green chili pork kettle.

ioOsvPVC8EHGBPrMwUR9Pw.text: Food and service is First Class.   Very nice upscale restaurant in Scottsdale but not overpriced

vo8UjcycHFFQqExv5e3mYQ.text: Love the Roaring Fork ! The Happy Hour drinks are amazing ( Huckleberry Rita ) . And the food is always consistently good. I'm a vegetarian and have no problem being accommodated .
