Yze-5uRZCDfJZ0w6EWuWGQ.text: Excellent happy hour. The kettle of green chili pork is the best.cant beat the prices for the quality.   If I had one tip it's the serving staff, it's inconsistent sometimes are server is perfect and other times it took 10 minutes to flag one down. Still love it and recommend to everyone

ZEjhgKi6zKBwix1QLwC4Lw.text: Interesting business office complex location, also near the Embassy Suites where we were staying.  Three of us work colleagues came here for dinner on a Thursday night.  It was busy, so without a reservation, we had to sit at the bar, which was fine with us.  Amazing that they were so busy on a Thursday night on the 2nd week of November.  The waitress said it was even busier the night before!  She mentioned they have been around for over 20 years and have a pretty good following.  It was restaurant week, so they had a prix fixe special.  We all had a mixed green salad starter (good) and a bacon-wrapped filet mignon (very good) and a creme brulee for dessert.  The filet was well-prepared and very tasty/juicy.  If I came back, I would like to try the sea bass.  The interior is very nice, lots of stone and wood.  The service was very friendly and helpful.  Okay wine list.    I would definitely come back again next trip out this way.

fIEOEc72kKlcDpepQkyS3g.text: Their burgers are the best. Have been several times always good. The fried chicken is good but overpriced for what you get

FCxOM-hjgFE4rPK5rviJEg.text: Ate here last night for the first time and it was nice.  The ambiance is comfortable, casual, and the service is really good.  The menu had a variety of choices with something to please everyone.  The location is in a business park (a little odd) but there is plenty of parking close by.  I would recommend if you don't want to wait to make a reservation as this place gets very busy.  Overall this was a solid experience.

hvSEB_smwYyOyjtNEnYvjg.text: Chase   Made our birthday party  the best ever ... Food was fantastic  !!!  Can't go wrong everything and I mean everything on menu is  5 star ... If u get a choice make sure u ask for Chase !!!

5I1ox3uF0t4ay6JvhCRLTQ.text: This Phoenix favorite has left me wanting more. The ambience is warm and cozy, the happy hour menu is very nice with some of their house specialties included, the food is superb, and the service is fabulous. We sat in the outside bar area with a lovely fire nearby and the heaters blazing warmth with a nice chill in the outside air. Our server was amazing - great personality and perfect recommendations for us. We started with some happy hour favorites - fish tacos and pork wings with a few beers and a glass of wine. Our party of four was ready for the meal - scallops for my friend (grilled perfectly and flavored delicately); filet for her hubby (also cooked to perfection with a nice salty tang); my hubby had the ny strip - (huge cut of perfectly grilled steak); and I had the cioppino (loaded with monkfish, scallops, mussels, and lobster broth). To say the meal was amazing is an understatement. I would eat anything off that menu! Our dessert included their house pecan pie (loaded with chocolate chips & toffee bits) - a super decadent example of pecan pie with a buttery flaked crust. Our friends had the huckleberry cheesecake which was good but not as good as the pie with salted caramel ice cream. You must not pass this up! All in all, a perfect evening at Roaring Fork. Thanks guys!

qv48sJXwrniUBWo0vQpmQw.text: Honestly the food is so delicious but that is not the reason for my post. There are many places in South Scottsdale that has wonderful food. The difference for me is the a++++ service. The staff is so friendly and helpful. We always look forward to seeing Daryl. The bar staff is friendly and so are the managers on site. A great experience every visit! We are foodies and this is in our monthly rotation.

srb2GEiyySd491qHBLsPTQ.text: Food was ok for the high price I guess. Server was ok but always had to flag him down. When the food came out service got better. The atmosphere and venue is definitely very nice.

PiZB9FHzywtvXwJDFD8TpA.text: Go for the happy hour, enjoy the drink specials ($5 martinis among others. Yay!) and order the Big Ass Burger, but before you do remember these points:  It's open seating during happy hour (which runs 4-7). There were people sitting and standing around showing various states of impatience when we arrived. We walked around through the bar and front patio (the only areas open for happy hour) searching for an open table. Finally, a very nice manager caught up with me and offered a booth in the dining area with the caveat that we'd need to finish up or move to the bar by about 6:45, before a dinner reservation came in. We jumped at the offer, likely pissing off some others who had been waiting as well, and probably longer . No complaints in the way it was handled, but be aware that it's popular happy hour with open seating and when you arrive for a table you are basically on your own.  Second, it's an older crowd.  They look more like Scottsdale golf course residents than workers from the surrounding buildings. No problem there, either. Just a reminder that the line between "happy hour" and "early bird special" continues to fade.  Third, it was busy so service was a bit slow, though not unpleasant at all.   I guess the message for y'all: This place gets busy during happy hour. :-)

XNAV4t2iyqQnC4cjA_JWGQ.text: Conveniently located across from Firesky Resort- I was able to walk over and place my order.  I didn't call ahead, but it took approximately ten minutes to get my chicken flatbread.  It was sooo yummy and not too heavy.  I reccommend that as an entree!

DYrFfbmSKmggW4c2-dkBAg.text: Back here again for our second time since the  holidays. The food is great , the desserts are incredible, especially the pecan pie with salted butter ice cream, oh my!!   I will say, once you pay the bill, you are dead to them. We had just paid our $350 dinner bill, the waiter picked up the check and left. We were still chatting and finishing up our drinks when I accidentally knocked over a wine glass, breaking it into six pieces, spilling the wine all over the table.  We were picking up the large chards of wine glass when the waiter came back over and asked for his pen, he must have left after we signed the bill, we found his pen in the Malay and handed it to him, he sauntered off as if there wasn't a broken wine glass on our table.  Only thing I can figured is because the bill had already been paid and he has already been tipped.  We had to flag down another employee to help us clean it up.  When we were leaving, the two hostesses were wrapped up in their nightly to do list and didn't even say thank you or goodnight as we past them. No one even acknowledged us as we left.  We past by 10 employees. I don't know, maybe it's me, but customer service should be 100% until the customer is out of the door.  All that yummy food, wine and dessert we had and this is what I remember most from the night. The easiest thing to make perfect is your customer service, Ironic wouldn't you say.  Oh and the bathrooms were gross when I went in at 10:15. Water and paper towels all over the floor and sink area, no toilet paper in the stalls, we used toilet seat liners, I Know!  GA-ROSS! just plain messy.  The devil is in the details people!  Hoping they read this and take it constructively, we WILL be back , but when I pay a premium for a nice dinner , Is it too much to want toilet paper and a thank you. Did I mention the pecan pie to to die for?

PV7rtC0yl8mLkFuwyJM8Kg.text: Ok so again I booked this on open table. Arrived on time the hostess needs a bit more happiness in her life.   When you have a job such as this the show must go on.   Bad day dog died you still need to put on a happy face.   Or if you can't don't go to work and call off.  Because I go for he full experience, the atmosphere the ambience, decor, and of course the food and service.  So when we arrived there were plenty of empty tables but for some reason we were seated in the back forty.  Let me tell you avoid this seating because you miss the entire beauty of the restaurant.   We asked to be moved and were declined that option.  The couples next to us asked to be moved and were honored immediately.  The wan who sat us told us those empty tables had been reserved.   Nope not the case.    So the food was good not wowed.   The portions were ample I will say that.  But the management needs to brush up the staff a bit more.  This place is not cheap and I would have expected better service.  I wanted to really have a great experience for Mother's Day.   But it was just mediocre.   If you go don't sit in he back.

VbRF9j87DoZlflienIEBAw.text: Note: this review is for happy hour only.  My husband and I sat on their front patio for happy hour. We ordered the guacamole, which was good but overpriced for happy hour, and then green chili pork, which was so worth every penny--absolutely delicious. We tried mojitos, margaritas, and the spiked arnold palmer. All were delicious and strong.  The only places Roaring Fork loses points are the music: loud country. Bleh. And the patio view: parking lot.  I'd definitely go back, though. Not sure I could afford the normal menu, but the happy hour does just fine.

JOpsLrtPBcpxLwWSooHM9Q.text: You don't even know, girlfriend. This place was delicious enough to get me into a good mood after another long day at work. People were looking at me funny but I was smiling cheek to cheek while eating this entire meal. I completely indulged. I had the half chicken with green beans and cornbread stuffing. The chicken was juicy. The cornbread stuffing had a good consistency. The sauce was a little bit sweet and perfectly complemented the savory chicken. The Chardonnay went well with my meal. The bananas foster flambe with rum cake was a great indulgence and enough to share. The service was impeccable!

jPDRYzuxJz8C6SXhxSIy6w.text: Wow, I have never eaten at a place that was so all over the map in regards to service/food quality.  My husband and I came here on a Saturday evening to celebrate our wedding anniversary.  Now, I was a dumb-o and forgot to make reservations.  I did try that morning, but you have to leave a voice mail because they don't open till 4, so that was totally my bad.  When we got there right at 6 pm, there was no one waiting in the waiting area and the bar was filling up.  We saw about 8 empty tables in the restaurant, I was excited because I thought oh good, we can still get a seat in the main restaurant.  We asked the hostess for a table for two.  She looked at me like I was crazy and said, sorry we are all booked up, you can go sit in the bar or our next available seating is at 9 (WHAT?!).  I said, well I can see several open tables and no one is waiting here, I didn't realize this was a reservation only restaurant, there was no mention of it on your website.  She then says, well its Saturday, so yeah its pretty much reservation only.  This older gal was none to friendly and said, just go hang out in the bar area and scope out tables.  Um, ok...  So we decided to sit in the bar and take her advice on 'scoping out' a table.  We find a table quickly and our bar waitress was not helpful at all.  Took her 5 min to hand us a menu, we ask for a regular menu, she brings one 5 min later.  I ask her for another regular menu so my husband can look at one too and she replies, oh ok...Off she goes, where to, nobody knows...In the meantime, the seating in the bar is just what you'd expect, crowded, not that comfortable, so we scope out one of the three booths in the bar area and waited until this couple left and switched to that booth.  This booth was great, even though we were in the bar, didn't feel crowded or rushed at all.  So, that was nice, plus our server over at the booth was much more attentive and friendly...  OK, on to the food....  We ordered the mojito and their signature margarita.  The mojito was delish.  First time I had ever had one and I would totally order again.  The margarita was gross.  It was straight up tequila or something.  Maybe others would be happy about that (LOL), but I was not.  We didn't even drink more than a few sips.  Told the waitress, her response...sorry.  On to our appetizer, we got the Big Ass Burger.  It was very good.  Definitely a great happy hour item.  We split this and loved it.  For dinner, I ordered the pork tenderloin with Mexican street corn and grits.  This was good.  The pork did not have much flavor (it was wrapped in bacon) which was surprising, but it tasted good if you ate it with a bit of the corn and grits with it.    My husband ordered the ribeye steak.  This came out BLACK.  He took a few bites and called over the waitress to tell her all he could taste was the charred from the steak.  So they send it back and remake him one (the manager comes over and profusely apologizes, which was nice).   The redone steak came out great and we were happy with it, tasted flavorful, etc.  Now, the manager comes back and says, we comped the drinks and the steak for your trouble.  I am thinking, wow this is great!  How nice of them, the evening started out crappy, the steak was burned, this will be great.  NO, while they did comp the drinks, they comped the REMADE steak.  So, our check showed two steaks, with one written off.  I bring this to the waitresses attention and she goes to check with her manager.  She comes back and says, no the bill is right.  We are comping the steak we remade for you. I was in disbelief.    Needless to say, our first impression of The Roaring Fork was not good and we will not be back.  Too bad, b/c I think the place has potential, but I can get food just as good, for half the prices and pretenses elsewhere...

iVBLUZjK0X5ZgGtcL1aHBg.text: The food was excellent and the service was superb ... until we got our bill. We were double-charged for the duck dinner (most expensive on menu). When the waiter came to pick up the check, I handed him the receipt and simply said "You need to check this again". I did not tell him what was wrong with the check; he didn't even look at the receipt and immediately said "Oh, I'll remove one of the duck dinners". He had no more eye-contact. I Truely believe this waiter was deliberately trying to rip us off. We are above-average tippers, and this is a high-end restaurant. He did not need to do it. I went to the restroom to cool off, I was so annoyed.  I should have said something to the manager, but I don't want to get people fired.

s12tBbzyZGV8hWa4FAXJHQ.text: So long as they have the Carnitas tacos, you're in luck. Truthfully, all the meals we've had here are great (didn't love the mac & cheese though), but the best are the Carnitas tacos. Get there early though- the last two visits they ran out, and it was only 6:30pm! Last time we were lucky and they were able to get them for us after all, but they're in high demand, because they are de-li-cious.

1eEwVQn_mmUV-tsolo-BGA.text: The food here was bomb! As an appetizers I got were the kettle green chilli and guacamole, both excellent. Then I got the roasted chicken as an entree and was stuffed! The waiter was also friendly and very knowledgeable of the menu and recommended us a delicious drink.

_sbknh9bxUW7LpFPkxxyhQ.text: Wonderful Food!!!   Great atmosphere and service as well.  We recently visted Scottsdale to watch Spring Training games.    I made reservations knowing it was a busy weekend.   I had told them it was my son's birthday.   When we got there, the table had birthday decorations on it and a hand written card from the staff.   Nice Touch.   The Food . . . . my son had the boneless fried chicken.  Amazing.    I had trout which was wonderful too.   Each of our dishes were excellent.    All of us at the table have eaten at nice restaurants, but we were impressed with the overall experience.  We need one in Los Angeles! Gravett Family.

f9Wq9m8SYLYdyLpfdarf9w.text: The first time I ate here last year I would have given them 5 stars, but tonight they got 1 star for the following reasons.  1. It took over an hour to get our appetizer and food.  Our appetizer came out only moments before our food. 2. It took another 45 mins to get our check and leave 3. The waiter barely touched our table  The only plus is that complaining to the manager is that we got our appetizer comped.  Needless to say we're never coming back.

e1xLbkPTuAyl4qmCZNBaHQ.text: It was a convenient walk over from the FireSky hotel across the street. We started with the green pork chili. It was tasty, but not hot. We also had the lamb fondue, which is lamb rack with a squash sauce to dip them in. The squash "fondue" part was quite tasty. The lamb was cooked well.  For the main course I tried the braised short rib. It was really big. It didn't have a ton of flavour; a shame for such a tasty meat. It needed salt & pepper and the core seasoning just didn't stand out.  The food is good, but I feel it's all a bit under seasoned. Everything (except the lamb fondue) could have had some extra punch to it. Still, it wasn't so bad that you feel ripped off, so I'm going 3 stars on this.

vc0hi89BQcZp4CnXomPPsA.text: Fantastic restaurant and service! We have eaten there on 3 occasions and they did not disappoint. Reservations are taken serious and your table is always ready for you. We went there for our wedding anniversary and they placed a rose and a personal card signed by the staff on the table. We were also give a complimentary dessert. This was above and beyond what we expected.  Must try:  Green Chili Mac and Cheese  Braised Beef Short Ribs Buttermilk Fried Chicken Seared Scallops

qlGBUxEak42HVi5aZOtuiA.text: This place is great. The food is unique and savory. The menu is small, but terrific. I've never had a bad experience here. This place is a bit spendy, but go for Happy Hour to get a deal. Show up early as this place is popular! If you really enjoy the dining experience, this is a place to go for sure.

R4_P4HOqbAMSldrqf4pr9g.text: Worst service I have ever received. Had to wave down the bus boy to get a drink. They had us seated, then moved us elsewhere because they said it was our fault. Then, I had to wave down a bus boy to order a drink. Rarely saw our waitress, especially when she was needed. When I did see her, she was rude and never smiled. I was with a friend who had a food allergy that they basically tried to tell her she didn't have. Her mouth was swelling up and they told her they swore they didn't put this stuff in it. Okay, well... her mouth is swelling up. Explain that to me. They did however pay for that dish, but I will not be back. I'm not even picky--

FoqOBBvKnXfRVS1bfhSu1A.text: Man, they get you in and out!  Ordered:  BBQ Baby Back ribs..4.0 / 5.0 Ordered:  Green Chili Pork Stew 2.5 / 5.0  French Fries were cold, Pork stew was dry.  Drinks were surprisingly small. Wait service very, almost too efficient.  In and out in 45 minutes. Make sure you get everything you need when your waiter shows up because you'll likely not see them again.    Not sure I'd return on my own, but if someone wanted to go, I'd go.

rvlNrpw-2fSu4zRNRLG0xg.text: The atmosphere is great as well as the service. I had the burger and the Mac and cheese. The Mac n cheese and the fries were awesome! But the burger  was average as best. Overall above average.

OLloG0ld8IK-GAszpis3NA.text: We were in Scottsdale and starving.... looked on Yelp for something yummy...   RF is located in an office park where Chapperal and Scottsdale cross.   We arrived around 6 PM on a Sunday evening.... they were having Happy hour until 10 PM in the Bar Area!  YEAH!  The only problem was finding our own seat among all of the other hawkers trying to get the next available table... the wait staff and hostesses do not seat people in the bar area it is fend for yourself!   We got a table after about a 15 min wait--- but I hated that 15 min because I felt like a stalker!  Anyway...the food was great!   My fiance and i shared the Big A** Burger and the Green Chili... I also had the huckleberry margarita... we also shared the Huckleberry Bread Pudding for dessert... everything was yum-o!  We also enjoyed conversations with some older couple who sat next to us and shared all of their fav happy hour places!   Our server was also great:)    We will try it again in the future for sure!

sw6mLB1kzzns_qnX8snyYg.text: Came here for Brunch on a Sunday and was disappointed. The hub and I had eaten here about a month before and it was very good. However, this time made us a little sad. Brunch at Roaring Fork is served buffet style and although we were excited at first about all of the offerings, our excite slowly decreased as we ate our food. We have begun to conclude that most buffets are not a good idea since the food never seems to be fresh. This, unfortunately, was no different with The Roaring Fork Buffet. Yes, all of the RF popular eats were displayed to try, however, had this been my first time here trying these items, we would have never wanted to go back. Thank god this was not our first time here, otherwise, we would not have known how good the green chili stew and cheesy grits truly are. Here are some details: The hubby and I tried almost everything which included Eggs Benedict on biscuits, chicken chiliquiles, herbed pork tenderloin, fruit parfait, fresh fruit, breakfast quesadillas, bananas foster bread pudding, sage and cornbread stuffing, green chili stew and tortillas, Chopped salad with ranch, Cheesy grits, fried chicken and loaded mashed potatoes, candied jalapeno slaw, chocolate opera cake, biscuits and meatball gravy, and roasted sweet corn. Out of all of that, the only items that were decent was the loaded mashed potatoes, bread pudding, jalapeno slaw, breakfast quesadillas, cornbread stuffing, fresh fruit (hell how can you screw that up) grits, and opera cake. I say decent because none were good or great, they were simply ok since they were not very fresh. The remaining items were a huge disappointment though. The Benedicts had overcooked eggs and not enough hollandaise (they should have had a dish of hollandaise off to the side in case you wanted more and because the hollandaise already on the Benedicts got kinda congealed and hard), Fried chicken had no flavor to it and was overcooked, green chili stew was not the same as the cheesy melty goodness we had had a month ago ordering the same thing, and honestly, the meatball gravy on the biscuits was absolutely horrendous. I usually don't feel the need to spit things out but the meatball gravy was very hard to consume and was to the point of being downright inedible. In any event, I still give this place 3 stars as the service was very good, the dining area was very nice, and I know how great their food can be during the dinner hours. My suggestion and hope for if I ever am forced (yes it would never be my own decision to go) to do brunch again is that they come up with a regular brunch menu in which you must choose and all items would be prepared fresh. Otherwise, I honestly feel that the brunch buffet is only giving The Roaring Fork negative feedback. As I stated earlier, if I was a first time customer coming for brunch, I would not return after this experience and I believe this would be the case with alot of first time customers.

nVcmXgISJviydNuJQhrkDA.text: We arrived around 4:30 on a Sunday. The ambiance and seating arrangements are excellent. The waitstaff is not up to snuff for an upscale restaurant. No specials were mentioned and the busboys kept trying to take plates of food that we were eating. And kept leaving the dirty glasses we had placed on the edge of the table. Sigh...does anyone get trained properly now? Anyway most of the food was stellar. The avocado/crab remoulade appetizer was inspired. The green pork chile with hot buttered tortillas was fabulous and the tortillas were pillows of goodness. We had ordered the short ribs and the smoked prime rib. Alas, the prime rib was a bit tough...it should be unctuous and beefy but didn't hit the mark. The horseradish cream was superbly done and really helped. The short ribs were served with a tomato coulis which neither of us really cared for. The ribs, however were outstanding. These were served with horseradish potatoes which were also very good.  Unfortuately we tried the huckleberry bread pudding with creme anglaise. This should be full of berries and wasn't. It was a hunk of doughy, leaden bread. The small amount of berries/sauce was very good but the creme anglaise suffered from too much vanilla. Overall, I will dream about the pork/green chili and will go back just for that and the cushy seats.

wBSpG_aQsVeiEETII2rOIQ.text: This place was recommended by friends who just ate here the night before.  When we arrived, we were greeted and seated promptly and were given a basket full of warm bread and biscuits. They were delicious!  We started off with their green chili pork appetizer. This was my favorite dish of the evening.  It was kind of like a stew with tender chunks of pork simmered in this flavorful green chili stock topped with cheese.  It came in a cute miniature cast iron pot, piping hot with a side of warm, soft, and chewy tortillas.  Yummy!  Had I known how good it really was, I would've just ordered two of these and be happy for the night.  We then had the trout with capers, almonds and brown butter.  This was another winning dish. The capers were deep fried, so a lot of the briny taste disappeared leaving us with these little salty, crispy buds of goodness that perfectly complimented the the entire dish. The trout came with a huge slice of corn bread that was also very delicious.   My hubby ordered the short rib tacos which were full of flavor with plenty of cilantro and zesty sauce to bring it all together.  For dessert, we had the chocolate cake and bread pudding, both of which were good, but nothing extraordinary.  Overall, it was a great experience and I would recommend this place to anyone who is in the area.

Ui-4Hx6f97qv7E-xtVnWeA.text: This a definite "regular" for us!  We generally sit in the bar, because the specials, they have a happy hour menu, which is pretty great!  Green chile pork is to die for!  The Big Ass Burger is great & only $7 with fries!  Oh and it has bacon & green chiles on it!    The little bar snacks they give you as well are great!  & Fresh Beef jerky if you're really lucky!

Vq5HiAkogqO-MURkvalqrg.text: Very nice place but the food was too heavy on the butter and oil.  A few artistic options on the menu make it worth a try but will not be on my list of repeats.

DU9TKXWWSJ2WvKgAI1y-6A.text: Definitely try the duck dish.   I rank it among the 10 best duck dishes I have ever had....and I love duck.   I always order duck dishes to test the cook's skill level.  A solid restaurant in Scottsdale.

NVzNXBZbHQ5O4vaGQ7NvZQ.text: One of my fave t-shirts reads "Spooning Leads to Forking." That said, all I can say, is that whatever leads me back to the Roaring Fork is OK with me. A sprawling, rustic space with antler chandeliors (pahleeze, I can't spell that) and a roaring fireplace serving up fantastic New American fare. A perfect spot for a post movie double date. Let's start off in reverse by reviewing the desserts....The banana split, with fried bananas would make even a monkey cry with ecstacy. We were fighting for the last bite. Entrees of roasted duck with sour cherry sauce and sauteed cabbages was delectible. I ate, seriously, every bite. Rickie's fried chicken was juicy and crisp. The seared Ahi tuna with fresh avocado was perfectly prepared. Appetizer fish tacos were fresh, clean and light. All pre dinner salads were crisp and tossed in fantastic dressings. My field green salad, however, was short on beets and the fried goat cheese a bit gummy and luke warm. Service was polite, friendly, although I would enjoy a little more spark and verve from the staff. She seemed like she was sleep walking. Wine list was extensive. Crowd was very family like this evening, with lots of holiday revelery and gift exchange. Great spirited vibe all around. Can't wait to go back. Perhaps I'll wear my t-shirt. Perhaps the server will wake up.

oe2xjQYpdl3asbrj5SyQ6g.text: This has long been a favorite of ours. We have been here every time that we visit from Baltimore. The food has always been exceptional. This last visit had been quite disappointing, however. The food was bland, the shrimp weren't cooked properly, an the temperature of our dishes was cold. This was the only disappointment, so instead of 5 stars we will give this a 4.

mT_-t3Z-1fJfsvUqWmFCGQ.text: Yelp did us right by this restaurant. We initially tried to eat here for lunch, and found out they only serve dinner. So we came back for dinner the next night. The service was good and the burgers were huge! You can't go wrong with dinner here!

Z5xNBzwboSfnPdUYTRFm7A.text: This is a good restaurant.  From the service to the food and the atmosphere everything is really good.  If you haven't tried it, you should.  The braised Dr. Pepper Ribs are excellent.  The mac and cheese, delicious.  If you're into Southwest Cuisine than this is the place.  But, make a reservation, because if you don't you may not get a table--especially Thursday through Saturday.

k_bOte5fLNvY0D1sJ5yVFA.text: Just dined there with a large group.  I think we tried almost everything on the menu.  Most of the stuff was really good.  We definitely froze on the "heated" patio though.  That was a bit of a bummer.  Service was good.  It would have been helpful if it was a little more kid friendly.  No juice offered and luckily they were able to come up with kid friendly mac and cheese or we would have been in big trouble.

v25Fw2DbjF3DfKLpZLd9VQ.text: It was good. The food was delicious and prepared well, and the service was attentive, wine list is comprehensive, and blah blah blah. It had everything it better have at these prices and in this economy. We had read reviews on Yelp and needed a Mothers Day night out. Made reservations three weeks ago with no hassle, even got a reminder call the day of the event. Nice touch. Got there 8 minutes early according to the hostess who also informed us we would have to wait the 8 minutes. Really?? Big shout out to Stephen the bartender who has the perfect bartender personality. When we were brought to our booth, we noticed the restaurant only about 3/4 full and fading fast. Really, we should have been seated -- come on hostesses, improvise a little. Walk-ins were seated right away. Our waiter was top notch. He made appropriate suggestions and was friendly, and the food was brought on time. We ordered the green chile pork cauldron and it was spectacular -just like all the other Yelp reviews say. She got the roast shrimp -way too salty and the shrimp was beyond chewy and rubbery; it was nearly inedible. The accompanying grits were terrific. I had the fillet with a crab and Bearnaise sauce - really good. No, REALLY GOOD. These guys do meat the right way. We also had a side of spinach with red onions. The flavor was strong and the spinach was freshly cooked. We had the choc lava cake with vanilla ice cream and it was good like all other choclavas around town. We had a hard time giving RF distinguishing remarks. It's all pretty darn good, but we are in the age of asking, 'so what?' when something is just pretty darn good. I recommend RF even though the total experience is a bit forgettable.

ButJDii8WNqVz8vv8QD6Ig.text: After reviewing Yelp comments, my husband & I visited last week. We had an amazing dining experience. Service was excellent, cocktails yummy and food delicious. We had lamb shank, babyback ribs (both were fall off the bone) and sides. Green chile mac & cheese was amazing and the roasted asparagus was cooked perfectly. Can't wait to revisit next spring training!!

rOffzoG0CzZwGJxClbQD8g.text: we met friends from seattle who were in town and said we want to go to a hoyty toyty scottsdale restaurant so i had a week to decide my wife and i had not been to the r f but had heard good things ...it's all True we just had apps and drinks big ass burg   yummy flatbread w/topping lamb pops ..........excellent service

6990fxspnaZSNPM1prI1bQ.text: Good food. Nice atmsophere. We are in our 30s and felt quite young compared to the other patrons.

GYO5N6pv3y1etUFYS_BSfw.text: I had heard about this restaurant a few years back but never had the time while vacationing in Scottsdale to actually eat here. I decided that I'd make the trek here this time around. We were seated very quickly and had our drinks ordered in no time. She had the wine and I had a margarita and both were excellent. They had a special going on, caesar salad, filet mignon and desert which she ordered and I had the wedge salad, braised ribs and asparagus. In no time our salads arrived and both were very good. Our dinners arrived a bit later and both were great. Her filet was cooked the way she likes it (medium well) and my braised ribs were cooked to perfection. All in all, a great dinner.

eQ5YUOLa7Q_VdtwfuVa1hA.text: Waiter was racist and rude, she took our order and never came back. The chicken was dry and my fries were cold. Table was dirty and I had to flag another waiter for assistance. The manager apologized but you can't ignore when your being profiled. Black or white the money is the same, we lost our appetite. Her replacement was rude and unprofessional, so this was not an isolated experience. This was my 40th birthday I expected better, I came here for my daughters birthday and had a awesome experience. We got the point we will not come back, I hope others can read this post and lower your expectations if your coming here. Please get rid of that waiter!!!!!!!!!!!

cn-YdwK9LOizq0DzUkRImg.text: This place was wonderful. I'm from out of town and my friend and I was looking for a great place to eat before I head home the next. I stumbled into this restaurant as I was looking on Yelp. I read the reviews and a lot of people said great things about this place. So we decided to go.   The food was amazing. I started my meal with the tortilla soup and was shocked about the presentation on the soup. It looked amazing and I enjoyed the flavor when I was eating it. Then I ordered a small salad. It's a salad. Nothing special. And last I had the half chicken. The chicken had a lot of flavor and a side of cornbread that came with it. Both items were very tasteful.   The price was very reasonable. I thought it would be more because of the look inside the restaurant. It wasn't the case. Service was excellent as they took really care of me and my guest.   When I come back to Phoenix, I'm definitely coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half Chicken
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tortilla Soup
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. When you walk into the restaurant.

AuJMGl8ntZ5cxSkmM5y2lg.text: Interesting flavors for apps and entrees. With traditional steaks and chops. Worth a visit if you were on a date or with the in laws. Something for everyone.

KNhPHwuIZh_e7YeFDmdD9A.text: We stopped in for happy hour which was awesome. The queso was to die for and the "big ass burger" truly lives up to its name! They also had yummiest lamb fondue that I will be craving for the next week!!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

3WWBa9NSlff0QBkfBts9sQ.text: Wow! I've been wanting to come here for awhile now. We finally went with our friends tonight and I am so happy we did. Everything was amazing--from the moment you step in, you feel so well taken care of. We were seated outside on the patio under a delicious heater. Our waitress, Sarah, was outstanding. That perfect blend of friendly, knowledgable, and magically showed up at the table right when you wanted her. Impeccable service. The food was delicious. Our friends shared the ribeye, mashed potatoes and mac and cheese which they raved about. My husband and I shared the chicken flatbread, caesar salad and Mexican corn. All delicious! We literally finished every bite. Not sure why it took us so long to come here. I cant wait to come back. I hear their happy hour is unbeatable.  Highly recommend! Great atmosphere, food, wine, service.

edG-jbwZtLA3JpD5iOLv9w.text: There's a learning curve to this place - for one, get there early, otherwise you will have to hover and then vulture down upon someone who is just leaving (I was not prepared for this during my first attempt of dining here, but came prepared - and at 4:30 pm - the following night and was able to score a seat outside on the patio). The patio tables are only four tops, which made me feel like a little bit of an ahole since I was in Scottsdale on a work trip and was here solo, but c'est la vie; it was gorgeous out and the outside space was perfect.   I arrived with plenty of time to enjoy happy hour, and decided on the green salad and grilled fish tacos to eat, as well as a glass (which quickly turned to two glasses - hello, I was eating alone) of the $5 happy hour Cabernet Sauvignon, which was delicious.   The salad with feta and candied walnuts ($6 for HH prices) arrived first and was delicious, followed by the grilled fish tacos ($10) that were some of the best I've ever had. I do wish I had the huckleberry margarita, as basically everyone around me ordered it and it looked AMAZING. Because I was there by myself and everyone probably assumed I was stood up on a Tinder date, I played into it by ordering the creme brulee for dessert, which had a perfect hard shell and was absolutely delicious (and well worth the four miles I had to run the next day to work it off).   The service was also good - my server was attentive (probably pitying the fact that I was eating there alone, so he was very quick to offer a second glass of wine and dessert menu), and to bring me the check at the end of my meal. For everything I ordered, because of the phenomenal happy hour prices, my bill was $36, with an $8 tip, I ate all of that for under $50 (not sure if I should be proud of that or not).   This will definitely be in my rotation for future business trips to Scottsdale, especially now that I know it does pay to get there early.

Bh3o7liPa7juHFb0a4m4Rw.text: First time going for dinner after doing happy hour multiple times. Food was good but service was weird. Had a reservation and the first table was next to the kitchen which is a pet peeve of mine when you have a reservation. We had to ask and got moved. The busboys were some what over zealous clearly extra silverware while still eating.  Mentioned to waitress who apologized. The vibe of the dining area is very nice.  The menu is a little tight  We will be back in the future

4bDlfNVJDFIjmR6ATSGueA.text: Make sure you come early for the happy hour! The Big Ass Burger does not disappoint! Drinks are great as well! When the weather is nice, seating in the patio is relaxing and comfortable!

JvVU6OFJ5tTEZKL33c7YnA.text: I went to dinner with my mom to enjoy her last night in town and it was a great place. Really nice vibe, lots of seating. Some outdoor seating available first come first serve. Our server was great, very knowledgeable and professional (sadly I don't remember her name). We ordered the queso con puerco as a starter and then I got the Filet Mignon and my my mom got the Trout as our entrees. Both were amazing. The steak was cooked perfectly and was more than enough food. All around a great dining experience and will definitely be back.

fpDtBOUm9yba3Q7NuaaAlA.text: This review is long overdue. We dined here months ago for a birthday celebration. Service was great and there were no complaints about the food while we were there. I ordered the salmon with spinach. The salmon was seasoned and cooked to perfection. However, while eating the spinach, I noticed it had a funny taste to it. I tried finishing it, but I began to have stomach cramps. I blew that off as if it were no big deal.  To keep this short, within hours, I felt like I was on my death bed. I had terrible food poisoning and I was sick for a couple days. Please understand that I think this is a wonderful place to dine and things like this can happen at any restaurant. However, my review is based on the response I received from an email sent notifying management of this issue. I was very clear in stating that I wasn't looking for anything, but that I had some concerns with whether or not anyone else had become ill from the spinach. I believe it was the spinach because my mother ordered the salmon with a different side order and was not affected.  My response from this location, was that there are two chefs who taste test the food daily, no one else reported an illness and that they would give me a gift certificate for my troubles. All I wanted was an apology and to be asked if I were okay. I responded explaining that and letting them know how disappointed I was with the way the situation was handled. A response was never received. Btw, if they were truly going to offer a gift certificate, one should ask for an address or send out via email. This left a bad taste in my mouth, so I probably will not dine with an establishment that refuses to take the time to show a little compassion again.

m0X08Uzo_BktkjCG_fPvuA.text: Saturday night. Impromptu dinner with a friend. 830pm. Parking lot was full. Restaurant was pretty full but we got a table right away. Ambiance was lovely. Waitress was pleasant. The bread basket they brought was delicious, especially the little cornbread muffins. Compliments of the chef was a crostini with fig jam and goat cheese, delicious and unexpected. Next was guacamole and chips. Fresh and to die for. I ordered the fish tacos and my friend ordered a salad. We both cleaned our plates. To top it off, gelato. Smooth, sweet, perfect ending to a wonderful meal. Very impressive, I'll be back this week. I would have given 5 stars but the black beans that came with the tacos were just a touch salty.   I came back the same week for happy hour. The green chili pork kettle was AMAZINGLY and I can't stop thinking about it. Good with the fresh tortillas or even just chips. We also got the queso which was amazing. And the guacamole is hard to beat. Love love love this place.

WklxxwQw71jYdmSZT2SpxQ.text: Delicious food, excellent service, but the lights were SO dim it was almost difficult to carry a conversation across the table.

GXYYJSHaXA9QJJO3rgAE6Q.text: Fabulous service.  The food was delicious as usual.  We sat on patio. There were 12 and 2 babies.   Fabulous birthday celebration

mqFtemb_1x6JdpUWjB6BdA.text: Oh Roaring Fork, Roaring Fork - where art thou, Roaring Fork?   North of the Scottsdale Fashion Square lies Roaring Fork. I came here for dinner with co-workers and the experience was fabulous! It is an intimate, cozy, romantic restaurant. I started off with the Huckleberry Margarita - it was pretty strong and couldn't finish it, but highly recommend!  The complimentary cornbread was moist and warm and full of goodness. The fresh guacamole and chips, rotisserie chicken flat bread, and the kettle of green chili pork was full of flavor!  I was already starting to get full, but I had to order an entree - the sugar-cured duck breast with green chili mac & cheese! So much food, not enough room in my tummy! You have to order the duck and the mac & cheese - it was the highlight of the night for me! It was ridiculously yummy...  I wish I saved room for dessert, but I didn't. Normally, very rare as I usually save room for dessert. This time, the food was just so good that I couldn't stop. I did not want to stop!  I woke up the next morning daydreaming about my dinner the night before. Yes, ladies and gentlemen - it was THAT GOOD!

3kgOMb_7KWiqBf_U-t_w3g.text: Had dinner here during Spring Training. We had dined here several years prior and had great memories. Well, the memories held up and Roaring Fork is as good as we remembered it. Their bread basket with sweet butter is delicious. The guacamole and chips are very good. We shared the carnitas and the portions were generous. It seems like there are many locals who eat here since this restaurant is in an office park and off the beaten path. For anyone going to Spring Training, be sure to dine at Roaring Fork---but make a reservation!

UhPLJAtJe9b2JAQEzEulvw.text: Great Scottsdale location and great food.  Might have been 5 stars but little slow out of the kitchen tonight.  Maybe they haven't recovered from the slow season yet.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

r-3RTvu6O3pooJ8Yqu7qkA.text: In short, it was very good but not great.  I'd give the food and ambiance 4 out of 5 stars.  The host, wait and table staff were impersonal and why I dropped this to 3 out of 5. In Scottsdale, and at this price point, I really expect a lot more from wait staff and customer service.  Portion sizes were outatanding.  Trout dish was exceptional!  Big @$$ burger was great! Guac, green chili pork kettle, flatbread and short rib were good but not deserving of the price tag. Reading reviews I can understand why so many of the positive write ups come from the happy hour crowd.  At the discount prices these items are spot on, at premium prices you can do better elsewhere. I'd be willing to try this place again but customer service leaves a lot to be desired.  Are staff indentured servants?  God forbid anyone cracked a smile and seemed happy to be there.  At the very least have someone at the hostess station pleasant to greet you.

APYy_MX5wFtbmcH57hLsqQ.text: Made reservations here for my graduation dinner, and honestly did not see the hype.   Atmosphere - The atmosphere had more of a corporate feel to it, with several large business parties and golf buddies dining beside our large family party. Our server was very patient with us and was very attentive.   Food - The food was average yet pricey, with most entrees $20 and up. A few key plates we ordered:   Guacamole and chips ($9-10) -  very fresh but also very small portions. Could probably only serve 1-2.   Big Ass Burger - all hype. Yes, our burger was huge, sparked awe, but when cut, the beef was dry, the bun soggy, and the vegetables slid out on the first bite. Would not try again.   In summary, the food was just mediocre and there wasn't really anything I'd be back for. If anything, it was a cute restaurant to entertain my out of town family. Otherwise I would not be back here again.

4Z2ogcitrCuofRRkYJ0odA.text: The Roaring Fork is still very good but it was much much better when Robert McGrath was there

ABed6wLufpn45NFurhTwaQ.text: Walk into chickens roasted on the open fire. Looks like the ones they sell at Costco but even better!   Has a lodge feel, makes you feel like you just came back from the mountain after a day of skiing. While you skied you attacked some moguls and hit some sweet jumps now your just letting your gloves dry and you are enjoying your Green Chili Pork Kettle with tortillas.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

MKM0IJ8dlktzTZ-01Bz3Rw.text: I stopped by here this past Monday night as part of a party of 6 for dinner.  Roaring Fork is located in the bottom level of an office building which wasn't what I was expecting when we got there.  It's also deceivingly large as it wraps a good way around the building.  It's decorated in the old west style with a fireplace complete with spit in the lobby as well as antler chandeliers and barbed wire wrapped around single lights. It was around 6:30 PM whenever we decided to make our reservation here and the earliest table we could get was 8:00 PM and so we went for it.  We ended up arriving at the restaurant at 7:50  PM and were taken back to our table, a 6 person booth, within 5 minutes of that.  For dinner on this evening our table decided to split a couple of appetizers in the kettle of green chili pork as well as the guacamole.  The kettle of green chili was cute whenever it came out as it was indeed in a smallish kettle with some hot buttered flour tortillas next to it.  It tasted really good as well and I loved the large chunks of pork which had a light heat to them on the tortillas.  The guacamole came with a side of tortilla chips which had some green onion and cheese on them.  Both the chips and guacamole were satisfactory although neither was exceptionally good.  Then for my dinner entree I ended up ordering the Bacon-Wrapped Pork Tenderloin which came with sides of White Falls Mill Cheese Grits and Mexican Street Corn.  It came out with the four bacon wrapped tenderloin pieces on top of a base of grits with the middle two pieces of pork topped with mexican street corn.  The pork was cooked perfectly and I loved the pork on pork action that came with them being bacon wrapped.  My Mexican street corn was also good as it was charred and consisted of cheese and some green onions.  The most disappointing part of my plate was the grits.  It's not that they were bad as they had a nice creamy texture to them but I wished that they had a little more cheese flavor.  The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  While the location of Roaring Fork may have you scratching your head the food here is quite good.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped pork tenderloin with Mexican street corn and grits

9FuH0Akpn9hAcDox6AXa1Q.text: It was a little confusing to find RF parking lot entrance but glad we did. I was checking Yelp for a good place to take my hubs for dinner on his birthday. We strolled around downtown Scottsdale in the afternoon, checking art galleries and wine rooms and Roaring Fork turned out better than I expected.   We were able to grab the last patio table available for happy hour.  Though it was hot outside, the patio faces east and is well shaded with fans, misters and plants.  Beautiful patio. Intimate but spacious.  Brandon was our server. We arrived at 5:45pm and happily surprised that Happy hour was until 7pm.   We shared the Queso con Puerco. A bit spicy but perfectly paired with the happy hour mojitos. This queso dish comes topped with pork and green chilies, served with corn chips.  What drew my attention to this restaurant was the pork tenderloin dish, on grits, topped with street corn. I knew my husband would love it and it didn't disappoint. Our visit was coming an end, otherwise, we would have brought family back here for happy hour or dinner.    Great for special occasion, date night or simply a fine dining experience. Staff was very friendly and accommodating.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped pork tenderloin on grits w Mexican street corn
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Desserts. Creme brûlée and a cookie? SOLD!
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Formless desserts

8keKce9rRdvSoSasUKJW6A.text: We were so impressed with our service last night. Our waitress was very knowledgeable and treated us like family. The food was fantastic as well. My husband and I had the guacamole for an appetizer, which was great. I chose the Pork Shoulder Carnitas for my meal, and he opted for the Bacon Wrapped Pork Tenderloin. We split the Green Chili Mac and Cheese for a side. Both of our meals were fantastic, and we easily could have shared an entree (for sure could have shared the Carnitas). Would HIGHLY recommend the Carnitas. We had every intention of trying the pecan pie, but were so full we didn't!

hwCWeqSDy_rTww4Rl_3Gtw.text: Always a favorite for their excellent food. The happy hour is one of the best in Scottsdale. Well poured drinks, great wait staff and very good food. Can be a bit crowded but worth it any time we go.

o2Lf-9J7DZKatiWmKaxvQg.text: The 22oz steak was amazing. The mash potatoes and the green chili macaroni was beyond this planet. This steak house is fire!!! If anyone is ever traveling to Phoenix, Arizona. Go there for dinner!

raVrgZo77pw_qixWtGI0_Q.text: I can't say enough good things about my first experience with the Roaring Fork. I made reservations for a table of 5 at this very very busy restaurant on a Friday night.  Arrived at 6:15 to check in and was kindly told my reservation was at 5:15. Oh crap, this was totally my fault  and how embarrassing. My parents were with us and in their late 80's so it's not easy moving them to another restaurant. The very sweet hostess told me they would do their best to get us a table so she and probably the manager went to great lengths to seat  us as soon as possible. This is seriously unheard of at busy restaurants. If you are late for a reservation, it's tough luck for you but they went out of their way to make it work.  The food...amazing high class soul food. Think grits and grilled corn meets pork tenderloin medallions. Great balance of flavors. I've never seen such a huge hamburger or a filet mignon that's fork tender.  I would highly recommend Roaring Fork. I would suggest making reservations but don't forget to show up at the correct time!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Filet mignon wrapped in bacon. Yummy!
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork tenderloin medallions with grits and grilled corn. A-mazing!!
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mile high burger with pablano Chile&#39;s and bacon.

7S8o9JWXOl45GP2YF11Yjw.text: I have to say the burger here my just be the absolute best in town. Get there for happy hour and it's only $10. Best $10 you will spend I will tell you that. Food is amazing and great wine selection. It's a must go restaurant if you have not been.

69dgyLS5a10iFzjQ69fO0w.text: This place has EXCELLENT SERVICE!!! after having a terrible experience with our reservations over at bourbon and bones we decided to check this place out. Not only did they pay attention to detail and cater to every need but they made our night by giving us a round of dessert on them to make up for the other restaurants lack of accommodation. The food was perfect and our waitress Amy was amazing. Make sure you check this place out!

4od_jisnrWJCfshhWS8AiA.text: Went here with a group of 8. Kind of weird location because it in a business park area. Overall the food I ordered was amazing. Some of the other dishes seemed a tad bland but that could be my pallet.  The tortilla soup is a must! So great the way the avocado and chicken make the soup so creamy and filling. Plus the presentation is gorgeous. I ordered the dried chicken. Of the 8, it definitely won everyone as the best dish. Only comment is that I would of loved a green vegetable with it, alone it was quite heavy.  I appreciate that they have a pre fix menu option which is a good deal. There was a wedding party or something going on which made the place super busy on a Thursday but Overall I'd totally go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Normal Cesar salad
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tortilla soup! So great must get it.

pFy2aatr7GFqXg8pshvmzw.text: Excellent food every time. I try to have something different every time I go, and have not been disappointed yet. Make sure you make a reservation in advance as this place is crowded every day of the week. Happy hour seating is first come first serve and always packed.

_7wx0mLQT8BCOH849KaZ3A.text: June 2017 - Not the first time I have been here, but definitely one of the best experiences I've had. Happy Hour food & drink were incredible (as usual) - Huckleberry Margarita & Big "Ass" Burger this time around. Burger was so big that I needed a knife and fork just to attack it. No way was I going to be able to get my mouth around that piled high "bun-meat-bacon-cheese-giant green chile-tomatoe-lettuce-onion-pickle" sandwich. it was lovely! And plate was piled high with great fries too.  But this time my real 5-star impression came from our Server - Sarah. She was super busy, but was able to be on top of every little detail that made our HH experience outstanding. Sarah was there whenever we needed anything. Definitely a Five-Star service experience.  Roaring Fork has a Rewards Program card. Just ask your server. They are open from 4-10. Happy Hour is 4-7. Great HH specials. Go early . . . they get busy!

Z9nSD4fFdB8fd4k-x8Sn9A.text: Came here last week. Dissatisfied and disappointed is how I would sum it up. Had guests in from out of town. It was my wife's birthday.  Our server was inattentive, zero personality and disappeared halfway through our dinner. Asked for a steak medium rare and it came medium well. I was asked by the server to cut into it to check to see if it was cooked okay (that's new one).  She then offered to bring another...I refused to wait another 20 mins for a new steak while our company would be finished their dinner. There was no accommodation on the bill for that one. Took them 20 mins just to bring the bill and I was already to just about walk out of there 45 minutes before that.  If this is how this place operates their prices should appropriately reflect the mediocre standard.  Honestly this isn't a good one off steak house.  For the price go to capital grill or an equivalent.  I wish I could say it was forgettable but i still have a bad taste in my mouth from the whole experience.

j9nWm9T4NQOw4bNz2tmIVQ.text: This was such a fun, upscale place to eat dinner! It's a nice place to have a birthday dinner as well! There were a variety of options between the appetizers, entrees, and sides however I felt a little restricted being a vegetarian at the restaurant. I ended up getting a salad which was tasty and came out quickly! The dietary restrictions were surely made up for by the great service and great drinks/food.

-jtQasOGwIf_JCxT-c_MMg.text: Yep, delicious and really cool atmosphere. Very unassuming from the outside as it is on the first floor of a business building. But inside it has a very cool and unique, almost lodge-like feeling. We enjoyed everything we tried - kettle of green chili pork appetizer, green chili Mac n cheese, filet mignon steak, and spinach chicken Waldorf salad. I'll be back.

R75Rd7NbhZWC9CPH2PiWpQ.text: In town on business had a date night at this establishment it had been quite a while since my last visit. The atmosphere in the bar was great and the whisky selection was ample.   Had the fish tacos wow unbelievably good my partner had the salmon amazing. Server was on point explained the dishes and helped with our making selections. Our favorite side dish the mac and cheese. One of the best I have ever had and the peppers in the mix added a very nice touch. I highly recommend this establishment and the consistency of the food. Just an enjoyable evening.

Qg5KoSAWDt7NTu7o9070Cg.text: This place is awesome,  they keep the menu short and sweet and not complicated.  Took my girls parents here awhile back and they loved it, which is exactly why we're back. The server was amazing and was very enthused at everything she was telling us.  It was my gf bday and she made sure we had a great experience.   Make sure you try and green Mac n cheese along with the carnitas,  you really can't go wrong with anything you order.   Highly recommend this place,the vibe and the decor make you feel comfortable and enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

o6nwkaQA5QgVPbIu0YNuZg.text: I've been to Roaring Fork several times.  The food is always good but the wait staff and crowd sometimes feels too uptight to me.    We went in Saturday night around 7 pm without reservations.  Seemed to be a big no-no by the response of the hostess.  She said they are full for the entire evening with reservations but we could look around the bar and patio area if we want.  We took a walk around.  There were a couple chairs at the bar that had empty glasses and table cloths still sitting on them from the previous guest.  Rather than bus our own tables as we were seating ourselves we decided to go somewhere else.    I really don't think I will be back here again.  There are too many places that are more laid back and welcoming with the same quality of food.  In fact we left and went to one right around the corner that was just as popular and busy.  No reservation no problem.  We even got sat by a real live person.

aMn62lQTPowGAjb05oTQhg.text: One tip: get there early if you are going for happy hour! Roaring Fork is amazing, fun and not expensive. It is one of our favorite places to meet up with our friends. Everything is delicious!

DAalITmhkDq1FhHs7REspQ.text: We had a gift card and thought we'd have dinner here. We often try to dine out a little early to beat the rush so we arrived at about ten to five.  The hostess was busy on the phone so we waited.  And waited. Finally the hostess put down the phone and tersely said only the lounge was open, then got back to the phone. We walked around, the lounge was full, no empty tables, nothing at the bar, so we left (hostess still on the phone) and got a fine meal down the street. It's like they're so popular they'd rather we didn't come by. And so we won't. Update:  Comment from RF:  "The manager wants to personally apologize".  But then he never did!   Appears they're OK with my review! Hey, ask yourself how bad was it they walked out on a free meal? Yes, that bad!

oA8z5c148HFr_sqr-FA3EA.text: This was the first time here and it was more than worth it.  I had the most tender buttermilk fried chicken.  The service was fast and very efficient which made the dining experience even more enjoyable.   I was we had a place like this back in Nebraska.

OImbV6JMRlBAdNIcREpqFQ.text: If you haven't been here yet....then you're missing out!!  Big Ass Burgers, Fried Chicken, and a happy hour that is worth every penny.....shall I say more??

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Guacamole anyone??

sxXiXwoX9dDnTW7RssWpjw.text: Thank you Brian and the staff of the Roaring Fork for rescuing two out of towners on business for dinner on Valentine's weekend!  Our hotel wouldn't serve us even after being here all week.   The Roaring Fork has wonderful food and fantastic customer service.  Especially the shrimp scampi!!!!

CGRIkCsj6JS0oz1Z604X5g.text: Ambiance: I liked the outside seating area much better than the inside. It felt too rustic on the inside, at least for my tastes. The outside area had this really nice tree decorated with Christmas lights, but the lights weren't overpowering.  Food: A-ok. Nothing to write home about, but nothing to complain about either. I thought that it was average at best, mediocre at worse...if that even makes sense. I had the steak and my dining buddy had the salmon.   Service: This is where they lose my business. Service was exceptionally slow. What should have been an hour long meal turned into a two hour meal, and a good chunk of that was us waiting to have our wine order taken, waiting to have our food order taken, waiting to have our dessert order taken, waiting to have our check brought to us, waiting for the to-go boxes. I finally had to go up there and ask the hostess to run my card because I didn't know how long it would take our server to do it. I want to give her the benefit of the doubt, but the place was not busy (it was a Sunday night). No complaints about the hostess or the bussers, they were fine.   Definitely recommend this place if you've never been, but it will be a one time affair for me and my friends.

vb_y27zgxDI7PHi0DyAPzg.text: Delicious! I made a reservation here after reading yelp reviews and I'm so glad I did. It was right across the street from our hotel. The service was great. My mom ordered the fried chicken, she loved it. There were no bones, the chicken was moist and the outside extremely crunchy. I ordered the roast chicken with corn bread stuffing and it was so great! Chicken very moist and flavorful and the corn bread stuffing was to die for!  I deduct only one star for location. It is in the middle of office buildings. Honestly though, once you're inside you wouldn't know the difference.

bZ6DwqQ_ghYPqDWM7bMonQ.text: Myself and a couple coworkers decided to try Roaring Fork for dinner on a Monday night. Upon entering, we really liked the atmosphere and energy of the restaurant. I will say that the food was mediocre for the price however.   I ordered the Prickly Pear Mojito and I would not even call this drink a mojito. It tasted like drinking a glass of juice with no mint or rum flavor whatsoever. The green chile mac and cheese is good but nothing I would describe as over the top delicious. I had the grouper for my main meal and I felt the dish was lacking vegetables and balance. I was given a HUGE piece of fish rested on a small pile of spinach. The entire plate was HEAVILY doused in a beurre blanc sauce. Overall, way too salty and not terribly impressive.  The food is ok but definitely not worth the price tag.

iuP2kF0yM5q-0Ub3AedXmg.text: Very impressed with Roaring Fork!  Food was excellent, nice ambiance, & service at the bar was friendly.  Will definitely return for happy hour.

enjnKHHSSUBxiZm-8OHvsg.text: I have only been here once, but will definitely be back! We were seated right away, the waitress greeted us promptly and we were in a nice table for the two of use (not one of those two-seaters crammed up against the wall).   The food is amazing! I'm pregnant so didn't get to enjoy any drinks, but my husband had a glass of wine from their more unique wine menu. We've noticed most restaurants tend to carry the same things, but not here, it was pleasantly different!  I had the blackened redfish - delicious, cooked perfect, and the accompanyments were delish. My husband had the bacon-wrapped pork - I didn't try it but he loved it. It came with grits (he's from the south and orders then any chance he gets) and he said they were REALLY good.  We will be back for sure!

go751WjBX9GXo3MtkmOgvw.text: Advice:  Make a reservation  The place was packed on a Sunday night (and it wasn't happy hour).   Not a table open and we did not have a reservation.   They found our party of two a small table by the fountain in the back patio.   We weren't happy with the table or location but we were hungry and stayed.     Our server Bob was great.   Service was perfect.  We ordered appetizers for our dinner and they were all very good.  The flatbread pizza, tortilla soup, steamed mussels and guacamole.   The mussels dish was huge and very good.  We ordered cocktails and they were great and served quickly.  Will definitely return and hit the HH next time or make a reservation.

cO67ebdawFzzIDziatwudg.text: Love, love, loved Roaring Fork!   The dining room is warm and cozy, with lots of wood and stone in the decor. Usually a Southwestern theme like theirs can come across as pretty casual, but they manage to make it feel like a classic, upscale lodge and touches like lovely crystal and white table cloths lend to the appropriate high end atmosphere.  Based on other great reviews, we started with the Kettle of Green Chile Pork, which was as amazing as expected. The amount of pork served was more than the initial serving of tortillas could accommodate, so we needed to request seconds so that we could scrape the bottom of the kettle and finish every last delicious tidbit.  Our entrees were the Boneless Buttermilk Fried Chicken (mine), Sugar Cured Duck Breast (hubby) and Rainbow Trout (friend) All were delicious - I particularly loved the peppercorn gravy with my Fried Chicken, which was full of flavor. The Duck that my husband had was melt-in-your mouth tender and flavorful, and the skin on my friend's Trout was too good to leave on the plate (she normally bypasses it but instead it was her favorite part!)   We did order a side of the Green Chili Mac n Cheese which was good, but not life changing.  My memory is a bit fuzzy after all of that amazing food, but I believe we had a huckleberry bread pudding for dessert, which was a great way to end a super yummy meal.   Service was good - not overwhelmingly personal, but attentive and nice.  My hubby works just around the corner, so we nee to head back again very soon :)

AxAS9aOMvadgCsWxOoid5w.text: I work close and decided to go here on a date last week after walking in to check the place and menu out once before. After enjoying the atmosphere and then seeing the great reviews on Yelp, I decided to give it a shot.   The waiter we had was very attentive and knowledgeable. My date and I ordered drinks, including a Sapphire martini, which came with a delicious flavored onion (onion requested). But the highlights were a huckleberry margarita and prickly pear mojito (both recommended).   Where our experience fell off was with the entree that we shared. It was their market fresh halibut with arugula and watermelon. Unfortunately the fish came out over cooked and over seasoned and not seasoned properly, as the ingredients didn't seem to be complementary.   After drinks, a shared appetizer, shared entree and tip, the bill was over $100.00 and I would have rather just skipped the food altogether.  To be fair, this was our first experience at Roaring Fork and we only had one entree between the two of us. I will go back for happy hour and try something else and report back, but as of now, I can only recommend for drinks.

ZxQPZ3jVYj_R42S3Ze_kFQ.text: Happy hour all night on Sundays and Mondays. Oh yes...who can complain about that? Answer: Nobody, except when you get there too late and all the tables have been taken. Womp womp.  The weird thing about this place is the location. Tucked into the corner of an office complex? Very strange.   However, I can appreciate food, especially the "Big Ass Burger" that lives up to its name. The thing is ginormous for a typical restaurant burger. Another item I love is the kettle of green chile pork with buttered tortillas. Pair that with a HH margarita and you're doin' just right.  Good restaurant, solid food and service. Come for happy hour on Sunday and/or Monday, but get there early.

Zo_1vEh76oAJ6wYx2_3PDQ.text: Well worth the trip.  Food was excellent, though portions weren't huge.  I had the Ahi Tuna, which was prepared well, my wife had a salad which she enjoyed.  Prices were reasonable given the quality of the food.

t9leBBaGAul07WiUqRZV3Q.text: Came here for lunch and had a burger, flat breads, tacos and more with my family. It was delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

AG0acrw7uZtG_G9e3mje7A.text: Noisy beyond belief. A huge party at a long table screaming at top of their lungs. Ruining the whole room . The staff , specifically the female mgr refused to suggest to them to be more quiet.  Been going there for 15 years.  Never again Too many better options

BoBXtgXMtOknJBCi6_FO1g.text: Great food! Authentic Southwestern without getting too Mexican. Food came out fast and service was great. A little pricy but worth it. Highly recommended the Mexican Street Corn! No tap beer though. All in all a great eat for everybody!

KGj5iixUaCb8KPIwQM6QCg.text: Our daughter took us here, because her and her fiance went to one in Austin. Ordered Mac n cheese, and green chili pork apps and they were amazing!!!!!!!then for dinner we all had the "big ass" burger OMG!!! We had one small issue and it was handled professionally and quick! The waiter Darrell was amazing!!!! For sure try it!!

S9ZcJgbA4fkG64wdt6KYjg.text: Phenomenal! Incredible flavors of food pairings. Gourmet, very reasonably priced with a well rounded menu. We started with happy hour and the drinks were delicious and strong. My husband got a traditional margarita and another person in our party tried a martini. Both said they were great! For dinner I had the fig salad and the roasted chicken w/ cornbread stuffing. My husband had the New York strip steak. The fig salad was a flavor explosion! Chicken was tender, juicy and cooked to perfection. My husbands steak was beautifully cooked and packed with flavor. The desserts were to die for! We got the cobbler and pecan pie. Both were so delicious and topped with gelato. I can't say enough about this restaurant! The service was A+, and atmosphere was great. We loved it so much we are going back for our anniversary this weekend.

C5qVFCu9EBcQV49CxJiBrA.text: Yes, it's pricey but everything is oh so good.  I had the tortilla soup which had guacamole in the center which was a little weird but it worked.  Everyone like all the entrees, trout, steaks and chops.  Be sure and make a reservation this time of year.  Poor beer selection but good margaritas.

l3l-vRFOzpZ_OIOPg1WeSw.text: Absolutely a solid four star experience. It would have been five if a. the hostess didn't give me a "wtf" face when I told her I hadn't made reservations for a Tuesday night and b. the door leading to the patio had been shut every time someone walked in and out - it was a bit chilly.   Other than those two sillies, dinner was good! My boyfriend said this was his favorite dinner of our trip. OH, another thing that disappointed me was the limited list of appetizers. Usually I can find at least one thing to start with (I am not picky) but nothing seemed appetizing.   So onto mains we went. Our server was ridiculously nice and charming, Tania was her name. I ordered the shrimp and grits and my man ordered the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin - lots of pig for him!!!!!   My shrimp was solid. I enjoyed the creamy and flavorful grits mixed in with my cut up shrimp, but the shrimp didn't have a ton of flavor. That was totally ok though, as the broth that surrounded it all was garlicky and tasted of the sea! Our server also brought bread to me so that I could sop up all that delicious broth - waste not!   The tenderloin was done perfectly. So....tender.... And the charred corn salsa it came with was crisp and sweet, a wonderful compliment to the salty bacon!   For dessert we went with the creme brulee. It was your standard dessert, nothing that put us over the edge, but delicious nonetheless.

Wby6ohcHKFi_U-2gZw5f0Q.text: Cannot post enough good things to say about this place! Seated immediately at a great, round table perfectly fitting our party.  Highlights of the menu: We enjoyed the kettle green chili pork with homemade tortillas for app. I loved the buttermilk chicken with peppercorn gravy, served with mashed potatoes. I ordered a small side of the green chili mac n cheese as I read numerous raves and this was my absolute favorite of the night, with several other contenders. Other faves: pork shoulder carnitas, mexican corn, and complimentary cornbread muffins. Great atmo/experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Boneless buttermilk chicken with peppercorn gravy, mashed potatoes, and small side of green chile mac n cheese

ElN1GeD0PJiLnfekUDd1pQ.text: Fantastic happy hour! Our Big Ass Burger was exactly that...HUGE! And perfectly cooked. And really great French fries.   The huckleberry margarita was delicious.  We really enjoyed sitting out on the patio.   And our server, Sarah, was outstanding. Excellent service. Great attitude. She really made our dining experience special. Thank you, Sarah!

zNq3r0sHQr9jcLDh_lIbDw.text: This is an amazing restaurant! The ambiance was great and the waiter was super friendly and helpful. Also, make sure you get the twice baked potato, it will change your life!

PhSOw1WJNjLF-FiD5njVnw.text: Fun environment. Great patio. Good service.  Happy hour was not available in the dining room- lame! Started with the queso appetizer- runny and very few chips. Hubby had the special of the night - seafood stew. Good but not worth the price. I had the beef short ribs- they were delicious but the mashed potatoes were instant I'm sure. Friends had the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin - no flavor and dry as was the corn side. The bread was good. Ordered the Ancho Chocolate Torte and the Pecan Pie - both flavorless! Huge disappointment!

MUzCHF8FEQobvl1jRrQPfg.text: Too many people gave this restaurant a high review for us not to try it on our first trip to Scottsdale.  Did not live up to expectations.  Starters were good, bread (2 types) was nice, caesar salad had very fresh and large anchovies topping it which was a pleasant change from that traditionally served in other restaurants.  The missing piece was the entrees.  I had the seared ahi special served over crab fried rice.  Way too salty.  So over the top it masked all of the other flavors.  Didn't even attempt to eat 1/2 of it due to this issue.  Waitress highly recommended pork shoulder carnitas to my husband.  Half of it was fat and the flavor was lacking any spunk.  He (a carnitas expert) did not enjoy it.  Would never return.  Waste of a night out with too many other highly recommended restaurants we should have gone to instead.

NO98rgvu06yQniYrBjpufA.text: I've been wanting to try this place for restaurant week for years! It was worth the wait. The ambiance is perfect and not too dark, which my boyfriend hates. Our server was energetic and helpful with deciding on the 22 ounce ribeye. We also got the rainbow trout which was phenomenal!! Every bite was delicious from beginning to end. I was brought their signature pecan pie for my birthday dessert, which was a nice surprise. I'm not a fan of pie but it was rather tasty. We will be back! The pricing isn't too bad either!

bnZT-qAzhghtZuHbrlw6Gw.text: All night summer happy hour made the bar area of  the restaurant a hoppin place on a Thursday night. We sat in the restaurant area. Date and goat cheese salad and some Sonoma Cutrer? Yes please.  Service was a little slow but he was very nice.  Saw the "big-a** burgers going by were crazy big.  Food was great. Didn't eat the bread but it was a nice touch. I would return.

rE75J-6hO9cI14l_ehniHw.text: We went for dinner but the happy hour and appetizers were so attractive we opted for that instead.  The guacamole was great, with huge chunks of avocado. The pork wings were a pleasant surprise and the rush tacos were great but a little too spicy for my taste. Overall a great meal and a great experience

j5HMiyA2x22N0u5hJwK47A.text: Someone should have told me about this happy hour! This really is the best value for happy hour that I have ever seen. You get food off their regular fantastic menu at a discounted price and they don't skimp and give you tiny portions like many places do for happy hour. I shared the "big ass burger"  and the green chili pork and they were both really good. The burger really is huge but really good and comes with fries. The green chili was good spicy and flavorful and I want to go back for more!   Drinks, they have about 5 signature drinks for happy hour that are $5 and a few wines as well. Great value. The guava mojito was amazing and I could have had several! The margarita was a dissappointment, too much sour mix. Stick with the mojitos! They are great. This really didn't feel like happy hour with the full meal we had at such a great price for such a nice restaurant. Service was good and not pushy or trying to rush you at all which is a nice change! I will be back very soon!

6oxaYAwIdtMkUxYLG6ABrg.text: First time trying this place. We tried the wedge blt salad... yum. The dressing was amazing. We also split the braised beef short ribs. I don't usually eat rib but these were very good. Drink were also good.
