hoxGGZOdl6J0fpoQNGd8Xw.text: This is one of my favorite places in Scottsdale. The happy hour is great and during the summer it runs all night. The bartenders are pros. Ask for George, he's a bar treasure. Sure do miss Stephan at the bar but all the same faces at the bar make it the Cheers of Az. The kettle of green chili pork is my favorite but I might have to replace it with the new bar ribs. Delicious and affordable.

3AF2YTMKG0VU9qXsElzHkg.text: Great food, get the special s Just pricy  Great service.  Food is different than many places.

v-jyjnkDF59xBI13BZpwfQ.text: My boyfriend surprised me with a wonderful day/night and this was one of our stops. Dan was our server and he was great. Everyone made it a special time.  From the rose to the dessert to the delicious food. I love great cocktails and great food. This place has it all. Can't wait to return.

batwKVXji3_9N8ZxSKKwGw.text: What an exceptional experience! I ate with about 11 others for a birthday dinner. There was not 1 misstep or hiccup; a perfect evening. The food was out of this world! Luckily I ate with good friends who like to share, so without ordering 1 of everything, I got to try bites of this-n-that. The Kettle of Green Chili Pork and flour tortillas is a must for an appetizer! I had the fish tacos; excellent choice. The service was A++. I can't wait to go back for happy hour as the menu is generous and inexpensive.

NTLP6N_bthFrWtkDr40FDA.text: Great atmosphere and great service combined with a really good, and very hearty food.   Their location is sort of a pain to get to but when you do find the front door, the ambience is great, very open, clean and inviting.

DW4Jgy_26Hdeu1dqwN5yyw.text: I love this place! The happy hour is incredible. Make sure you get there early though. It fills up by 4:10pm. My family and I visited this past week and their team accommodated 8 of us and two babies on the patio. Not always an easy feat at other restaurants. Their staff was on point and friendly throughout the evening. The queso and flatbread are drool-worthy. Love, love, love this place.

6pHytgFUqdn6kAibNlLcHQ.text: I went there with a group of friends to try their happy hour menu but that was only available at the bar. We didn't really cared about it so we say at one of the tables. I got a guava mojito and the 'big-ass' burger. I thought the guava mojito was very delicious but the burger was not so great. The burger was very dry. I heard great things about this place but the food was just okay. To top it off, the service wAs bad. Our server was an A-hole and he kept on pushing us to order appetizers even though we already said we were going to wait for our friend. Was he thinking that we were not going to get any food??

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The big-ass burger.

hT3_-eY0eoDzxUEkBIA70Q.text: Went here for dinner last night. Staff very accommodating and the meal was excellent. We had the rotisserie chicken with twice baked potato and grilled asparagus. All prepared well. Great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Twice Baked Potato
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rotisserie Chicken

QQ6Z-cVVVyGp_GeDuVj13w.text: Our first night on vacation in Scottsdale we decided to try the Roaring Fork. We arrived while happy hour was still happening (around 4:30 pm) and although we explained that we were there for dinner which starts at 5:00 we were told we could not sit in the dining area.  Our server was attentive although she seemed stretched a little thin  We ordered the guacamole and the queso with chorizo off the happy hour menu, both were good   Once we were allowed to order from the dinner menu I ordered the muscles and chorizo OMG ... That is one of the best things I have tasted it was amazing !!   We would definitely be back :)

tGUK9noTs_rEeZC0v78KUg.text: Maybe because they put us in a booth that faced the backside of the servers station.  Or maybe it was the under counter lighting strip that had fallen at some point and remained unnoticed -  hanging down randomly and glaring at me throughout the evening. We heard Scottsdale has a great fine dining component but this is not it. Service and food was okay but overpriced for the setting and definitely didn't feel like a special place or a special meal.  Skip it.

cV5fLRxMBquhhM6pze84hw.text: Love the atmosphere and the overall setting of this location - I feel like it's a hidden gem. I went there during restaurant week and oh man, their menu was amazing and very different than most. The quality and service of not only the food is above five stars - they know how to treat their customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A must. Street Mexican corn. Soooo good.
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pecan pie with pecan ice cream. Best ever.
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Filet mignon with green chili macaroni and cheese

sC1vtBubnbe6Qx0pJM_ntA.text: It can be hard to find food in Scottsdale late on a Sunday, especially in the off season.  OK, by "find food" I mean food that will please all, such as one can find at this new American meets char-grilled bourgeois chain with its massive menu.  So for me, this has been a kind of safety net for culinary dilemmas.  I've eaten the mac-n-cheese and other nom noms at the Austin location, and I've eaten at this location both for the "burger/bar" experience and the full on dinner extravaganza.  Much of the food is way above average, and described in detail elsewhere.  On my last dinner trip, we had the scallops and the plank-grilled fish special.  Both were well executed, although I can't tell you anything specific about the flavor profiles.  That in itself says something for me.  Not that it's not good or not worth it, but that it's not "special."  I can still tell you what I ate at Citizen Public House a year ago, but not this meal from a month ago.  But the burgers are amazing.   And the lamb app is fun.    I will say that as a dining experience this location feels like a cattle call, a kind of high-priced assembly line production with solid food, rushed service, and faux veneer on multiple levels. For me, this is the place to sit at the bar and get a burger and a glass of wine or beer in the afternoon, and perhaps an app.  As a dining experience, it's a bit cold an anonymous, not helped by the expansive interior.  The bar in Austin, just from a vibe level, is much more suited to my tastes.  And in Texas, at least the platinum-blonde dye is REAL.  :-0

PZjWHkemw5PSsyiOpKIOeA.text: Been going to this established restaurant for many years and it never disappoints.  Service and food is on point.

sDUNq9sro44wg-VFuMuYtg.text: I'm going to give a benefit of the doubt 4 stars here as I've only been once and it was with a large team of people who had traveled to Scottsdale for a business meeting so, the meal was one of those here's your salad, pick from these three entrees and these two desserts kind of deals.  The salad non-choice was some fresh greens with what was a tasty vinaigrette that unfortunately was in short supply.  Entree choices were organic rotisserie chicken, grilled salmon and a Dr. Pepper beef short rib with tomato jam..  I went with the short rib and found it both good and disappointing.  The good was the fall off the bone quality of the meat itself plus the flavor of the meat and the less good was that it was kind of small, and too fatty.  Judging from the conversations around the table, sounds like the chicken was the way to go.  Dessert was an ancho-chocolate torte that was really pretty good and I'm not even really a sweets kind of guy.  Walking to the banquet room we were in, I got to see some orders coming out to other tables and I saw some things that looked really good, including a delicious looking thick steak with some compound butter melting on top.  I would have ordered that in a heartbeat had it been one of our choices.  Service for the team meal seemed to be kind of slow with longer than should have been periods in between each course.

DgXXEeTppPK1c-4SyNfRwg.text: Good service. Amazing food Very packed fast so get there early. Affordable especially for this side of town. Will return

alHA0wt8P6pNWxVmL5PvvA.text: Excellent service and above all the food!!! Great taste, beautiful presentation!! Relaxing and quiet atmosphere. Will keep coming back....

b8T1PN2BxXY-JmppZ9jPug.text: It is in the DETAILS!  I took a friend here for his bday and it was a great experience. The hosts were very welcoming and the servers were very attentive.  Since I told them it was his bday beforehand, they had sprinkled confetti on the white table linens and placed a bday card, signed by all the staff, on the table. They also included a free dessert for his bday.  The drinks and food were delicious too. We both ordered the filet and they were cooked just right...his as beef jerky and mine as barely moving rare.   It's all in the details and they detailed it up!

0rH-82P3jQWljsLxlv7fgw.text: A local legend, but I just recently ate here for the first time, and I wondered what took me so long....  the food was really good. We had the buttermilk southern fried chicken breast and burger, both where great. The service was a little slow but it was a Friday night so its forgivable. The staff was warm and friendly. All in all, I am glad we tried it and we will be back.

2A-6aJv6LvlFxR6rN4MaOQ.text: Atmosphere was great! Service was great! Food was amazing!  Highly recommend the fish tacos, steak or salmon. Delicious! More expensive but worth it!

utnIQGvgMoNMEF9YU_8V3w.text: Food was good. We had service issues. Server got a large group about the time that we were seated. After letting him know that we needed another minute to make wine and drink selections, we waited fifteen minutes before having to head to the hostess station and ask to place our drink order. After this, service seemed rushed and not terribly attentive. While the food was good, the experience was not.

7OhGEfMpWzWOYPqmlbqXSw.text: What a fantastic dinner!! To begin, our waiter (Chase) did a great job serving us and assuring us we made a great selection of dishes. He was attentive without being intrusive. Our order was as follows:  - Complimentary Bread Basket - comes with rolls and mini corn bread muffins... Very tasty actually. Comes with a plate of 2 types of butter which I confused for cheese and pate (the butter was cut in wedges... My bad) - Green Chili Pork with Tortillas  (appetizer) - delicious and full of flavor. Generous portion. Would order again in a heart beat. It is topped with melted cheese. My photo does it no justice.  - Half Roast Chicken (entree) - comes with really tasty corn bread stuffing and veggies. Chicken was cooked very well. Not dry at all. Only was to make it better would be to find a way to improve the chicken skin flavor which was good, but not fantastic.  - Green Chili Mac 'n Cheese - good lord this was good. It has some crunchies on top which just pull it all together. Creamy cheese, a little green chili spice, perfect pasta with a delicious crunch for texture.   All in all, I would happily come back if I'm  in the area. Sadly I'm a visitor but thank you yelp for helping me find this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Green chili Mac &#39;n cheese (wow!)
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half roast chicken with corn bread stuffing and seasonal vegetables
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bread basket with roll and little corn bread muffins (plus butter plate)

8ftVYeGAoOXhTCxau5W5iQ.text: Wonderful, cozy place in the heart of Scottsdale -- the Roaring Fork gets two thumbs up. Their jalapeno mac & cheese alone is worth visiting, but there are a lot of other delicious treats on the menu too. If you're a vegetarian, ask the server what your options are, there aren't many on the menu which is why its getting three stars from me. Once I asked my waitress about vegetarian options she told me all the dishes that could be converted to vegetarian which I greatly appreciated.   Their wine selection is absolutely amazing though, lots of delicious, quality wines for you to enjoy. I'd visit this place again if I'm back in the area!

6moGn9g1hbCUxhkOAj_pzg.text: When I got here what was roaring was my stomach! It had been a long day and after unwinding a tad at the Fairmont we headed here for a special birfday dinner. We hung out in the bar area while waiting for our table. Immediate service... woot. woot. What? Table ready early? woot. woot. woot. Drinks were brought to our table and we examined the menu.   I was having a difficult time deciding on what to get until I saw the RF Mixed Grill... Baby Back Ribs, Bacon wrapped Quail and Prawns. Roasted Corn side with a dollop of mashed potatoes.. look no further I am sold. The prawns were slightly over cooked but that did not bother me as the quail was friggin awesome. I am noticing a bacon theme here in Scottsdale and I endorse it 125%. The boyfriend got the teriyaki cedar plank salmon which was inhaled in seconds. The lamb shank is ridiculously huge... it looks like a turkey leg on steroids. I had a bite and it was also well cooked (not super gamy in taste). The grilled asparagus side is huge and can easily be shared between 2-3 people.   Dessert... Creme Brulee how I love you so.... the birfday girl got a Mexican Vanilla Creme Brulee and it was perfect... the custard was sweet but not too sweet and the brulee was a wonderful golden brown thin layer of crispy sugar goodness.   Extensive wine list, classic and infusion mixed drinks. I suggest making reservations.. this place is consistently packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. mex. vanilla creme brulee with dark chocolate happy bday
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. cedar plank salmon
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. trio of meaty goodness

WPO3dUOS9Fwy87RPJrxcNg.text: Really good food. The music in the background was awesome. The restaurant is really nice in rich woods and attention to detail from the floor to the ceiling. Service was excellent. If you are in the area-Definitely worth checking go out.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. &#34;big ass burger&#34; yes. That&#39;s what it&#39;s really called.
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ciopino (sp?)

ZlocrPph1xGFEO-lTF_v8g.text: This is the first time I ate at "Roaring Fork" Happy hour specials: The queso and pork on the appetizer was the best. The hamburger should be shared as it was enormous the French fries meh I've had better. They seemed stale or cooked in old oil... Not worth the calories imo. I had the traditional mojito which was just ok. This is the first time we are here and weren't  100%. However I am at a happy hour so.... There ya go.

EK9WJMC-17dGplCEyJSs-Q.text: Took my family here when the visited from out of town. The food was amazing and the service was even better. Had the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and the beef short ribs definitely recommended!

JLl3hx87eLU7w3bK5N5LRQ.text: I made a reservation here to celebrate a one year anniversary with my girlfriend.  We arrived to our table with a signed card from the staff which was a nice touch.  Our server was prompt and cordial, and the food was fantastic.  I went with the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and my girl got a filet.  Both were cooked perfectly.  They even offered us a free desert of our choice.  Overall it was great service and great food.  No draft beers which was a bummer, but still a decent selection of bottled beers.

Am5mxdy6j8AAMeAOAb_q1Q.text: I had never been to the Roaring Fork before, but I was excited to try it, based on the recommendations from friends and family.  I was pleased with our meal - we had a variety of items, and all were very well done. We loved the heirloom tomato salad with goat cheese and arugula. This was probably our favorite thing. We also tried the lamb chop fondue, which was very good, but a little difficult to eat. I'd still recommend it though.  We decided to split the Big Ass Burger, for which I am glad, since it was huge, and it came with fries. This item was so memorable, since I loved the poblano pepper on the burger. Since we were splitting, we also ordered the green chili mac and cheese. This was delicious! I'll definitely try it again.  Very courteous wait staff, and very nice ambient room. I can't wait to go back for half-priced appetizers!

N_HQLalxxqVyqUHFNs2A0A.text: I brought the work crew out for dinner at the Roaring Fork. Every single person was amazed.  Personally, I have had a ton of great meals here, so I wasn't surprised.   This trip was: Starter: New Pork Wing appetizer with the old Dr Pepper BBQ sauce. EXCELLENT! (Bring back this sauce!)  Entree: Beef short ribs swapping the sides to get their awesome grits and corn! Wow!  Incredible  5 star Food 5 Star Ambiance 4.5 star service

N-vH_iNeEI9f2vy29ZnZTw.text: The $10 "big ass" burger from their happy hour menu is delicious and definitely not False advertising. Be prepared!

pwMFVQkvr9t6xFSSSONONQ.text: Probably one of the best dining experiences I have had. We came in for Happy Hour, which is amazing. The portions were huge. I ordered the nachos and special steak salad and my BF opted for the restaurant week special ribeye. AMAZING!!  But what really set this above for me was the service staff. Our server was busy, but another server got us started. He was sooo nice. Watching the staff bustle around they were all actively helping one another, something that doesn't happen enough in the service industry in my opinion. The steak on my salad was a little spicy. The server offered to make me a new one without the spice rub, but I decided I could manage. Then the manager actually visited our table to make sure I was ok; another thing that doesn't happen often enough. I am very impressed and definitely recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy hour nachos so good. Spicy for me but definitely recommend.

9BNjdz6uO89ehm2OYwshtw.text: I wish we had a Roaring Fork in the Bay Area because I'm already craving the lamb fondue! It was amazing! I also had a very tender and absolutely mouth watering braised short rib with mashed potatoes and Mexican corn! It came in a 3 course dinner with perfectly cold and crisp Ceasar salad with anchovies and a chocolate toffee pecan pie! We also had the huckleberry margaritas! Service was fast, food was excellent, price was reasonable, and service was outstanding! I'd definitely go back!

gZ3w3RsAfvQKpry1SW2upQ.text: This was probably one of my favorite restaurants back home in Texas. I came to this one for the first time since I moved here to Phoenix. The restaurant is located in an office building which is kind of inconvenient. The service was excellent the waitress was very nice and professional, she also knew the menu very well and her recommendations where great. The Sirloin salad which is what I ordered was delicious I also share the fish tacos which where ok. If you are looking for a place to casually dine and have a good time this is your place.

JIFvoCw587GJtBy5Y76xdw.text: All servers so friendly and knowledgeable, managers on spot. Food way above average. Try or don't. It's my two times a week recommended place to eat

6ln81OQWzukvNnLKPCZDYw.text: Wonderful cozy restaurant more for the Scottsdale upper crust crowd. The food is excellent. I really enjoyed the duck- excellent. The chef sent a nice surprise tasting to the table which was awesome. Definitely coming back.

cYqYu0mpO3fkSR7l_pfWag.text: My steak salad was delish and my husbands duck was great.  My only complaint was that my waitress disappeared when it was time to pay.  After waiting over 10 minutes for her to come back, we took our bill inside (we sat on the patio) so we could pay. Oddly, the table next to us has to do the same.

04Ls_KjfHzK8ioaK-Txl0A.text: I'm going to start this by saying that the beginning of our experience at Roaring Fork was amazing! The bread and the flatbread app was AMAZING! Service was okay! However, when it got to the main entrees, we were not impressed. My friend got the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin, the bacon was burnt and the the tenderloin was beyond chewy. I tried it and had to take it out of my mouth. The grits were extremely gritty and flavorless. My salmon was okay. The Brussels sprouts tasted blah. It wasn't out of this world. Not sure if it was because we had dinner later in the evening. As a managing partner of a restaurant that does 12 million a year, I enjoy trying new places and food. I was not impressed with this restaurant.  I'm giving it three stars ONLY for the bread and drinks.

Ij8tE_74MVC6uenNNcLWKg.text: This has become my favorite Happy Hour spot in Scottsdale.  Walking distance from the house.  The bar is usually crowded but we always manage to find a couple seats within about 5 minutes.   We go for the $5 martinis and stay for the food.  When you get a martini, make sure to ask for a cocktail onion!  They marinate them in the restaurant and they are phenomenal!  I wish I could buy a bottle of them and take them home!  The green chili pork is tender and the warm tortillas make it a finger food.  The queso has the pork too and we end up getting both appetizers because we can't choose just one.  During the summer, their happy hour is every day until 10:00 pm!   This place is our weekly stop to get the weekend started.

Q-ivm4MId6-MwV-VqhwKPw.text: One of the best restaurants around! Happy hour menu is on point $5 huckleberry margaritas. The green chili pork with house made tortillas is a go to. When you have a big appetite try the big a$$ burger with a poblano pepper mmmmm

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Roaring Fork Big A$$ Burger
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Logo
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Decor

ESQkPp9YUajxpoE1ArvHNg.text: I've been coming here for many many years and can't believe I've never written a review for them. Definitely one of my favorite Sunday night spots. They have an all night happy hour on Sundays from open to close. Great specials on food and drink. One of the Staples there is the big ass burger with fries for $10. Which is a 10 oz Patty of beef with choice of side. Also enjoy their muscles in a spicy chorizo sauce served with toast points. I would recommend getting the toast points on the side as they get soggy in the sauce. I have also eaten steaks and other dinner's at this restaurant and everything as always comes out correctly. Staff is on point. Bartenders really take care of business and are also in charge of serving the happy hour and bar food. A few of them at work there for 10 plus years which shows it's a good place for employment. Management is on point and always around if there is a problem. If you've never check this spot out and you're in the Old Town Scottsdale area definitely come by and check it out especially for their great happy hour. Also during 4 months of the summer they run the happy hour special every day all night all day. Call to check the dates

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 1/2 burger on HH.
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. HH May 19

1bbb5C4PIYFhAcPvQ9vRCA.text: This night will be one I try and forget.   At Roaring Fork I ran into an issue that seems to plague me once every month or two. I am a single guy who enjoys a nice night out so that often leaves me by myself finding a place to sit at the bar. Sitting at the bar alone never bothers me. But once bartenders find out that I don't drink alcohol, it certainly bothers them.   MOST and I am saying most for a reason. Most bartenders respect my wishes to not want to drink and leave me alone. While at Roaring Fork the bartender asked me at least a dozen times throughout my meal if I wanted to see a drink menu. Each time I said no I don't drink I was met with a huge eye roll and some little comment. Just because I do not drink doesn't mean I don't take care of the bartenders. I am usually a 25%-30% tipper on an average night. But this guy just couldn't leave me be.   The food was decent, nothing spectacular. My steak came out medium when I asked for it rare but I didn't want to even begin to try and go through that process with the bartender I had.   Overall it's frustrating when places make you feel super unwelcome just because you didn't feel like drinking and driving.   I can't give my business to a restaurant that allows employees to act like that. Hard pass for me.

U5yZVL6SYXMRE6syyIHvmA.text: I'm so glad I made the decision to come to Roaring Fork for restaurant week because it instantly became one of my favorite restaurants in the area! Their steaks are cooked perfectly with a great sear and I absolutely loved the pecan pie and gelato. Probably my favorite dessert that I've had in Phoenix! They also have a delicious green chili Mac and cheese and gigantic 12 oz burger that's only $10 during happy hour! I highly recommend coming here! I've eaten in the bar area when I'm there but if you'd like to sit in the main dining area, your best bet is to make a reservation ahead of time since the wait time can get pretty lengthy.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

I8KJD-WlxmyFUHfQ26k_iQ.text: This is an incredible place. I've lived in Phoenix area for almost 5 years and I'm kicking myself for not coming here earlier. Ambience: wonderful. We sat at the bar area. Beautiful antler chandelier. Gorgeous lighting. However, Entrance in was weird as it is in a commercial area. Therefore, I think this really is an excellent location to take out of town visitors for business. Food: I am absolutely impressed. My husband did the AZ Restaurant Week; he got the Caesar salad, 16 oz Delmonico medicine rare steak with asparagus and potatoes and creme brulee. I decided to take advantage of their practically all day Sunday happy hour. If you are reading this for restaurant week. Do what we did. Best of both worlds!!!! Steak was perfectly charred on the outside. Closer to rare instead of medium rare on the inside. Wished for more asparagus, but usually their entrees don't come with sides so I shouldn't complain. Best seasoned mashed potatoes ever! They use the jus from the strain as a thin gravy. DELISH! Drinks were surprisingly well priced for this location in Scottsdale for happy hour. Service: We walked in 10min before our OpenTable reservations. But because we wanted the Happy Hour we wanted to seat ourselves in the bar area. Our hostess was excellent. Our server, Amanda, is absolutely fantastic! She dined here before she worked here. I think that shows the quality of the service: you'd want to work where you and your customers are treated right.  All out: I will be back. I will take friends and family here anytime they are visiting me!!!!

yy__JY6lSehaW9li1Vdwlw.text: Always a trusted, consistent venue for ambiance, quality, value and fun!  The only reason for less then 5 stars is the management of Happy Hour.....mature clientele, child-like hosts.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ambience
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Roasting hens

p4rPbM4yAGF2k-5GBXZR2w.text: We were there for their all night happy hour! It was a little difficult to get a table, seemed like some people wanted to drag out their one glass of wine for 2 hours. I am sure this is frustrating for the restaurant staff as well. After about an hour and a half wait we finally were finally able to get a table and order drinks and food. The happy hour drinks are $5 and the they have a great happy hour menu as well the tacos and guacamole were great! Really great time and great atmosphere! Love the all night happy hour!!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

gq-615xLCmqlUa-07j0RrA.text: Brought my wife's cousin here for dinner.  My wife and I were visiting from Los Angeles and her cousin lives in Phoenix.  I was still full from lunch, but ordered the bid ass burger, my wife ordered bthe trout, and cousin Margie ordered bthe half chicken.  The bread that was delivered to our table was awesome.  There was some corn bread with jalapeno and some roll that was sweet, but not too sweet.  The food was very good, but I had to take half of my meal home and will enjoy it tonight for snack.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bug ass burger
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Awesome bread

T6jpMAUVRPEmDrLh4oHcZA.text: The food itself was fantastic! By far, the best happy hour I've experienced around Scottsdale. I had the steak salad which hit the spot! The meat was a little too rare for my taste, especially since I asked for medium! Ribs were great!! Easy to come off and great side coleslaw because it had a nice little kick to it. I gave one less star because of ten service. Our waitress had about 6 of us, but she didn't seem to really want to work with us. It just would have been nice to have a little more service such as water being filled more frequently. Great little nook though!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

xgCQv9fECgW-f00ea6pTgQ.text: Good food and certainly of local taste. Southwestern. Excellent service and good atmosphere but not upscale. If looking for a real dress up spot this is not it. Attire is anything is acceptable, flip flops torn t shirts Doesn't matter. and that is why it is not a place to take your lady for a dress up night   For a casual good food experience in jeans and whatever it is very good

PaLbHSFZi4x13yw6_Nts_A.text: We went here because we heard that they had good happy hour and good food. We stopped in, and although the happy hour and margaritas were decent, the food wasn't the best. We probably won't go here again, but if you're looking for a good happy hour place, then it would be worth stopping in and checking it out.

0yZOPqjLYlRZc67MgXdfew.text: I've been here 4 times now and I have nothing negative to say. The service whether at the bar or in  the dining area has been impeccable. The filet I ordered last time was cooked perfectly and very tender and flavorful. 4-7 Happy Hour is also a must not miss. They have a $10 "Big Ass" burger that is really awesome with a huge side of fries and great drink specials. Get there early for Happy Hour though because the bar fills up. I've also had the short ribs and the seared scallops and so far, you can't go wrong with anything I've tried.

fgw-4yzYl-5Z0Tgimri-TQ.text: We had a wonderful dinner here. The atmosphere was nice and cozy. I had the goat cheese and date salad which was amazing. My husband had tortilla soup that was also very good. He had the duck which he enjoyed and I had buttermilk fried chicken. It was very tasty and the portions were large. The street corn was also very good. The best part was the dessert -- chocolate pecan pie which was really excellent!!

JK86k8P5XdlxoE0y_RX6LQ.text: Wonderful dining experience. Great happy hour till 10! Great if you want to dress up a bit and amazing amount of food for what you pay for. It's classy but also fun. I will be back for the price and the atmosphere. Great service, if you get Sara, she's awesome. And their drinks are NOT watered down. :) I recommend the frozen huckleberry marg.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Big Ass Burger, (actually what it&#39;s called)
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huckleberry margarita!!!

xs2GOaaAb6EXL436twpdqg.text: Happy hour at Roaring Fork aka Fight Club.  Limited number of tables combined with aggressive patrons makes for an awkward  setting for both the seated guest as well as those hovering for tables . Not worth the hassle for the overrated  and limited menu. Balance of the restaurant was virtually empty .  If you're in the mood for a showdown either while seated or waiting for a seat head on over . Personally  we won't be back

J2jyl34M7CRfQwRa9NHBhw.text: So sad this didn't meet our expectations.  Servers were being shuffled around, we were ignored a good portion of our meal and the plating of our KC Steak was very unappealing.  Server was a bit uninformed about the cook on the steak, and he asked us to cut into it.  It was too rare, and bled all over the mashed potatoes that were stuck underneath it.

a0U4Bf4XtBS12PesM3LIdg.text: Attention to detail here is second to none. Friendly staff are very attentive without feeling intrusive. We had a wonderful meal with friends. Steaks, soup and sides ( Mexican corn,twice baked potato) were delicious. Flawless presentation. Minor surprise by lukewarm fish in the tacos(?) but we are newbies here. Easily worthy of six or seven stars. Will definitely be back.

TmEcAh5ntO7TCAQz1c38_w.text: The Fork has been at the top of my list for years as one of Scottsdale's best Happy Hour spots for fun, flavor and value! Their chips and guac are to-die for and the fish tacos are an absolute must!!! The secret is out though, so get there early if you want a great seat!! *

qYEvcXbDriTWmcMMNa_woA.text: Very impressed if your looking for  a beautiful  tasteful meal for a special occasion, I recommend  5pm reservation. If you'd prefer happy hour on the Misty Fan Patio prices are extremely reasonable $10 fat a$$ burger (yes huge) or try $10 fish tacos, heavenly Creme Brulee and Carrot Cake. Generous portions and detailed friendly servers. I am so happy we found this little corner tasty heaven.

K1-j60c_yryqAmcOq4ovdg.text: Um, yeah--Good! V nice. V fancy. Prices. Bring your wife or something. That'll be nice for her. Server v good. Combed hair and whatnot. Perfume I think. Pretty good! Probably won't go again tho, but yeah give it a shot!

-KaGFQh1b6HUshbVyV-EMw.text: Awesome food, not the best service I will have to admit. For a place such as "upiddy and hip" kinda lame in my book...not very good service.

LWl1vr-hjopuOG8KU-kbhA.text: We love the happy hour here. We seem to be happy hour people . The big ass burger, green chili , con queso dip , martinis and margaritas. Get the frozen maggies for sure. They make a mean martini too with blue cheese stuffed olives. We love sitting outside and enjoying the great food and service. You wont be disappointed here. They get really busy during happy hour so make sure you get there early to get a seat. Enjoy

UwEnCecOcpots-BxghaQVw.text: After stumbling across so many great reviews, we decided to come here for dinner while we were visiting in Scottsdale. They started us off with the complimentary baguette and corn bread muffins served with whipped butter which were SOOOO GOOD!!! Seriously, I could've eaten this all day. We then got the tortilla soup served with avocado and chicken. It was very thick but very tasty. Next, I ordered the pork chops and my husband ordered the duck. We enjoyed both of the dishes though i thought the pork chops were too thick and too lean. I wish it was thinner and had a bit of fat content. I also ordered the Juliet Rose just because it sounded so pretty! Overall, we loved the charm of the restaurant, the good food, and the great service.

uhGHyBipS9cGdVoTHJFzgw.text: Absolutely delicious!! We had filet mingon, tortillas soup, queso dip, green chili Mac and cheese and bacon wrapped pork tenderloin with grits and Mexican street corn. One of the best meals I've ever eaten. Beautiful restaurant with excellent service. I highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped pork tenderloin with grits and Mexican street corn
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon and bacon wrapped pork tenderloin with grits and Mexican street corn

p1-4rUxqL0qpF6Dzx7-Kmg.text: Their kettle of green chili pork might be one of my favorite dishes of all time! Words don't do it justice. It's on the happy hour and regular menu. Their margarita on the rocks and mojitos are also great and available on happy hour. If you are coming in for happy hour, do come earlier. Happy hour is limited to the bar area and front patio, which are open seating. If you arrive well into happy hour, you are unlikely to find a spot. And it feels silly to pay more for the same dish/drink just because you are sitting in a different area of the restaurant. I wish they would extend happy hour pricing to the entire restaurant.

SSvCctVQBBX3TyJV-GVtJQ.text: Tried the bacon wrapped pork tenderloins, Mexican corn and cheesy grits, fried chicken, also had for sides green chili Mac n cheese and twice baked potato. Everything was great!

jOCD41PcBhV--oLbcyk5BA.text: Beautiful restaurant, particularly the lighting and gorgeous wooden floors. The service was wonderful. Tortilla soup lacked flavor. Would have preferred more traditional broth than tomato soup consistency.  Steaks were cooked to perfection.  Horseradish mash potatoes was delicious as well as the pecan pie.  Very romantic setting.

OqdOnIWFho5TSErugi9yYQ.text: Ambiance is very romantic. I can get pretty loud here when it's crowded but the food makes up for it. I've been dining here for years. Make a reservation! Very important. You have to walk passed the bar to get to the seating and that's always crowded and loud. Steak is always cooked to perfection. The Mexican street corn is my favorite side dish! LOVE IT!

-62QiLOC5z4QHrZZaIZp_A.text: For over 10 years I have been coming to this restaurant, as I pride them on great service and good food until tonight! We are even members of restaurant chain! We have gone to this place for anniversaries and birthdays and then all went down tonight due to favoritism! I was lied to by the bartender who said spot was saved because of patrons going to bathroom which was a total lie as other people showed up when then those left . If you are in the group or on the list for the restaurant then don't go here because they will treat you like second class! What a shame!

mNmdBjBSGUikont0bEWnRg.text: The rustic atmosphere is delightful. Our server was very gracious and helpful. We ordered off the menu that had a choice of three entrees. It included a salad and dessert. We chose the  Ahi Ahi tuna. The chef was gracious to sear it bit extra for us. However the tuna had an incredibly spicy rub on it. It was not noted as such in the menu. I literally could not eat it and had to send it back. So disappointing..The tuna was on a bed of chilled blanched green beans which excellent . Also accompanying the tuna were corn bread croutons. Honestly, I could not see the correlation between the corn bread croutons and the tuna. We chose the pecan pie for dessert. It was excellent with a flaky lard crusty. The accompanying gelato was absolutely delightful. To me, my meal was disappointing but I would definitely go back and give it another try. The area in which the restaurant is located is upscale and seems quite trendy. Wish I had ordered the salmon on a plank. The Ahi tuna gave  me an extremely upset stomach. Will never order that again.

rXB7YnDrN0Kx_6VFNr93sQ.text: Very nice place with good drinks and foods.  Service was definitely slow but trying just appeared to be understaffed.  Hope to try again but will stay away from any weekends including Sunday night when we went.  Best to Try a week night.

zC8mE1LzsDhiQuZ-5gz0oQ.text: I asked the hostess what time happy hour ended.  She told me 10pm.  I left and came back 20 minutes later and she then told me it ended at 7pm.  I asked to speak to the manager and told him the situation and all he did was come up with an excuse about how the hostess took 7 months off and just came back.   I told him i wasnt happy and all he told me was ok

_SkOaoHI6n5_o3pnQHuZ9Q.text: Went here for a date night and it was so fun.    They have great steak and sides finished w a bottle of red wine is the topping for the night! Gelato was the special for dessert and it was amazing. Awesome atmosphere and great service!

J4WmTj_RvToeW_2FbAAG1w.text: The food here is good, not great, solid good. The hostess, the first and last impression was horrible. Her attitude stuck out the whole meal. Her body language, demeanor, and attitude made a lasting impression. It's a team effort and this solid 3 is now a 2. Enjoy.

K3MDvc9BLsfl9OW85UCOXQ.text: Had a great time. Sat at the bar for happy hour and enjoyed good conversation,  libations and great food. 4-7 is there happy hour times. Go. Enjoy. Leave snooty attitudes at home this place is well priced, very comfortable and warm. A favorite... thanks guys

HidjqEOYhR2SkSz3hKJLSw.text: Where do I begin? We were seated at a table by kitchen. We asked to move to a different location and they said there were no more tables available. We ordered our meal, I asked for vegitarian options and the waiter suggested a vegetable plate of sides. Ok. As we sat there and waited for our food to arrive, we watched the food come out on the line. I actually timed on my iPhone a steak that sat there for 5 minutes and 29 seconds before a waiter came to take it. The sides were prepared way ahead of time and sat there under what I am assuming were warmers waiting to be ordered and then served. Hence why when our meal arrived the potatoe side wasn't even lukewarm. As we continued to watch the cooks, both men working in the entree/meat/seafood line were not wearing gloves. One of them clearly had a bandage on his finger and was handling food with his injured finger. The other man I clearly saw picking scabs off of his arm and then handling food as well. Our meal came, my husband ordered a steak and I the vegetables as suggested. When we ordered the waiter said the meat is cooked on wood planks. My husbands steak he said tasted like the smell of fire pit. As I bit into my asparagus, it too tasted like the bonfire we had the evening before. I then became extremely irritated that now I am realizing that my vegetable I ordered where I clearly stated I was a vegitarian was cooked on a wood plank where meat was. We asked for the manager who offered us a free desert. No thank you. We just wanted out of our misery.

A--QrTDeawbX-oPwIVY50w.text: Although I haven't physically been to the restaurant, I was assisted by one of the hostesses and the manager Jeff in order to buy a bottle of champagne for my parents anniversary while they're on vacation. We are from Boston and they are in Arizona celebrating their 24th anniversary. I bought them a bottle of champagne over the phone and asked Jeff to walk over and say happy anniversary. He was more than happy to accommodate me even though I was on the other side of the country!

37lOEb3_4kIu-XH2xhx1Sw.text: We have been here twice, and enjoyed the food, service and ambiance both times. Recommendations for making reservations during happy hour are spot on. We were seated immediately upon arriving at our time of reservation; we had two other couples with us, and all of us commented that it was a great experience.

R-mPxwHUXjc2AvscChquVg.text: I absolutely love Roaring Fork.  It's Happy Hour is phenomenal, and I've actually never not eaten in the bar for this reason.  Also, it keeps the visit a bit cheaper, but this is no compromise.  The drinks are reasonably priced, the food, truly fantastic too.  I like to come here with a moderate sized group so that we can try to sample as many of the entrees as possible.    Some of my favorite Happy Hour Menu items are as follows...The Mixed Market Greens salad, Big-Ass Burger, Kettle of Green Chili Pork, the Fish Tacos, and the Chicken and Pepper-Jack Flatbread pizza is beyond wonderful.  You are still able to order dinner menu items from the bar as well, which is nice.  Roaring Fork has a mountain lodge kind of feel and decor, it's relaxed, but usually quite busy.  The bar is first-come-first-serve, so be prepared to stake out for a table.  A great place to start off an evening in Scottsdale.

qMisd8CKjZgYn98_cr1EGA.text: Great food totally worth the extra few bucks you would save some where else.   The restaurant is located on the bottom floor of an office building and unless you were looking for it, you would probably drive right past it. The prices on the menu can be a bit off putting but I would say worth it if you enjoy a good meal.   As an appetizer we shared fried avocado, for no other reason than to try it. It came topped with fresh crab meat, the avocado is coated with an egg wash and then rolled in bread crumbs before its fried to produce a delightful this crust. I would definitely order that again.   I had the sugar cured duck breast and my girlfriend had the bacon wrapped pork sirloin. I love duck and this one was very tasty, this particular piece had more fat on it than usual but no complaints. The cure cured skin was crispy and sweet. The tenderloin melted in our mouths, so ridiculously good.

RViAwssGx3lswP7kCzN--Q.text: We were excited to try Roaring Fork and especially for the all day Monday happy hour pricing. It was a disappointment.  Service was fine, it was the food that was not good. We were glad to have only paid the reduced happy hour prices, but it was so bad, that it was not even worth those prices.  We ordered: Pork Wings, Grilled Fish Tacos, and the Roaring Fork Big Ass Burger.  The pork wings were fine, not too exciting. The sauce was like a sweet marinara, not what we were looking for from the Dr. Pepper BBQ description.  The fish tacos were ok.  The remoulade was tasty as were the vegetables, but the fish was very plain. Even at happy hour prices, this was 2 fish tacos for $10... so $5 per taco... so they should have been great or at least good. They were fine, but only worth a buck a piece.  The burger was a real problem. We ordered it medium rare and it came out rare, like cold in the center rare. They graciously refired it, but it was not to be fixed (still rare on the refire). So they made us a new one - which was not medium rare, and not medium, but well done, as in hockey puck well done.  At that point we just gave up.  It was a bust of a dinner.   We left disappointed and having spent $46 before tip on ho hum food.  Definitely skip this one.

hXVQ1BKVezlV-hjca2qycw.text: We ordered the fried avocado, the barramundi, and a bone in ribeye steak. It was one of the best meals I've had, period. To top it off, the coffee was crazy good at the end and made me question the True meaning of life. Awesome!

iDEBfCl8TMKeJ6GnXwcixg.text: Wow. Duck Breast. Short Ribs. Pork Shoulder Carnitas. Chili Mac & Cheese. Incredible.

iLPEilGtWNfECjDgZOBq6w.text: OMG   GRAET VALUE!  The happy hour here is awesome. Do try their big Ass burger as it's the best! The ambience, service and every  item we ordered was most excellent !  Inexpensive drinks too.  Happy hour is first come first serve....and busy as the word is out. Get there early!

7QWKKKCCRRcftPfghjiJ2A.text: Make a reservation!  The food is great. The wine list wonderful. The service quite good.  The down side?  It is packed. We had to basically circle a table on the patio, like hyenas to get a place to sit.  Everything I have tried there was superb. I really enjoy the vegetable sides. Very savory.

4EPBKZhVY-VSGzSRKmbN6w.text: I love this place so much!  I have always had amazing service there! Last night, our server, Amy, was incredibly sweet!  I love huckleberry so much and you can't find it anywhere else in this state! Their huckleberry bread pudding is AMAZING! So are the huckleberry lemon drops and huckleberry margaritas! I have had the salmon, the bacon wrapped pork tenderloins with grits and the half chicken with cornbread stuffing, all delicous! The chili mac and cheese is awesome! This is definately my favorite place to go when. I can!! I reccomend it to all my clients :) I definately reccomend making reservations if you want to go!!

HsJ46gvlbHvBcv8FLE7XJQ.text: Great service, delicious food, and the price is really not as expensive as the restaurant appears.  Very nice looking restaurant in an mostly office building area.  As you step in, you are greeted warmly and professionally by the staff.  The decor is very nice and classy, and not overly pretentious.    There is a nice variety on their menu to please everyone.  Well maybe not everyone, I did not see if they had a good vegetarian selection but pretty much a good place to bring friends who dun eat certain meats, like beef or seafood.  I had their RF Mixed Grill, which I highly recommend to anyone.  It gives u a sampling of all that is good at this place.  U really cannot disapprove of baby back ribs, chicken, shrimp and sausage.  all nicely cooked in a wood fired grill.  And all for only 24 bucks.  thats actually very comparable to a dinner at many chain restaurants, like outback steakhouse or even olive garden but without the tackiness and crowd you find at a chain restaurant.  We had a big group and everybody loved what they had, be it the buttermilk fried chicken, pork carnitas, or dr pepper baby back.  All were good and everyone were happy.  For appetiziers we had the really well cooked green chilli pork and, amazingly lamb chops and fondue.  I never knew fondue could be this good with lamb chops.  U would think an overwhelming combination as one is rich and the other oily, but it was really a tasty combo.  I think folks who come here expecting mastro would be genuinely impressed with the excellent service and relatively lower price.  Definitely a place to come to for a change if you are someone who is bored of chains like outback or olive garden or buca di beppo.

uI8x-eWoKeAjZGXKl23GNw.text: Great happy hour scene and food selection. Honesty i would say the seafood is generally avg given pricing, but the meat dishes are really quality and worth your time and $$&

anspujSr6gTUpB0MHwZBFQ.text: Love tis place for NYE with my family!

FfUhztwFno7KVvh6wh6aSw.text: Another successful date night!   We were seated quickly, and our server Kenneth took very good care of us. The complimentary biscuits were delicious, and we also got a salsa amuse bouche, courtesy of the chef. Unfortunately, they ran out of the spare rib tacos, so I ordered the carnitas instead. My husband got the duck confit. He got two Heinekens for $5 each, and I got a tasty prickly pear mojito. We split the creme brulee for dessert.   The food took a little longer than I would have liked, but my husband's duck was very good. I wasn't thrilled with the carnitas, but I think it's because I had my heart set on the spare ribs.   We will definitely come back for another special occasion!

RfJzwXnYwNfzbuo0Eusevg.text: Sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo Good.  If I didnt believe 5 starts gets overused, id do it.  I had ZERO complaints.  We went for Happy hour and had Tortilla Soup, Kettle Green Chile Pork and the Big Ass Burger along with a couple Arnold Palmers.  All for under Awesome food, all of it;...the pork is the shining star here.  Service was great!  Great waitress, and supporting staff as well.  Will be back soon no doubt.

QkRY1R8yJqO4dxXLPdgG2w.text: This place was terrible! Would never come back! Wouldnt recommend anyone coming here. Food was okay...atmosphere was cool but the service was the worst!! I hate that i have to give a 1 because they deserve a 0!!!!

iwGQWPX76sUKHNSMtI-nOw.text: Epic $10 happy hour burger.  Seriously....  Great staff.  Absolutely recommend on Sun-Mon all night happy hour.

qysYq6U61q452ynsHF7ctQ.text: I went here for restaurant week w my fiance, and was impressed. It was super yummy! I really liked the green chili pork. We were sat at the tables by the kitchen and it was fun to watch the dynamic of the staff. I would have liked to see more of the decor of the actual restaurant though. The bread basket was one of the best I've ever seen at a restaurant. Good assortment. The cornbread was my fav! Was full after my appetizer, very hearty portions! I was thinking- how am I going to do a 3 course meal?! Great time at roaring fork! :)

_-_cwIX3bEu3bzZFGzUU4Q.text: My wife and I stopped in here for happy hour and sat at the bar.  The bar tender was a neat guy that made us feel welcome.  I had the hamburger and I was surprised by the quality and size.  The happy hour price was a really good deal.

ns1DHte5Ukjqxc7lyH4CLQ.text: I find this place very unique and fun! Its a great place to take out of towners... Its colorful, has very unique and quality food, and you have to love a place that has a "Big Ass Burger" on its menu! Its a lively joint, far from romantic, if that's what you're looking for. Not the greatest location, as its almost hard to find if you've never been there before, as its in an office-like complex. But, those minor items aside, I really dig this place and the food is more than outstandng!

PNiU0WFPm6pAiiYv25p-qA.text: Went with large group...the GPS tried to route us elsewhere (old location?) but a few illegal turns and we were there. Had reservations, went right in and the menu was fantastic; so many great options for everyone, I wish I had one close as I'd return weekly until I worked my way through the selections. Don't miss the Queso con Puerco (we ordered a second). Everything we tried was great, as was the service.

0-REoD3IyprpyeW1PpSbyQ.text: After leaving a previous poor review, I was consistently contacted by upper management trying to redeem themselves. This restaurant is not near my home but I agreed to try them again and was promised they would send a certificate for dinner on them at our convenience.  However, it has been over a month now and I have yet to see anything. I am still VERY unsatisfied with this company.

W_GShXaSSwuoHmps3dwCcg.text: I've always passed this restaurant when I'm being driven down scottsdale and I finally decided to stop there since its so close to Optima condos. I have to say, it was pretty good. Atmosphere was great and food was too. I suggest going there for happy hour and getting their macaroni and cheese. Or tortilla soup. Both are very delicious.  Nice work for a location trapped by offices

p5K8fSVtMvwtpdk0W-wYuQ.text: Drinks were good and reasonable....Meal was good but hate it when everything is a   "side."  Good Steak but was disappointed in the chile mac'n'cheese.  Good service and a nice place.

BUvJW76VDdyo5fbkiV7EYA.text: Everyone I knew spoke so highly of the Roaring Fork that I couldn't wait to get to Arizona and try it out. Needless to say I was disappointed. The atmosphere of the restaurant is very unique and different and has a mountain type vibe to the decor. The place is always packed and we couldn't get in until about 830 on a Sunday night.   The food is overpriced to say the least. Side dishes are all $7 and the french fries were a disgrace. The menu was limited but did feature a wide array of fish.   The friend chicken was dry and tasted like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for a good amount of time. The braised ribs were average and a little went a long way. The sides overall were horrid and the service was shotty to say the least.   The banana desert was a home run! One of the best desserts I have ever had and I highly recommend it!   I may give the Roaring Fork another shot if I am in town again because of the dessert. Maybe I ordered the wrong dishes, who knows.

0ox4yzIwbCM11TC4B13l_A.text: Yelp guided us to another yummy dinner in AZ. We tried to find a place that would have some delicious and yet sensible options and just could not get past the good reviews and a few of the OH SO GOOD sounding menu options. We both knew what we were going to order before we even left the hotel.   This place in is an office building complex off Goldwater and Scottsdale Blvd. Our GPS took us a funny route, but we avoided all the craziness of a Friday night in downtown Scottsdale. We did make a reservation, and glad we did, as it was quite crowded inside and out when we arrived. The patio is first come first served, so that could have been an option. It was a little chilly, and the patio was full, so we waited about 5 minutes from our arrival to be seated inside.   The menu looked great. Some rather creative dishes with a southern/comfort food type flare. Lots of pulled meats and ribs and spices. YUM. I had already chosen a dish based on reviewers comments, but the menu did look so appetizing that I was tempted to change. Instead, I just added a Waldorf chicken salad to my order to go with the green Chile Pork appetizer. SG was not swayed by the menu, though he did agree that lots of items looked great. He ordered the Dr Pepper BBQ sauce Rack of Ribs. These are country style and the meat literally falls off the bone.   We were quickly brought out some sweet warm rolls with butter and a chipotle butter spread. Creative for sure. The rolls were so fresh and tasty. The Green Chile Pork came out first in the coolest little cast iron kettle. It was served with tortillas, though I do not think it needed them at all. We each had some and saved some to have the next day. WOW, delicious. A little spicy. Very tender and just good. I could have had only this and been perfectly content. (Once I put this aside a server came and offered to box it up for us, talk about on the ball!)   The main courses came, ironically the salad for me and the ribs for SG. Everything looked great. The server/kitchen took extra special care to put things on the side for me, which I really appreciate. My Waldorf was great. It had egg, mixed lettuces, dates, apples, grapes, and huge pieces of pulled chicken breast. The onion dressing was the perfect addition to this salad and it was just great. SG found that the meat was very fatty and spent a great deal of time cutting off the fat. This is understandable on ribs, but a bit frustrating when almost half the meat is fat. The sauce also was not as Dr Peppery as he had hoped, but still good. The meat was very tender and quite good, but for $25, he thought it could be better.   Overall this place is a 4+, not quite a 5. The service was excellent. The staff is very helpful and great. The owner even came by to make sure everything was to our liking. Nice touch. There are lots of restaurants to try in the area, but we would definitely come here again. Make sure to make a reservation (especially during spring training.)

DBIiyTP3CDSOArjy-QMX9Q.text: Checked it out for Happy Hour yesterday.  Get there early because it gets packed!  We managed to swipe a table in the back.    Good service!  Margaritas were tasty and cheap.  The Big Ass Burger is BIG.  I don't think I could finish it on my own, and I am a burger guy!  We split it in quarters and shared it.  It was delish!  What else?  The pork stew thing was my favorite and the Lamb Chop fondue dish was decadent!  I would say it is a bit more pricey than most Happy Hours, but then again, the quality is pretty high!  The crowd was a little more...  conservative than I normally like but all good right?

M3ffxyiDEAN73kBaHe4BMw.text: Do try the Green Chili Mac and Cheese! Its life changing...

W8SoXisR1caMntWLsGQkvw.text: Awesome...happy hour with my fellow gals from Texaz Grill.....and Robert took such great care of us!  Kudos for Robert!   Fork needs to give him a raise!  Will be back!

-0BVNKeT_duFk6KnVRX6sQ.text: This was by far the best meal I had in Scottsdale. The service was excellent and the food was delicious. Our table had salads, the scallop appetizer, trout, shrimp and the swordfish special. And of course, the green chile mac & cheese and the asparagus sides. There was not a complaint among us -- and we're a picky group. Everything was cooked to perfection and the flavors were amazing together. We had notning bad to say about this restaurant!   The server recommended terrific wines and was knowledgeable and attentive.   I will absolutely go back to this restaurant when I'm in town again. It was a great experience.

c-LLfY5PHLPIwWyoASSefg.text: Amazing service! The food me and my Party tried was outstanding! No complaints. Plus it is a beautiful environment inside the place and also outside in the patio. Will definitely return.

AfO9b1xOnqupU_18z_-BeA.text: Happy hours here are the best. Always busy but always attentive service. Their burger is massive and very fresh, while only being 10 bucks. Fish tacos and chicken flatbread are also superb. Drinks are great as well, even as a 'bourbon and beer sort of guy', I still enjoyed the huckleberry margarita. Certainly a great spot, just be sure to get there early for happy hour as seating can be a challenge.

ZJa2a7HJM1DX13_DVf1Bbw.text: Myself and my husband absolutely love this place.   My husband does a lot of business dinners and always suggests this place for the dinners.   We have eaten here a lot and have had excellent feedback with each visit. You won't go wrong bringing a date, business partner, client, parent etc... You can be dressed up or in a nice pair of jeans and fit in just right.

IIbLAi77OCduOPbVTNBxtg.text: I believe I got a very good facial from the misters at Roaring Fork.  My hair also got a little frizzy and my date walked out with literally wet shoulders.  Out of control!!  TURN DOWN YOUR MISTERS!!    Whew ok.    My mister rant was the only issue I had with Roaring Fork at all.  Aside from being slightly damp when we left, our overall experience there was great.  We sat outside on the patio which is decorated pretty cool, white lights line the trees, etc.    My date had the tortilla soup, which he raved about, and a chef's special, lamb.  He loved everything including Moose Drool beer which not a lot of restaurants serve.  I had the salmon with mushrooms which was perfect.    Great food and service, nice atmosphere.  Reservations recommended, we had them and had absolutely not trouble being seated.  Good date spot.

oLamBBbAhkjYawE8QxBM1g.text: This is my favorite restaurant of all. I travel extensively and eat out way too much. I love this place not only for the BEST happy hour...but for the consistent quality of food...not the greatest of gourmet food...do not desire gourmet food all the time...but SO good plain ass food. Love the wait staff also.

jGDAMrLSfqZt7i575lCnrQ.text: OMG...so this place is the place to go for happy hour...the bar is awesome and its alot of fun to go with friends...I absolutely love the mojitos...I love all three flavors the citrus, orange and the original.  I am just a mojito lover!   Okay and now there is the delicious food!  The reason you go with a group is so you order alot of the happy hour menu so you can try everything!  There is the guacamole, the queso dip and roasted tomato salsa.  Those two are great to eat with your first drink.  Then you should order the Fondue with the Lamb chops-DELICIOUS and maybe accompany that with the Kettle of Green Chile Pork with the tortillas!! OMG can you say heaven!!! It is just fabulous. Of course you should be enjoying this round with another drink!  Then for the last round you get the "Big Ass" Burger and the Crab Cake!  The burger is fabulous!  It is not my top but its definitely worth the mention and you cannot fault them for that because it is still delicious!  The crab cake is quality not just those typical cakes that are made of all bread and you cannot really tell if its a crab cake.  It is awesomel I like the chipotle butter!  Anyways, that is my suggestion and review of this fantastic restaurant!  I love it!  It is a great deal and the food is quality and fabulous!

C-5v7n8O5UAM-TBhuoQFjg.text: If you haven't been, you need to go. The food is amazing!! The best service... The happy hour is crazy good.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped pork tenderloin..

8lwGf-rO6ArU0XpqFNioAw.text: Am I the only person in the metro Scottsdale  area who doesn't think this place is the cats pajamas? There was no one there under the age of 55, walkers were more prominent than able bodies and the food was ehh. The $14 "big ass burger" I was hyped up about was ok, as were the fries, but nothing phenomenal. Maybe in 20+ years I'll head back with my titanium hip and love the place. Service was on point - extremely attentive and fast - crumb scraper and all.

n3hbehzq_Lut-rllTsihZA.text: Amaaaaaazzzing every time!!!!  4th  visit today.  Happy hour is ammmmmaaaaazzzing!!!!  I have had the chicken flat bread,  fish tacos,  and tonight  a special grit,  quacamole salsa cake that was a daily "special" !!! Those items are amazzzzzinggg !!!  Ingredients are fresh and the items are consistent every visit.  The huckleberry margarita is  amazzzzing every visit!!  The drinks are cheap during happy hour and definitely good!!!  Yeh!!  Best happy hour place in Scottsdale"!  My friend loves the "Big Ass Burger"!!

u-0QhnOYrAgPtWGa0VAhpg.text: Absolutely delicious and fresh food. Great service. Great prices.  We had the pork roast, buttermilk chicken, broccoli, pecan pie, and a few cocktails. Service was impeccable. Food was tasty and filling. The pork roast was cooked just right and was deliciously marinated.  I'm surprised I hadn't dined here before. We will definitely go back!

_xszTfB7bihvUhG_o5fdxQ.text: Happy hour is the way to go. I was really satisfied with this place and the patio is perfect. Note** You have to sit at the bar or patio for HH. If you want a good seat getting there at 4 p.m. when they open is recommended.   Their drinks and appetizers were amazing. I got a mojito and house margarita that were both tasty and they did not skimp on the alcohol. For appetizers the pork wings are delicious. The best thing I ate but was not on the HH menu was the Sugar-Cured Duck Breast I was in heaven. That whole dish was thoughtfully made and executed really well. Either I don't get out much or that was one of the best meals I've had, probably both. Also, the Green Chili Mac and Cheese here is a must and did I forget to mention come for happy hour?   I am definitely returning back here for the Big Ass Burger that is also on their HH menu which I've heard was awesome.

A19tJiVIplgObBaA9D6Wiw.text: My husband and I came here a while ago a few months after we moved to Scottsdale and we loved it. So just recently we decided to bring our kids and we also brought along my mom. We loved the restaraunt! The waitresses were nice, the food was great, and we had an enjoyable time here! I would definetly recommend this restaraunt as a special occasion restaraunt or coming here for some luxury!

dZGPLlIxj4HbEaLM2XuVlw.text: Fun atmosphere. We had a booth in front of the kitchen. The filet mignon was tender and so delicious!  The 1/2 chicken was good, but a little too salty. Our waitress, Amanda, was super friendly, and very attentive to my food restrictions.

Zk6-6oKowdZoD1-jYTjkEA.text: We go to the Roaring Fork often for Happy Hour.  It's always great.  A couple weeks ago we took our nieces visiting from Philadelphia for dinner.  The service and the food were excellent.  This is a favorite of ours.

LUoUOTWcEqikjEMXmlHnBQ.text: Come for the bar, stay for the food. The kitchen cooking area, while nice to observe is loud and the cooking staff are a bit verbally active with choice words, if you catch my drift. So, sit in the bar area. You can order from the discounted menu, or anything off the full menu as well. Cocktails are hit or miss, wouldn't recommend a margarita but the Manhattans are on point. Fondu was superb! Lastly, if you're looking for atmosphere, the motif here is great. Think wooded cabin meets modern industrial, however it's not too over the top and obvious in any stylized decorum that it feels forced or novel, instead classic. I'd suggest this as a great Father's Day or Dad's birthday spot.

mrag2XZ8t6MMsMQUav9vRA.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the ambiance of the restaurant, and the service was top notch!  The food was absolutely fabulous- ordered the date salad to start, the duck with Brussel sprouts for the main course, and the pecan pie.  OH, THE PECAN PIE- WOW!!!!  Everything a must!  Additionally, the wine list is very nice. I would highly recommend this restaurant!!!!

ieQFKgjj9Ls-vI3zdJ_FbQ.text: Pretty good! Went here with some colleagues on a business trip earlier this year. I wanted some thing that wasn't super spicy so I went with the Spinach Chicken Waldorf Salad. It was great with lots of flavor and variety of ingredients. Only $13 too, really good deal. I felt like I had eaten just the right amount of food & healthy food at that.  We were able to get a table for about 5 or so people on a Monday night, so I guess that's that time to go if you don't want to wait. Everyone else ordered steaks or fish and it all looked and smelled amazing, but I wanted to err on the side of caution since I have a bit of an unpredictable stomach and, well, it's not a great feeling to be sick on travel, ya know? If I ever came back here I would probably try the salmon or steak...unfff! Smelled so good!

2VK3w3KMYGbagtXF98kC_A.text: Been dining here every visit to Scottsdale the last several years. We've always enjoyed sitting outside or in the bar area for drinks and dinner. The drinks, the food and the service has typically been excellent. But our recent visit a few days ago was disappointing, and I'm concerned that this may be indicative of a overall decline in quality. Most tellingly, the "Big A** Burger"--a renowned specialty of this establishment--was not nearly what it has been in the past. My wife and I both ordered one and, almost simultaneously, complained to each other that the burger had the texture and taste of mediocre meat loaf. Very different  than in previous years; certainly no longer one of Scottsdale's best burgers. Beyond that, the salad I began with looked and tasted like it had been sitting too long in a refrigerator--and it was covered with scallions despite my emphasizing that I could not tolerate onions or scallions or the like, and despite the fact that scallions were nowhere mentioned on the menu. Enough said. I should note that the pecan pie desert was amazing, and the servers were wonderful and made our experience very pleasant notwithstanding the generally lowered quality of the food.

lwX5vL2OsY9qtfmvu4rZZQ.text: This place was a bit of a fancier American-style restaurant. Table cloths, multiple forks.... and DELICIOUS FOOD and greeat cocktails. My boyfriend got the boysenberry margharita and I just got the regular and both were made to perfection. He ordered the half chicken and green beans and potatoes which was just made so well, the chicken especially was really flaborful and juicy! He ate more than he usually does. Also I got the carnitas with a side of asparagus instead of buttered tortillas. Even though they did charge and extra $3.50 for 3 asparagus spears, all the food was amazing. The server, Amy, who helped us was a total doll as well. Kudos to her and the cooks. A great Birthday dinner!!  Oh and they hooked us up with an amazing deep fried banana-stuffed tortilla (that kinda tasted like a churro) and ice cream (to make a mexican bana split) and it was seriously the MOST yummy dessert I have had... maybe ever. Do not skimp on the dessert!!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

B1kA7dzfREC_JiLWtEj6og.text: Fantastic ambiance and service. Our server was kind and incredibly attentive. No glass was ever empty under her watch! The food was so delicious my mouth is watering just thinking about it.  Yummy gluten free options. Made for an enjoyable family dinner during the holidays. We can't wait to return and enjoy again very soon!

ffjTIDYCq4Mb-GZvBV5hwQ.text: Twas my first time - and I was really quite impressed.  When you get to the parking lot, you are not expecting to be impressed - but the layout / ambiance is quite impressive.  They have quite a large open area in the back as well as a cozy patio.  My only complaint was the men's bathroom was 100 yards away, but they're at the mercy of the building they're in.  For food we tried like five of the appetizers, I was impressed by all of them.  I loved everything I ate that night and even enjoyed a couple of their cocktails.  Truly it's a 4.5 due to the price, but I rounded up because I couldn't really find anything else I didn't enjoy.    Totally worth checking this place out, although I probably won't be back unless it's for happy hour.

oDA0HomNvFrhVb6rXpLraA.text: We will be back for Daryl!!!  He is a sweetheart and got to know us as a table. It was more than just a dining experience, we created a relationship during a busy happy hour

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mix them greens
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork wings
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish tacos on happy hour?

s0zLAq-9uCacFZTZ6Mseog.text: Overall our dinner experience here was excellent! We had a reservation and were seated right away (would have hoped for a better table, considering we did have a res, but it's all good). Atmosphere is nice - some cool SW decor, bright, and warm.  The food was delicious. I had the roasted duck breast - it was cooked to perfection, super juicy, with a  yummy mustard, cherry sauce. Mmmm, I am craving it now as I write this! My ceasar salad was the only thing that left something to be desired. I like a good, hearty dressing - since there isn't much else to a caesar salad - and this dressing just did not make the cut. Pretty watered down and lacked that umph. My husband had the mussels for an appetizer and the entire table was instantly filled with such a perfect aroma the moment they were set down in front of him. We each had a bite and loved every part of it! The sauce was so rich and delish! He had the chicken for dinner - another perfect sauce. One friend got the Trout - wow, this will be what I get next time!! It was cooked perfectly, super moist with the flavorful skin still on. Our other friend got the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and he was quite happy with it. The creme brulee was a delightful way to end the meal - not too sweet, super creamy, perfect!  The service was 4 stars. Our server wasn't super friendly, but was attentive enough. I would say it was fine. I think this is where Roaring Fork could have a better rating on Yelp - because the food is spot on, the service experience could be improved upon to create that perfect overall dining experience!

sZXqmVTe3WxjqoYmFR9Wnw.text: I've dined here twice and have been blown away each time. The first visit was with a colleague at work. He suggested that we drop by here for some Happy Hour drinks and some grub. The 2nd time was with a large group of 20 people. During both visits I had: Queso con Puerco, $9 yelp.com/biz_photos/roar... Fresh Guacamole, $9 Kettle of Green Chile Pork, $10 yelp.com/biz_photos/roar... Pork Wings (Dr. Pepper BBQ Sauce, Hominy, Pickled Vegetables, & Cotija Cheese), $12 yelp.com/biz_photos/roar... Big Ass Burger (Poblano Pepper, Cheddar, Smoked Pepper Bacon, Lettuce, Tomato, Onions, Pickles, & French Fries), $14 Filet Steak yelp.com/biz_photos/roar... The Queso con Puerco is melted Cheese with a green Chile Pork added to it. It's ridiculously good.....and addicting! Trust me, you won't stop eating it once you have a bite. The Guacamole is awesome too. However, I suggest that you give this a try before the Queso con Puerco so that you can taste the full flavor of the Guac. If you eat the Queso first, the sharp flavors will override the creamy, smooth, subtle flavors of the Guac. The Guac is outstanding and definitely a must have. The Kettle of Green Chile Pork is pretty good. It has similar flavors to the Queso, but without the Cheese. It comes with Tortillas for dipping, wrapping, stuffing, etc. The Pork Wings were awesome and very interesting. They look like a Chicken Wing at first glance, but then you realize it's a Pork Rib cooked/cut to look like a Wing, but much larger. These are full of flavor and a must have. The Big Ass Burger is big and sloppy. The Poblano Pepper and Smoked Pepper Bacon flavors are prominent and offer a unique taste....which is very good. Very difficult to take a bite of all layers at once...ha! The Filet has a smokey flavor to it. It was cooked perfectly and very satisfying. The service here is outstanding. Despite being very busy during both visits, we had impeccable service. Hats off to management and the staff. Return Factor - 100%
