OAdkWc7MoGh9LdT00toqWw.text: Let me start by saying the food was delicious and cooked to our liking. However, the portions were very small. Don't come here if you are looking for the "Hungryman" dinner. The service was where our family was greatly disappointed. We waited far too long to receive the next course (15+ minutes) and our waiter was no where to be found, never checking to see how we liked our dinner. My water glass set empty during half the meal until I snagged a busboy to fill it for me. I saw our waiter only once during the meal when he did a "flyby" through his serving area, not making eye contact with any of his tables. We waited and waited to order an after dinner beverage and when it was finally brought to the table, our waiter tried to leave both glasses with the closest person rather than distribute them accordingly. Our waiter shall go nameless here as I do not wish to humiliate openly on the web, but something was not quite right with this guy! Not just his absence, but his actions, speech, facial expressions and demeanor. I think that this establishment needs to reevaluate its hiring/training standards.

5MAub7krLlDxYSFdc7HkkQ.text: Been to location in North Austin .... this is just as good.  Great drinks, helpful waiter and phenomenal chicken flat bread.  Reasonable cost for the environment and treatment.  Food is outstanding and employees seem to care about what they do.  Rest room is a long jaunt but nothing is perfect.  Well worth the trip and your money.

EbNjWPiC4nKVipRhgookqw.text: I have only gotten to try a little piece of Roaring Fork but what I did have, I liked a lot.  I went there for happy hour.  They had a lot of options for happy hour.  I had the chicken pesto flatbread which was good, but was kinda missing the pesto part- it could use some more.  I also had the lamb which was very good.  The mojitos were amazing.  There are so many good things on the menu.  I will definetly come back for dinner soon.

-6K9AyRBQ30lXlwDLQCLyA.text: Burger was OK.  Didn't have anything else but a lot of the dishes looked gimmicky and some I would not even want to put in my mouth.  Take the three stars for what its worth.

aqORszxT7R4VOFK10KH-ww.text: We went for happy hour on a Friday at 6:30. Waited 12 minutes for a table  for four - not bad considering how crowded they were. The place was relaxing and accommodating (we had a disabled companion with us).  Our server was Shay and she was as good a waitress as I have ever had. Just the right combination of personable, helpful, efficient and not over-fawning. I would go back just to be in her section. Ask for her - you will not be disappointed! The food was fabulous. I had the Green Chile Pork Stew (on Shay's recommendation) and I now crave it. Hubby had the Big Ass burger which was just that. And while it was excellent, it could not be called a signature dish like mine. The tortilla soup was very good and surprising.  We enjoyed the salads as well. We all had the Guava Mojito which was quite good. Our dining companions raved about the Huckleberry Margaritas which they had on a previous visit so we are looking forward to trying them next time. I would like to try another dish but I suspect I will not be able to resist the pork stew. I highly recommend this restaurant and it is now at the top of our list of relaxed, delicious, reasonably priced happy hour spots in Scottsdale. We WILL be back!

HWtCWOVHvNMl6iwq3SQKyw.text: We've been visiting RF for the last 12 years. Over the last 4 years there has been a noticeable drop in the quality of the food and service. Tonight was the last straw for us. Our waiter was non-existent. Dirty plates took forever to be removed and the food was served luke warm.  This used to be one of our "go to" restaurants in Scottsdale, not anymore.

g5DYGAAUbLwBD6QmFgLSxw.text: Food was good but not spectacular. Nothing really stood out, everything was a little bland and mild. (Especially mild given the ingredients and southwestern theme.) Frankly, I was a little disappointed, given some of the terrific reviews. Service was excellent and the atmosphere was fun with a good buzz. Would come back with a group to have fun but not for the food.

vs8l7wYkTZQOg1CXrnagsQ.text: I do not get it Yelp! I was so mislead by this place. I took the BF here for his *official* birthday dinner and it was a massive disappointment. The menu looks really good and the restaurant looks ok... kind of big and Houston's -ish. We were sat at one of the 'chef's tables' a table right next to the kitchen. That was kind of cool.. lots of yelling. Our server was really not good, he was extremely slow and inattentive. It took him a long time to come around, and when he did he only wanted to take drink orders. We wanted to drink water, and he didn't seem too happy with that. He walked off. Anyway, we finally ordered and I got the fried chicken and the BF got the short ribs (which he was really excited for) and we got the green chili mac and cheese due to the good reviews of it. Then we waited for a very long time. When the food came out, mine had a sauce on it that was congealed and looked really gross. The chicken itself was nothing special.... they used a really thick cut boneless breast and it was really dry. The mashed potatoes that came with it tasted like nothing.... totally flavorless. ugh. The BF's short ribs were also very meh. They were bone in (really? they couldn't take the bone out for 25$ hmmm). They also didn't render all of the fat so they had massive amounts of fat on them. Yuck. In addition, they had very little flavor... you would think something braised in Dr. Pepper would be delicious... not the case. Again, it was totally bland. Furthermore, the mac and cheese was really not good either. The first bite tasted ok, but as it went on, it tasted like kraft singles with chile peppers. yum? not so much. So we wanted to get cake, it being the BF's birthday and all.... but nothing on the dessert menu looked very good and honestly we were scared to get a dessert after the food being so lackluster. I will never go back here.

74rza9C-OLHUB4N9qHBF3Q.text: Roaring Fork offers a more rustic feel for the bold American cuisine.  The dim lights created a warm and inviting atmosphere to the cool evening.  But there was still enough light to view the food that I was served.  I opted for Frying Pan River Rainbow Trout.  The trout is sauteed with roasted almonds, capers and brown butter creating a delectable combination for the palate.   The fish was flakey that melted in my mouth.  The slight crust on top created a wonderful contrast to the soft fish.  A squeeze of lemon actually added to the flavor as well to the saltiness of the fish.  The taste was light yet strong as the same time.  The almonds added to the crunchy taste like the crust on top of the fish.  Along with the fish was a piece of cornbread made with real corn.  I could taste the corn chucks in the bread.  It had a slight sweet taste to contrast the fish's flavors.  But it didn't overpower the fish.  The whole dish had so many textures and flavors that made me jump with delight.  My tummy was happy.   Of all the great things I have to say about the dish, I would still say that it lacked "specialness" to it that would make the dish and the restaurant shine and stand out from the others.

_tYyoBTK98N6P6M7Ht45Pg.text: I've been here several times, both for pleasure and for business.  Never disappoints.  As my friend Gabi mentioned, the Happy Hour is still excellent.  The food is very good, and the wait staff has never been less than excellent.

F9i84OkNhJRlZwA-WLZ4og.text: I was taken to Roaring Fork for a business dinner while in Arizona.  I liked the ambiance, the service was excellent, the food was very good and I would go back when in Scottsdale again.

jDZShKoyJwRMiPMYOy8kFg.text: Yummy steaks, great atmosphere, good wine list.  All around great!  It was a bit rowdy but it was fun.

wkXF6CoanOdnoJygabKnkA.text: We've dined at Roaring Fork twice since my last review. Both times the food was excellent and the service fabulous. Extra points for serving Mercenary IPA.  Will go again!

qY91tkxbn7dUcgEuX6NOyg.text: The Green chile mac and cheese was incredible! Everything is fresh and so delicious!  Husband had the half chicken and raved about the corn stuffing. All their ingredients have a southern flair but not as greasy! Def recommend!

UIxr5GXD5VN3IqN6ejZcZQ.text: My friends wanted to eat "Southwest cuisine," so I Yelped and the Roaring Fork came up. The reviews were good, so we gave it a try.  EXCELLENT service at the bar (there were no tables available at 7pm on Thursday night).  Waiter and staff were prompt and knowledgeable, and willing to make recommendations.  I had the soup - was ok, not something I'd order again, but I wasn't that hungry.  Husband had prime rib and pronounced it among the best pieces of meat he'd ever consumed (this is no small compliment).  Friends split the Big Ass Burger (making it a "half ass burger"?) and pronounced it excellent.  We were very satisfied with our meal and the service. We didn't eat enough or spend enough time to warrant a 5-star, but I would definitely recommend to friends.

HodS_iqot3XoOln77zQDOQ.text: All time favorite restaurant so far in Scottsdale! I have been 3 times and never been disappointed! Make sure you make a reservation, there is a reason this place is always packed! Everything I have tried has been absolutely mouthwateringly delicious! Honestly they have the best taste to their food! You cannot go wrong with steak very tender, juicy and full of flavor! I had asparagus with the steak that was delicious! Another time I had the trout which was to die for. I wanted to lick my plate! I have also sampled: cedar planked salmon, scallops, duck and carnitas - all of which were absolutely delicious! This is our go to restaurant for any visitors and special occasions. Don't read anymore, just go!

7ja6sCCLWSLVy52SmIcJ6A.text: The service was fantastic at this place along with the food.  Very friendly atmosphere and very quick about our orders.  However, they had specials that I wish the waiter would have told me the prices about.  For two of us, my bill came out to be a hundred dollars.

bXegRCnRCYJiETQfaOuxBw.text: Amazing green pork chili appetizer!  Amazing green chili Mac & cheese, picky about Mac & cheese! Waitress was very knowledgable. I'll be back soon

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. So dam good!

q4YPfUk3JBlqtqFEsolerA.text: Excellent happy hour! I wish it went a little bit later on weekdays. Flat bread was delicious as was my cocktail. Very relaxing patio and love that it's a little further out from the craziness that can be downtown Scottsdale

TXmE2vRGrnZUsrU3abdREw.text: The food was excellent ... the service not so much.   A colleague and I took one of my clients here for a business dinner. The atmosphere was great, the food was outstanding but the service was embarrassing.   It was a fun, Arizona type feeling restaurant and made quite the difference for my clients who are originally from Scotland.   I had the roasted shrimp and grits. The grits were the best I have ever had (sorry North Carolina!). The shrimp portion was amazing. The dessert was great. I was surprised to see the offering of huckleberries.   Sadly, the server forgot quite a bit of things. My client's wife ordered a second glass of wine to have for dinner, which was forgotten. We also asked for corn bread - the server forgot and brought it with our dessert. He tried to explain that it is made fresh to order and that is why it took so long.

isbTBHLva3JbifbQHe7LrA.text: Really, really good food with slow service. I'm torn between 3.5 stars and 4 for this. I would have given higher marks if service was better. I would go back. They had a cool outside patio with a fountain and heaters which would be cool to try on a cool night.  Food - Lamb shank was cooked perfectly. Good sized portion with tasty sauce. Others had roasted chicken and grilled trout which was really good as well  Service - Waitress took 5 mins to first greet us. And it took 10 mins to get my first drink, which she got wrong at first and had to correct. I ordered the grilled vegetables which she said was zuchinni and squash. But it was broccolini when it came. Instead of apologizing, she laughed and said "oh I lied, its not zuchinni".    Perhaps next time, I'll get a better server

yxhqpjfwXjSye0bOcYHTMQ.text: Fantastic place! Get here early. Great ambiance,good vibes all around, no problems at all! The weird thing is that they didn't have salsa.

HWsf1VTGN1eVjglB66pZ6A.text: Salty as hell but so yummy! Every year we come for the pork chili, tortilla soup and huckleberry margaritas! Nice service.

SOcrMIbXwYVeoAMjyvc4dQ.text: I was in Scottsdale on business and this was a great find for happy hour. The pork in a kettle is awesome, a must try along with the crabcake. Nice people sitting at the bar..... The place is in the corner of an office building and easy to pass by.

8Fxx23hj9qMnyKa-Ti3wJg.text: Roaring fork has a great happy hour.  I really liked the huckleberry margarita.  I did try the "big ass burger" because so many people have told me that I have to try it.  I actually wasn't impressed.  I would probably come back with friends for happy hour but I don't think I would take visiting guests here for dinner.  The restaurant is really nice and seems cozy.

pbDQDTh6FTh-joKEwuuFrg.text: Loved it. Beautiful atmosphere, wonderful attentive staff. Our waiter Derek was awesome. Had the chef special Cioppino and mom had fish tacos. Will definitely be back many times

32tXCembt27kElWwMm3IaA.text: The receptionist claimed she didn't have my reservation, despite my email confirmation. They had no place settings so the receptionist threw them together at the table, setting the silverware on directly on the table to do so (a no-no). We were not brought menus. Twenty minutes went by and they still had not taken even a drink order (though a busser had brought bread). My date had to go inside and ask for service. When my parents arrived they suddenly found my reservation, and the receptionist told them I had not arrived yet (which I had)! As a result, they had to search all over the restaurant to find us. They finally took our drink order and a bit later actually delivered us menus! The food was adequate and overpriced for the quality. Would not go back.

uBXPB5dj-sgGe-rAwKWl1w.text: I have heard a lot of solid things over the last few years. Things about Eddie V and Roaring Fork. Always forget to try it out, well we went last night and the food was better than expected. Great variety of dishes, prices are fair. Great Staff.  Id give 4.5/5 if that was an option

AKg9uZihEvuMBna0cvCwLw.text: Just enjoyed a wonderful dinner with friends to celebrate a birthday. The atmosphere was very nice as was the staff. Highly recommend the buttermilk chicken.

nJnfwatwmtvycGWdSDBSfw.text: LOVE! DINNER AND HAPPY HOUR = AMAZING!  I took my dad here for his birthday dinner and they absolutely spoiled us with a card and dessert! My dad and I had the best time. We actually enjoyed sitting next to the kitchen, usually sitting next to a kitchen turns me off, although we were drooling over all of the delicious looking food coming out the kitchen. It helped us decide what we wanted to eat!!  THEN because I loved Roaring Fork so much, my boyfriend and I decided to come in for happy hour about a week later and had the grilled fish tacos with some wine and their Huckleberry Frozen Margarita! MMM! Usually I'm not a fan of frozen margs, although this frozen marg was AMAZING! Still drooling over it.   Definitely come in for a great time for a dinner or even just for happy hour! You won't be let down!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Look at that Huckleberry Frozen Margarita and glass of wine! Oh, and the grilled fish tacos! YES PLEASE!

ZxKF7idMQxn_zS75pqrB8Q.text: Highly recommend making a reservation especially on the weekends.  Nice atmosphere with a great bar and bartenders.  Diverse menu with great steaks, chops and fish selections.  Highly recommend the mussels as an appetizer.  Very friendly and professional staff from the hostess stand to the support staff and Steve our server was great.  Nice Bourbon choices too!

mCnPOU_bZ3q-P58RR86Otw.text: Went here for a work dinner and no one at the table had anything but positive comments.  The menu had something for everyone so you are covered.  The ambience is very nice without being stuffy.  If you need to please a group of eaters this is your destination.

gP0HfuaTPw0qhJ5VKbY7cw.text: Great happy hour food. Drinks a bit high for happy hour prices. I had the green Chile appetizer. Plenty for four or five!  Wonderful chunks of meat. Probably 80% meat not quite enough Chile sauce.  Comes with tortillas could use some chips too. Extremely tasty not too spicy but a great start for any meal. My beer was icy cold and fine. Big ass burger huge and fabulous.  They cook rate if you want. Go for happy hour prices much better and portions still big enough. Atmosphere nothing special (middle aged snobby Scottsdale crowd) but worth going.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

UOvQXXZBrdkefHoE6eQEsA.text: Love happy hour pricing, can't go wrong with a Big Ass Burger. HuckleBerry Margarita is great

N1ml1cuQ0svPZB22EFpslg.text: Took the group here on a Saturday night. Everyone raved about their steaks and the service was too notch.

xb1j7TU7T2jsZAqIqQanPQ.text: Fantastic meal. I had a business dinner here on a weeknight.  Our sever was fantastic; helpful, attentive and patient.  She help guide us through the menu and recommended a few items based on our tastes.  I ended up having the southern fried chicken, which was absolutely outstanding.  not something you would want to have every night of the week, but fantastic for that special occasion.  A colleague had the petit fillet, which he said was also outrageous, cooked perfectly and seasoned nicely.  All in all it was a great meal with great service.  I will return.

g5tyIWNifUmZk_d7-UiBBw.text: Wonderful atmosphere, wait staff was very polite, outdoor seating area looked great. We sat in the bar and found that to be very comfortable. Food was good, did have the blackened red fish, great texture, nice presentation, would have liked a little more flavor being it was blackened though. Otherwise a very nice experience.

AKKH6Fc4BcrUbS7_sk8wNw.text: We went here a few days ago! The drinks were on point! I got a filet and it was so good! This pls e was definitely packed. You're better off making a reservation. I'd definitely recommend Roaring Fork!

S8thop5yFbD1z___t0uIQA.text: We were visiting Scottsdale and we looked on yelp for a place to eat.  We chose Roaring fork and it was delicious!!!  I think most nights, you need reservations but we showed up early Sunday evening and was able to get a table.  We loved the bread basket they give, the pork tenderloin wrapped in bacon with grits and Mexican corn, my son loved his kid's hamburger, salad with rotisserie chicken, the cheesecake and pecan pie.  And to top it off, service was excellent!    We are back home and we are still talking about how good the food was at Roaring Fork!

jAcNUwd6G5pBk0InNaMN8g.text: Always an enjoyable experience here.  Food is consistently good, drinks are generously poured and service is top-notch.  Great happy hour!

WUpteqYEa_SOmSX5f_I6kg.text: This restaurant is always consistently great.  Their beef has an incredible flavor and the wait staff couldn't be more pleasant and helpful.  The Big Ass burger has to be the best burger in the country.  My husband is handicapped and they seat us quickly (we make reservations) or move a chair for him to sit on if a booth isn't ready.

JRdQmEfIChwpleyfiS2AAw.text: I have to say this place was fantastic.   Atmosphere: This place reminds me or a country club. It feels old school dining with new menu items. I loved the feel of this place. I sat at the bar for happy hour and was wearing jeans. I did not feel out or place but almost everyone was wearing slacks  Food: So good. I had Duck Breast cooked perfect with a cabbage side that was amazing. Serious I would kill donald if it meant I could be served this duck breast again.   Dessert: I had pecan pie with ice cream. Both were made in house and my God kiss that cook. My grandma would weep for the deliciousness of this Pecan pie.   Drinks: I had a 5$ jim beam old fashioned that was pretty good with a glass of Bone breaker Zin from Lodi region. I found a new wine man was it good. I actually Google it to send a case home. I love me some lodi wines   Service: I had Chris the bartender and he was fantastic. Ask for him. An old soul who is nice and delivers perfect service

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pecan pie homeade with ice cream OMG that was good
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Duck breast wirh a cherry reduction

368yfVM1hdY0aOOppm0EhQ.text: The tortilla soup appetizer had a great presentation. Wife and I split a 32oz Tomahawk steak. It was excellent, done perfectly! It came with one of the best sides I've had ever, crab mac n cheese!   Warm pecan pie desert was to die for with the ice cream it was paired perfectly. I need to get the flavor of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 32oz Tomahawk... It Was awesome!
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

c9-hDVydv-ePTa-VTiwtLg.text: If you come for nothing else, come for the Big Ass Burger during HH. Phoenix has been a huge disappointment for me as far as burgers go however the RF saved the day. 12 oz of pure bliss for only 10$! Coming from a gourmet restaurant I had high expectations & was not disappointed. I only finished it because I don't stop eating until a hate myself. next time I have to see if they can add a fried egg & avo to seal the deal as the best burger in Phoenix. Only 4 stars because it took like 10 minutes just to be greeted when the place was dead. otherwise Blaire was fantastic.

-Urf5BAC8o13TxWzjZ7q_w.text: Heck with the bill, Fork is awesome!    Our table had salmon and trout, and all were extraordinary. I think sometimes fish has to be fried or heavily seasoned to be super tasty.  I make blackened fish at home with my own seasoning recipe, and it's a wonder there's anything recognizable under all those herbs.  Fork accomplished the opposite--huge wonderful flavor and taste without frying or overwhelming the trout.    Plus they put a single perfectly HUGE ice cube in my whiskey. What is nom nom for whiskey? Until I figure that out, "I'll have another" will have to suffice.

cGwlmRg36zyCS4e1p3nxKg.text: Would definitely go back and try more things on the menu.   Meats cooked perfectly.  Lots of flavor and seasoning.   Had a braised short rib with a pepper demi. It was really good.... The surprise of the evening was the mash..... Love the horseradish in the mash! So good, such a nice contrast to the rest of the plate.   I took off one star for two things: 1) cold creme brulee, I prefer it a bit warm... Eh to each his own.  2)Caesar salad as tangy but so blah.  Like buffet line salad.  Croutons were homemade but they were burned. Then the romaine was cut gigantic. Had to use my butter knife.  Disappointing because it's meant for butter, just like steak knife is for steak.... Didn't see a salad knife on the table nor expect to need one.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

s0701v-1EBh9s3vYdbTawA.text: Wow, the summer happy hour here is amazing! We heard a ton of great things about roaring fork so we definitely wanted to try it out. We got there around 6PM and just had to wait a minute or two before someone at the bar area got up and left. Our server was excellent and very kind to us! I highly recommend the queso and chips - I'm originally from Texas so I must say this is an awesome place to get good queso!   My husband had the fish tacos and I had the BBQ brisket sliders. Both were phenomenal and we would get them again!   Drinks: I had the huckleberry marg- YUM!! and mojito- good but not great!   We will definitely be back here for another happy hour really soon!

4-TBtrMkwccaJJ-1BMTz_g.text: We have been here several times. The food is consistently delicious and the staff is always friendly. Last night, New Year's Eve, there was s delay in the availability of our table. The manager, Matthew, was apologetic and graciously provided complimentary appetizers for our party of eight. This is just one classy restaurant and we always enjoy going there.

n0obINpITkEQAIOkCgOhxA.text: Really nice service; our waiter knew EVERYTHING on a very large menu.  Although the Caesar Salad was pretty mediocre, the bacon-wrapped pork tenderloin and the pork chop were both absolutely delicious.  The kids menu was unbelievably inexpensive for the portion size and my kids were happy, despite being the only kids in the place. Based on the reviews, we ordered the pecan pie, but were underwhelmed.  The crust was thick and chewy, the chocolate was not a good add and the pie was more luke-warm than warm; the ice cream was actually the best thing on the plate. Summary: go for the meat!

qXjJz7aiZJT07PKAoPiafg.text: This place is amazing everything is Delicious from the burgers the salads happy hour is amazing I only wish I had more money to visit more often a little pricey definitely worth the money

bSYKmmZPIRoldiufzEMheg.text: I was in town for work and had a really good experience at Roaring Fork. The atmosphere is definitely a steak house vibe with a lot of wood and low-lighting, which is a vibe I really love. I was seated in a booth for two right by the kitchen (which would have been distracting had I not been alone, but since I was alone, made for great entertainment while I was eating).  My waitress, April, was lovely. They start with a basket of bread that has french bread and little muffins that I believed were jalapeno corn muffins and a side of whipped butter. The bread was hot and delicious. I also ordered a glass of cab, which April advised was the driest and it was perfect.  For my main, I was between two dishes and April helped me decide by letting me know they do individual portions of the sides and that I could get the horseradish mashed potatoes that normally come with the short ribs with the filet I wanted to order. I ordered the filet medium rare and it came out rare (which for me is a very pleasant surprise because I prefer it rare but never order it that way since most restaurants cannot seem to get it right). The steak was very good, could have used a little more seasoning, but was cooked perfectly and was very tender. The horseradish mashed potatoes were SPICY. I liked them, but could only eat so much before my throat started to burn.   Finally, the star of the show: the pecan pie. Wow. I am not normally a fan of pecan pie but a lot of reviews mentioned it so I figured I would give it a try. It was awesome. They serve it warm and covered in chocolate chips. It comes with ice cream too but I was too full to eat that without sacrificing a bite of the pecan pie. If you go here, order this no matter what. Simply fabulous.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dptLdRWrlZxMQfhv-0r6mA.text: This place has an amazing happy hour. We got to the restaurant a little after 5 on a Friday and there was no place in the bar area, the extended bar area (by the front door-which was new since we last visited) or the outside patio that is part of the door so we were seated in the patio area where you can't get the happy hour menu. We would have loved to enjoy the happy hour menu but that wasn't going to happen.   With that said, we had great service and a very good meal. We both ordered cocktails and they were well made and fairly priced. We also both ordered the bacon wrapped pork loin over grits served with Mexican street corn and a balsamic glaze. I subbed the green chile mac and cheese for the grits which required an upcharge of $2.50. I gladly agreed to the upcharge because the green chile mac and cheese is one of my favorites here. It is served in a small cast iron skillet with toasted bread crumbs on top. It is not spicy and is well flavored. We each ate about half our meal which was a large portion and a shame because we were headed to the airport so couldn't take it with us. When you arrive, you get a bread basket with freshly baked rolls and mini corn muffins. I have been here many times before and never had a bad meal.   Again, the happy hour is awesome but get there early----it fills up.

6Er5ydHieJUD5npjIheovQ.text: Appetizers were amazing, my salmon was a little too sweet for me but still good. Service was good, she wasn't friendly, but not rude either. Overall experience was great.

SN1jPmLrHalgGVeMCGANXw.text: I had high expectations of this place based on reviews. I have to say the food was very disappointing.  We had a party of 6 and didn't have reservations so instead of wait we sat in the "bar/side area."   The service there was spectacular! I'd give 10 stars for service. Our waitress was beyond amazing, attentive, friendly, and helpful.  This was during restaurant week but we didn't realize it. The waitress suggested that menu as it would only be available for a few more days. We started with various appetizers and also each had the chicken soup. The soup looked incredible but was very bland and disappointing.  The short ribs again looked fabulous but were full of non rendered fat. The sea bass was okay, but not much flavor. I really expected a lot more from the food. The cocktails were good, so that helped.  All in all this was decent, but not really worth the cost.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

pPdthbzEYg1nSua0AYZVRg.text: Still a great place for happy hour.   Went with a group; I had not been there in a few months.    The bartender was fast and efficient in getting the drinks out.   The happy hour huckleberry frozen margarita was the best.   I am thinking it has chambord in it but maybe not.    They still have the big ass burger with fries.   I see the HH price has been adjusted to $10.   Last  I was there it was $6.   Still a good deal.  I had the rotisserie chicken flatbread pizza.   Since I am not a fan of bread, I had tasted it, and the crust is like a cracker, which is perfect.   The topping is what makes it, of course.   It wasn't soggy; the chicken was flavored and cooked perfectly, and it had a good mix of whatever cheeses and herbs and spices.   The price was right as well, only $8.  Yepp.   I'm definitely returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. rotisserie chicken flatbread pizza

vIScY-wMPyqQAeONdtot7w.text: What started off as a great 19th anniversary dinner, quickly snowballed into the wife and I questioning what the heck are we doing here?  Was seated in the (almost) back corner of the dining room and when the bus boy went to reset the tables and chairs back to normal (after a large party just left), he closed a floor-to-ceiling curtain that rested against my chair...um no, I was not sitting here. When I told the staff that I didn't like having a huge curtain wall brushing up against me causing claustrophobia while I ate, they couldn't understand why I wanted it open (see pix) and opened it back up amid some protest. Note, this all transpired while the wife was in the bathroom. As my wife got back to the table, she said she overheard the staff complaining in another language (a language my wife is fluent in) about some guy's gripe about the curtain being closed...that guy being me.  As for the food, the complimentary bread was better than most free bread at sit-down restaurants...two types were in the basket, one of which was a slightly spicy jalapeno bread. The guacamole and tortilla chips appetizer we ordered was a nice compliment to the jalapeno bread.  For the main course, I opted for the "special," which is a printed insert located in inside the menu. For $55 bucks, I got to choose a 3-course meal: an appetizer, main course and desert. For the appetizer, I selected the tortilla soup, which had a dark and rich broth with the rest of the components (chicken, avocado, cheese, cilantro and tortilla strips) scooped into the center of the bowl. And while the broth was perfect, the appetizer would have tasted  much better had all the components had been cooked together to allow all those wonderful flavors to mix together. While the presentation was a perfect 10 (see pix), all of the components lacked a cohesiveness which could have made the soup a perfect 10 as well!  I ordered the 16oz Delmonico Rib eye steak and was disappointed from the first bite. According to the waitress, all the steaks are cut in-house, including mine. Whoever cut my steak must've been their first day on the job because my steak seriously looked like and had the texture of London broil (see pix). There was no marbling whatsoever, only a small strip of fat on the end. To compound a felony, the steak knife I received, was dull and literally could not cut the steak. I kid you not, my butter knife had a more serrated edge and did a better job of cutting thru the meat.  Long story short, the waitress allowed me to switch things up and recommended I try the "Big @$$" burger, which was one of the better burgers I've had. And while the waitress allowed me to go from a $55 plate to a $15 plate, they still charged me $9 for the first course tortilla soup which (while fair) was a bit of a cheap shot and did nothing to rectify the situation. On a side note, I guess I can't complain too much as we did score a free desert because it was our anniversary.  One other minor complaints is that for as upscale and romantic as other Yelper's say this place is, there is a lot of alcohol flowing and some of the patrons were a bit obnoxious (drunk) and kind of killed the romantic flair of this joint.  Will definitely go back and give this place another shot, but will be sure to first do our research before placing an order.

Q2ngJry3LcrpML0q81Otpg.text: One of the best happy hours in Scottsdale.   Older crowd and gets super crowded so dont  expect to saddle up to the bar easily during that time.  Finally had full dinner service again after a year or so and forgot how delicious the food is. Portions are large, drinks are tasty.  Nice to have a couple of fish options for this pescetarian.   Our service was good and the place was packed.  Definitely worth a stop in for a special occasion meal (moderately pricey menu) or happy hour treat.

TRo6VNDboAOe1pNgfNuTGA.text: Another awesome meal here. Lamb chop fondue is the most indulgent premise - perfectly cooked frenched lamb chops dipped in seasoned molten cheese.  Mmmmmmmm.   Always great service. Great value wine list. Perfect cocktails.

br8cPlv0031qISbQpTNk8Q.text: Amazing Happy Hour!!!   Huge selection.  Try the Big Burger ...Boo loved the Cheese Dip and o thought the salad was great.   Phenomenal prices mean the folk of a certain age flock there...so seating is a hassle.    It's offered all day on Monday, so wait until about 6 and they're in their way to bed

Tlx6WwIJ8lcrj2i-vCyoYQ.text: Great 3-course meal with Ceasar Salad, aged bacon-wrapped filet, and a Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee dessert. Little pricey, but the quality truly reflects the price. I ordered the filet medium and it was borderline medium-well...so I would suggest medium rare...  I would highly recommend the dessert though - definitely a highlight of the meal!

31WM8A2JSMWnz-Aw9XrOgA.text: Our friends came here a few years ago and were SUPER excited to bring us. The food is pretty good, depending on what you order. Any steak will be 2 levels less cooked than what you ask for. My sirloin strip salad (ordered medium) was literally bleeding on the lettuce. I'm not kidding. The real problem here, though, is the service. It's horrendous. The wait staff will refill water ONLY if you ask for it and then only half the glasses on the table. Remember my salad? We had six people who were waving and shouting at literally ALL the wait staff and couldn't get anyone to come to our table. It's very loud and they are all oblivious. By the time we got someone to ask about cooking the steak more, our whole table was finished eating. That tells you, through an entire meal, nobody came to check on the food or drinks, or anything.  They did eventually bring a new salad (steak still undercooked) and the horseradish salad dressing is great. But we will never go back.

U2S70Tmi8TT2kTZRAOpYFQ.text: I have been going to The Roaring Fork Restaurant in Scottsdale, AZ for over 20 years.  I bring friends & family there on a regular basis. I'm a highly educated woman 64 years old, certified teacher.  I was approached yesterday by one of the male managers & he accused me of throwing alot of food on the floor at the bar the weekend prior.  I would never throw food on the floor.  I was Falsely accused, he threw my money at me & forced me to leave & told me not to come back.  I was blatantly discrimination against since I was alone & am a woman. His reaction was inappropriate, unprofessional & intimidating.  I felt like he was going to strike me! This happened during Happy Hour  in the bar area when it was crowded, full of patrons.  I was totally humiliated & embarrassed & Falsely accused.  Rating a 1 because they have great Margarita's!

KWTzO-DwZHDD6falFoqMkQ.text: This review is just for the burger. Hands down the worst bun I've ever had. Super thick, dry, dense. WAY to large to eat your burger. I think they are looking for the wow factor. I HAD to take the meat out. Very nice meat. French fries hot and tasty. I saw another trying to eat bbq from this bun. They took the meat out as well.

dLBnj-tBr_oOWuHd5Zqs2Q.text: It's been 6 years since I've dined here and tonight I thought why. It's better then I remember. The BEST chicken tortilla soup ever. I love the way it's served with the waiter poring the delicious broth over the fresh chicken, veggies and tortilla crips. Don't forget to order the amazing pork queso! Yes I filled up on appetizers and had had to skip the entree

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork Queso
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Tortilla Soup

G5XGQ5MvT9MRpas89Sl3PA.text: Great outdoor seating option, staff we friendly and attentive. Our server made dinner recommendations and we both loved our meals! I had the pork chop, it was cooked perfectly! My husband, whom is very picky, was really impressed with the duck. I noticed many around us had ordered burgers, that looked delish also.  We recommend Roaring Fork to several others at the resort.

rs0nPSYgqXR9h7I8iLmX2A.text: We had reservations for two and our table was ready when we arrived!  We had a cool spot near the kitchen and it was surprisingly quiet yet a fun atmosphere.  The service was fair and efficient.  Wedge salads  Carnitas Dinner and Braised Short Ribs  Dinner was delicious and we had a great evening!!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

DJ9ovdWPvki3aSK8SjmiWg.text: So came here based upon yelp reviews as well as the beautiful building.   Very nice ambience walking in, very nice staff, etc etc.  so far, so good.  Bread ?  Very good.  But then...   wine glass was VERY dirty. Waiter just poured wine in anyway then replaced it when I complained.  Ordered Caesar salad with NO anchovies.   Salad comes out with whole sardines on the top !!  Like wow.  That was replaced.  Then came dinner.  My steak was over cooked (medium instead of medium rare) the meat quality just wasn't very high.   What you expect for a 40.00 filet is much more than what I got.  and the tenderloin salad was just plain tough, over cooked bits of meat in a salad.  Flavor wasn't even good.   At least the candied walnuts tasted good.   Overall a disappointing experience.   The location, ambience would seem to give so Much more opportunity !

68ZNPAL_eUK_N0y6E0K0Sg.text: A very pleasant evening. Service was good and friendly   The chicken Waldorf salad was seriously tasty. I would suggest ordering with the dressing on the side.    The spit cooked chicken was good, the leg was super moist, although the breast portion was a little dry.  White meat tends to be that way   The braised beef short ribs were amazing. We substituted the horseradish potato for Yukon mashed potato.  The tomato jam made this dish.   All in all a good meal

AOoNgAUD0m6rCFx58wjduw.text: The Chicken fried chicken is incredible. Went there both times we stayed in Scottsdale.

tv-UcQQhXhAdwU5HAIFlRg.text: Anyone who has a happy hour until 10 pm all summer long is worth checking out. I can only give this review based on two items the short ribs  and the big ass burger were awesome. I have heard the chicken is awesome so next time I come that is what I am going to try.

7l5esBBfAQvz7vopn_7arw.text: This place is EXCELLENT. Fast attentive service... (didn't have a reservation) Spectacular outdoor patio and the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin was outstanding! Topped it off with Creme brulee to seal the deal. Very nice indeed!

dwYoOb88OGZMGi5LI3SS_A.text: Arizona Baby!  Whenever I come back I feel like I am home again!  The Roaring Fork is a beautiful restaurant with great service.  It is hidden in an office park, but has that great Arizona feel with a beautiful outdoor Patio.  The food is world class with a casual western feel.  I had the guacamole to start which was wonderful!  I then had the ribeye steak with the green chile Mac n cheese.  My steak was as good as you will ever find.  The green chile Mac n cheese is not to be missed--something you cannot find East of the Mississippi.  I had a great evening and to top it off got to spend time with a SUNY-Optometry fellow alum and faculty member.  SUNY-O Baby!  I must return to this restaurant one day.  It has me playing the song "Arizona" in my head, but is it the Marc Lindsay version or the Scorpion version?

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

nMK9vnJYcSNtAT11Y8KfOw.text: Happy Hour all night Sun/Mon - what a deal!  The guacamole & chips were very good. Green chili pork and rotisserie chicken flatbread was excellent.  Very good service - I'll be back!

kalSncNgn9tY6-A5arYw0g.text: I have not been to the Roaring Fork in 10 years (we live in Montana but frequent Scottsdale). I decided to take friends, we made a 7:15 reservation, arrived an hour early and grabbed a table in the bar to have drinks and apps before hand. We were fortunate to have John as our server!  John was engaging, extremely helpful and has a great sense of humor. John was such a great server we cancelled our table in the dining area. Why move when our experience was already fabulous???  Needless to say between the outstanding service coupled with the quality of our meals which were all fantastic (short ribs, pork verde, mussels to name the mains) we have to give 5 stars!!!!  Thanks John for taking great care of us in one of Scottsdale's finest and most consistent restaurants.

l_u9XsIqWLBYu7iRd-Gjdw.text: Fresh, delicious foods...dont sleep on the smoked ribs, burger, and the chili ! The service is probably the best I've had compared to many other establishments.

mDuIlYmGn8TpfIMlaKbwQA.text: It does not get any better than this! Happy hour items are very tasty  and the price is right. I was in on Labor Day and they had a buy one entree get one free deal going on. It is packed for a reason people.

cjJs_VuaNR1QVjP1AzttRg.text: service was great.  Awesome happy hour that goes everyday until 10pm. $5 drinks $6 wines and all full size appetizers are under ten dollars. Try the guacamole. Crowd a little on the older side few people under 40

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huckleberry margarita...

f84Cf393K8f61h9t4YJVAg.text: Great venue. Excellent happy hour...AND they found my sunglasses that I left in the booth, so with a quick phone call, all is great!  Thank you!

MQUqskHj1FkxrtUQmW3Taw.text: This restaurant doesn't look like much on the outside but the atmosphere is really great! We made reservations that evening and there was not a problem getting a table at all. The service was prompt and friendly.  We decided on just getting the specials for the evening after some contemplation. My father got the 8 oz Filet Mignon and I ended up getting the seafood special with lobster sauce. I enjoyed the assortment of seafood and some bread to dip into the lobster sauce. I tried a little bit of the steak as well which was excellent, although I usually don't have steak on the norm.  While the experience was wonderful we thought it was a bit too pricey for what was being offered. Even still I would recommend Roaring Fork and may come back to try out their happy hour menu sometime.

gl0xN8j3K5cmKj7ilraDBA.text: This is obviously a well run and managed establishment. We were well taken care of and the whole team works together to serve at a superior level.  The food was also incredible.  I enjoyed the short ribs which were tender, delicious and perfectly cooked. The horseradish mashed potatoes were amazing but if you don't like a little kick you've been warned. My wife enjoyed the trout and said it was a great combination of textures and flavors. As a final not I would highly recommend the signature huckleberry marguerita.   All and all you get much more than you pay for at the roaring fork!!!

7jkgfJZV39dChlXuwcuBmg.text: Came here for a work dinner - the food and service were great - however - I left my sunglasses at the table and when I called back almost minutes later they were already snatched up by someone on the staff.   I find it very disheartening that a business lacks ethics. In fact, I had reservations to come back the next day and decided to take our group somewhere else because we just couldn't fathom giving our money to a place that promotes this kind of behavior.   I asked for follow up from a manager and still haven't heard a thing. Really a shame.

E3WbWOs2cwIj8LvY2XTx-A.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Scottsdale.  The Happy Hour here is amazing, they offer $5 Margaritas and reduced priced appetizers.  The size of the appetizers is significant so they can easily substitute for a dinner entree.  I usually order the Big Ass Burger for $10 (the name is pretty accurate). My son and husband usually get the Kettle of Green Chile Pork and the Pork Wings respectively, often times paired with a salad. Happy Hour begins at 4pm and there is often a line waiting to get in, well worth the wait!    If we forgo the Happy Hour menu, which is rare, I usually order the Bacon-Wrapped Pork Tenderloin with White Falls Mill Cheese Grits and Mexican Street Corn and my husband gets the Rib Eye, both are delicious!  Definitely make reservations if going for dinner, it can get crowded.

Jf3R9-D7OXCh5SVaJeVmKA.text: Excellent service. Great place for dinner. The staff is accommodating and the food selection is good (tortilla soup, trout, ribeye/steak). This is the place to bring your guests or colleagues from out of town. This would be in my top 10 in arizona

bApMn5yPe8QgkalHcCDYtQ.text: Omg. Omg. Omg. That's really my first words when I explain this place to other people. I have tried 6 different entree items and none of them have disappointed me! My favorite will have to be the half Chicken! Sooooo good and juicy! Plus you can see them roasting in the fire place when you walk in! I will also say the Kettle Chili Pork is so scrumptious! I've been craving it ever since! Those are definite must haves if you have never been. Did I mention the prices are extremely reasonable? Walking in, I thought this place was going to be really expensive but I was really surprised to see that the prices are very reasonable! Definitely a must try place and perfect place to go for date night. Also something to note is that they have happy hour every weeknight until 10pm (I might be wrong on that time but it ends late!) during the summer. You're welcome ;)

tqr9pTBTFqQMTsOcRRDMSQ.text: Managed to grab a car for the evening and immediately hopped on Yelp to see what's good in Scottsdale! Roaring Fork is on the ground level of a generic office park. I later realized that this is a chain restaurant!  The interior was upscale. I tried my coworker's ribs and have to admit that it was the best part of the entire meal!  The Big Ass Burger was so big that I finished maybe 1/2 of it? I ordered it medium rare and it looked like it was still half alive... Maybe I'll order medium next time...  The Seared Ahi Tuna was good, although somewhat bland.  The green chili was good. The warm soft tortillas were a nice touch and the chili had a slight kick to it.  Service was top notch from a uniformed waiter.  Make sure to check out the loo, it's just like the one at the office! ;)
