Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Green Chili Appetizer
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seared Ahi Tuna

SOcVeRH9OSVBlkn627dL4g.text: Came here for restaurant week and was not disappointed. Food and service were great. Started out with the tortilla soup and the presentation alone made it worthwhile   If you like tortilla soup just go for this to try and see the presentation. Very fresh tasting. True the duck breast with the chili Mac and cheese and shaved Brussel sprouts along with onion jam. Yummy. We also tried the Delmonico steak with mashed potatoes and asparagus. Wow. Have leftovers of all of this for tomorrow. Darr was really good. I recommend the crime brulee. The pecan pie was tasty with the ice cream and whipped cream but I like my pie better. Everyone worked as a team and service was great. Good place for a date or family.

mzKynLpSVwKtxrb3ct7MLw.text: Very impressed with this place!  Everything was delicious.  Atmosphere was great and our server was very friendly and accommodating!  We started off with the Queso Con Puerco.  It had a bit of a spicy kick to it and was so good.  I had the Carnitas.  The pork was so tender!  The guacamole that came with it was fresh and very tasty.  My husband had the split roasted half chicken and said it was also very good.  We would love to come back to this restaurant and would highly recommend it!

JgYHYzCizw5eQMOENWSQAQ.text: Visited during restaurant week. The food was mediocre at best. Too pricey for average food. I won't be back. They are going downhill. The service waa good. They seated us  immediately. The atmosphere was pleasant. Food was a disappointment.

DmBCv4keNBlepwCYSuflgA.text: Green chile pork and the gauge mojito are hits the spot just right. Love sitting at the bar because the bartenders are attentive, nice and funny

v3NvE9K8zhybE1Pm6m_nzg.text: You know, after decades of different restaurant experiences from pasta just outside the Vatican, Antipasti in Bologna, fish and chips in a London pub, Haggis in Edinburgh........pierogies and kielbasa in Chicago's Polish 'hood, Seattle's Pike's Place, Gilroy Garlic Festival, Hatch Chile Fest....I could go on and on... Sooooo...Roaring Fork-if I had to pick a quintessential Arizona restaurant, this would be it.  It's cowboy/Southwest but just superbly prepared and served.  The staff is more than accomodating, and everyone in our party just had the best experience. I'm this .[read index finger and thumb about a quarter inch apart]. far from duplicating their green chile pork MWWWWWWWWAHAHAHA!!  :)  Seriously, this dish is killer and a must try!! T out!

DOC_sYUJ01PyORHozbVyiA.text: This place is awesome!!! I found a new hang out YAY!!!  So the happy hour is really really good. Here's What I got   Kettle of pork Carmita's with melted jack cheese and bettered flour tortillas   7.00!! = This pork literally melts in your mouth this was the most tender meat I have ever had. I wouldn't have though to order pork I'm soo glad I did. I was also surprised I wouldn't have thought of this place as having mexicanish food?  The tortillas were sooo thin and soft and buttery. Very good dish, perfect for 2.  Fish tacos 9.00 = This was very good, I have never in my life ever ever ever ordered fish tacos, since I hate fish. It was grouper   and  it came with very fresh avocado and thin sliced red onion and a very good salsa. The salsa was like blended, so it wasn't the typical tomato chunks salsa.   They also have a 7.00 "big ass burger" Yes, that's really what they call it.  I saw everyone order it and every time they brought one out I got jealous.  It was about the width off two burgers and came with a side of fries that looked soo good. They too were served in a kettle and were very thin but not the crispy gross thin ones.   We came in before they opened at like 2 and we were told that happy hour is when they open at 4pm.   This guy came in at that time and was telling us how he couldn't wait until 4 because they have the best burger ever.   So I'm excited to try more off the menu and especially try the burger

EmC2SEBthHa1eH-f2bGM8w.text: My absolute favorite place for happy hour, and during the summer happy hour lasts all night!!! I've never actually eaten dinner here because the happy hour food menu is enough to fill you up, but I think I've tried almost all the items on the happy hour menu and I would recommend every one: Ahi tacos, guacamole, green chile pork stew, big ass burger, seared ahi, lamb chops and fondue and the drink specials are all mouth wateringly delicious! Also, they have bleu cheese stuffed olives which top off an already perfect dirty martini. I'm in heaven in this place and go back often.   The bar area isn't too large, but happy hour is offered on both patio areas also, one of which is screened in and cooled. Very reasonable prices for happy hour items also, especially for the quality and quantity you receive.

hZgcX8uZw1hYCE6-wnim2A.text: "An American Bistro and Bar," this western but elegant establishment serves up cowboy fare wtih a twist of new mexico and a dash of french savvy for sauces.  The decor is typical for the wild west...chandeliers made from the antlers of deer, wood finishes, and a saloon to quench the thirst.  They do have an extensive wine list, though I tried one of their mixed drinks, which is something I do at every restaurant I visit.  'Iced Tea' - Bacardi Limon, Lemon & Mint  'Wrath of McGrath' - A Shiner Bock Beer with a Shot of 100 Proof Smirnoff Jalapeno Vodka drizzled over it & a Squeeze of Lime  For an appetizer I tried the Cockles and Craw Fish, with a roasted garlic butter sauce with kaffir lime.  I would have spent more than the $9.50 just to delight in the sauce again.  Truly a phenomenal and unique taste, though there was only a small amount of crawfish, and perhaps five cockles. Well, it is an appetizer, though i can guarantee that once you sample this savory sauce, you will want more.  Second Appetizer was the Kettle of green chile pork, with jack cheese and flour tortillas.  Also $9.50, and very delicious, this appetizer is not so overwhelming as to satisfy appetite, but is intense on the taste buds, as it is flavored with a habanero pepper.  The Restraurant offers two seperate menus.  TheSaloon menu is available at the bar only, and features less expensive foods from 8.50-12.00.  Stew, Steak, Quesadillas, and a "Big Ass Burger" are all found here.  I shared a "Big Ass Burger" with my beau, for $10.00, and we couldn't fit it into our mouth.   Though our waitress was slow, and we waited quite some time for our drinks, she was very amiable.  When I bit into a wedge of plastic while enjoying the appetizer, the manager came to personally apologize and to offer us complimentary dessert, as well as taking the Crawfish off the bill.  Though none of that was necessary, it is always a treat when a restaurant concerns itself in such a way with pleasing its customers.  As for the Restaurant menu, here is the complete menu and photos, taken from the roaring fork website:  Boneless Buttermilk-Fried CHICKEN with Pan Gravy & Mashed Potatoes AHI Seared with Smoked Salt, Chamomile Steamed Vegetables, Chipotle Vinaigrette PORK Rib Chop, Red Chile Sauce, Baked Squash with Apples SALMON Campfire-Style Ginger Vinaigrette, Soy Beans, Tomato DUCK Breast, Onion Jam, Sour Cherry Mustard, Little Cabbages HALIBUT Dusted with Dried Tomato...Soft Herbs, Sugar Snaps, Meyer Lemon Sauce LAMB Rib Loin, Corn Fritter, Green Beans with Toasted Hazelnuts Vanilla Lamb Glace & Green Jelly Almond-Crusted TROUT, VEAL Bacon, Asparagus & Horseradish Potatoes Tarragon Sauce BEEF Short Rib Braised in Dr. Pepper Barbecue Sauce, Chile Cheese Grits Grilled SHRIMP with Green Rice with HAM BEEF Tenderloin, Whiskey a Shellaca, Green Chile Macaroni

eT5u1krFS4AMkY6SenvhQQ.text: Me and my wife went here for dinner and ordered the NY strip and the double cut pork chop. They were both delicious! The only complaint I have is the NY strip was $45 which was a big surprise when yelp has it rated as $$. Overall great food and service but be ready for the steak to be over priced.

5KzQJ18rOxPvwgW_5WDXgw.text: OMG! Fill up my bathtub with the green chile pork stew, I want to lay in it and eat until I'm sick! Really guys, this stew is phenomenal. If I hated, HATED, everything else on the menu, I would still be a regular for the stew... the awesome thing is that I've tried a bunch of things on the menu and liked them all. The fried chicken, delicious Dr. Pepper ribs, pork tenderloin, they're all mighty good. Throw in typically above par service and an awesome happy hour in the bar area and you get four big fat ones.

on7XKNk_BrwGEN8hpTpUOw.text: Took a friend here from out of town the other night. No lie, probably the best service I've ever had at a restaurant- they set the bar very high in valuing their customers. Aside from the service and most important- the food. I ordered the half chicken with vegetables and my friend ordered the "big ass" burger. The chicken was roasted perfectly. My favorite part though would've been the cornbread stuffing that the - chicken sat upon... they should offer a side dish of it, it was unbelievable. My friend's burger was huge, no surprise given it's very direct menu name- he loved it. Our server was very personable and extremely professional. I actually don't drink but the wine list was very extensive and have heard good things about the selection. Furthermore, I hear the happy hour is hard to beat, so I will definitely be coming back soon for more.

mjsrNrULQdV7--XM9q982A.text: Love the food and the service, especially if you get Shay, is impeccable. We have frequently said she is the reason we keep going back (ok, it doesn't hurt that their food is also great).  She not only remembers us as we go there at least twice a month but, comes to the table with our drink orders - how's that for service?!  We love their guac appetizer, their salads, buttermilk chicken and green chili pork.  I am sure everything on the menu is great but, we love those so much we haven't tried anything else.  The couple of things that are negatives are the nasty attitude of the people at the front desk.  They also insist on reservations.  There are so many empty booths and tables and yet they will turn you away at 9 pm on a Friday if you don't have a reservation.  We then made a reservation through Open Table on our phone and they immediately seated us.  SERIOUSLY??!?!?  Still, the food and atmosphere are great.

T-miImEUjHGRyWLJfTL36w.text: Talk about great date spot! The Roaring Fork screams cute and cozy and is located off the beaten path of the typical array of downtown Scottsdale restaurants.  Be sure to try the scene-stealing green-chili macaroni and cheese. It's out of this world. And wash it down with a fruity Huckleberry Margarita, their signature cocktail.

YTzTwgDH1XCXZAUDu3rlKA.text: I was really disappointed this evening. We stopped in last night and had such marvelous service that I booked for the following night for a group of 6. They were so kind to accommodate us. We went back tonight...the food was wonderful but the service did not merit the price of the restaurant. Our waiter, Darrell, virtually ignored us...long spaces between courses, no explanations. 4 of the 6 had the fixed price and had given their dessert order. He left the remaining 2 with a menu but never came back to follow up. We finally asked the bus boy/man.  I had also booked the reservation telling them we were celebrating a birthday and a graduation...of which no mention was made.  I was embarrassed that some of our guests were disappointed, and disappointed that my grandson's graduation was not acknowledged when they told me they would be sure to mark it down. Although the food and atmosphere were great, there are other places who respect our desire for value for money spent.

JAEqY65wg3NCxG_3mRUxbg.text: Great Happy Hour!!! Food and drinks were amazing. Pretty crowded. Self seating in bar and patio during happy hour. Reservations required for dining. Will go back again and again.

qXsSux2oVj49_Ri8dNHdCg.text: If you are in the area, this is a great restaurant to visit for its wood fire inspired dishes. The bone in ribeye was especially flavorful and bold with the open flame char. The cedar plank salmon was delicious and perfectly prepared. The service is attentive but not overbearing.

c7kmmFQiXGDp9NRbnZvveQ.text: I attended a corporate dinner at Roaring Fork.  We were seated outside and the misters were on, I was sitting closer to the door inside and the misters were perfect for keeping it cool enough, but others on the outer skirts of the patio (closer to the actual misters) were sopping wet.  I guess it's better than sweating?  The dinner entree was a menu choice of 3 proteins: chicken fried steak, steamed fish or an 8oz. filet-- I had the filet, it was excellent and cooked perfectly to order (medium).  We had shrimp cocktail to start and that was sooo good!  Giant succulent shrimp with an amazing, salsa-ish cocktail sauce.  Really, it was just wonderful.  Ended the meal with a creme brulee that knocked my socks off, errr heels since I wasn't wearing socks to begin with.   Service was friendly, fast and helpful.  Roaring Fork was an excellent choice for this dinner party.    Oh, I can't forget to mention the cornbread-like biscuits in the bread basket, those were delicious.

uu4QmMFF6ukea8LHPTL2Eg.text: The food here was decent, but nothing to write home about. The tortilla soup had a nice spicy kick. The ahi tuna appetizer was pretty good, I had that as my main dish. My fellow diners were also satisfied with their orders. The one dish I didn't think was very good was the green chili mac and cheese side. It tasted like velveeta instant mac & cheese with a little green chili added.  If I was only rating the food, this place would probably get 3 stars but I had some issues with the service and ambience.  Our party was seated towards the back of the restaurant near a back door, which servers used to go in and out to get more chairs. This happened at least 3 times during our meal, which was an issue since the temp was down to about 50 degrees that night. The service was also not great, for example, we asked for more bread and it was never brought out.   All in all, decent food but nothing special.

3xQU3yjCvLdPOeKG0VLYTg.text: Amazing place!  Atmosphere, food and prices (happy hour). We went there with 12 of our close friends for happy hour.  The service was stupendous, everything everyone ordered was top notch.  When I asked the waiter for a recommendation, he said everything on the menu was great and so right he was!  In our crowd we had the big ass burger, mixed green salad, pork wings, fish tacos.  Everyone in our group is a converted fan and we will definitely be back!

QPLD3EwcE1mDJBtwVLqIhA.text: We had our company xmas party at the roaring fork last year and I must say that it was a pretty good spread. We had the back room all to ourselves which was really nice, and we had tons of appetizers as we mingled and chatted with drinks in hand. What the appetizers were, I do not remember, but I do remember that it was alot of food.   Next we were seated for dinner and mind you I was a little stuffed from the appetizers but alas I took one for the team and made sure to partake in dinner. We had a caesar salad to start, I ordered the filet mignon and of course the chocolate brownie for dessert. We also had a huge bowl of the mac and cheese to share at the table and I tell you that was some good mac and cheese. Cheesy and spicy! What more can a girl ask for.  Will have to go and visit that place again soon.

hMtriPQj5vPO4LgXgTf2cQ.text: Yummy! I hadn't been here in about 4 years, and I went for dinner with some friends and family. I ordered the fish tacos, and they were so delicious. Thumbs up! The service is very friendly, even though the food came out slightly slow.

EtSDYPSrFyd8njlU2vA43w.text: I think the Roaring Fork is the best Southwestern restaurant in the Valley. Not only for the outstanding cuisine, but also for the service. I've never spoken to an aloof idiot hostess on the phone, ever, and that's pretty much my job description (to speak with hostesses, not to deal with idiots... I'm a concierge).   It's rich and delicious, and it happens to have the best burger in town. The bar features lots of delish micro-brews, and the service doesn't disappoint in this section, either.   I'd far prefer going here than Richardson's or Rokerij any damn day of the week.

wuuUebxoz4HbVk-GoXk_Sw.text: Have been to "The Fork" 3 times now.  Incredible staff, friendly managers and great food!  I worked in the restaurant industry for quite some time and I really think they know what they are doing!

zOtR76FPqyzO902CrMBsww.text: We had a reservation for a Friday night and we are glad that we had one. The place was packed. A large group was next to us on the patio. We were warned upfront that they could be loud and they were. The food was very good and the portions were rather large. The service was very attentive and friendly. We liked the restaurant a lot. One problem as out of towners that we experienced was the location of the place. The address says that it is on N Scottsdale Road while it is really on Chapparal. It is very difficult to see from Scottsdale Road. There is room for improvement to make it easier for people who are not familiar with the exact location.

cOfeaGuUnA-gXt0f4_mJZw.text: I ordered bbq cedar plank salmon with asparagus.  it was A M A Z I N G.  The salmon was cooked PERFECTLY. I was really worried that they were going to just drench it with BBQ sauce.  But you could barely see a thin layer on the salmon and it didn't even taste like bbq sauce.  It had this nice hint of sweetness that did not overwhelm the wonderful taste of the salmon.  Pure perfection!  They were nice enough to trade out the greenbeans that come with it, with asparagus.  Asparagus was pretty good with this salty/garlic sauce on it.  One thing I was really disappointed with was the service!  O M G talk about waiting an hour for a check!!   And she was a bit snippy on her responses.  Did not like that one bit!   All in all I would DEFINITELY recommend this place, but don't hold your breath on getting decent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ih7qI8a7taAg-dwzhvsKog.text: Green chili pork is a must, very tender and delicious, waiter was good and my glass of water never went empty my only complain was a very bland filet minion....but my wife's duck was delicious, I'll be stopping by the next time I'm in Arizona.

AHuQ3kEOowHpIV9seczFtg.text: Thanks to the previous reviews that said it was busy in the bar at happy hour and that it is hard to find (corner of Chaparel and Scottsdale)   We arrived at 4:40 on a Saturday.  There were about three tables open and a dozen seats open at the bar.  By 5:30, people were hovering waiting for a table.  That would be my only complaint (but they can't help that customers are rude).  Our service was excellent, drinks are well priced at $5.  We had two appetizers, the Ahi Tuna and the Wood Fired Shrimp.  Both were good.  Atmosphere is nice and there is plenty of parking.

TM_2aM3Uxk3T4wGvha7Ohw.text: I found my favorite place to eat! This place is so gorgeous with beautiful settings and you can see the sunset through the mountain view at the patio. Wonderful dining experience. I love their Seared Ahi Tuna with Guacamole and Pepita crackers, Fondue with Lamb Chops, Green Chili Pork Tacos and Spitfire Rotisserie Chicken! Excellent! Their happy hour is until 7pm which gives you much time to drive all away here and enjoy the lovely dinner. I'm most impressed with the service! My waitress was very friendly and thoughtful. I forgot my card and she was running to the parking lot to find me. I definitely will come back soon to this place! ;D

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

49dwK2OznzSJwmHp35fj5g.text: Omg, this place is great. Matt, our server was top notch. The food was great, my duck was cooked to perfection, the 22oz steak was so tender, juicy and delicious. The bread basket was amazeballs.

I4vtsWh4Em_Ej3tzRKVeEA.text: Delectable!!!!!  That's the one word that comes to mind. Fresh, farm to table type food. Choice cuts of meat grilled to perfection. Reasonable wine prices and great selection. We went back two days later.

HHO2FsxjOGSLSW12l0CrXA.text: Food and service is wonderful! After trying Roaring Fork for my friend's birthday a few months ago, I decided to bring a visiting friend to try it again. We had a great visit, with even better food. We had the Green Chili Pork appetizer (which we later said would be perfect as an entree and maybe could just eat that the rest of our lives and be happy). I had the pork chops and she had trout. It was all fantastic! Roaring Fork has definitely become one of my favorites, and a place that I look forward to bringing out of town guests to - to show off the great food in Scottsdale!

PHAMMK-JXpOM_ZbCULrnww.text: I went here for happy hour with my group of girls on a thursday after work. We got a table on the patio right away and really had a great time. The prices were *amazing* and so was the food, and now I'm dying to go back and have a full dinner here as well. Everything tasted amazing, but my favorite was the fondue lamb chops. We got something like 5 appetizers (including the big ass burger), 3 drinks and 1 dessert for around $65.  The only thing that was a bit lacking was the service. Two times the gal walked away as we were still trying to tell her what we wanted, and my friend's soup didn't come with our first round of appetizers so she had to reorder it when we ordered burgers.

ZfXZWj8n6CqTgTLMapJ80g.text: They have the best happy hour in town in terms of food quality. The service is exceptional as well.

8ZCRbRww6OOlawVYjCzJ5w.text: Their summer happy hour is great and runs through 10 PM! Specialty drinks and wine glasses are $5 but you have to order only from their happy hour menu.  Also, the food items are a delicious no matter what you order.  My favorite is the fondue with green chile pork.  This deal is only for the bar and patio areas not the dining room.

1XhaxpjMktAvDmtj3eRE_g.text: Very good food.  They have a menu that kind of goes all over the place.  I had some kind of BLT as an appetizer and a steak with chorizo sauce as my main dish. Both were absolutely delicious.  The servers were fast and friendly, the place was very modern looks and reasonably quiet for as many people were there. Prices were a little high but not the end of the world, nor would it deter me from going there again.

aAmx3i0tudL4Wzr2QDD0EA.text: Amazing food and drinks, but sadly a little too pricey for me...luckily someone else paid!  I liked Roaring Fork because it has a wide range, yet short list, of food, good portions, cooked well, and I definitely got my moneys worth with the Huckleberry Margarita. The seared Ahi, green chili pork stew, and short ribs were delicious. I took off one star because the place was too dim, and we were with a few children, and this place is not kid friendly. And as usual, it just cost too much!

Soy1dIDyr5xEkStGV16X1g.text: Roarrrrrrrr! No, it's okay prefer chopsticks :)  This oddly located restaurant is a delight.  When you first walk to the doors you know you're in for a treat -- I feel like making an entrance like Aragorn in LOTR -- you nerds know what I'm talking about.  I was feeling hungry that night and ordered me a "Big Ass Burger" -- no I'm not just saying it because it's big -- It's actually called the "Big Ass Burger!"  Yum!  Filled my little tummy :)  Service is bangin' -- Thanks Mr. Ryan!  The ambience is low and chill with a rustic feel.  No, not because of the age of the people :) - Enjoy!

H4gHzy3d3hx6SI-YtmGArA.text: Went here with my manager and coworker for a holiday meal, and it was gorgeous - the only issue really was finding out way into/around the parking area.  Once we got inside it was all good.  Beautiful aromas wafted around the place, nice mood lighting.  We had the old vine zinfandel - highly recommended - and the mussels to start.  Then I had the filet minon special; heavenly!  For dessert the spicy chocolate torte.  Truly this meal had me feeling like all other foods I'd ever eaten were a sham!  SO GOOD!  And the service was excellent, too.

gaigUcadCLs9pwsxJs6u6w.text: Really liked the atmosphere. Very comfortable and upscale clientele. We love the tenderloin fondue appetizer. It was tremendous. We both had the teriyaki grilled salmon with reen bean salad and mashed potatoes. Service was great and would come back again.

nwWn_vnFF2yLt0lujXkzSA.text: Went to try the happy hour and was pretty impressed. $5 martinis (perfect full pours) and really good margaritas. The Big Ass burger for $10 was very tasty. I had to box it up even, such a huge portion. The green chile pork dish was very tasty as well. Good service, nice bar area and good schedule on the happy hour. Every day from 4-7, Sun and Mon 4-close I think. I will be going back here for sure at some point.

JqTjb6WEF5M5JxEafgMyGA.text: I love the cozy feel of Roaring Fork, but what's even better than the atmosphere is their incredible happy hour menu. I think they have one of the best happy hours in town, especially when they start their all-night happy hour during the summer months! That's right, I said all night happy hour! Their happy hour menu includes their signatures items including the pork stew, fish tacos and the Big Ass burger...and yes friends, it's truly a Big Ass Burger! Keep an eye on their updates because a little birdie told me that the all night happy hour is coming to town very soon!

ZTbPFnxOtQv8lzprdPfaEQ.text: My mom and I were looking for a restaurant with a southwestern feel so we went to Roaring Fork. The service was great. The food was good my chicken was a little salty but still very tasty. We tried their signature side (chili macaroni) which was very tasty and their margarita drinks was tasty and strong. When I am in the area again I will def make a visit.

oyg8ZjxRPIAbRoWgCWRx4Q.text: This was one of the best southwestern meals I have ever had. The margaritas were fantastic and the carnitas and green chile Mac and cheese were very inventive!! We also had the corn, which was awesome and the filet that was prepared perfectly.   Overall a great experience. They also have a good happy hour that we are going to try next time.

kiMrLKCvGBym5ck_WQzTLg.text: Excellent meal, the rainbow trout was cooked perfectly, I highly recommend it, the green chile mac and cheese was delicious, Bob provided great service and everyone was friendly, managers asked if everything was good, great place. An easy walk from the Doubletree Paradise Valley.

SlHT6BvfymPCsz9RyVXlRw.text: I was expecting a better experience. The food was good, but nothing spectacular. I ordered salmon and my husband ordered a filet. His steak was very tough even cooked medium rare. Our server forgot our drink order and was borderline obnoxious the entire meal. This was a special occasion dinner so we were disappointed and were expecting more for the price. The bread basket selection was sadly the best part of the meal. We won't be going back to this overrated and dated spot.

MDsoS074yKvoETZABfsTNA.text: One of my favorite places for date night ! The food and service is always great ! My favorite starter is the green pork Chile with the warm flour tortillas yummy  and they have a 3 course dinner filet Mignon is what I get and it never disappoints. It's a must try!

iY8trsnKIr9HJRRt0VvE2g.text: Wow! Great food! Excellent service! Get reservations. We walked in just before 5 pm on a Friday night and they had no tables until 9 pm. The bar and patio were open seating and there were 4 or 5 groups ahead of us. Luckily a reservation canceled and we were able to get seated. Even with over an hour wait it was worth it. We all had specials which included a salad, entree and dessert. I had a steak that was cooked perfectly and so tender. My husband and nephew had ahi tuna and said it was delicious. It was seasoned well and the rice that went with it was very good. Desserts were creme brulee and pecan pie. Both were very good.   It was a bit difficult to find but so worth it

kcjyTHt74z0LKoNJhckbYg.text: Happy hour here for us really were happy hourS!  On a Sunday and Monday, happy hour hours are from 4 to 10 PM!  And on all other days, 4 to 7 PM.  This place is gigantic!  A patio is even provided and perfect for November days.  Heat lamps are also available.  Everything we devoured was on point!  All we ordered were appetizers off the happy hour menu.  The pork wings ($8 - 3 big meaty pieces) were amazing and came with a unique Dr. Pepper BBQ sauce!  I love Dr. Pepper!  And I loved how it came with the sauce on the side so you can dip the generous amount of pork wing into the sauce.  I also liked the touch of hominy, pickled veggies, and Cotija cheese sprinkled over the wings.  A+ on the overall balance of this appetizer.  We liked it so much that we ordered another one before finishing up the first one.    We also ordered the Kettle of Green Chili Pork ($8) - this one I also loved!  It really came in a cute little kettle filled with the goods!  Then it also came with hot buttered flour tortillas in foil to keep it warm.  This one just melted in my mouth.  I think this one was probably my favorite out of the three appetizers.  The pork was moist and very flavorful and savory.    And since we were still hungry, we decided to try the Rotisserie Chicken Flat Bread ($8) - also loved this one too.  This flat bread was surprisingly larger than expected - a bonus!  Basil pesto, pepper jack cheese, and tomatoes completed this wonderful flat bread.    I feel like this is the first time in a long time that I've liked every appetizer that I've eaten in one sitting, especially for happy hour.  The food was quality to me.  The portions weren't skimping at all.  And I didn't have to complain about something being dry to the bone or stale.  2 thumbs up for the kitchen staff and menu selection!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kettle of green chili pork
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rotisserie chicken flat bread
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kettle pork chili w/flour tortilla

fW7QKqut2UlUkZ3RmOqRsw.text: ABSOLUTELY the best happy hour in old town considering how pricey their normal menu items can be. The burger is fantastic, the steak salad is phenomenal, and the frozen margaritas are on fire!! They happy hour menu is quite large but you do have sit at the bar or on the high tops in front of the bar, and they fill up quickly! If you're not there just before happy hour, you won't have much luck until 7pm because the restaurant is on the same lot as two huge corporate buildings.

19nDUsEXZzLV8GnSOLcLUA.text: The Roaring Fork is one of my favorite restaurants in Scottsdale. It has a warm, cozy feel to it. We were shown to our table and immediately greeted by our server "Roo". Roo was very friendly and attentive throughout the evening. A nice blend of stopping by enough without being a nuisance. I asked if they made a "Blood and Sand" cocktail and was pleasantly surprised to learn they could. Oh, by the way, it was great.  For an appetizer, we shared the green chili stew, which is one of my favorites. A basket of different types of bread was brought to the table. The small corn muffins are excellent. The night we were there they had a special of duck carnitas. Served in a skillet, a generous portion of duck, avocado, onions and jalapeno, and corn tortillas. Outstanding! This place never disappoints

Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Blood and Sand cocktail
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Roaring Fork

fPWhFzrzt4gKizQIytVD7g.text: Food was delicious and everything we expected. Had a mishap with my girlfriends dish and management made sure to take excellent care of us to make us feel as if it never happened. Place is well run and very costumer oriented based off of our experience.

4X90KIQgmvzhtKnTb2g10A.text: I tell you I don't typically pull out my phone and do a  restaurant review but I MUST tonight. Had dinner here and I am from out of town. Had the BLT wedge salad, loved it!  Then the Big Ass burger...wow what a burger and with the roasted poblano pepper this was the star on the Christmas tree, gave the burger a great little spice. The burger meat was fantastic and it was huge, could not finish it and I walked in starving ... Thumbs up to this place...

UsSumoKih14_sZ6xfhJvew.text: Just went in for happy hour. No help at the hostess stand . Walked around the bar area a few times. Overcrowded and never as much h as a glance from a bar server. 1 star is too kind. Bad service and bad attitudes u less you are a regular and then you get paid attention to.

kAXR540iy3TOUnWDeO0aGg.text: I wanted to go get a good traditional steakhouse came around this place I give them a try me and my dad when they're both got steaks it was pretty good I would definitely recommend going there trying it out on your own and seeing how it is everybody got their own opinion of course but my opinion on this place is a good place I would definitely go back there definitely would tell some friends about it too the staff was great environment was a great clean nice not too long of a wait the drinks were awesome I'll definitely recommend going there and trying it out definitely going to go back there sometime soon to try out their different dishes they have a lot of dishes you can choose from that's what I like that there is a lot of things you can choose from and everything's make fresh to order nothing was called when they gave us everything everything was good I would definitely recommend going there and trying it out the staff is wonderful and they're nice

FwW8rUsqVTQRly54mgUiOg.text: This place is great! Their margaritas are the best! Their appetizers are amazing. I'll highly recommend the green chile pork stew and the "pork wings." Their staff is usually on point and does a fairly good job. This was our favorite happy hour spot over the summer while they did their neverending happy hour. It was great for us since we worked late and never are able to get to a happy hour around 8pm.   Sadly. The establishment got rid of the all night happy hour after labor day. This was to much surprise since it was so popular. And sadly we had to stop coming for such reason. I thought it would be nice to leave a review of the "good times." Thanks for a great summer. Maybe next summer you could do it again. Till then see you roaring fork forever.   I say forever because without the happy hour this place is so not worth the value.

7SJbR7a87dqr3JRaY683bg.text: I come here for their summer happy hours deals. Great prices on drinks and entree specials. The big ass burger never disappoints if you're in the mood for high quality bar food! Typically sit in the bar area and have had phenomenal service with great recommendations from the staff.

I3IiXuM4WlihbRA2ZnsJFQ.text: Upon our girls trip, we luckily stumbled across this amazing gem of a spot! Yelp did us justice in leading us here! The food was out of this world and affordable! We ordered the salmon and the rainbow trout. If we lived in Arizona this would be a regular spot for us! Us California women were on cloud nine after leaving and couldn't have asked for a better experience. The waitress and busmen were very gracious and kind. We topped our meal with a creme brulee and a pecan pie!  We will hopefully be back soon!

KglXNhLce7fQ2I22uvsNiw.text: Loved loved loved this restaurant. I was a little upset with them at first because they did not have my reservation. Luckily I called before and was able to get my reservation in and we were accommodated. We were a large group and everything was delicious. The steak was cooked to perfection and the mashed potatoes were so good I wanted a whole bowl. The staff was very nice and very attentive. The drinks were also very well made. Overall I would recommend this place for a nice dinner date.

OKWDTPvRiqW0AT1IvX3ufg.text: Such a magical place!!  Staff is excellent and the food is remarkable!!  Love the Happy Hour!!!

YmWvFpRFYYd2KmXT6lGEKA.text: We were there the other night. My husband had the burger and I had the salmon. Both were done to perfection. The service was wonderful. I love the fact that you can see the chiefs cooking. The kitchen is very clean. And just a side note-so are the restrooms. It's a place that we will go back to.

MLzFMBChev2yIMYknNZ6pg.text: This was an amazing experience-- i ordered the blt wedge for starters--strip steak and asparagus and Brussels  AMAZING! Very good dinner! Service was excellent!!

FOamafiOEyH2pdw_h9ANUg.text: One of the better restaurants in Scottsdale. Came there with a group of 5 and loved the place. The service, the food, the ambiance....hell I even liked the price point for what I ate. For the appetizer I went with the tortilla soup, and it was one of the best I've had. Then for the main course I went with the buttermilk chicken which came with mash & peppercorn gravy. It was excellent and would order again.   I especially like the service. One of my buddies had his steak a tad overcooked; and the server was spot on - meaning she was apologetic, quickly got it rectified, and took it off the bill at the end of the night. If you read my posts you know I love good service...and it's not about the mistakes, it's how you bounce back from them that counts.  When I'm in Scottsdale, I would go back here for sure. Next time I'll try the fish tacos b/c those looked good.

6r4ziYIRT_RSPXxKcmdNfg.text: I tried this again and was very pleased that I did....I had the pork tenderloin wrapped in bacon and it was delicious as were the sides and the desserts were great...everyone in our party was extremely satisfied with their dinner and the service was fantastic.

T11XWS70D9CUyXMtBZU27A.text: amazing food, beautiful atmosphere great for date night

Lzh4sr-zQ8EW6P7FIWSaog.text: D was our server tonight and I can honestly say that the service was more like a 5 star dining experience rather than a casual, local happy hour. Very impressed!   The food was great as always but the service was perfect! We were celebrating a win after a long period of struggle and it just couldn't have been better.   This is a server with a keen eye for human behavior and interaction. Truly a memorable night! I'm looking forward to going again soon. So grateful for this lovely experience.  Green Chile Pork and Big Burger are always a good choice. The food at Roaring Fork is consistently good.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tortilla Soup
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. BLT salad.

52LY3f48aQ_lXuRjMOJDmQ.text: First timer here. Meeting friends that swear by the Happy Hour. Most especially the Big A$$ burger. Okay... I'm in.  Opens at 4:00 pm. Perfect. We'll meet then. A Saturday. Pull in at exactly 4:03pm. Open the door. It's packed. How does this happen when you don't open until 4:00?  Did manage to find a table in the " lobby" area. The bar area was completely full.  The food/drinks/service amazing. No complaints. I will be back... however; I really want to know what time I can actually enter this establishment and get my seat. Because I think that this is very shady to say you open at 4:00...and clearly... you were open much earlier.  Note to self... I'll be at the door at 3:00.

4pI6hi-IicGtiQygjiU2ZQ.text: I travel a lot for work, and I've been on the hunt for good food in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area for over a month, trying a recommend restaurant from locals on a daily. Most of been average, but I finally found a winner here.  I went in with little expectation, but the quality and flavorful ness of the food, and friendliness of the staff and patrons all caught me by surprise. I literally walked out thinking everything on the menu, I easily would've spent $5-12 more for that.  Only reason for 4stars instead of 5 is that they brand themselves as a steakhouse, and though they sell steak, it doesn't have that steakhouse vibe or menu. Cheers to the chef, and I raise a glass to the owner and staff for running a great place. I'll be recommending my friends as this is one of the best spots in the area

oh6_O5QXCOSixT7ugjMF_g.text: Some of the best duck I've had!!! This duck was amazing. I came here off of other yelp recommendations when I was in town for work and finding this place was a little tough because it's tucked in an office complex but not impossible to find and signs are posted for your direction.   I chose the duck and was not disappointed it was cooked medium to perfection with a perfectly crisped skin. It was packed full of flavor and I enjoyed every bite as much as the first!   The breast was served with a cherry sauce on top of a bed of thinly sliced brussel sprouts that tasted pretty good but were drenched in the cherry sauce so I didn't enjoy them as much as I did the rest of the dish. All around a great duck dish would definitely order again.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The duck!

Id30LNDN97tZXecmm0r8_Q.text: Another sparkling review for the AHHHMAZING happy hour!   This was our first visit, but both of us have had Roaring Fork bookmarked for awhile. We had cocktails (spicy marg  & Manhattan, $6 each on HH and you even get the extra in a cocktail shaker!) and ordered the BLT wedge salad to start. I'm fairly certain we were audibly oohing and ahhing over the salad; how a simple wedge salad could be so good is beyond me, but there we were! Honestly, every element was perfect.  Next up we split the Big A$$ Burger and the Braised Short Ribs. Unfortunately, we are currently avoiding carbs, so we chose the asparagus and a side salad, but the green chili mac n cheese looked and smelled heavenly. The burger may truly be the best value in town. It was phenomenal and HUGE; we easily could have shared just this and the salad and been stuffed...for under $20! The short ribs were equally fantastic and just melted in your mouth.  Service impressed us. Our server was super busy but on top of things and we were well taken care of. We were lucky enough to quickly snag a table as someone was leaving, but know that's not usually the case - expect to wait.  It's only been 3 days, but I'm already planning another visit later this week.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Side of &#39;steak mushrooms.&#39; Who knew mushrooms could be so delicious?!
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Big A$&amp; birger, modified for keto/low carb!
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak salad with balsamic &amp; horseradish dressing. Holy smokes, this is such a killer salad!

ZJyByFIcxZPf_ShwY6DcaA.text: This is probably one of my favorites in Scottsdale.  My colleague was in town for vacation and made the reservation, it has been on my list to visit.  What a lovely surprise.  We all had the three course, steak and a fish, but I don't remember what kind.  It was really good, but the brulee was delightful.  The cocktail picture was perfect and one turned into two.  This place will definitely be in rotation.  Three months living in AZ and the food scene gets better with each adventure. I should add the service was impeccable.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seared Tuna
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pre dinner drink

-gCnPk_rIk11ZoGhumI48A.text: I'm a little on the fence with this place. If you have been following me, you know I hate rules, and I felt this place has a few.  One of them and for sure the most annoying is no happy hour prices at your table. I perhaps, with a little help, might understand this rule for food, but for drinks? Why in the world?!! The service was pretty phenomenal both times I was there, at the tables by the bar and at the dinning are. The bar itself, not so good.  Location and parking are good. The bad ass burger is great. The fillet minion was perfect and the sides were OK. The cheesecake pretty good too.  The classic margaritas are already made and served from a jar. Not my favorite.  There are a couple of low hanging fruit that, if changed, I could rate this fine venue a 4, but today? A 3 it is.

2ZNtUtky3QzqB0aity8Ubw.text: Great happy hour and nice ambience for a date setting. It can be confusing to find. But it looks like it's tucked away in one of the business buildings. They have a great drink selection.

2a3s9ysUnkL33UDhLhV0Dg.text: This has been my husband and I date night spot for years now. If getting there for happy hour make sure you come early as sitting is limited. We enjoy the atmosphere, service and best of all food. You cant beat the price of their Happy Hour combined with the quality. This place is a winner.

pspSFo5MnU9N8bryTnccwA.text: This place was amazing! I know they rave about the happy hour here, however we just came for dinner and we were not disappointed! We started with the queso con carne for an appetizer and it was delightfully creamy and very tasty (we could have licked the pan!). Next for our main courses, my mom got a delicious filet cooked medium well and I got the double cut pork chop, both very juicy with flavor. We split a twice baked potato (thank goodness because it was more than enough for 2 people!) and that was our favorite part of the meal.  Our server was kind, attentive, and very personable. Service was above and beyond.  Overall, this is a place you will want to check out if you're visiting Scottsdale!

A9ip20Y3fGNStzg9lYD2sQ.text: The Roaring Fork Happy Hour is a crazy thing. The regulars and staff take it very seriously. The place opens at 4pm and there are scores of patrons already waiting in the lobby. When the bartender is ready for the hoards to enter he rings a big cowbell to begin the giant rush for seats. I expect Pavlov's dog would also be salivating after the cowbell wails it's feeding signal.  There is a reason for all the excitement. RF serves up generous pour cocktails and really good eats for virtually no money during happy hour. They have a $6 Manhattan that lights my candle. As far a food goes, try the kettle of green chili pork for a mere $8. It would feed a third world family for a week  If you get there much past 4:30 you can kiss the bar and happy hour good bye. It will be full.. This happy hour is no secret and you will be beat to the tables by those with no job. if you're lucky enough to get a seat during happy hour, consider yourself lucky and enjoy the deliciciousness.  PS Dee gives top notch service!!!!

OANTliRkSfRm-nRpjvZteA.text: Over the last few years I've been to this restaurant several times and the food is always excellent. The service is extremely professional and they are definitely on top of their game.  The food is great and every time I come here I order something different and I've never been disappointed. The atmosphere is super cool and is conducive to a relaxing time.  The roaring fork is definitely recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

rtrtJnzurYVWhQCUwryo0g.text: Great food and customer service! Wasn't sure what to expect, but I'm glad I got to try this place during my 2-day trip in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

cBC8d-Y1MLv6zDoBFZzYPw.text: Best happy hour in town. Great drink prices, delicious food, and great service (especially bartender Derick). My favorite restaurant and it never disappoints.   August 2019. There are only two issues with Roaring Fork.  1) The WIFI is horrible. If I'm eating/drinking by myself I want to be able to have access to a decent WIFI. While it looks like you connect, it never seems to work.  2). Desserts. You can't have the same 4-5 everyday. You need a new pastry chef or one if you don't have one.   Yes. These are little issues in the scheme of things. I love the food, drinks, and the bartenders. But they need to address these two items.

u3FB2N7BtGynHfLuvmHIqQ.text: IF YOU HAVE BEEN HERE IN THE LAST MONTH PLEASE CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARD STATEMENT. You might be the victim of theft. Read below.   I used to love this place. I had a friend come in from out of town, so I took here her because I knew she had to try this place out. The service was ok. Our server, offered us some free dessert for our special occasion, but before he even asked us what dessert we wanted, he had already charged us for two desserts. We did not have any time for desserts in the first place, so we declined the free dessert, and he fixed our bill. Just a small mistake everything was good.   The three of us that were there had all worked in the Service industry and know how important it is to be tipped cash. We left a cash tip, and wrote "cash" on the tip line. We left feeling good!  Unfortunately, the server Austin, tried to add $35 tip on top of what we tipped him to our bill. We checked our credit card statement and found a charge of almost double what we paid.  I have no idea how someone "accidentally" adds a tip like that to someone's bill. It's a little too coincidental that he tried to add desserts to our tab and then a $35 tip on top of that. I didn't want to have to write this review, but I do not think management is doing anything about this scenario, so I just want to make sure no one else is the victim of getting money added to their bill when the servers cash out at the end of the day.

RDDGT0GACV94Diao9p_8rg.text: This turned out to be one of the better places we tried when we were on vacation in Scottsdale.  Really good service and tasty food.  They had a 3 course deal when we were there with a salad, I had the rib eye with great sides and a dessert which was a pretty good deal at $60.   One thing I will mention is that this place is in a business Park so we were not sure if we were in the right place at first.

roa4S66ZR2qEoDwZSdh7Bg.text: Here for a family dinner, the food and service always consistently very good. My only comment is that the mixology of my Cosmopolitan cocktail is always inconsistent. Some visits it's excellent first time around other times I have to send it back and then its right. Last night was an off night for my Cosmos.  Dinner was very good, the prefix meal of 3 courses, (appetizer, entree and dessert), chosen was the 22 oz. T-Bone Steak, Caesar Salad and Pecan Pie was a smoking deal for $60. We also ordered the Tortilla Soup, Fresh Guacamole, Mussels & Chorizo, Kettle of Green Chili Pork and the Boneless Buttermilk Fried Chicken. All EXCELLENT!  Great place, private parking and easy to get to.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kettle of Green Chili Pork
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Boneless Buttermilk Fried Chicken
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mussels &amp; Chorizo

pnivH7oUqIGP13bBcEOMYg.text: Friendly service.  Meal was very slow to come out and when it did the chips that came the queso appetizer were awful.  Burnt and tasted like metal.   The $60 ribeye was not quality beef at all.  Both my husband and son were disappointed.  Very thin cuts of meat.  Not like a $60 ribeye should be.  My other son ordered the burger and his fries were inedible.  They were more like croutons. So tough, cold and stale.  Very disappointing.  Server was friendly he deserves more stars but food was subpar... won't be back.

hN3XT2pqyOy3Qg1nz8K8hA.text: An excellent place to have some wine and a great meal. The bar is open seating,  a good thing since the dining room was backed up. We were lucky and found a table in the bar.   We started off with a pre dinner drink of a manhattan. I believe it was in their happy hour menu so it was just $5. No appetizers for us this time.   Dinner was pork tenderloin with Street corn. The tenderloin was as the name implies; tender. And the street corn was very tasty. There was a glaze over everything that perfectly added to the meal. I've had this selection before and was glad they still had it on the menu.   Wine was a Zin called Klinker Blink.  That's a good selection.   It's a great place, but make reservations if you want a dinner table.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu

NLMf5CHpT7NPhUgHlfCmFg.text: So first let me say that we had the best server at Roaring Fork. Adam was absolutely amazing. Very attentive, great personality, had great recommendations and was knowledgeable about the menu. Overall very pleasant waiter.   To start, we ordered the queso con puerco as an appetizer. Let me tell you, my husband and I both agreed that it's the BEST queso we've had in Phoenix. It's queso with green chili pork and salsa verde and for whatever reason, this concoction is pure perfection. Like seriously.  Now on to our entrees....hubby pretty much knew what he wanted before we even arrived. He ordered the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin. It was tender, flavorful and cooked perfectly. The dish is actually pretty big. My husband ALWAYS eats all of his food; never any leftovers. He has a few pieces left over tonight!  I had the rainbow trout with almonds and green beans as the side that came with it. I was pleased. While it wasn't jaw dropping amazing, I still enjoyed my meal. We'll definitely be back and will request Adam. Thank you for a great dinner tonight Roaring Fork!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

hPXRJkzUVeuzct1IjRswIA.text: First time trying  the restaurant.  We made reservations  and was seated promptly.  We waited for our third  guest who was a little  late . This allowed  us to discuss  some business  . They were pushing  their  wine list . And appetizers.  My guest  ordered  a flat bread which was a little  soggy and salty probably  the cheese.  I tried their short ribs which was too saucy . The ribs were overcooked  not like what was promised.  They were slow is refilling our water. Finally tried their pecan pie . It was OK not great

s3KcirYw506jIlnUnz0PDA.text: Spent the weekend in Scottsdale and came across this one on Yelp, the ratings were high and so were our expectations. We were not disappointed, everything we tried was exceptional and our server was great. I couldn't help but notice the burgers heading into the bar area, although we enjoyed our seating in dinning area, we plan on returning for some of their happy hour deals.

UynnR9vTRtKmGfRxkKq65g.text: We were excited to try this, but unfortunately it did not hit the mark. Service was good, but we asked for some modification to the meal to eliminate sodium, and were less than pleased. The server basically said the chef was unable to be creative and find a way to add flavor to the salmon, the answer was it has pepper on it. We had suggested she likes spicy, and we got "it can have pepper". With the lack of creativity we switched to the steak and ordered asparagus, again we asked for spice and creativity, instead we got plain steak and steamed asparagus. What a let down...  The short ribs were good, but there was way too much horseradish in the mashed potatoes, and the cherry chutney was a weird accent.   We will not be back

p-8RChLBzyl6cisygAhvHQ.text: Disclaimer: I only went to the happy hour.  I live across Roaring Fork and have meaning to come here for a while now. I came with a couple of friends and was able to try a few options on the menu. The first thing I would say is that they don't skimp on happy hour foods. The portions are large and we were all definitely full when we left (and tipsy, but I'll talk more about that later).  Food we got: 1- Guac: Eh. Honestly, I've had better. For $7, it was a little expensive and not very worth it. I wouldn't recommend getting this.  2- Green Chili Pork: The pork was really tender and the flavors were pretty good. I wouldn't go back just for this, but if I were to go back, I would order it again. They give a really large amount of this and the jalepeno that came with it was just the right amount of spicy :) 3- Tortilla Soup: Another mediocre dish. However, it was exactly like what they described (with the rotisserie chicken, avocado and tortilla strips) so I guess there isn't anything to complain about. 4- Burger: This was good. From the reviews, I expected something amazing. However, it is great for the price and definitely filling. It was HUGE and the fries that came with it were also pretty good.  Drinks: Huckleberry Frozen Margarita: This was SO strong. I drank about 1/3 of my drink and gave up. I really appreciate the fact that they give you so much alcohol, but I really did not need that much.  Citrus Mojita: Eh. Not great. It wasn't citrus-y enough for me, but that may be just personal preference.   Overall, it was fine but I do want to try it for regular dinner one night because I have had friends give Roading Fork raving reviews.

kGHVKXwLjdcl7ZL9d6FrrA.text: We went here for my girlfriend's birthday and I was impressed!  I had the fried chicken and it was too die for!  However, the only thing I would advise anyone getting that would be to get the gravy on the side.  I had no idea they put the gravy over the chicken.  It made the batter a little soggy.  Other than that it was awesome!    Her dad got the ribeye steak which was so tender and flavorful!  Great service as well!

DmGOsH0nye-FYjniNukxuA.text: We liked this place, great social atmosphere and great food! My daughter and I enjoy the vibe of the bar when we went. Quick service too as it was very packed when we were there. Outside looked tempting but we were weak and settled for the Air conditioning.

AJpZlPRyhwTmo0nGF5jA5Q.text: Man , I hate doing this, but in True yelp fashion, I have to ding em HARD!   I never ding hard.  But this was a BAD EXPERIENCE!     Let me back up!?  We are in Phoenix for a weeklong vacation over the valentines day week and on holiday with me , my wife, mother and father - in law, we book this reso with OpenTable  for 4 and they get us hooked in.  All is well, we get a confirm phone call, my wife also calls and requests the patio for seating, asks about happy hour everything sounds awesome, we are all in.  All is confirmed.  I have 5 emails , 1 call and we are all set.   I thought, but remember VALENTINES DAY at 5pm IS A TOUGH NIGHT for restaurants, especially this one!.     Well this restaurant was something, here we go hold on kiddies, it may get rough from here on out so hold on.  We walk in, its not horribly busy, but they have 50 in the bar, fighting for seats, it looked like an old, retired, 4pm happy hour crowd, it was classic, all feeding on whatever was out there, it was a mosh pit of old people, retirees in Phoenix I assume.      So they seat us quick, very cordial, but the old lady behind the reservations system didnt know how to operate the computer so the NERVOUS Matre De or GM, whatever was instructing over her shoulder, whatever..new person at the desk..so we get seated and we are in a dark corner behind a pole.  At this point I go speak to the Matre De and ask if we can sit in the bar or on the patio.  Remind you, I reserved PATIO on the RESO.   He says NO, your reserved seating is inside here.   OK, what about giving us the happy hour pricing you promised us in our current seats.  NOPE.  No deal.   hmm...I go back to talk to my party, they are life lets leave.  I say let me talk to bumbles bly at the front computer, maybe she is in charge.  She has no clue, I told her if you cannot fix our seating, or honor your deal we got via the phone call to you less that a week ago, we are leaving!    Ok, BYE!    REALLY!   BYE!  Ok, we are off , as I walked into the parking lot with my $350 I had budgeted for this meal, I said to my wife, and her folks, they should call this place the ROARING F-YOU, it was deadpan, they were not amused!  We happily called a wonderful restaurant in Old Town Scottsdale, and I would totally recommend them as a 5 STAR!  Citizens Public House, they had a table waiting by the time we got there from ROARING F-YOU , and they were happy to see us.  I dont get it, the food smelled delicious, reviews were pretty stellar, we called talked, communicated, all was on, then a F-YOU and we dont care.  Is this Scottsdale Attitude I hear about, or just stupidity?    If I was the owner I would fire the GM, the door that night, or rethink my service standard.  Weak, I if I could have given them less than 1 star I would have given them a HALF star, place smelled delishious and I was ready to go off on the drinks and food.  Missed opportunity.  I would love a reply from management, maybe I missed something on there end.      Moving on.....I will not return.   BOooo...!  Hiss.....a big miss.....

50q6OR32uOsajs8J54Yu3w.text: Really liked this place. Great vibe, good service, good food. Docked one star be used of spotty food execution (one dish was way over cooked). Definitely will come back again.

KO_J97fusJXvCfFSG7aePQ.text: 5/5. Service was spot on. Food within 3 minutes of ordering. Short ribs were phenomenal. Will be back for sure

qm8bos64TBfCvQFnIP-A1A.text: The only thing I didn't like about this place was the portions (hence 4 stars). I could have eaten more but didn't want to spend more money than I already had. Other than that, the salmon was perfect, the button mushrooms were sauteed exquisitely and the overall experience was A+. Friendly, courteous staff helped with my nut allergies and the ambience was great for having a date. If you don't need supersize helpings and want a nice night out for a reasonable expense, I recommend Roaring Fork.

iU5XrG9wcFrwalV3t0Fktw.text: Absolutely incredible gem in Scottsdale. This is one of the local fan favorites. You better get there before they open if you want a seat for happy hour. This has to be my favorite place for a good steak and a glass of wine. It's obvious why this place still goes on strong when so many others around it close there doors. I've been a patron of Roaring Fork for 16 years and I hope to be for many more. Great job!!

t99tSAFgouzVxHmWeCUIZQ.text: I love this restaurant!  Great service and fantastic food!  Get the lamb chop Mexican fondue for a delicious appetizer and the trout with brown butter and capers was amazing!  My grandma always said, "If in doubt, order trout."  The other menu items are delicious also.  We will be back!

mGGYEZkCAYNAfc1z-ljwFQ.text: Happy hour was hopping today, unlike last week.  Bartender Ryan wasn't there, but no worries, as Stefan was just as able and gracious.  I selected the cab to go with the RF "Big Ass Burger," even though I wanted to try the zin.  Did I choose wrong?  I'll try the zin next time.  Since I enjoyed the chile-pistachio bread last week, I asked if I could have the commercially-made burger bun swapped out with the new-recipe chile-pecan bread.  No problem.  Ordered it medium, no pickles.  By the time I had thought to take photos of the burger (I was starving so I dug right in!), the scene was a mess!  From the very first slice, the longhorn cheddar-topped patty crumbled into many pieces- I kept wishing I had a spoon to scoop them up!  No matter, as it was still a wonderful meal- loved the smoked bacon, and the chipotle mayo worked well both as a burger condiment and as a dip for the wonderfully crisp and seasoned fries (see photos).  If only there are more happy hour meal selections (only two, excluding the salads) for me to enjoy.  Guess I'll be forced to try the Huckleberry bread pudding with creme anglaise and vanilla bean ice cream next time... woe is me ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crispy, seasoned fries!

VdimmuKGaX0HY5Imdf8Spw.text: Best Happy Hour in town!! The Green Pork Chili with the Hot Buttered Tortillas is quintessential Southwestern eating.  And the Huckleberry Margaritas are a must...$5 at HH!  The best deal is the Big Ass Burger, enough for two.    Sunday and Monday are the best days to go because it's all day Happy Hour so no crazy crowds!

psx9fKq5Jxolq-AOMCk38Q.text: The only bad thing about Roaring Fork is trying to find it and parking your car in a office building parking lot. Once you get inside everything is great, even if you end up sitting on the patio. I've taken a date there, gone to happy hour with the guys, and even treated the parents to a good steak. Green chile appetizer is unique and the Big Ass Burger is phenomenal. Beer and wine selection is fantastic, only draw back is I'm always too full for dessert.   TIP: Go on Monday's for all day happy hour!

nOlzO01-9DS5vXPJjw2dFg.text: Everything is perfect here, except you can't expect to get in for their happy hour, which makes it! We have done the restaurant and not sure why, but it doesn't measure up to the happy hour food. Still, a five star experience!

SCFoy3HsjakgXhGodBn6LQ.text: Went here for our 34 th anniversary. They sat us by the kitchen . I asked if we could move but the hostess said no. It was hot and noisy and made the special occasion not so special .   There were plenty of cooler empty tables during our dinner.

3i-XOxgqzO2WmdTn0UHqOg.text: Cool Spot in a Hot Town. What a hidden treasure. This place has atmosphere, great service and "big ass" food. The service was tremendous sitting at the bar. We ordered the Big Ass Burger and shared it because it was one "big ass" burger. Ceiling fans and misters keep you nice and cool on the patio in temperatures over 100. The bartenders are friendly and deliver great service.  The food is out of this world.  We recommend the BLT salad and Big Ass Burger. Stop by this restaurant to cool your heels and fill your belly.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar Area

mZdiB37JVZBX_C1j7YdO_g.text: Best happy hour in Scottsdale! Especially the green chile and pork wings! Good luck finding a table in the bar though.

TxSSdJx0wuspTS8Sg7U5XA.text: Green mac and cheese! GREEN MAC AND CHEESE! GREEN MAC AND CHEESE!!!  If you can only have one thing while you're there, you HAVE TO HAVE the green mac and cheese. I am a mac and cheese fanatic, and I was in love! It was perfectly cheesy and the bread crumb crust was perfectly toasted. I can't wait to find a reason to go back to Scottsdale to have it again.  Now, on the drive to the hotel, our driver recommended the "Big Ass Burger," which I didn't order, because it was literally a BIG ASS burger. It was the size of my ASS! I couldn't bring myself to do it.  Our group did order the spicy jack fondue with apples, yams (?) and the best crouton thingys ever! In addition to loving mac anc cheese, I love all things with cheese in them, so this was perfect.   Dinner - I had the filet mignon. Come on, it was on someone else's tab, I had to do it. It was a piece of meat and nothing else. It was cooked to perfection, so I was extremely happy.   Dessert, well the chocolate cake was meh. Even though it had chiles of some sort in it for southwestern flair. It was WAY TOO dense! I could only handle ONE bite, and that's saying something because I love sweets and could eat them all day long. The creme brulee was much better.  But get the Green Mac and Cheese!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

w5d9X6bEucNFv2kg9A_K1A.text: One of our favorite restaurants here in Scottsdale!  They have a nice southwestern take on a lot of dishes that are recognizable, but I appreciate that Roaring Fork puts their own spin on things.    They offer a lovely bread basket with hot rolls and mini cornbread muffins with soft, whipped butter--a nice way to start of the meal.  We haven't tried a lot of apps but highly recommend their flatbread chicken pizza, which can also work as a meal.  The cheese they use melts so well and creates a really creamy texture paired with moist, rotisserie chicken.  Delicious!    The Spinach Chicken Waldorf Salad is amazing!  The chicken they use is the spit-roasted chicken, which is juicy and flavorful.  The salad is incredibly large, especially for the price and contents, with a good mix of ingredients, texture, and flavors.  My husband is a fan of the flavors of the "Big Ass" burger as well as the Cedar-Planked Salmon.  The Sugar-Cured Duck Breast was cooked perfectly with a nice crispy skin and great flavors between the duck and the accompaniments.  Would also highly recommend the green chili macaroni and cheese; decadent, rich, and luxuriously creamy.   We had their seasonal pie, pecan, which was warm, rich, and deep in flavor, and they paired it with plenty of ice cream (because nothing cuts sweet like sweet!).

ZkApxzYaBVAQfWGd-jKwpA.text: Love this place! I brought guests from out-of-town and they also loved the happy hour menu. They wanted to return the next night but we made the fatal mistake of trying The Montauk instead. Huge mistake. Nice sunset view facing Camelback Mountain too. Great service from our waiter. Come here as often as you can and try everything on the happy hour menu. You'll love it too!

jtRpp7079rZ3XDMuVF6e5w.text: Not as good as hoped but better than many. The service here was great, the food looked amazing and flavor was good minus the tortilla soup which i would not recommend; looks pretty leaves the taste buds confused and wanting. I ordered the roasted half chicken. The chicken was a little dry,and the green beans a bit overcooked. I can't fault the seasoning of my dish and I liked their Mac and cheese. P.S. It was super busy best bet is to make a reservation

5sB1Uahrs_46UimQRjUECg.text: No wonder the Roaring Fork has lasted all these years in the tough, high-turnover restaurant market of Scottsdale. The service was fantastic. Our food was AMAZING. The trout is perhaps the finest fish meal any of us has ever had and the banana cream pie dessert was phenomenal. To top it off our server Dan was very fun and personable to put the cherry on the top of our experience. We will certainly be back!

N74DYJnkIecCMEEuOgjxAA.text: Amazing restaurant! They have an open kitchen concept and it's really neat to watch when they are busy. The staff was very friendly and very professional. I ordered the trout (which could have easily fed 2) and my coworker ordered another fish but blackened. Both were so delicious! Be sure to get an order of the Mexican corn on the side. Their dessert menu looked too good to pass up so we ended up with pecan pie (amazing but very rich) and some salted caramel gelato (yummmmmm)... will definitely be back if we're ever in the Scottsdale area again.

jJKiElH5RlzF3I3rqJ3mOg.text: I've been here before for dinner, but this time we stopped by for a early happy hour dinner.  I was thoroughly impressed.  The food, ambiance, and service was all top notch!  We stopped by yesterday and ordered a few drinks.  We then ordered the green chili stew, and fresh guacamole.  Then we ordered the big a$$ burger.  I ordered it medium rare and it was cooked to perfection.  They have an awesome happy hour and I would highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Perfection!
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Burger
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Green chili stew

RvPmHryaixMDkmHoawUPiA.text: This is our go to place when we don't feel like risking disappointment. Food is great, waitstaff is never rude or condescending, a rarity in Scottsdale, and it's rarely difficult to get a table.   I've never left this restaurant unhappy.

lBF8_g0p2eQ0Yco3y76leg.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants. It was my birthday so I wanted to go there! I love, love their rainbow trout. They start off, with small yeasty rolls, delish!  I of course ordered my fave, rainbow trout, with brown butter & toasted capers!  My husband ordered the short ribs, served with tomato jam & mashed potatoes. Excellent! The only thing I will tell u that my trout came with green beans, they do them very crisp. I asked the waitress to cook them well done? I mean soft, they turned out perfect!  A cheesecake was presented for my birthday, delicious! Thanks to Danielle our server, she was awesome!

hdpJqQfN30utYRB6vJJj0A.text: Great food and great service! Our server Sarah took great care of us during our dining experience even though we were only sitting at the bar high tops. She did an outstanding job at telling us the specials of the evening and we thoroughly enjoyed our meal.

KEalAn2VCNqTW4hxflteSQ.text: Unbelievable food. I had pork tenderloin and my friend had salmon. Beat ever. Sat at bar and bartender was amazing. Let us know when happy hour was ending so we could get drinks at cut price. Would go back.

GcoLWkocgHiPOlNDlPSDKA.text: Celebrated our anniversary. Nice table with a rose.  Food was great.  Steak melts in your mouth.  Mac and cheese awesome.  Loved everything.

65Rx-c9JxRrFRpg_8yLF3A.text: I went for happy hour and it was an overall great experience. The Lucky Star Pinot I got was stunning. The artichoke flatbread not so much, the cheese was too much. Our server was just OK only due to the fact that he dropped our drinks and went straight to a different table who sat after us to take their order when in fact we were ready. So they got their food before us. Not the biggest deal! Guacamole and Fish tacos were very good!

n3KmIdiZGVFWQT7rWZRRFQ.text: Enjoyed the enclosed outdoor atmosphere with the fire pits and lighted trees. The grilled fish tacos had a good size filet on each taco.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

xeVN8r5yZa1Ny8UbKUSK-g.text: Phenomenal HH menu from 4-10pm! Great, shaded outdoor patio with misting system. Older crowd (40's and 50's). Food was kind of roasted tex-mex style similar to Bandera.   Awesome selection of mixed cocktails such as mojitos, etc. highly recommended!

YnkK1Saf5IUrpKydmbUU_A.text: Absolutely fabulous! We visited for our anniversary.  Sat at bar for about an hour happy hour every day until Labor Day. Got the Green Chile Pork, was outstanding. George, the bar keep was very friendly and accommodating. We then made our way to our table where my wife was greeted with a rose and a card on the table for our anniversary.  I ordered the Chicken Rotisserie and my wife ordered the Trout. Both dishes were outstanding. We will definitely return!!

iJ3MoMZwbgWCDy6QJ9jdLg.text: Ok, the prices on the happy hour menu is kind of high to be happy about but the food is pretty solid.  The sliders are a bit weak - 2 per order, comes on a plate with some horseradish and aujus and fries.  The sliders themselves are actually small bits of sirloin meat.  With the sauce it was actually quite tasty.  The waiter kinda spilled au jus into the horseradish while delivering the plate which kinda made it look unappetizing but I'm glad we pushed through.  :P  The green chili pork is very good.  I like the hint of spice and large chunks of pork.  It comes with a couple of grilled tortillas.    We also tried the chicken flatbread which was a bit more oily than I thought it would be but the pesto flavor really comes through and the chicken bits on top were plenty.    The big ass burger was also delicious, however, a bit dry.  At $11 it really should be juicier.. afterall there are many ten dollar burger places one can go to in that area.  All in all, it's a decent spot for happy hours with friends.  The drinks are a bit weak and they charge $5 each.  There probably are some better spots but I would recommend trying at least sporadically.

wK1Yh3U-j1Kh6hwiKH34Nw.text: Came here last night with party of 8.  We have always liked this place and wanted to try their happy hour.  So did everyone else in Scottsdale!  Bar area was overflowing with people.  With some help from Amanda, a waitress, we got a table at 6 and proceeded to have an outstanding meal at a great price.  We ordered appetizers, Guacamole, and a flat bread, and several cocktails at $5 per drink.  For main courses we all,shared orders of filet mignon sliders, the big ass burger (appropriately named) and fish tacos.  Finished off sharing a slice of cheesecake and creme brulee. Everything we ate was outstanding and the value was terrific.  Drinks were also excellent. Best of all, Amanda, our waitress could not have been any better.  She treated us great, explaining offerings, recommending, displaying a lot of humor and personality etc.  I wish all wait people everywhere were like her.  Next trip to Scottsdale will include a stop at the Roaring Fork. For happy hour or a regular dinner it is a quality restaurant.

S36l-8A5dfxxD21kabgnkA.text: We were excited when we found Roaring Fork on Yelp. We were way more than satisfied with our meals. We had the pork chop, Cioppino, the half chicken, and carnitas. Everyone loved their dish. GREAT SERVICE!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Double Cut Pork Chop

4WWbuC0icecRreAC5wkDjg.text: Ate here while visiting the Scottsdale, AZ area celebrating my sister-in-law's 50th birthday.  I was under pressure to find a restaurant that all 10 in our party would like (including 2 children; ages 2 & 7).  I looked on Yelp and picked the Roaring Fork based on the reviews.   It's in an office building, but don't let the outside fool you.  It is very nice inside and looks like it would seat ~200 easily.  We went on a Monday evening about 6pm and we had about a 10 min wait without reservations.  I would recommend reservations for any weekend or for special occasions, I can see this place getting busy. The service was good and the food was excellent!! When you walk in you will notice chickens on the rotisserie straight ahead and the wonderful smell. 2 people had their "Big Ass Burgers" and said they were great.  2 people had their Ribeye and said they were cooked perfect and were very flavorful.  2 people had the rotisserie chicken (including myself) and it was yummy (the corn bread stuffing was the best).  1 had Braised Ribs and thought the BBQ sauce was sweet and tangy.  1 had Fish Tacos and enjoyed them, as well. Overall our entire group was very impressed with the amount and quality of our food.  Everything was well prepared and very tasty. Oh, and the mini corn muffins were delish too!!! Highly recommend!!!

836cG61iz6EvC9urThSowg.text: Great happy hour and great service!  Big A$$ burger was excellent - certainly enough to split between two. We'll be back for this when a burger craving arises. Pork sliders and chicken flatbread were very tasty too.  A bit of an older crowd upon the start of the 4pm happy hour (NOTHING wrong with that, simply noting).

tGGTka-2DPJVnRjeSWzyYQ.text: Stopped here the other night while in the old town area and I forgot just how good the food is.  I had the cedar plank salmon which was fabulous and a few people at our table had the fried chicken which is a whole chicken breast they debone and fry - delicious!  Definitely a return visit is in order
