cTpfghyzstxE0xLWlitvwA.text: Roaring Fork was the highlight of our Scottsdale vacation. Highly recommend !  The duck was fantastic. For me it's rarely done perfectly but RF nailed it. Juicy and perfectly cooked. The steak was also nicely (but not overly) seasoned. I've had a couple of overlooked medium rare steaks recently at top steakhouses so I was a little cautious. They got this one right.  Oh the sides: The Mac and cheese with chilies was spectacular. Get your carbs on. And the corn, soooo good.  Simplicity is good and RF made a straight forward menu really come to life. I will return....soon

NE27MlqSVSvzgM6ZoZX8EA.text: Went for my mom's 60th birthday, part of 4...awesome food and good service. I will go back!

lXJNLhoxryq-3ZlMadmlIQ.text: I've been here for the second time and it was very good as the first one.  There is a special dessert called rum cake with foster bananas that is just amazing!! I would recommend to match it with an Espresso Martini...yummy!!   The only negative point was about the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin: too dry and overcooked.  Anyway, this is still one of my favorite places!! :)

-YQm0VXVNZr7dZb_8HO3Jw.text: Love this place.  Service, ambience, cocktails and food.  Good energy throughout the restaurant, too.

rQNV4KfC4T_LjqOmjT39NA.text: Wow.  Our first visit.  Absolutely amazing food.  From flat bread appetizer to Caesar salad.  And each of 4 entrees. Incredible savory flavor.  Really haven't had an all in terrific experience like this in recent memory.  Zero disappointments.  And Mark our server was spot on!    Our compliments to the chef!!

zDWN_H5P0Ucz7f6jCoj3EQ.text: Happy Hour Haven in Scottsdale! Great restaurant with outstanding food and service. Spent some quality time with my spouse and we both loved the experience. They have Happy Hour seven days a week from 4-10 pm in the bar area. They have a tasty Huckleberry Martini that has a little kick! The must have meal is the appropriately named Big Ass Burger! It truly is big and tastes great! The filet mignon is top notch and reasonably priced. You can't go wrong with this place. Enjoy and you will thank me!

WxJaOc7F55HdiT4W_gtdhA.text: Last night I had my birthday at this place. First impression was a pretty nice ambience. It took at least 15 minutes for the server to come up and ask us for our drinks. Waiting another 20 minutes for the drinks come out before we can order any food. I order a margarita for $18  which said it has top shelf liquor. The server brought my drink out, the moment I picked the glass up, it broke into 2 pieces which I didn't even do anything to break it. The whole drink spilled all over my dress. My dress was completely soaked in margarita and all over the table. The server came and gave me some towels and cleaned up the mess. He said he would bring a new drink. After that, we finally can order food. Sitting there with my soaking wet dress on and waiting for another 30 minutes; the food still didn't make to the table. Finally, the food came. The food was good despite all the troubles and suffering I had gone through. At the end, I asked the server for some type of compensation since the glass shattered and spilled over me on my birthday day without my fault. He refused to give any discount, he said he only charged me for one drink. He did give me the free dessert since it was my birthday, but I don't believe the way this restaurant handled the situation was acceptable. It will be "best" and most memorable birthday so far. Thanks to Roaring Fork!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This is the second drink they brought out &#34;supposedly&#34; to make up for the first one broke and spilled all over me!

poS7awRJiQ9lrazT2-eGUA.text: Wow! What a cool atmosphere. And the food... My husband and I went here for date night and were blown away by the great service and unbelievable food. We ordered the lamb fondue appetizer unsure of what to expect and were pleasantly surprised-Our favorite part of the night. I had a Caesar salad and the bacon wrapped filet mignon served with mashed potatoes and asparagus while he ordered the tortilla soup and the ribeye with mashed potatoes and asparagus. Everything was delicious. Our steaks were cooked perfectly, and his ribeye had such great flavor. We definitely recommend this restaurant, and will be back. Thank you Matt for the recommendations, and the superb service.

WrJphNBG4GojMXVamRTSfQ.text: Had a great Happy Hour here. Guacamole, fish tacos and garden salad were all very tasty. All have been shown in pictures. Loved the grilled fish in the tacos and the quac was delicious.   $5 tasty wine a bonus. Got there about 4:30 Sunday and managed to get a seat inside. More seating options open on the patio, but it was a bit chilly. Alex, our lovely server was totally great!

VixVrAwJ6SxOGtJNrqP85A.text: My wife and I are in Scottsdale for spring training. We selected Roaring Fork based on Yelp reviews and our personal dining interests. Our experience met all of our expectations. We arrived on a Sunday evening without reservations. We were directed to the bar area by a very cordial hostess where seating was "first come first serve". We found a table and were given both the bar menu and the restaurant menu. Happy hour prices for both drinks and bar menu are all day on Sunday. We had a very delightful meal of a salad and appetizer selection of fish tacos and beef tenderloin sliders. Service was excellent as was the ambience of the facility. I highly recommend this venue.

VB6PCYiMoMW5N6SexRe2RQ.text: My uncle (who is old school Arizona) recommended last year. Loved their selection and preparation of a diverse menu. The big ass Burger is still perfectly prepared,  as well as it was a year ago. We tried other the grilled shrimp and grits, grilled half chicken, green chili bowl, and well, all of their happy hour selections. Their HH drink menu hits the spot with well prepared cocktails (perfect martinis and margaritas ) with a balancedbalanced wine and beer list. Thank you Roaring Fork, for not letting us down. Great service,  food and drink, thank you Uncle Bob for this gift!!

3nZ8RmGRMjgD5D1N_EWlEQ.text: The Roaring Fork is one of my very favorite restaurants.  I am not a big fan of the environment, particularly the patio and back rooms, but the food more than makes up for it.  The pork green chili served with warm tortillas is dreamy.  I also adore the huckleberry margaritas.  Can't go wrong.

oA_ZrKQa9uSDZ-6BGupSIw.text: I realized when I looked around...Happy Hour is the new "Early-Bird" Dinner...seniors galore...enjoying the happy hour prices and five dollar wine...yes there were a few True happiy hours like me...looking for the buzz of fun people and great good and drink...And yes I achieved the great food and drink...nice five dollar cab...and then yummy tortilla soup...very pleasant service...lots of activity...would like a more trendy crowd....

SzPliYRCfKYpYJkA5_H9UQ.text: Great food had the short rib and the pork tenderloin both amazing.

8HSBytbeZPMMzrpYMV2WYw.text: I gave roaring fork 3 stars because although it was expensive, I felt that the food was mediocre and the portions were small.  My friend's boyfriend is a chef there and she had recommended the restaurant.  I can't complain but it wasn't anything I'd write home about.  I will suggest the Dr. Pepper prime rib, It was excellent, very flavorful!

5X0eFrPQafOJSdxXQNO1_Q.text: Amazing service and food. We each had four different entrees that were unique and very favorable   Matt our server was the best at his craft that any of us has experienced

4jYtdOKK5RXbBDLj994qAg.text: I went to roaring fork for a Sunday night happy hour with my husband and had a great time.  I had a glass of wine $5 and my husband had a mojito $5.  We spilt the happy hour cheese burger and guacamole, both were yummy, but we regretted not ordering the happy hour rotisserie chicken. It looked delicious and was a nice sized portion! I'm definitely going to go back and give it a try.  You have to sit at the bar to get the happy hour prices, but the ambiance there is just as nice as sitting in the main portion of the restaurant and the service was still very attentive.

h9_ykP1BKwT5SZbMYFmGrA.text: 4.5  there is a SLIGHT reason why i give this place a 4.5... it would have easily been a 5 had the trout i had ordered had a side of rice or veggies on the side. you wouldn't believe HOW BIG the fish was...  anyways...  prior to roaring fork, i went online and decided to scope out the menu and noticed that there were 3 other restaurants by the same owner. so i called and asked what the main difference was... the other 2 places focused primarily on meat/seafood while roaring fork had both. why not enjoy the variety?  we started off with an upbeat, easygoing server. very easy to please with lots of suggestions.... we ended up ordering a side of GREEN CHILI MAC AND CHEESE and my gosh,that mac and cheese blew me away. soo soo damn GOOD.. i would have easily ordered it as an entree and took it to go had they had it on their menu....for $7, that was  no goner! :P  he ordered the $23 some INFAMOUS "DR PEPPER" BABY BACK RIBS.. with fries on the side... the fries on the side kinda killed it, but who is it say that it is not an american place to be...  good choice... it was def a nice size... i may be a meat eater but when one orders meat, i tend to go the other way and order fish.... never tried a "RAINBOW trout" so i figured that i should be adventurous. for $19, which is a steal, was OH SOO GOOD but that is where my experience went wrong. had they had a side of grilled veggies or rice, it would have been a 5 star experience. EASILY! it was too salty that i left a few bites in between and took it home... it was sauteed with roasted almonds and you wouldn't believe how tasty it was!!!   anyhoo, the portions were quite generous and im definitely stoked that i came here for dinner and oh, not to mention, kudos to playin the USC game!! and yes, the trojans did win! :)  RF also has happy hours and if i was a local, i would totally hit this place up... for the young ins, the crowd is quite ... hmm, what's the word? more of an older crowd, from mid 40s and up, and business casual attire is quite appropriate... but don't let that ruin your experience here...  valet parking is comp and nonetheless, because this place is located in a businessy district, parking is not a problem...  in fact, it felt like irvine, for those who are familiar with so cal.  if the trout had the sides i wanted, i would be a happy camper... i still am, but i didnt really get to enjoy my food.. :( maybe next time RF will hook me up? blah... my next visit to AZ perhaps? atmosphere/service great.. thanks RF!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. trout
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. ribs

2H2lYgu-FIGvmiwfI8e2eA.text: Came here for dinner. Had recommendations from local. They also know the manager of the restaurant. Service was a bit slow even at 8.30pm but the food was worth the wait.  The appetizer or starter was the green chili. It had a little bit of a spice to it and it was hot. That's a good sign. I ordered the beef tacos and those things were GOOD!  The beef in the tacos reminded me of pot roast. It was hard to eat the whole taco at once, so you'll have to eat some of the beef of and then you can fold it up and eat it like a taco. There was also some rice with cilantro and that was bland and sort of dry.   My boyfriend had the buttermilk fried chicken. The chicken was sort of dry and kind of salty. The only way it was saved was with the gravy and the mash potatoes. The mash potatoes were GOOD!  Would have had dessert, but I was stuffed after eating the tacos.

MDnXVQSxw-WdvQpsDyIe3Q.text: This might be my favorite restaurant in Arizona. Their green chili pork is to die for. Their bar scene is so cozy and relaxed. The service is great. The happy hour is awesome.

8CHuDCztxFGNLSpJWhUr6A.text: Does anyone else think that writing these multiple reviews makes you tougher and tougher to please?  Am I being tough or is it that all these restaurants seem so much alike?  I liked this restaurant.  The food was good.  The waiter, Kevin, was great.  But, geezuz, I didn't think there was really anything special about it.  I guess it will go into my "count on them for consistency" file more so than my "new and different" file.

uU6OUDh4ncDwgq-89WoatA.text: Went there for a family B-Day celebration and thought it was fine.  Our server did a great job.  She checked in just the right amount of times, not overbearing and didn't disappear either.  As for the food: the roasted chicken flat-bread was a nice starter, Salad was good and fish tacos were well prepared, not too heavy and tasty. For all of that I would have easily given Roaring Fork 4 stars.  The reason I didn't is that their restroom was an absolute disaster. Yes, its connected with the office building above the restaurant but that is still no excuse. And when I write, "disaster" what I really mean is "disgusting".  I won't go into detail other than to say, I rarely even notice a restaurant's restroom facilities and have never written a word about one.  But given the amount of business that Roaring Fork does and the amount of money being spent nightly in this place, these guys really need to stretch the budget to get this facility serviced every hour or so to make sure its clean and reflects the standards of the restaurant overall.

ubeG4GUxwcswTXwtWcHOJw.text: Roaring Fork, oh Roaring Fork.  How do I love thee?  Let me counts the ways....  1.....  Okay, I guess I don't really love you.  But I do like you, okay?   First off, what an interesting location.  I could have been killed getting in the parking lot.  I had a reservation for 8:30.  No, my table wasn't ready at 8:30.  I found that very interesting because there was no one waiting in the lobby.  And wouldn't you know, they seated me by the kitchen.  Okay, folks, I know how long your food was sitting there Friday night and it's not pretty.  Their staff is like a bunch of crazy lunatics, but that's okay.  I opted for the Huckleberry Margarita, nice but nothing to write home about.  Doesn't begin to compare with Roy's signature drink, but that's for another review.  The bread basket was full of unhealthy little taste treats, I especially liked the bacon & cornmeal bombs and the buttermilk, bacon, artery cloggers.  Yum, yum, even better slathered in chipotle honey butter.  My salad was great, I opted for the wild greens disguised as the iceberg wedge.  I'm a red meat girl, so I had the 8 oz. center cut filet mignon.  Eight is too much for any girl, so I was unable to finish.  But I did order it medium and since it was barely medium rare, I did have to send it back.  Luckily, I was close to the kitchen, so the re-cook didn't take long.  The flavor of the meat wasn't really remarkable, but satisfactory.  The green chile Mac 'n' Cheese is a really great idea and something that I will try to duplicate at home.  If any of you yelpers have the recipe, I would be interested in it.  Now, I'm thinking that since I didn't finish my steak, my server deemed me not worthy of a dessert, it wasn't even offered!  But that's okay, I guess I didn't really need it.  All in all, pleasant, but nothing to write home about.

vTbwoM3705dy8JIxyixOGg.text: I came here for happy hour and left a happy camper. Everything on the menu sounded great and we finally decided on the queso con carnitas and the big ass burger. The appetizer was very flavorful the only thing I didn't like is that there was more meat than queso so it was kind of hard to eat. The big ass burger was the best burger I have ever had. It came with chipotle mayo that wasn't very flavorful but the burger didn't need anything added on to it. The meat was amazing and melted in your mouth. I ate half of the burger and was full for the rest of the night.

VuygnyL6H6xO3LoY9EO3EA.text: How does a fork roar? There is a certain zen quality to that question, much like the ever popular "if a tree falls, yada-yada" (I know, it's not really yada-yada, but you get the idea). I have been to several restaurants lately named with utensil based nomenclature, or named after the place in which the meal was prepared (Kitchen, Wok, etc.).  I fully expect that trend to continue, but I think it shows a certain lack of imagination. Sometimes that can be helpful, like "Jimmy's BBQ Pit"...I know it's likely to be BBQ.  Simply "Jimmy's Pit" or "Jimmy's" or "Pit" wouldn't be helpful (well, "Pit" might tell you avoid the place). But generally, I like a little romance in the naming...a little something to pique my interest (having said that I still think the food at Hooters is just not up to the name, but that's a discussion for another time). The Beautiful Carin and I headed over to the Roaring Fork for Happy Hour a couple of nights ago and spent a lovely evening at the bar with Clark, the bartender/server/happy hour ambassador.  The bar is the place to have a happy hour dinner and couple of cocktails. Tables are fine, but the bar is just a better atmosphere!  We hadn't been back for happy hour since Bob McGrath sold the place, but it really hasn't changed (which is a good thing!!). All of our favorites are still solidly on the menu, and the Big Ass Burger is still riding tall at the Roaring Fork Happy Hour!  We started with the green chile pork stew and scotch (why yes, they do have one of my favorites...Bunnahabhain...that always puts me in a good mood!). I had the Big Ass Burger... it truly is a big ass burger and really tasty...it's not Kobe beef, it's just beef, but good beef, cooked correctly! Carin had the Roasted Chicken which was also really well prepared...crispy skin, moist and flavorful! We couldn't begin to eat it all, so DeeDee was delighted with us when we got home:) For the capper, they have started making their own pies, in their wood fired oven. You know what's better than chocolate pecan pie in homemade crust (yeah baby, none of the store bought crap for these Roaring Forkers)...almost nothing! Sex, that's about it. Jeez, I waddled out of there, $50 lighter, but that's a hell of a meal for $50, (including a couple of single malts, a marti and dessert)! So, how does a fork roar?  It roars for thee my friend, it roars for thee.

5WD11V1gOUj8YbAT9MwrJQ.text: Thanks to Donald S for organizing a UYE happy hour!  So glad I came back.  Dawn took care of our group last night and did a fantastic job!  The manager even stopped by and chatted with us about Yelp.  Will definitely return!

ll03oRUWykBGU1tnkc4qPA.text: This place had great food and fun atmosphere. I ordered the watermelon salad and fish tacos. So good!

Gp0Bi4th5M3D6uBLEM2dJA.text: 5 stars for the excellent service and delicious food! Everything we had was great but the one thing that stood out for me was the Green Chile Mac 'N Cheese!! Thanks to all previous yelpers for this recommendation! : ) Neither the green chile nor the cheese was overpowering but with each bite, there was definitely a "kick" to it!  YUMMY!!!!  I am now on a mission to get that recipe!!! : )

B467kNv1WwSQBJlKJRmdYA.text: The absolute highest creativity and quality you'll find in Scottsdale.  All the regular items are wonderful and the rotating dishes like the BLT salad are outstanding.  The ribs - YES.  The barbequed chicken - OH YEAH.  The green chile mac and cheese - HMMMM.  In the dining room or bar (best deals), you'll love it.

cxRTuqudCquRatJOFzzlgg.text: I have eaten at roaring fork twice.  Both times when I was done I felt like I over paid and under enjoyed.  This is partly because of me I am sure.  I go there thinking it is a steakhouse and it is not.  They do have steak but the menu is more eclectic.  You could say it is a very Arizona menu, which I like but I think it is too pricy for that level of food.  Service has always been just ok as well.  I don't expect glorious service but I do expect more returns to the table and service with a smile.  My suggestion would be, don't go here for a big steak dinner and expect a little less service than you are accustomed to in scottsdale.

Svd-X_qY0a3miYjSJa8QSg.text: All night happy hour?! Yep! Can't beat it! In addition to their normal happy hour during the week, they also extend it to all day Sunday and Monday. The only downside is its only in the bar and front patio, but hey for that deal you can make it work.  I got the green chili pork stew on the recommendation of the waiter. It comes with a side of warm tortillas and is the perfect size for a filling meal without feeling stuffed. The pork was delicious and cooked perfectly. The cheese topping and the extra zing from the chilis made this absolutely delectable. Definitely a must try!   If you want a go to place that always has great food, great service, and good atmosphere this is your place. Will definitely be back....again.

2Sn1vQGbmkviY0uT6PAKpg.text: Great food, love the trout and mashed potatoes! I've never had a bad meal here. Plus the service has always been excellent!

N4VRG9KmtcD8lp0Sg65gow.text: Food was excellent as was the service. I was slightly disappointed by the wine as they had to pop open a 2nd bottle due to the first one tasting a bit off.  Still, I will go back.

30_hnoUAVmXa0hdxzDENyQ.text: Walked in and loved the ambience. Didn't make reservation but was seated quickly. Service was great and friendly. Ordered queso con puerco for appetizer and it was mouth watering, would highly recommend. Fiance ordered the big ass burger and I ordered the bacon wrapped tenderloin and both were delicious. Pretty much all food was great. Would definitely come back with friends.

u-AKouv3ELlzGDyGgyJl_w.text: Amazing happy hour!!!! Great food every single time and excellent staff! Love it.

ObAPmabnffaLLNyMXjFKRw.text: Lovely. Awesome. Great. Need I say more???  Had their fish tacos last night and they were amazing. And only $10 during happy hour. Great bar, atmosphere, food. Love this place. Oh, and great cocktails too!!!  They are running a special for Labor Day, buy one dinner, get one free. You can't beat that!  All of their food is fantastic.

kDoKlwQ8uZOWTY-pM4b5-g.text: Wow!  The staff was attentive and friendly. The server was excited to share his input and help make an informed decision. The food was unreal!!! We had green chile kettle with tortillas.. It was amazing!!! We tried the restaurant week menu and had oven roast shrimp and grits with bacon. So so good. My gf had half a rotisserie chicken with corn bread stuffing and I had almond crusted rainbow trout. We could not stop eating!! This place is a must visit!! Don't miss out. The prices are decent too because the quality of the food and service is so un-parrelled it is rare.  Loved it.

sSB7kvw7P4KR_TyTgEQS_g.text: Terrific spot - recommend reservations if you can.  We had a group of 7 and figured we would be fine on a Monday night but only the manager's creative efforts got us in pretty quickly.  Great steaks were had by all and the BLT wedge was fantastic.  For the appetizers, try the pork burritos - those were terrific.    As many others stated, the green chile mac and cheese and the mexican street corn are both great for side dishes.    The servers and wait staff were very very good and the vibe of the restaurant overall created a nice scene.    It won't be a miss, I promise.

FZbczsXEpL5kqgt4f6-APg.text: Yep, the "Big Ass" Burger lived up to its name. Hard to finish (even without the bun). Sat at the bar, pleasantly surprised to enjoy all-night happy hour on a Monday night. (Sunday nights too!). $5 for a lovely glass of wine. Heck, I'll have two!  Bartenders were great -- busy and attentive. Bar is popular with locals. Outdoor seating area looked pleasant and popular too.  Not exactly a "sports bar" but two TVs over the bar did the trick for us to watch a game and have a great meal and drinks.

cmGaj7lhSN_OoErP8hKbuw.text: Incredible food, and impeccable service.  We came here for dinner the last night we were in town, and were blown away by the attention to detail.  Our server was incredible and very helpful with regard to my partner's food allergies.  As others said, it is definitely a little difficult to find, especially if you are not familiar with the area, but we will definitely return once we move to the area!

l1Hedo_ulrwXZg6VuXOxnw.text: Roaring Forks is one of the best restaurants I've been to in a while. A couple friends took me here to celebrate my birthday. For appetizers, we decided on the green chile pork which is served with tortillas and pork wings served with vegetables and a Dr. Pepper BBQ sauce. The green chili pork was flavorful and had a little spice to it but it was not overwhelming. I didn't really know what to expect with the pork wings but they took me by surprise. They were very tasty and tender. The Dr. Pepper BBQ sauce was just icing on the cake. For dinner, I had the buttermilk fried chicken breast with mashed potatoes. The skin was a nice golden brown with a crunch and the chicken breast itself was juicy. I believe they used red potatoes for the mashed potatoes and gravy. The mashed potatoes were good but didn't blow me away. But then again they are just mashed potatoes. I also had a huckleberry margarita to compliment my meal.

Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

MjvySTx529lciJvJSo-XFg.text: This place is a modestly priced restaurant with great  quality and great atmosphere.  We had the green chili pork stew as an appetizer.  It comes with warm tortillas and sorrento peppers.  Incredible.  Our group had the pork carnitas, the pork loin, and the halibut.  We all shared the green chili mac and cheese.  Needless to say, we went away full and extremely satisfied.  The waitstaff was great.  I would recommend a trip to Scottsdale to check this place out.

vAZ5BtBZQNhZNwZX7W-Omw.text: Let's start with the positive, which begins about an hour after we sat in the bar area - the Big Ass Burger is big and delicious.  Now to the rest:  We ordered the Green Chile Pork appetizer after asking our waiter to help us decide between that and the guacamole and queso.  We take our time ordering dinner because we have an appetizer coming - except that we don't.  When it becomes clear it isn't arriving we start eyeing the kitchen for signs of our dinner.    Our meal shows up much later than our leisurely ordering would have dictated and we advise our waiter not to bring the Green Chile Pork. He responds "You didn't get that?"  I was thinking, "you helped us order it but you didn't bring it, you didn't arrange for it to be brought, and you certainly didn't clear it from our table prior to serving our entrees and still you seem surprised."  But because I am on a sarcasm control regimen I just said, "No, we didn't."  Two of us ordered fish tacos which were very tasty but 4 of the six tacos across the two plates served were extremely undercooked.  We are not afraid of fish a bit under temperature but this was well below that.    On the plus side the manager stopped by to apologize.  On the minus side he was unaware that both orders were off.  Plus - he recovered quickly and graciously said he was buying our drinks.  Minus - he comped less than half the drinks.  We were a party of 4 and none of us ordered another drink after his offer so our drinks were fully accounted for on our bill at the time and we were not trying to take advantage. Perhaps he comped just the drinks of the two who ordered the tacos but the meal was interrupted for all as we waited for the re-fire.  On to dessert.  Plus - the good and hot coffee came quickly and the chocolate infused pecan pie was delicious.  Minus - the pecan pie was very small and we were again craning our necks toward the kitchen looking for clues to its arrival as it was served well after the coffee.  Had the tacos been served correctly the first time the taste and quality of the food would have tipped this over to a 3 star review.  The food was really very good but difficult to enjoy when the overall meal was so poorly managed.  We are divided about a return visit.

tV2K2qi-QbfX95cB83XwmA.text: One of the best happy hours in Scottsdale - great food and drink specials...just gotta get here early to grab a spot.  Fun for a Friday happy hour to jump start your weekend or a nice romantic dinner for two with your sweetie.  You can't go wrong with the Roaring Fork.  Oh - and their brasied short ribs are to die for...

p8PrrDWUdZWHxY_rrMxu2w.text: Good food, decent price and a southwestern atmosphere.   The food is decidedly better than the decor, but then again I've never been big on the southwestern look. Something about Antlers above my head while I'm trying to have a romantic night out with the lady just doesn't cut it for me.   I (like most everyone else) recommend the big ass burger. You can't go wrong with their side of mac and cheese either and I recommend giving it a go regardless of how much you fill yourself with all their other delicious entrees.

Pcd5noVjmfmcbks_0urYpg.text: Based on the Roaring Fork happy hour last night, I had to update my review, and it was another 5 star experience for sure.  I met my boyfriend there around 6pm, and we waited just about 10 minutes until two seats opened up at the bar... The entire bar area was packed though - it's no secret how fantastic the happy hour prices are at RF!  The bar service was perfect - (thanks Ryan) and for a total of $33 before tip, we walked out full from the following: -a glass of Cab Sauv ($5) -a field greens salad with fresh beets, apples, candied walnuts and goat cheese ($5) -fish tacos that came with avocado, tomato, lettuce, salsa ($7) -a half roasted chicken that came with beans, tortillas, avocado, and additional garnish ($12)   We were completely satisfied, ambiance was fun (we made friends with our neighbors on either side), and food was phenomenal!    Helpful hint we were told for next time - if you order the salad and ask them to split it in the kitchen, they will put a full goat cheese fritter on both plates!  We're already planning to order that way next time!  Thanks for another fantastic meal, Roaring Fork - see you again soon!

MLWtx9sDZMJlyUlMDunq8Q.text: Had a great time here last night, despite there being no Valet for some reason? Anyway, this is a great place to bring out-of-towners, it has a chic southwest feel, while remaining upscale and impressive.   The spicy shrimp appetizer was perfect, salad was crisp and fresh, my chicken was succulent, and a guest had the "Big Ass Burger" - which is a Roaring Fork tradition.  Highly recommend this to people visiting the Scottsdale area. (avoid the patio in the summer when you book your reservations) Three of us paid about $100 total for dinner with 1 drink each :)

I5gsINoj_HN4yNwUkhl3Tw.text: Subpar food - flatbread appetizer was dry, BLT salad was excessively smokey in flavor and the hostesses were really unfriendly. We requested a booth with our reservation but when we got there they said there wasn't one available. When taking us to our table we walked by 4-5 open booths and we asked to be seated at one of them but was told they're for parties greater than 4 (mind you they were set for four) However we saw ALL the booths later sat with parties of four! Won't be returning.

bb0WKVXr208LSJchBEzhNw.text: The service was great and the food was delicous. I highly recommend the green chili appetizer, it was incredible. Also the little cornbread type muffins in breadbasket, they could have been just my meal they were so tasty! If you have a bigger party on a weekend I would get a reservation. We just had two and they were able to slip us in, but we only had an hour at thr table - which was plenty of time to get our food and enjoy every bite!

-TDE2jgeOlzcPUTUpVWH2w.text: There is very little here that is mediocre. The drinks and service are very good. The food is awesome. We've come here 2 times for company outings and they have been extremely accommodating.   The margaritas and old fashions are made perfectly. The green chile pork appetizer is to die for (yes, everyone is right... ask for extra tortillas). My favorite entrees have been the short ribs and ribeye. I've tried a little of everything, however, and it's all very tasty.   The deserts could be better. I only really like the creme brule, which is hard to mess up, and they make a good one. The strawberries are a nice touch. I wish the bread pudding was better... it is quite bland/boring.

627NpvwE3wE2RSdAyCgEFQ.text: Awesome experience!!!  I decided to bring my gf for our 1 year anniversary.  We decided to try two items and split both (as usual, so we can try more lol).  The food was excellent and cooked to perfection!  I was shocked to to find that after an appetizer, two entrees, 2 drinks and a dessert, came out to less than $100!!!  Great value for the quality of food!  To top it all off, since it was our anniversary, they gave us a free dessert, a rose and a sweet card signed by all the staff.  It's those nice little things that take their customer service to the next level.  So, delicious food, great prices and very polite service in a nice atmosphere.  We will be back coming back again and again!

_UInI69bijyZxNrpZTq4dQ.text: I've been in here a few times. The food never disappoints. The regular patio is amazing - not the happy hour patio. If you want happy hour prices, you have to sit at the bar or the happy hour patio which is cramped. But, outside of that, I'll keep returning. I think it could be a little more affordable, but for the part of town and it's popularity, I suppose it's fine.

qsx1m4-q9LDd2q8FgW4H-Q.text: If you're looking for a great deal on a fabulous steak, try the 3 course porterhouse special (look for a menu insert).  So much food, but so good.  Cheesecake desert was special - not too rich nor too sweet - with the berries to make it a little tart.  Service was exceptional - Madison is amazing. Spectacular dinner experience with my co-workers. I'll be back.

hDKGY2bOTXxs4AQUT6uF_A.text: Always great to see George Jett! Happy Hour food and drinks are fabulous. Bar top is always busy, first come first served. Bartenders do very well directing the flow of traffic. We always mention the "Roaring Fork" and highly recommend it.

ChCH_oStLGH6jpiKplITkw.text: This place rocks! Consistently great food, low prices, ( but I only eat here during happy hour), Excellent bar counter service from  happy people. One of my all time favorites!

8ArDbrfORj_4PKlSGt-JFw.text: I have eaten here twice and have been thrilled both times. The food was outstanding in the service was great. It's right in the middle of Scottsdale and very convenient to my home. Give them a try I don't think you will be dissatisfied.

HGPVeCgbbh0yG0k0TVN_6w.text: Ohhh my goodness, the chorizo with muscles app is freaking amazing!!! Now the filet on the other hand perfectly paired with a Franciscan Cabernet. The Best cut of meat in Phoenix...

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This is the muscles with Chorizo!! Oh my goodness gracious what an awesome and taste filled fare!!!

eQzz5kBYIiTZLfSipAPSbw.text: Best place in town for happy hour hands down.  Get there early for a seat. They fill up super fast. I've tried almost all the menue as i frequent often and have never been dissapointed. I was in the service industry for over 10 years and this place runs at a high pace with no hiccups. Bar staff is outstanding.  Derek, George, Christian, Mark and Ace are the best in the business behind the bar.

DWSdpqnmD1cQ2TlSLjzf2g.text: We decided to come here because of the good reviews. We had their prefix meal, bacon wrapped filet mignon with creme brulee for dessert. We had a side of their Mac n cheese and I have to say that their green chili Mac n cheese is by far the best Mac n cheese I've ever had.

Q7DIb26p1xx89yKGbvbawA.text: This is more about service, courtesy, and ambiance.  We had reservations through Open Table and requested a booth as we were celebrating a special occasion for just the two of us.  When we arrived at 4:55 for 5:00 pm reservations, we were informed at the podium that seating doesn't start until 5:00 and were requested to wait 5 minutes.  Another couple walked in after us at 4:58 for 5:00 reservations as well and they too were informed the same and were specifically requested to wait 2 minutes.  When we were escorted to our table at 5:01, I was surprised that there was no one seated on that side of the restaurant, so what gives?  Do they really need to have customers wait for tables that were obviously ready for seating? Poor customer service as there was little to no available seating in the entry, making guests stand for not only those with reservations but also those without. How ridiculous!  As we were escorted to a table, not a booth, I noticed also the chairs have wooden slats on the back and we have medical issues which is why we always request a booth and we brought this up with the maitre d'. We motioned to the booth which was set up for 4 and asked if we could be seated there instead.  He disappeared and returned and said he wasn't able to accommodate.  We requested the manager and explained our situation, including the special celebration.  The manager returned a few minutes later and in spite of our medical issues and the event we were celebrating, this manager was hope-less and help-less.  His explanation was that the Open Table reservation didn't specify a booth which was upsetting to both of us, especially since our comfort would be greatly compromised.  Given the time of the evening, we agreed to sit at the table with punishing chairs and ordered cocktails.  We, at that point, finished our cocktails and told our waiter that we weren't able to stay.  Their consolation was that drinks were on the house.  Big deal!  So now where do we go for our celebration?  We called Durant's in Phoenix and they happily took our reservation for 6 p.m.  We enjoyed ourselves, although not in a booth obviously on such short notice, but in very comfortably padded chairs.  We had a great dinner, better than the one we're sure we would've had if we stayed at the Roaring Fork.  By the way, this wasn't our first visit.  We were at the Roaring Fork on the same date last year once again for a special celebration and we were seated in the rear part of the restaurant.  While we were there this time, we were offered that same seating but we declined because of the acoustics and conversations carried over the space become very loud and once again made our experience miserable.  The Roaring Fork is nothing to roar about and if you're planning a special occasion, it would be best to take it to Durant's, with excellent customer service and the menu and food is unbelievably delicious.  So much so, that while we were there, we booked our Valentine's Day reservation as well.  In summary, Roaring Fork, "Thanks for Nothing!"  We will never return to your establishment and will make sure others will know of our dissatisfaction with the lousy customer service, courtesy and ambiance, with no less the care and consideration for those with medical issues. The one star rating is only because this review can't be posted without one.

c_RAWdsuGwIzs6R0wR1VZA.text: Came here with my love for the first time tonight. We ordered the fried chicken and the pork carnitas, both of which were delicious. Although the food was great, and the atmosphere was enjoyable, the food was somewhat overpriced. However, the man who filled our waters (which were never empty!) and bussed the table was outstanding -- he gets 5 stars!!

neHyJbN6jfARaEbPLKuxtA.text: First time there and it didn't disappoint, except maybe for the service a little bit. But the food was fantastic. Appetizers were good, entrees were really good and the desserts were probably the best. I would definitely recommend going.

yZbIu8QyTo_09dehEh4EuA.text: We came here for NYE to enjoy a nice dinner with friends and it turned out to be a great evening! We started out with white wine and some whiskey which were both good! We then got oysters and chorizo, green chili pork, and fondue. The oysters were amazing! Add a bit of chorizo to your bite and your mouth was in heaven. The best part of the entire meal was the  green chili pork! WOW!! I think I might get a to-go order of it and get it right now for dinner! My main meal was below average. I got the carnitas tacos and was pretty disappointed and the lack of flavor but the appetizers made the entire dinner worth it. The Mexican Street corn and Mac and Cheese was also excellent!!! Thanks for the great service on NYE, we will be back!

ntyV8AgtLSQriAujXTCiXQ.text: Best happy hour ever!  Generous portions and fun drink specials.

cejnpxM4Ulv3fuwNUqFgFQ.text: Had a great experience with a small wedge salad and chicken. just what i was craving and left so taken care of after a 12 hour day. great ambiance and perfect portion size. and thats just the bar food. cant wait to go for a dinner.

HzujbJE-32SXho5k9ibD0A.text: The atmosphere of this place was really nice- classic American west. It was a large place but was very crowded when we went on a Wednesday night-- so I'd probably make a reservation ahead of time (we did for 3 people). I had the porkchop and mixed green salad and it was delicious! This would be a great place to celebrate a birthday or go on a nice date. Kind of expensive for just quick food.

Ke7UYkh_8ntPL4woLguskA.text: One of the best dining experiences I've had in the Valley! Great service & exceptional food and drinks. Do yourself a favor & give it a try or revisit it if you haven't been in  a while!

qEStpJgsRGHGYmyH6QI4Dw.text: I really like the ambience! It's kind of a hidden treasure really. The "Big Ass Burger" -it's actually what it's called- was a hit! I had the Waldorf salad and it was tasty. Nice for a quiet evening with a significant other; cozy.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. &#34;Big Ass Burger&#34; minus the tomatoes and onion though.

mo7v48fPm98a0Nrm-D7k9Q.text: I went to this place two night in a row. The first night was with a party of 32 people. I had the beef braised short rib. It was delicious. The flavor profile was out of out of the world. The macaroni and cheese with the green peppers, was the best mac n cheese I've ever had.  The second night I went it was with a party of 6. I had the bacon wrapped pork loin, cheesy grits, and I'm not going to lie the mac n cheese. The pork was cooked perfectly and paired well with the grits and the basalmic reduction. The mac n cheese was even better. This time it had bread crumbs and parmesan cheese on top before it went under the broiler.  Both nights the restaurant was super packed, bit you didn't en notice because the wait staff was on top of their game.  I highly recommend trying this place if you are in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped pork loin on cheesy grits with basalmic reduction.
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Big ass burger...really it&#39;s what it&#39;s called
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu

lgAnKw-8oMZX219PBio1Fw.text: This place was amazing! Best food I had in a long time, hands down. I'll be back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qVFInxHAWZoFRPG3sEJR6Q.text: 5 stars all the way!! We come here for special occasions, and they never disappoint. With a note on the table wishing us the best for what ever occasion we come in for, wether it be birthday or anniversary. They know how to make it special. The drinks, food, service is awesome! It's our go to place for birthdays and anniversaries.

4175QsrfH1l7xlBXcP6Kkg.text: Wow. Very cool place. The food was very good. Service was excellent.  Very old clientele though. I would even go as far as to say elderly. Had to wait to talk to the hostess for a full 5 minutes wile she explained to some old geezer where to sit. That was probably the only negative of the place is that the girl at the front desk was busy answering the phone and talking to the confused old people while others had to wait. Should have two or three people to help when you walk in.

FRhy7bx0vIRNqXFV4cJJXA.text: What a great place.  Really nice ambiance and the food was amazing.  I had the pork shoulder carne asada and it was simply divine.  The salads were also very succulent.  The green chile mac n cheese was so good I wanted to lick the bowl (but was afraid to with the upscale scottsdale elite in the vicinity).  To top it all off, we had the pecan pie with an scoop of ice cream that made our pallets melt with enjoyment.  The only thing better than all this was the service from the amazing "Amanda M" whom I now henceforth refer to as Amanda the Magnificent.  She is beautiful, classy, and very attentive, and she makes the place one to remember, and one in which I shall return.  Thank you Amanda for being the best at what you do, and thank you to the Roaring Fork for doing it all so well!  Bon appetite!!

224DbI1cO88WjpyNM217sQ.text: Roaring Fork is strangely located next to some giant business complex.  They share the same parking lot and has every space marked with 2-hour visitor parking.  Since the business closed during dinner time, guests may park freely here.  The restaurant reminds me of an upscale version of Claim Jumpers. Dark, intimate restaurant with a Western theme and open kitchen.  Menu is highly meat-centric, and ideally you bring a large appetite and/or completed a full day of hiking because portions are gigantic!  We started off with a Medjool Date Salad - interesting how dates and that fig jam works with candied walnuts.  To balance out the sweetness, they have arugula and large chunks of goat cheese.  (4 stars)  Wife got the Double Cut Pork Chop. Wood-grilled and served with an awesome squash puree. The chop was huge and had some poblano chutney on top.  I found the meat incredibly soft and juicy, almost unnaturally soft.  The wife felt some of the pork texture and taste was missing some how, and she still felt the best pork chops are served in San Francisco's Prospect. (4 stars)  For some crazy reason, I opted for the Big Ass Burger out of sheer, morbid curiosity.  I could of went for any of their other excellent-sounding entrees but the "Big Ass" just sounds so cool.  I indeed lived up to its name and was indeed big - layers of bacon, medium-rare juicy patty, tomatoes, onions, and poblano chili.  Pretty decent burger, definitely bigger but not necessarily better than some of the best burgers I've had.  Fries were super crispy and well-seasoned. (4 stars).  Clearly after that meal there was no room for dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outside
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huckleberry Rita
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The famous Big Ass Burger

V3K0VYESm_hmRf_DOwtAxw.text: While spreading Christmas cheer with my fellow coworkers, we decided to stop by Roaring Fork to grab a quick frozen margarita (the best in town!)   We sat at the bar and were happily greeted by the sweet bartenders who got us all a famous frozen margarita. We ordered a pizza as well -- because margaritas and pizza, great combo! The ambiance was perfect and service was amazing, even though it was busy.   The reason for my 3-star review was that when we left, a friend asked for food so we ordered the tortilla soup to go, and to be honest, I was quite disappointed with the order we received (see photo). Not sure why the "cup" of soup was more than half empty. I even measured it when I got home and it was less than half a cup; don't really think this was worth $8.50 (more expensive than the pizza).   We love Roaring Fork, and come here quite often... Just a bit disappointed in the portion sizes/price this time around.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The more-than-half-empty &#34;cup&#34; of soup

XV-VqOOMNXNwPmZ3RVpjiQ.text: Roaring Fork has an awesome happy hour, but if you relegate yourself to just that menu you're missing on the most delectible items available. Obvs still get there in time for $5 martinis, manhattans, and maragritas and grab an app too but order from the full dinner menu because youbcan go anywhere for a burger. Here they've got delicious carnitas, bacon wrapped pork loin, cedar plank salmon, oh wow. Not amazing for vegetarians, but just make it work with salad if you're willing to come. Dig into a new bite here when you getva chance. Only con is the price is a lil steep for portions. C'est la vie.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Manhattan on rocks is fire tho...
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Manhattan at happy hour for $5. Yasssss.

isnH22U0b-oYe-6qqZ-F-w.text: We have been to Roaring Fork several times. It is our all time favorite place for date night. The food is always outstanding. The wait staff is friendly and brings us our food and drink exactly as ordered. We will be back

hXy1eoRUK-WxFy3PflOVWA.text: Let me start by saying reservations are an absolute must! When booking through open table availability was 2 hours out, but well worth the wait.   We chose to be seated on the regular patio (apparently there is also a specific HH patio) and started with a nice glass of prosecco & riesling. For appetizers we shared the lamb fondue and mussels & chorizo, both of which were very tasty. And, for our entrees I had the half spit-fire chicken and my hubby had the rainbow trout. Both were cooked perfectly, although the chicken lacked flavor. Note to self, next time go with your gut and order the porter house. Also, portions are very generous so keep that in mind when ordering.    All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Service was great (thanks to Daryl), food was good and the atmosphere was perfect! Despite the strange location in the midst of a big business complex, it was a great find and we'd definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Green Chile Mac and cheese
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half chicken
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb chop fondue

Ze1lFWXhlo5LsPDi7zhk0w.text: Although the food was amazing, the service was off a bit Wednesday.  We waited more than 10 minutes just for the table to be "touched" and the adult beverages were slow to come as well.  The food portion was timely and as I mentioned, very good.  The water glasses were not refilled and there was no offer of a second adult beverage.  The tip that was left was closer to 10% than to 20% so hopefully the server got the message.  It was the last meal my son and DIL had before returning to Guam to complete their tour.  Not a very good send off.

Ueih1WShRIq4gh63vWgKAw.text: Lovely atmosphere and amazing happy hour . The queso was amazing. The burger was good as well

mpM9ZQmi3TLbafOyvcLawg.text: Such a nice place. Had a business dinner there and it was very nice. Great setting for us to be able to enjoy our meals then talk business over drinks after. My meal was amazing and a very large amount of food. The service was very good, our service was very happy and pretty quick. The food was even good the next day when I finshed my left overs. Would highly recommend and will be going back myself

iwwh_K-7cM0Eajhh9u7QEQ.text: This review is a month late but here comes! My husand and I debated about where to go during our last night in Scottsdale, AZ. ROARING FORK came highly recommended by a dear friend of ours who lived near by, we decided to give it a try. My goodness I can't tell you how much we love the place! From the beautiful, warm cozy wood fire ambiance to the food and drinks and our wonderful server everything was just perfect!!! I ordered the Bacon wrapped pork tenderloin which was highly recommended by our server, my mouth is watering as I'm writing this review a month later!!  Forgot what my husband ordered but his mouth is watering now too!! So you can just imagine how good the food is! Haha What a night to end our trip! Will definitely come back again at our next visit! Can't wait!!

qcMpLKO2F0XRkp3ikyXmBQ.text: Dined here while in town-I appreciate that we were seated promptly even though we arrived a bit early for our reservation. I also appreciate that our request for a booth was accommodated.  Our waitress was lovely and attentive. What I did not like was the food- or at least MY food. My guests both had the buttermilk fried chicken which was a great choice. Hot, delicious, crispy, etc. gravy garnish was very good too. One of my guests had a wedge salad which she enjoyed. I ordered the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin. My issue is that it was totally drenched in balsamic reduction which I found offensive. The pork was cooked beautifully but the plating was weird with a ton of 'street corn' on top of a small portion of grits, the pork and then the balsamic reduction on top of it all. The menu did not describe the dish properly never mentioning balsamic reduction nor did I ask- I simply went with what the menu said- the street corn had waaaay too many peppers in it basically making it so spicy I couldn't eat it. It was off putting especially combined with jalapeno grits underneath. The pork was the star and was delicious but it was difficult to eat with all the unnecessary stuff on the plate. This could have easily been avoided with a proper description on the menu. If I did ever go back I would order the fried chicken instead....

hGvFG1idcdPOAFXj0_nHJA.text: Very nice place, really tasty food! Great place for a date night with your significant other

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

BZq27JIf07VxYdYrM0nHqw.text: Sat in the bar with friends because restaurant was full. We ordered the muscles with chorizo and flat bread off the appetizer menu.. absolutely amazing!! Huge portions and then ordered the cedar plank salmon and that was delicious.. next time we're sticking with appetizers only because they are generous portions and so dang good!! Fun place, great waitress!!

rKEh3n-_Rg_kPXQ9xQB_oQ.text: We were in town for vacation and made a reservation several days in advance based on a friend's recommendation.   I recommend the stew for an appetizer, unlike anything I've ever had and plenty for sharing. Satisfactory service and food was ok, but expected more for the hype and price.

TqEzZZ768POH86pIQekuRQ.text: Went to Roaring Fork for the second time. We went for my husband's birthday and it was fantastic. Had Amy as our waitress and she was phenomenal. Very knowledgeable of the menu and the restaurant overall. Very sweet. We ordered the green chili pork as an appetizer which was delicious even though the bowl of bread rolls and cornbread would have been sufficient enough. Was delicious. Butter it came with tasted slightly like it was left open in the fridge but wasn't horrible. Ordered the New York strip with mashed potatoes and spinach as the side. Husband's only complaint was that it was slightly too charred on the outside but still delicious. I had the boneless buttermilk chicken with mashed potatoes and gravy. Nice and crispy. For dessert we had the huckleberry cheesecake and the pecan pie. We also had the Texas mule and category 6 lemonade as drinks. They was very pleasant. Overall amazing experience and will keep coming back and recommending this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Category 6 lemonade. Delicious

cAuvN9jVNkMTTLSr2GwhZQ.text: The best happy hour in Scottsdale and the surrounding area. Hands down. The drinks are strong and well made classics. The food is to die for. My absolute favorite queso I have found anywhere in the valley. The big ass burger is truly HUGE and unbeatable for the price. And the pork wings have the most delectable sauce and such tender meat that it's temping to order more than one plate every time I go. This place is a gem.

nbioA1rjccK-0SRm2Lmztw.text: Those of you who've watched Check Please Arizona on Phoenix's local PBS Station (KAET-8), probably remember the show's original host Robert McGrath.  The soft talking food loving Texan ran the show for multiple seasons, inviting guests of all different backgrounds onto the show to share their favorite restaurants & love of food in general.  McGrath's rise to celebrity in the valley is well deserved, though perhaps largely unknown.  He's one of a select few valley chefs to have received the prestigious James Beard award (Nobuo Fukoda & Chris Bianco being the others).  Originally a chef in his native Texas, McGrath eventually made his way to the valley first as head chef at the Phoenician.  Then in 1997, he opened Roaring Fork.  It was his work here that earned McGrath his coveted Beard award in 2001.  McGrath has long since handed over the business, but I'd never set foot in this two decade old restaurant.  I have no way of knowing whether the restaurant or menu has stayed True to McGrath's formula now that new owners are in place, but for Arizona Restaurant Week it was as good an opportunity as any to find out just how good it was.  Roaring Fork can be found on the southwest corner of Scottsdale and Chaparral Roads.  You'll find the restaurant on the ground floor of the six story office building on that corner.  The interior of the restaurant is both rugged & elegant with a mix of high country touches like deer antler chandeliers & stone walls along with more formal white table cloths & beautiful cherry wood floors.  I arrived right after they opened for dinner at 4pm on a Tuesday & sat at the bar, expecting a fairly light crowd for the evening.  By 5pm, the place was jammed full of more than 100 people & there were about 10 waiting for a table in the lobby.  Not sure if this is the Restaurant Week crowd or a normal night, but whoa.  The Restaurant Week menu this go around offered up a three course meal & a non alcoholic drink for $44.  Based on the prices I saw on their everyday menu, Roaring Fork was most definitely offering up a discount versus their normal business hours.  I was offered a non-alcoholic drink, but instead opted for their happy hour house margarita.  The usual suspects with this one:  tequila, triple sec, & lime juice (I got mine on the rocks with salt).  Delicious, refreshing margarita & impressively strong.  I probably could've handled one more but after that I wouldn't have been able to drive.  I'd read all the buzz about their tortilla soup so I got that for my appetizer.  Here they give you a bowl with pulled rotisserie chicken, guacamole, & string tortilla chips & then the waiter pours in the broth using a second bowl.  Hands down the best tortilla soup I've ever had.  Admittedly I never thought to put avocado in my tortilla soup, but I'll be damn sure to do that from now on.  Though I doubt I could ever replicate the broth this soup uses.  Man, that was good.  The entree selection was tough as I was torn between a steak and duck.  As I can get a good steak almost anywhere, I took a gamble on their Sugar Cured Duck Breast entree.  The duck breast is cooked to a medium rare & sliced up for you on a bed of brussel sprouts, a sour cherry mustard glaze, & onion jam (which I honestly didn't know was a thing).  It also comes with a side of green chile macaroni & cheese with breadcrumbs.  I loved the mac & cheese & all the sauces that went with the duck were great.  Honestly though, I wasn't in love with the duck itself.  The meat was cooked fine & the sauces definitely flavored the meat well, but I just couldn't get into the texture of the duck.  I've had duck confit before which is byfar my favorite way to eat duck, so maybe I should just stick with that.  Lastly, dessert time & in this case that meant Pecan Pie.  Roaring Fork's Pecan Pie dessert is actually a chocolate & toffee pecan pie with whipped cream & a brown butter gelato on the side.  The gelato was perfect, the pecan pie was...okay.  Little Miss BBQ actually serves the best pecan pie I've ever had so Roaring Fork's effort to top that was going to be a tall order.  Roaring Fork's version was admirable, but a little on the dry side for me.  Total cost for the restaurant week menu, plus the drink, tax & tip came to about $65.  For context, the same items I got tonight would've set me back about $80.  Its an even better deal during Restaurant Week if you order their New York Delmonico or Filet Mignon steaks, which are discounted by almost 50%.  Overall though, a good meal.  Some parts were better than others, but I was pretty happy with my first run here.  Is it James Beard worthy?  No (at least not now that McGrath is no longer in the kitchen).  Certainly not when compared to Kevin Binkley, who's been a Beard runner up multiple times and is long overdue.  Still, there's a lot here Robert McGrath & his followers can still be proud of.  After all, you don't last more than two decades in the restaurant business by accident
