Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sugar Cured Duck Breast with a side of Green Chile Mac &amp; Cheese
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tortilla Soup.  Fantastic dish.  The secret is in the broth

jUlLBn2565DwSnSuowi1uA.text: The happy hour menu is legendary and so locals know that during the summer we've got unlimited hours of Sun & Mon to enjoy without waiting in line with the hoards of snowbirds.  The bar food menu has remained the same for over the last decade with the Big Ass Burger remaining front and center.  Whatever you may believe is the "best" burger in the Valley...you can't cast your vote until you taste the Big Ass.   French fries are likewise superior, evidencing some fine oil that bring them to a crispy brown that my wife dies for.   The flat-bread with chicken was a little heavy on the cheese...but who can really complain about that? The crust is perfect...a balance in between pizza and pie. The huckleberry margarita remains a classic, especially good if you like frozen which I normally don't choose but make an exception for this one. Service was decent if not spectacular, but another reason to show up when it is still 105 degrees outside at 9 PM and avoid the crowds.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Big Ass Burger &amp; Flatbread w chicken

sNpDCMQrC_shyCRvWx206g.text: 5 stars all the way, I have been years ago, and always enjoyed this establishment. Last night my boyfriend and I ordered the Big A** Burger , and boy was it large , a nice big 10oz burger with all the fixings perfect for sharing, and a steal at $10 on happy he I can't believe that I have never ordered this burger at Roaring fork, Perfectly scrumptious, and cooked o so perfectly, yum,yum  Nice lovely establishment perfect for a date night, or a classy business meeting  Dress code is business casual, So golf shirts gents, and a dress, or jeans and a nice dressy top ladies

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy hour special All looks so good!
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy hour from 4 to 7  Great prices

GXrvNI4gGzPWA4nffgjdLA.text: Was there on a weekend date for a late dinner. The staff were kind, quick to answer all questions and since it was late, they didn't mind us lingering and enjoying our romantic time. I had a Manhattan and steak, both of which I rarely indulge. They were top notch and made my meal very enjoyable. Definitely a repeat restaurant for us.

aW9JRQBUkiTw10zrCpbGYg.text: Dinner was really good! The ambiance was everything the four of us anticipated.    This isn't a complaint, but, this isn't a compliment either. Our waitress Miss Shay seemed a bit apprehensive about our table. She was nice enough, but, she appeared somewhat "fake" for less than a better word. She was quite attentive to our table, and she answered our questions often time with a "slight frown" on her face.  Brian, our busboy came over and mumbled something to our table, however, we were engaged in conversation regarding our drink selection(s). We later asked Brian what he said when he came over to our table earlier to ensure we didn't miss something of importance, he seemed scared out of his wits...his hands started shaking and his face was flushed, he said, "I was just asking if you needed more water/bread." We thanked him, and said "oh no thanks, just wanted to make sure we answered your question."  I am not sure, if the Roaring Fork serves many African Americans, but, there is no need to fret when we come in, we are there for a good meal like our Caucasian counterparts.    Fun time - amazing food, quality spirits and a memorable evening.

XyO4TGCKHSmmgfBZl3WRLA.text: First time back in a long time. Place is still very good.  Sat in bar area to watch basketball last week while in town for work (and golf). Caught the end of happy hour, place was packed! Couple of cold beers to start.  Strange they only have bottles and cans, didn't see any taps, unless maybe I just missed them. Had a very good Caesar Salad to start, happy hour price. Watched several of their famous "Big Ass" Burgers go by. Insane Happy Hour value, but I'd consumed so much meat my prior to nights out, I decided on the Lake Trout, with shaved almonds and capers and a side of their outstanding green chili Mac n Cheese. The trout was huge, flaky and flavorful, best I've had in a while. And the Mac, well, what is there to say...freakin' awesome. A few glasses of pinot to top it off. Very nice night.  Next time in town, I'm having that burger!

HsxUnidY-mkuEjXh7bJEOQ.text: Fantastic burger! Happy Hour till 7pm ($10).   Best guac!  Can't wait to return. Service was fast and efficient.

fO6QYk5uLh1_631rjtOnSQ.text: We came here for a small dinner with our families after our tiny courthouse wedding. It was perfect. Everyone was able to get beverages of their choosing (only weird thing here is I don't think they have any beers on tap, just canned and bottled). We shared the guacamole as an appetizer and it was DELICIOUS.   Our guests ordered everything from the filet mignon, spitfire chicken, duck, bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and various fish dishes. Everyone raved about their meals.   We were generously given a delicious crepe brulee topped with strawberries to share for dessert once the restaurant heard we were newly married. So sweet.  Our service was top notch, and this was a lovely place for our small celebration. Thank you so much!

6hGtO0k__yUkibevhLzE7g.text: Saw the yelp yelp reviews...did not disappoint white table cloths higher end great food and atmosphere..the guacamole was great the rainbow trout cooked to perfection...roasted chicken was awesome would highly recommend...the asked if we had reservations, we didn't but were seated quickly

b4G0HFgya6bZNSoX1aB43w.text: Had an amazing dinner here!  We had incredible service from start to finish. We were a half hour late for our reservation (we had called to inform we would be late) and we were happily ushered to our table instantly upon arrival. My husband had informed them we were celebrating a special occasion and we found a rose and a card signed by the entire staff at our table!!  Our server was Shea and she was awesome. She recommended the pork tenderloin to my husband and he LOVED it. I had the Big Ass Burger, because I have heard amazing things about it for years, and it was everything I hoped it would be and more!  First, it was huge!  Everything about it was perfect and delicious. We were comped a free dessert due to our special occasion, we really appreciated the kind special touches. What a great restaurant, next time we visit Arizona we will definitely go here again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qoTAGi5r0u-dI4M3O-x4yw.text: This was my fifth time coming here, so I had to write a review! Making a reservation is best, especially if you want to cut on wait time. We are always seated very promptly, attended to with the best service, and treated to a delicious meal. The happy hour deals are pretty good too!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pecan pie w/ice cream and creme brûlée

cR4-WqxK7TATApYoyi4pnQ.text: We live close by and go for Happy Hour.  The service is always good no matter how busy.  Good wine for $5 a glass. We have tried most of the menu items, $6 to $10.  Our favorite is sharing a burger with a side salad and getting another, $6 item. There burgers are too big for the average person Trust me!!  People just love them. The cheese dip with chips is really good at $8.  Maybe not good for you.  The pork wings were flavorful and tender. Love the chicken flat bread, $8. Tortilla soup yummy.  Maybe not the cheapest happy hour food but some of the best. You can't go wrong here, especially for Happy Hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chips with a spicy cheese cause.

hpQdh-Vip3svejGgp3rikg.text: The whole experience is not what I expected being that this is an upscale restaurant. The food took around 40 mins to come out and was not good, seemed like had been sitting for awhile. The host was extremely rude, the service was sub-par. Will not be returning.

F-TNJMw25QO-_7TNGhM67g.text: The service here is amazing! I wish i remembered my servers name because he was very friendly and kept tabs on my table. The steaks and salmon are well prepared. I really enjoy the dessert options, i've got a huge sweet tooth!

ZaE6wtBluBFD869jl79n-A.text: Who can beat happy hour 4-10 pm Seven days a week in the summer!? No one!  Add to this the delectable treats such as the big ass burger and the green chili pork with warm flour tortillas for so cheap and you're in heaven. It's alwaysI busy but the service still manages to be spot on. Drink specials are great as well. So if you're staying in town, here's your reward for putting up with the AZ heat!

zb8aDNv7_5XCTDirBLE5EQ.text: Great dinner place. Gets a bit crowded at opening, so prepare . Nice happy hour menu. Some things can be a bit bland unless your ordering one of their signature green chili dishes . Opens only for dinner st 4:00

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-WlAu8wu-tSmA7NEhJ2QiA.text: Soooo we had dinner at the bar last night & it was great. This time tried an Agave margarita & it was right on leading to two ! Started w wedge salad which was good then onto the double cut pork chops which I highly recommend. Hubble had pork tenderloin due to all great reviews. He ate it but did not enjoy it. Bacon was burnt & he said it was just ok. He liked mine much more.

b80g2kS1LY-meyvoTHWyUw.text: So we walked over here from Postino (excellent place! ). The menu looked good, and I was anxious to try a couple things. We walked in to be greeted by two hostesses who were amazing! Good jokes, all smiles, directed us to the bar.   As soon as we sat down at the bar, we were greeted by a male bartender who had the face of someone who was just robbed of life. Tosses us some menus and wasn't really feeling it. No worries, everyone has a bad day. Female bartender comes over, and she's as cheery as a brush fire in a well-populated area. Was in a great mood, instantly put into the toilet. I've never been drained like that. Unfortunately will never get to try the food, one drink and done. Two stars for the awesome hostesses for their great personalities.

P5Fv19QliqT4kEUiZzFLQQ.text: First and most importantly the desserts are out of this world. The filet mignon was perfect and the Brussels sprout leaves, which I thought would bomb, were excellent.   Friday must be the night to go, as the crowd was active and vibrant.   The service, at first started off slow, became friendly and personable later on.  That's the only reason why I didn't give it a fifth star. Initially the bartender was standoffish and only improved when I brought it up.   But, I will return next week and try their signature BIG BURGER ! Which everyone says is to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great Burger
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. They know how to pour!

1sZRktIiMLlYCVZCuYn8og.text: Unfortunately I only stopped at this place for some late night cocktails.  I didn't get a chance to try any of their dishes, but geez, their menu is HUGE!  They also had an amazing happy hour menu.  This place is kind of tucked away and is a little difficult to find at night.  That being said, it's surrounded by a couple of different restaurants so there is plenty of parking.   The interior of the building is quite nice.  This is definitely a good place for a lovely date night. Our waiter was also very accommodating and the rest of the staff was friendly as well. Although I can't speak about their food, they definitely have a nice and VERY long drink menu.  Our waiter made sure each of our drinks were strong.  I definitely plan on coming back here sometime soon!  I'll be sure to update my review then.

q0xH7QkjpyOaiqgy0OyEgQ.text: Last night we had a great dinner last night thanks to the great service by Amy our server. We were fortunate to spend an evening celebrating Fathers Day and a birthday. Our food was excellent and staff very nice. Keep up the great work!

GQQuFHcdybgkpkEjRkfV0A.text: Thought this place was just OK. Despite the fact that they have Mexican food on the menu, they have neither normal Mexican beer nor any Mexican hot sauce. Food was OK, service was good. Margarita was a little weak. Overall just OK.

POoyB8pu9YnfojCjFfbosA.text: Came here for my birthday dinner with family and was disappointed with the service. We made a reservation and still had to wait about 10 minutes. I wouldn't have minded if our waiter made up for it in excellent service. Unfortunately he wasn't friendly, attentive, or patient at all. Each time he stopped by our table I felt rushed. He seemed annoyed when we asked questions and rushed through the specials. Even though it was mentioned to him that it was my birthday, we had to specifically ask about the dessert menu. I didn't end up ordering dessert because the vibe just wasn't comforting. The food we did order was quite good but it would have been a much better dining experience with better service.   This was our first dining experience at the Roaring Fork and some of our family drove all the way from Surprise, AZ to attend. It's a bummer that our dining experience wasn't very pleasant or inviting.

zzJ1Y2lHT1-VCjXA5NC-4A.text: This was such a great meal and place!  Myself and a party of 10 came to dine at "Happy Hour" for my sister's birthday.... At first we were ready to turn around and leave, BUT the Happy Hour pricing is only in a certain part of the restaurant. We did not understand this at first. Finally after a little patience on both parts, we understood each other and they were able to get us all seated within 20 minutes on a Sunday evening in December. Shae was our waitress and she was beyond incredible. She made our evening extra great! The food was delicious. Shae's recommendations of the Mussels and Chorizo and the 3 Cheese Dip with Chips was perfect for our table... She made sure we were taken care of throughout our meal and I give her personally 5 stars! Great service Shae! All except one of us LOVED our meals... The chicken plate tasted like Kentucky Fried Chicken, our guest was not overly happy with it. But it was delicious. Atmosphere was great, 70's music was great. We enjoyed. Thank you Roaring Fork!

a4GAvVwSeeHm4PC2yfCvCg.text: Came here for my birthday November 29th...atmosphere looked great....parking was a little difficult as it is located in a business plaza...did not have reservations but asked about the bar area...the hostess said to seat ourselves in the bar area however there was no seating available...then she said we could sit in the patio area...again no seats available...don't u think an upscale restuarant like this would be more organized and know what is or isn't available...not to mention the hostess was not very friendly or accomodating...so we walked out.... Now here is where i became angry inside..my wife and I are African American...were we treated this way because of that...?  We are both professionals....not to mention we are from an affluent area in Michigan ....we know good food and service and this service was disgraceful....won't be back but they probably could care less....no customer ettiquette or even an im sorry....

7eetJhW4ffnb1Mmo8loBsA.text: Started restaurant week off at Roaring Fork.  Very generous portions!  The short rib and horseradish mashed potatoes with tomato jam was wonderful.  The chocolate pecan pie with burnt butter gelato was also outstanding.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

9W1280abhBi-lxcIjKPXWA.text: Great happy hour. Don't pass on the kettle of green chili - the best I had had outside New Mexico.   Patio is setup nicely to enjoy an afternoon drink outside instead of being in the a/c.

V_t33f0fXTPq38vTQ_mecw.text: Salmon was paired with green beans / baby tomatoes with goat cheese (sprinkled.. not too salty).  I also ordered delicious Brussel sprouts as my side dish ! Excellent. I highly recommend this place !

GSmPe8IGxTvytmnL8B7wWQ.text: This is my favorite Stake House in all of Arizona. Order the Mac and Cheese with your filet -- it's freaking awesome.

33K7trFc4zrA82ZpNaxFWA.text: This is a super cute hidden gem. I loved the patios and fully intend on being a regular.  We only ordered appys, drinks, and a salad. I cant wait to come back  and try some of thier chicken and steaks, or the burger which was massive. I had fish tacos and a ceaser. It was good. My friend had pork drumsticks and a cheese dip nacho appy with shredded pork.

i3T-PV6ptHeZA918BPxsiQ.text: A....mazing. my nephew has his rehearsal dinner here and Matt was our server. Everything was badass and we all loved it. I had the shirt ribs with tomato jam, green beans and green chili mac. Omg, yum. Service was on point, food was great and the whole party enjoyed themselves immensely. Fantastic! Charley is a manager who came by frequently and made sure things were going smooth. They really made this night special as 2 families were coming together. Beautiful job.

qTFiFVUM-i8D54S0dGuxfg.text: Had dinner here for a group of 10 for a bachelorette. The outdoor seating is pretty. The service was wonderful. The food was good. We got pretty much everything but my rainbow trout was delicious! The salads were nice and fresh! I also enjoyed the bread basket with jalapeno cornbread :) I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking to host a dinner for a larger group!

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. They kindly customized a dessert for the bride to be!

rN10cuCCaonpOq7Nhq_KSw.text: I was prepared for a standard meal and was pleasantly surprised. The ambience was pleasant, not loud and clamorous. The service was friendly and knowledgeable. (My husband has allergies and we appreciate it when wait staff pay attention!)  I had the trout and a side of veggies and I was so full... but kept eating because it was ridiculously good. My hubby had chicken and he was really happy with it. We didn't have room for dessert but it all looked good. The guys next to us split a burger and fries and they were happy too!

ZX3vo4LOBpmmhH-TbmeBpQ.text: Happy hour prices are hard to beat!  The atmosphere is welcoming and classy. Everything on the menu is delicious. I recommend the burger and the prickly pear margarita!  Service is always top notch.

-5KLocRHxoEdDiE4FwbZww.text: We went for my husbands birthday recently. Had not been there in years as we live in Sedona area. This was nostalgic for us as we used to love the food and atmosphere. This time, not so much. Had reservation, had to wait 10 min just to check in with rezzie. Food was average, nothing special for the price. Roasted chicken and big ass hamburger very average tasting. Doubt we will go again as it seems it's reputation is better than its actual food.

0geNSbxtrbyASxTrL8o_IQ.text: Loved my meal!  Best food I've had in Arizona this weekend.  Prices are reasonable for the quality of the food.  Will be a place I definitely will return to!  Had the 1/2 chicken meal - the rotisserie chicken was so flavorful and moist.  For dessert we had the pecan pie- was AWESOME!!!

Qt8CgKpnVlb0jxrYfaL7JQ.text: Work celebration party of 12 with reservations at 6. Our Admin was there setting things up and as our celebrated employees  arrived they were refused seating by the snippy  hostess because "our waitress just got in and needed a few minutes to get ready for her shift". This poor girl has no idea what "hosting" is about...as a result guests were left standing in the parking lot waiting for a seat at an empty table....we could see our table there with our admin seated and cocktailing. The service for the evening was otherwise fine. Despite great reviews the food was a disappointment.  My iceberg BLT salad was good but my pork was way overcooked served at room temperature atop  cold grits. The corn side was fantastic. Had I not been at a work event this plate would have been returned to the chef. My recommendation is to skip this place and travel a few block south to old Town where you will find great food and service that is accomdating to the customer

tgi9PiCMusbL-Jn1AL7G1w.text: Incredibly impressed by this restaurant. Incredibly friendly and professional service, a great happy hour offering with reasonable prices. Comfort food at its best!

SuPvaW4ZL0KkClOTBLDweg.text: Went back recently for my birthday dinner with a group of 8 friends and once again it was incredible! The staff is some of the best and everyone raved about their meals (particularly the seafood). I cannot get enough of their green chili mac and Mexican street corn sides!   My meal came with a complimentary dessert of my choice (creme brulee) which was heavenly! Our entire dinner came out to about $35 a person incl. tip which is a steal when taking into account the atmosphere, service and cuisine!

rlIJ-ih9A7v5tPjgMgK_2A.text: I've had dinner here previously when I lived in Arizona, and always bring friends here. So on a recent visit I wanted to return for a birthday happy hour. We had great drinks, delicious appetizers, and met some fun people at the bar. The only thing was we were not offered a rewards card and I was unaware that we could be earning points. I visit scottsdale between 2-3 times a year and would like to join the rewards club but can not without a card. Is there a way to get a card number?

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

j-9plyIZjCInGNGwz92efg.text: Great. Great food and almosphere. Best happy hour in town.

yPPCTNklhBP0kyV20_ibeQ.text: Fantastic servers and incredible food. They had no problems substituting sides and gave me some damn good braised ribs and some incredible horseradish mashed potatoes. The drinks were strong and delicious so even away from te typical happy hour crowd I give them a firm 5 stars

_tPMO0P_wmP9ZHLnuzFVDA.text: The service was very spotty. Maybe this was because we were seated in the waaay back. We ordered the flatbread appetizer and it was both the least appetizing looking and tasting thing I've ordered from a restaurant in a long while. DO NOT ORDER THIS!!  As for the entree, I got the big ass burger. Big? Yes. Have any  taste? No.   I even saw another Roaring Fork all the way in Austin, TX when I visited a few weeks later and I avoided it at all costs.

hhPGFlk-BoqjEgxaYPGgcw.text: In one week of being in Phoenix I stopped at this place 3 times because they have a great happy hour! All we had were drinks and apps, but they were all very good and great priced. I mean $5 for a Manhattan is just crazy and it was very good. They Huckleberry margarita was also amazing. Service was also very good and I like atmosphere. Get in there for a "Big Ass" burger!

MJDW2kjog5aS33BHyQjpyA.text: Being someone who doesn't eat meat, steakhouses are frequently a challenge. This place was super delicious though! I got the rainbow trout, which had butter and lemon and amazing fried capers. Everything was cooked well and the fried capers made them so incredible! I also got the Gold Fashioned drink, which had huckleberry juice and blueberries in addition to whiskey (so tasty!). I would be back constantly (especially for happy hour!) if I lived closer!

xK2OLeZltGSzX0chJl6lGw.text: I went here with my boyfriend last night.  We opted for the happy hour on the patio.  I really liked that the happy hour runs all night long.  And they got great prices! $5 glasses of wine and cocktails.  My boyfriend got the big burger for only $10 he said it was good but he likes other burgers from other places better. I Got the fish tacos, the fish was really tasty, but the tortillas were cold.that's the reason why I gave it a 4 star instead of 5. I got to say I loved our server; she was very nice and attentive.

wySLcZ59ua5Oo5HmNrOfRA.text: As always great food and drinks. The servers and bar tenders are very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this place. I will come here every time I'm out in Arizona.

pDC_40JYDnMLuVsc1z-orA.text: Best happy hour around. Kettle pork green chili was great and can't go wrong with the big ass burger.

RUWauWz3Yc7db7I8ec4l7w.text: We got into Phoenix about 815 and by the time we reached our hotel in Scottsdale it was nearly 10.  We were all hungry and would have went about anywhere.  Roaring Fork was across the street so we walked over.   When we came in, it was five after ten and the waitress said no more food--kitchen's closed.  We were disappointed.  Then the manager came over and said they would seat us.  YES!!  We had a lovely waitron, Katherine who took especially good care of us.  We had a nice bottle of wine and began with the field greens salad with goat cheese and pecans.  It was wonderful.  The only part I didn't like was the beets (there weren't many) but I don't like beets.     I had a swordfish special which was divine.  It was late when we were done so we skipped dessert.  Someone had the pizza, which I didn't care for too much.    We are only here for a few days but we may come back, this place was great.  Ask for Katherine as your waitron--she rocks!!

LUdd0huU2KPl3qufUP5P8g.text: All around an amazing restaurant. Great service, food, ambiance. I would highly suggest it if you are looking for a good night out. Everything is fresh, and tasty. They have a great menu. Come check it out!

l8vwY5lzDvc4TBp44ywRRg.text: Went here for happy hour for the first time.  First little piece of advice... GET THERE EARLY....... There was not a table to be found 45 minutes after opening time.  The happy hour appetizers are def a good value for money. We were full after almost finishing 2. We ordered the flatbread, it was tasty. And that little kettle with chili verde pork. Again, very filling.  My margarita wasn't great, I hardly drank it. My friend returned hers, asked for something different. Hey it was only $5.

SlR7mVzb6goCs5IckYQghg.text: The "Big Ass" burger was delicious I would recommend that to anyone. This was my first time and I was very much pleased. Would definitely come back and have dinner here.

ut65bfbCNibihf_K6hKr0A.text: Yelp is a swindle!  You can ad every review you want they choose the ones they want Good review for their clients Don't spend your time with that site!

royaC7y_pucOeq8V4o9UMQ.text: Thoroughly enjoy the food, and atmosphere here. The service is also great!! We are in town every few weeks and make sure we stop in each time we're here.  Highly recommend it!

rtf0cNCxaXIHJ-D2BYQtPw.text: Well what you know. The day after writing a review on Harvey's I got the burger itch. Luckily my good friend was down to meet up for a quick bite. My review is based only on the burger, haven't had anything else or been there before.  "Big Ass Burger" and yes it was. It's 4 hours later and I'm still full. Be ready to make room for this if you're planning on eating it by yourself. I'm guessing it's somewhere around 12oz of top grade sirloin with bacon and the usual fixings. I asked for mine on the side, as I've said before I prefer to taste just the meat, cheese, and bun when I eat burgers. I had a couple bites with the bacon and it was pretty good, didn't overpower it like bacon usually does, but still liked it just plain. Great flavor, great quality meat, cooked perfectly, and super juicy. I could have used a touch more cheddar, but it was ok. Fries were just right too, crispy extra battered style. Washed it down with a Fat Tire and I left a happy man.  If you can make it during happy hour, it's prob best way to go since the $9 price tag is much more manageable. I think it's $12-14 otherwise. Ambience was okay, similar to a Houston's, Bandera, etc vibe.  I will most definitely be back when the craving returns.  And yes...that's prob by next week.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Big Ass Burger

b-aqPZsfQmkE2QCjlfZPRg.text: This is one of our favorite places to take out of towners. The ambiance, food quality and scrumptious drinks are all 5 stars. The Big A** Burger is the best in town and only $10 on HH. $5 well drinks, including standard vodka or gin martinis and more. Everything I've had on the menu has been excellent. You cannot go wrong here!

3DWJgMCJ7mO1LInMP0iDiQ.text: Returned to Scottsdale this month and of course to the Roaring Fork.  We actually had the same table as we did last time---and it was the only one left!  The food remains terrific, especially the boneless buttermilk fried chicken.  The cocktails are top-notch and theservice is as professional as it gets

dwa2vCaZVj2l0FVCkPSTNw.text: Great grub. The green chili pork appetizer is fantastic.  The menu has a great selection to choose from.   I ordered the green Mac n cheese based on all the great reviews.  Meh.

nPGcuzVENm3PfS9K-PtOaw.text: My review is only based on the appetizers. and drinks during Happy Hour. Having not been here before, my niece recommended the Beef Tenderloin Sliders and the Kettle of Green Chili Pork with hot buttered flour tortillas. Both apps were great but I especially liked the kettle of chili and we ended up ordered a second round of it. Drinks also were great as I had the Citrus Mojito and my niece ordered the Huckleberry Frozen Margarita.

hUVIq0l-fQK9YmjTnDROFg.text: Ok, so, I'm not sure if I just finished dinner, had an ecstatic spiritual transformation, or a really good sexual experience. Holy foodgasm. I ordered an orgy of pork and loved it all. Two words: HAPPY HOUR. Just do it. Food for 3, drinks, dessert--all delicious. $77. Need I say more? Go to Roaring Fork. Get porked.

wctdQRIOmdHsK8yMl2ldag.text: Oh crap, I hate, hate writing mediocre reviews when everyone else writes great reviews. So I'm going positive first:  The service was GREAT! Well, the waitstaff. I'll start from the beginning: We just got back from Wet 'n Wild where I mentioned, if you read that review, I didn't bring a hairbrush much less took a shower.  We decided to visit Roaring Fork as it's on my husband's burger list and we rarely get this far north. So we drive down Scottsdale road and surprised to find it in an office building.   We walk in looking like crap with our messy boys and we are completely ignored by the two hostesses who are engaged in conversation with an older gentleman. So we walk around the restaurant and decide to go back to the hostess and see if we need to be seated. So I rudely interrupted their deep conversation and ask if they need to seat us. One of them said yes, if you are eating dinner or you can seat yourself if you want the happy hour in the bar or patio. We said we'll do the happy hour.  We went t to the patio which on this 108* day into evening was wonderful. The decor was so nice I wish my home patio looked so good and the misters were great even though by the end of the evening I was soaked. The waiter was very attentive and made a great beer suggestion. We ordered  the Big Ass Burgers for $9 and an order of Guacamole and the boys ordered mac & cheese.   The Guac was amazing, perfect with big chunks of avocado and onion, chip were fresh. The beer was served with chilled, small glasses - great presentation.   The burgers were HUGE, I didn't think for $9 you would really get a HUGE burger and Fries but you do. The burger looks great, super thick cooked to order with thick bacon, cheddar, tomato, poblano chile, nice lettuce, tons of pickles with an aioli on the side. What could be wrong?   Hmmm, I bite, chew, swallow, add aioli, bite, add salt. Just can not get any flavor from the meat.  This burger should be amazing. The bread is a really generic, white seeded bun so I get rid of it and used a fork and knife. Just no flavor so I both my husband and I only ate half of our burgers. The waitstaff seemed confused by our full plates but it just wasn't great and not worth the cholesterol or calories. The boys were happy with the mac & cheese and ate most of our fries. The guac and beer were great! And the service, except the host staff, was truly wonderful.    We would probably go back as we liked the ambiance and give it another try hopefully just an off night. Total for two beers, guacamole, mac & cheese x2, burgers x2 was only $45.

DMXZNb6uCbIikrqwUczRaQ.text: I have must of been here on an "off" night. I was not impressed. The place is decorated like a Claim Jumper.  The service was good, however I was told the specials and the aged 28 day steak sounded good. When it came out there was so much pepper rub on the steak, I couldnt taste the meat. The pepper rub was so overpowering  that I couldnt eat but two bites. I let the server know my feelings about the steak and he said no problem we can just box it up for you. What?!?.  So anyway he proceeded to take it away and box it up. The real surprise is when I got the bill $78 dollars just for the steak!!! Last time I take the special without finding out the price. It was not worth the $78 dollars. Anyway, I pay the bill and chock it up to a lessoned learned

_-6nQgXfhdxSh0c_69sbkQ.text: You have to love Roaring Fork's awesome happy hour.  It runs until 7pm which is great for people like me who work too late!  The food is good and the portions are generous.  Hey, where else can you go in Scottsdale for a good meal and a drink and spend less than $20 per person?  And they also have a great wine selection.  Definitely worth going to and it's a central place to meet people from all over the valley.

FQsUg7i8jpzEmvbk6noW8g.text: Roaring Fork is running their happy hour from 4 - 10 p.m. all summer long.  I hadn't been in since Robert McGrath sold the restaurant, and was in the bar two nights last week.  I had the green chili pork which still rocks.  The service was fantastic the first night.  Couldn't make a complaint even if I was in a horrible mood and looking to.  The second night, our server was unable to take our food and drink order (in the bar) at the same time. That being said, they haven't changed the menu or tried to cut any corners on quality since McGrath left.   I'll definitely be in soon again.

OcYtglu4jv4p0Lk1msFOUg.text: Awesome!  I was on a business trip in Arizona and this place was recommended.  Our group of 6 sat on the patio (they had fires going so the temperature was nice).  It was dinner and the waiter was awesome (I think his name was Paul).  We had the chili Mac & cheese and it was good (I am not a Mac & Cheese person - AT ALL).  I had the Salmon and tasted the pork tenderloin.  Both dishes were awesome.  The food is presented nicely.  One in our group had the fish tacos (which were actually shrimp that night).  he said they were awesome.  I want to try the Big Ass burger - maybe as a carb load before a run the next day.  The ambiance was perfect for conversation with business colleagues.  I will caveat that our dinner was at the same time as the BCS championship game.  The waiter even noted that the restaurant traffic was light.  We had a great time and I learned that there is a location in Austin in my neck of the woods.  Funny, I had to travel to learn of great spot in my own backyard.  I'm adding Roaring Fork to one of my favs!  Try it!

2NwEfANM3neqW9q16pL0rA.text: When we finally arrived after a glitch with our GPS we were very happy campers.   The  hostess was very welcoming and the service was excellent from start to finish.  The green chili mac and cheese was excellent as was the shrimp cocktail--the shrimp were huge and very fresh.  My Dr Pepper ribs were excellent and very tender.  My daughter had the grilled shrimp over grits which she also loved.

dNrD1LqIe9CqROpjt63KzQ.text: The decor is an odd mix of Arizona ranch and Colorado fishing lodge, with lots of hammered copper, rough-hewn wood shutters, barbwire-etched glass, and antler chandeliers. The cuisine can best be described as Southwestern comfort food with some very gourmet twists. The fondue is a shining example of the kitchen's creativity - a pot of silky-smooth, creamy-rich melted pepperjack cheese is accompanied by rosemary-garlic lamb chops, pistachio bread, and butternut squash for dipping. Other highlights are beef ribs braised in Dr. Pepper, pork shank slow-cooked in beer, and hickory-smoked salmon that tastes like it was grilled on a campfire. Green-chili macaroni and cheese is a house specialty, and deservedly one of the most popular items on the menu, as is the Big-Ass Burger piled high with toppings, but be forewarned - it's served only in the Saloon, which gets very rowdy, especially during happy hour. There's a patio with a fire pit that makes outdoor dining cozy on chilly evenings in the desert. Sadly, this isn't the five-star experience it should be - reservations appear to be meaningless, if the forty-five minute wait we had is any indication, service is abrupt and bordering on rude, and prices are considerably higher than they should be for what you get.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ChmjRxM19bYsEzq8lHkISw.text: Came by Saturday for drinks and we were informed that the Margarita recipe has changed. I don't remember anything being wrong with it, but apparently it has less lime juice, which my boyfriend thought was a plus, I liked it better before. And I I think they are stronger now. I had 2 last time before I got a buzz and this time I could only handle one. Which turned out well for me since I had agreed to pay the bill tonight beforehand.

lYsETLXZNYZSmJgMOT-ZTg.text: the must haves:  fish tacos esp the mahi mahi their pork shoulder-carnitas style chips and salsa w/ queso-appetizer the huckleberry margarita  what the heck is a huckleberry? i asked the waiter. he couldn't give me a good explanation but it was probably one of the yummiest margaritas i've ever had.   the restaurant was beautiful, nicely lit. not the best of places in scottsdale to do some people watching, but the bar was packed with a variety of people of all backgrounds and ages.   they have a pretty kick butt happy hour menu and everything i tried was fantastic. service was so-so, maybe we caught the guy on the wrong day....  all in all....one of my new favs in scottsdale.

QlfmKPO16_lEOzBx2PfmWw.text: Don't understand the 3-5 stars for this place.  It smells divine when you walk in though that is for sure.  Ordered the organic agave margarita - good drink but the appetizer (shrimp brochette) was only meh and my grilled fish tacos (yellow tail) were not good - fish was dry and I like some mango or pineapple type sauce with it to counteract the savory fish - overall ok but won't be back.

Yd_gwscmC8tXyJfT2cKfOw.text: I just love the Roaring Fork!!!  I have been here countless times and every time has been a wonderful experience!!!  They have a nice big restaurant with two large patios. Warm ambiance. The food is spectacular...I loved the fish tacos..oh and that mac and cheese with the green chilies..MMMMM!!!  Great drinks and great service too!!

KRaur49Xm2_YfxLw7YNZ7g.text: The food is excellent and the service is generally friendly/helpful. The happy hour makes the pricing a little more reasonable. We did get doublecharged for some items last time, which took a little back and forth with the staff to fix. Apparently they got a new computer system that is the source of the problems.

JJzFGG4Nw33lU5x_pjbpqQ.text: We came here for a business dinner on a weeknight.  Everyone in the group went for the three-course meal for $25.  The wine list is pretty good, with a lot of choice by the glass.  If you order wine by the glass, they will bring it out in a mini-carafe, and you'll get more like 8 oz than the usual 5 oz or 6 oz, which turns into more like two glasses of wine.  I had a nice Opolo Vineyards Zinfandel that worked well with the appetizer and main course.  I started with the tortilla soup, which was fine but not very complex, and could have used something to brighten up the flavors.  The pork carnitas was the best food I had that night.  The portion size was incredibly large.  It could easily feed two.  The custard of the creme brulee was underwhelming somehow.  The service was good.

S9JBR6FlFuPfKL_yt-ca0Q.text: Been a long time since I was there but I was very pleased! The smoked duck and the jalapeno mac was great!

W0Mpn4cNIsUoo1UDqdlPGA.text: A couple friends and I decided to go out to dinner on New Years night, after our normal argumentative bickering trying to come up with a place to eat that would satisfy all 5 of us, we decided on a place down the street from our house called "The Roaring Fork". Seeing how none of us had ever been there before we were going in with our heads held high and our stomaches rumbling. We sat down and were instantaneously greeted by our server Bob. He went over the nightly specials with us and got our drink order, after quietly deciding our appetizer choice as well as our entrees we began to tell Bob, then the bad news set in, 3 of the people in our group were set on entree choices that they had ran out of for the night, with doubts they settled on choice number two. After 15 minutes our table was approached by what appeared to be the manager of the restaurant, later to find out was a corporate manager, with shame he explained to the 3 who chose option number two that they had also ran out of those menu items due to the fact that everything is made fresh on site and the evening was busier then expected. With extreme disappointment, they agreed to give the special (an 8 ounce filet) a try. The food came out rather quickly, they brought out salads to make up for the wait time, they brought out sides that they thought we would enjoy and when the main meal arrived, the 5 of us were fans. The food was excellent, and the service was even better. I eat out almost every night of the week, as someone with a rather busy schedule I find it easier to go out for dinner than spend time coming up with an alternative option. As we all know, it is extremely frustrating when we go to a restaurant and things go wrong, or our food isn't up to par, and we aren't compensated, or we don't get a table visit from a manager. Not only was our experience turned completely around, but our entire meal was taken care of. I can honestly say I am more then pleased with our visit, I would suggest this place to anyone looking for great food and service. I will return to The Roaring Fork as often as possible.

bx1StNngkEJneO80c5NjcA.text: Got the RFmixed grill and the chicken was blood rare. Be sure to check your food because there not! The ribs taste and look like they have been parboiled seasoned and then tossed on the grill for a few minutes. The Elgin sausage was very fatty/greasy. Not worth $24! No way. My wife had the Carnitas. The pork was tough. It could have been cooked for a few hours longer. I smoke mine for 12-13 hours. This happens when places get too big. They start worrying about the quantity and the quality suffers. We did enjoy the Fried Avocado and Crab spicy crab remoulade and chives and the Rotisserie Chicken Flatbread roasted chiles and pepper jack. If you like the western dark atmosphere and I mean dark! They kept playing with the lights! I thought that I was having a stroke! Have a drink and some appetizers. Skip the entrees! We went to the Blue Adobe the day after and it was 10 times better and less than half the price.

8lkyytC1PN6Rg-C9zs90Ug.text: Don't be turned off because this restaurant is in an office building; the food is great and the wine list won't disappoint. Check out the Huckleberry Margarita; yum. My husband had the fish tacos; very good. Not quite enough guac for me - but great overall. Patio seating is preferred. Enjoyed!

E1bGuvedg9bKrNuqC3r4Ag.text: Huckleberry margarita, incredible fish tacos, insane ahi tuna with homemade guacamole. This place rocks. Throw in your typical Scottsdale eye candy and the night is complete.

OgwmAdP5bN8OBI-vEs_CFw.text: We went for happy hour one weekday and ordered a glass of wine, mojito, and a burger.  Happy hour prices were good, the burger was pretty good, but very big, my husband & I shared it, and were full for the rest of the evening.  We found Roaring Fork to be about a 3.5 stars, it was good but not great.

2jG3Cixnf8ZPzdLG9TMMiQ.text: We went here for dinner tonight because it was Arizona Restaurant week and they had a special menu.  They were offering an appetizer, entree, and dessert  for $29 a person.  Unlike other restaurants, the items on this special menu were some of the same on their regular menu and really represented an outstanding value.  We both had the Yucatan Shrimp Coctail.  One would have been enough to share but we each had eight very large, succulent, and very tasty shrimps.  I had the Mahi-Mahi Tacos, which were excellent and the other person with me, had the Dr. Pepper Shortribs, which were tasty but a bit too fatty and heavy. Dessert was pretty good but we could barely eat it since we were stuffed.    If there was one shortcoming, the food came out too quickly.  I noticed it was the same for all the other tables as well.  The appetizer came out right away and before I know it, the entree comes out. Slow it down!  It seemed like just a few minutes after we finished the entree, the desert came out. Needless to say, I felt the dining experience was too rushed.  Also, when we arrived, the dining room was virtually empty so I am not sure why they seated us and the 4 other groups of people who came in afterwards all in the back room.  It was a bit odd, being in this room full with other people and seeing the main dining area, which in my opinion was much nicer being empty.  The staff however were all very gracious and friendly and as the food was really very good, I would definitely return again.

ZKo228Zb2Utx9qj4ajhM0A.text: I'm not sure how to describe Roaring Fork.  It's a little bit frontier Arizona feeling, a little southwestern, but neither of those in an over the top, contrived way.  As you walk in the large stone hearth greets you with the sight of rotisserie chickens roasting away.  It's a signature item on the menu.  The bar seemed lively.  The cuisine is excellent.  Everything on the menu appealed to me, but I chose to start with the tortilla soup and the duck for my entree.  Both were wonderful.  Southwestern flavors were evident, but not overpowering.  I would have proceeded on to dessert but between my appetizer and entre (not to mention the excellent biscuits laced with bits of bacon and the sweet corn muffins) I was stuffed.  I'll definitely be back.

ReEtjN7AbG1nTMO9KvsMeQ.text: Love it here!  Great menu options and always great service!  Patio is very nice when weather isn't scorching hot in summer.  Fun place to be with friends!

hcVMvDATYhVQKRPQCbvZTA.text: This restaurant is absolutely amazing. I came here with two colleagues and we ate dinner off of their killer HH menu. We ordered the chicken flatbread, pork wings, bbq pork sliders, fish tacos and the market greens salad. We thought we'd order more food but it was plenty! Best HH I've ever seen!

jxw0yq6RxSx7DI0au9ZJSA.text: Great food as well as the services. Can't beat that. . Not a greasy heavy throw up full.. Great on lamb chop Fondue, interesting food but tastes nice at a reasonable price...Also loved Rainbow trout - Great to feed a family of big boys! They are always full and satisfied

XKoLRc-p8gb9xQjSuug0Iw.text: I visited Roaring Fork for the first time last weekend and I have nothing but good things to say about it. The atmosphere is more upscale and relaxing but very nice. The bread before dinner was phenominal and we all started with Tortilla soup which I would recommend to anyone that likes tortilla soup, it was AMAZING.   More of a place I would go for an important dinner or a nicer date, I will definitely be going back!

OAsRWnW61JS6W_9mKpLtqQ.text: Definitely a more upscale vibe. Went in after a day of shopping and felt extremely underdressed! Ordered chile con queso with carnitas as an appetizer and it was so delicious. The margaritas were perfect. A little bit pricey but definitely recommended.

gR8jtytFbnRWfRWjCRcvIA.text: My husband and I had a date night decided to try our the Roaring Fork. The service was great. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. We were there during restaurant week and decided to try the duck. It was amazing. The creme brule we chose for dessert was scrumptious. We will definitely be going back!

-gicx2yS9P-faBtEwFPO3Q.text: We went for Happy Hour and found the drinks and food to be first class. The atmosphere and service were also very good. In fact we were so impressed, we returned 3 nights later for dinner and had an equally good experience. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. You can sit by the bar, in the dinning room or on 1 of the 2 patios. I definitely will return to the Roaring Fork!

0gicTX1t1itzE3-2k8PMdw.text: Probably had my expectations too high, but, I sat at the bar by myself while traveling for a conference and thought that it could be a lot better: Food: - mussels were delicious - ordered the 8oz filet medium rare. There was so much salt on the filet that my mouth felt worse than movie theater popcorn..  Drink: - recommended Cab was underwhelming  Service: - bartender service left me waiting after finishing my app and water - food arrived without silverware which I waited ~5 minutes for - the bartender talked so much to other patrons, I really struggled to get things that I needed to..eat my dinner!!

eQ-PONpOr4qSgafU-AFSBQ.text: Happy hour is awesome- fantastic apps and Bebe but get there early as the seats fill up fast.  Service is great , never been disappointed

rhfkGvhLD_CkAMpsmNK1Pw.text: Came for all night Sunday happy hour! Enjoyed the huckleberry margarita (good!), Caesar salad (standard), kettle of green chili pork (amazing!), and rotisserie chicken flatbread (good and filling). Plenty of food for 2

Nj9K-bkOzUreRRD7mem9Lg.text: This is a great place - consistently good tasting food and great atmosphere. We always make a reservation, the place gets busy!

suGQUUqoczBhAsgQXhYqiw.text: Excellent food and impeccable service. My glass was always full and there was always someone watching our table even when our waiter was elsewhere. I had a hankering for pork tonight, so have the chile pork appetizer and bacon wrapped pork for dinner. Succulent and cooked to perfection. This was truly the best meal I've had in a while.  The restaurant is designed to keep the noise at bay. It was a full house and we couldn't even hear the people next to us. I will definitely be returning.

9XyY3t4T7Qq6c7NgtbMeAg.text: good service but food only fair. ordered ceasar salad taco soup, halibut and new york steak (rare) the taco soup and halibut were okay but the ceasar salad was only fair. the steak was overcooked and quite tough. decent sides. our first visit and we do not expect to return.

Q05OU2AosxzAR6B5ZeuGlQ.text: Visited Arizona for summer week - too hot to grill (120 degrees out) after work so we opted to bar hop to happy hours every night - 2 adults, 2 kids (11/13 yrs old). Roaring Fork got #1 family rating of about 10 that we tried in a week's time. So much so that we returned - on time, 4PM - and there was a line waiting so they could grab a seat!. Best menu items - BIG BAD Hamburg - is exactly what it says HUGE!, loved fish tacos, never heard of pork wings (the shoulder) but they had a unique taste between pork and a chickenwing, soup nicely served with presentation, guacamole lacked some flavor but was clearly fresh avocados smashed! While the green chilles pork sampler was good, it was alittle spicey and really not my thing but had to try it since it was a signature dish. Refreshing cocktail options for $5.00 this place couldn't be beat. Quality of food amazing. Its nice that if this is a retirement community that these restaurants offer this happy hour to make fine dining experiences affordable. If this is year round - Pheonix may see me living here one day. Great time - great food

br7uLvNaXXLpe-LWP9ZgzA.text: My favorite happy hour spot... And my cousin agrees! We have come here several times for their fabulous kettle chilli verde pork and martinis. Both of these items are on the happy hour menu. Other favorites are the flatbread, big ass burger (yes it's ginormous), and their amazing fish tacos.  My best friend loves their huckleberry margaritas. I've been coming to this place for happy hour for the past 7 years and will be a continuing customer because of their delectable and affordable bites. Thank you RF!

9dkMK__BBgVySSWpxqUBSA.text: Great Food but extremely rude when we showed up with an infant. Even though we included the child on the Open Table reservation, we were treated poorly by the hostess. Their website says "child friendly", not so much. Our child was very quite and well behaved. We would not have brought him if he was not "restaurant tested". We would have appreciated a little more honesty on the website. We fully understand if Roaring Fork doesn't want children in their establishment, but feel that they should be honest on their website. There are so many wonderful restaurants in Scottsdale, we'll choose another one in future.

jEqOOQ1eYjnF7B4r59LuwA.text: Just the other day I took my father to this restaurant for his 40th birthday. Just a few months prior he took me here to celebrate my own birthday and we had a phenomenal experience. Our waitress then was extremely personable and caring. She didn't overwhelm us and she frequently came by to make sure that our dining experience was worth while, so much so that we gave her a 35 dollar tip. However when I took my father there yesterday, we did not get the same experience with this waitress.  We were seated towards one of the back booths and sat there for about 20 to 30 minutes unattended. After some time, she came to our booth in a very disrespectful manner to which I even signalled over to my father about when it happened. She came by and eyed us to shut up rather than speaking to us like people and in doing so that was the only time that we spoke. She took our order and never came back. She had other waiters drop off bread and our food, and she was never back at our booth again.  What made it worse was the fact that when the food was dropped off to our table, our dirty plates from the bread and the butter was still there. Our dirty silverware was never replaced and our table had nothing but bread crumbs all over it. The woman who dropped off our meal apparently saw nothing wrong with any of it as she quickly dropped off our meal and left.  What I think is the most spiteful was the fact that our food was stone cold. I ordered the half chicken and the chicken itself was so dry that it was almost inedible and the string beans were hard, which leads me to believe that they left our food out for quite sometime. My father's fries were so cold that the ketchup was warmer and his burger had bacon all over it (which we adamantly told the waitress that he can't have any bacon due to religious beliefs). What made it worse was that my father had to flag down another waitress just to get our dirty plates and silverware away and he requested to have another waitress tend to our table. The manager came over and apologized to us but my father's birthday experience was ruined. This was supposed to be a big and meaningful birthday dinner but it was the exact opposite. To compound it our old waitress came back around to a table near us and loudly laughed and treated them with a greater amount of respect because she knew that we had raised a complaint towards her.  Its gotten to the point where I would feel more comfortable to not ever step my foot in this establishment again. That waitress fit the notion of the term "Snottsdale" and she led us to believe that she held a racial bias towards us because we were an African American family in a predominately white establishment, to which she treated everyone else around us like royalty. But our money was no different than anyone else's and my father deserved so much more than that. I worked many hours at my job while I was sick and not feeling well just so that I could save up enough money to treat him to a nice evening and this is the thanks that we get. Our meal was covered by the manager but our new waitress looked at us like we were complainers and treated us as such, but don't worry I am absolutely sure that we will not return again.

iqbaYROi9NkUuhnZGLJGFA.text: Very good food! Loved the chorizo cheese dip and mexican street corn. Burgers and steaks amazing. Short ribs good, but a little too much sauce. Creme brulee top was burned and chewy. Service was great! Fast and friendly.

4Cno1SFjwPxh6PfbdJMcrw.text: I went there for Happy Hour, and it was amazing! We started off with the guacamole and the green pork chili. Both were very fresh, and were awesome!  Especially when mixed together. Then we had the big ass burger. Wow!!! That was one tasty burger!!! Great staff! Definitely going again !!!!

oVSRWRU3jJwuaWvCRnAAxA.text: GREAT meal.  Was a party of six and they sat us alone, outside, under the tent. The seating was a bit odd, especially given the fact the restaurant was only half full. Putting that aside, the server was great, and food outstanding. The Chicken Tortilla soup was great, as were the fish taco's.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

jUnNVQj0On2EZddaUfvCeA.text: Loving their during-the-summer-happy-hour-never-expires credo! Very nice.  I went here after work one evening and the place was packed (on a Wed or Thurs, maybe) w/HH/dinner crowds - always a good sign. Bar tables were occupied so I sat out on patio - don't worry, it was shaded w/misters around perimeter. Classy yet un-pretentious vibe that I sensed also.   Service was quick, friendly, and communication was ongoing throughout the evening - 5 stars there!   I tried their Huckleberry Marg - so delicious! Plus, loved their presentation - huckleberry (preserve?) at bottom layer, then frozen marg, then one huckleberry dollop on top center. Sorta reminded me of a nipple, but was refreshing nevertheless.  Since it was my 1x/week cheat-from-diet day, I ordered the kettle pork app w/flour tortillas. So dreamy! I had one, but then my internal guilt was screaming at me to refrain from 86-ing the rest, so I had the server sweep my goodness away. Booo!   Also ordered the Peach Arnold Palmer. It was just "eh" for me. Overkill of the peach flavoring and really sweet.  Almost felt like I was drinking a small bottle of Bath & Body Works peach lotion, but the alcohol in it helped it go down.

kK7Rwp_rKFZUUxNNyHHOqQ.text: Went here the other night and the space is really fun with an open kitchen concept.  This was not the first time we have been here but the first time I have written a review.   We were seated outside and there was a private party going on.  They were doing a video and it was very loud.  Had they told us that was going on out on the patio we would have probably opted out of sitting out there.  The other thing about the patio and where we were sitting was there was no air movement so it was really hot out there and it was a cooler evening.  On to the food.  It is restaurant week and they have a 3 course prix fixe menu.  2 of us went with that.  I started with the spinach salad.  It had way to much dressing on it to the point where the spinach was soggy.  The soft boiled egg on it was incredible.  Really creamy- outstanding really.  I got the pork porterhouse.  It was just ok for me and pork is one of those things I tend to eat out a lot because it always taste better in a restaurant. I didn't think this hit the mark.  I finished with the coconut cream pie which was a complete disappointment.  The custard never set up and it was runny.  The best meal of the evening hands down was the pork tenderloin.  The grits with the corn was excellent.  The best dessert?  The root beer float.

ucDDV_XCKLugTDYRk_sxfA.text: A little late, but hey, I'm getting it posted. In February of '11, I came here solo, and had the duck. It was superb, with a nice cool beer as the drinking compliment. The restaurant ambiance of weathered wood, and attention to service by staff were other items I noticed. I can highly (though belatedly, of course) recommend RF for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy duck dinner --superb meal!
Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The main entrance--Feb. of &#39;11.

_asBbl8wIr-3KvYpfv9RTg.text: I would give it 4.5 if I could. Queso con puerco was really good! Better than I expected. The manager saw that we wanted happy hour and got us sat just outside the bar but let us still get happy hour; amazing service! The pork was amazing! Got it to go and it was still good! Our server Matthew was great I will request him next time I am in.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

tn6BdIOnZ5Aqsc6B5Q0ACQ.text: Great burger. Happy hour specials and atmosphere are great.  Service was excellent both times I was there a year apart.

vpmGMMYxnWElJ97SdC1lvQ.text: Delish! Pecan pie dessert was to die for!!!! Happy hour prices are great. From out of town and so glad we checked Yelp and found this gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Roaring Fork - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. O M G so damn good!

CTnxupAXmS-orPwlgyv1Mw.text: Spinach chicken waldorf salad was superb! Boyfriend enjoy his big burger as did the kid enjoy his kids burger. The fries are delicious and the server was friendly and knowledgeable. We will certainly be returning for another wonderful exprrience.

BpYx9Q6XmgEHOId1Ui8AAw.text: My husband and I went here, after a recommendation, for our Anniversary.  I called in advance for a reservation (don't think it is required) and when I called they asked if it was a special occasion. I told her it was our Anniversary.  We arrived 30 minutes early and they seated us early (only waited 5 minutes).  When we got to our table there was an Anniversary card signed by all the staff and a rose on our table.  Sweet!  The waitress was very nice.  We ordered the Beef Ribs (which was amazing, falling off the bone) and the Salmon (so good).  We received a complementary dessert since our Anniversary.  The Huckleberry Cheesecake...MMM!!!  I highly recommend this place for a date!  Romantic and Intimate!

JfuEXh7tZQv5Du9gndRo9Q.text: Roaring Fork is a solid restaurant.  First and most importantly, the food is overall quite good!  Definitely a meat-eaters restaurant - would avoid if you are a vegetarian.  We tried the queso con puerco as an appetizer.  Pretty good though not spectacular - basically melted cheese with a small portion of pork topping, which is a nice touch.  For entrees, the pork carnitas are fantastic.  Very tender and nice flavor.  Bacon-wrapped pork tenderloin is also excellent - also perfectly cooked, tender, and the bacon... who doesn't like bacon!!  As a side, we tried the often mentioned green chili mac and cheese.  This was definitely good, though I do admit that I was slightly underwhelmed probably because of my overly high-expectations.  The macaroni itself was decent, though the crisp cheese topping was tasty.  Price is reasonable considering the pricey trend of Scottsdale restaurants.  Expect to pay high teens to mid-high 20s for entrees.  Service was great!  Other Yelpers described slow service, but this was not my experience.  Our waitress was prompt, friendly, and helpful, and we were frequently checked-on to confirm our meal was up to par.  No complaints.  Decor is nice.  We liked the ambience, and the kitchen can be entertaining to observe.  Would be a nice date place, since it's quaint and not overly loud.  Will be back!

ixUYsrXDW1abgjmq2V3oiw.text: Our night at this restaurant was nothing short of superb. Our whole family (8 people) were in town for my dad's birthday. We thought going to an early dinner would be a good idea with a large party, but when we got to the restaurant we were told that the wait would be a couple hours for a party of our size....we were bummed and using the lobby area to yelp somewhere else to go. While there the manager (Matthew) came over to me and my sister saying that he overheard we had a large party and he might have a solution. He had a large table on the patio that was just wrapping up, in less than 10 minutes we were seated and being waited on by our lovely waitress Alex. Her service was top notch and non stop.... Then the food and drinks started flowing. We ordered the green Chile pots, guac, pork wings, tenderloin, fish tacos, big ass burger, iceberg BLT salad and chicken flatbread pizza. Everything was so delicious, seriously drool worthy. If i had to recommend one item it would be the pork wings, unique, flavorful, tender and crispy. Little flavor bombs! Our cocktails were delightful, delicious and refreshing.... Most refreshing of all was the unparalleled customer service we got from start to finish. We will definitely be back... Our dessert too was so amazing, the creme brulee and pecan pie. The pie was like nothing you've ever had before. Thank you Matthew and Alex for making my dad's birthday a year to remember.

4AbLFkYbpNq6HSQ3WLw21g.text: DARYL SCORES AGAIN.  I promised our server (obviously Daryl) that I was going to call him out by name in our review.  We found Roaring Fork through Yelp and while the reviews we read weren't 100% favorable, we thought most were very positive.  We were not disappointed at all.  A reservation was easy to make on short notice (even on a Friday night) probably since we were hoping to eat early, having skipped lunch.  On arrival our party of two was seated in a bar type booth directly across from the kitchen area.  Some diners might have thought that to not be the best location, as there was a ton of traffic of servers picking up orders but we enjoyed watching the activity and the kitchen preparations.  Better yet, we were greeted quickly by our server - Daryl - who took our drink requests and explained the special menu items for the night.  First, we enjoyed a marguerite and a glass of the house Chardonnay.  Both were good.  Our appetizer was the guacamole which was one of the best we've had, complimented by the lightest chips ever.  Main courses were (1) a mixed green salad with grilled salmon and (1) the bacon-wrapped pork tenderloin served on a bed of corn grits.  Both were exceptional but the pork tenderloin is what will bring me back each time we visit Scottsdale.  It was simply fantastic.    I just hope we can visit this area again soon.

Smt0FCCsO_CGFwLXspgqmA.text: WOW ... where do I start?! It has been a little over a year since I ate at the Roaring Fork. I recalled the experience fondly and agreed to meet a group there for dinner. Place was crowded (as I recall) and we chose to sit at a high top bar table in the bar. Staff was amazingly attentive. We cruised through a couple of rounds of drinks and the three of us were about to settle on all of us ordering the house specialty ... fried chicken when the restaurant manager stopped by the table and had a nice chat with us. He succeeded in convincing of person in our party to order the rib eye that was the special of the day ... the person accepted the managers suggestion.  About 5 minutes later the waitress stopped by WITH the manager to inform our table the person that they had just run out of the rib eye, would he possibly be considered in anything else, perhaps the Filet at the special price? The person agreed to order the fried chicken and join the others.  We received a complimentary mac and cheese side to share and here is the astonishing part - what sets the Roaring Fork apart from some man others ...  We received the bill which was delivered by the manager to our table. He apologized again for the order mix up and welcomed us back. He informed us that make for the experience he had removed ALL of the drinks from the tab AS WELL as the cost of the meal for the person who was not able to have the rib eye ... REALLY!!  Most restaurants just give you the HO HUM sorry we are out ... pick something else. Customer service ... boy do they get it. I will be going out of my way to go back, recommend it wherever I can and share this story.  If you want to experience not just good food, a wonderful night out or a cozy venue - go to the Roaring Fork and get one of the best culinary experiences you can find in the valley.

7SKB4GqSAQ01iNHdBZQnlg.text: Go. Now. Perfect patio, even in the summer with fans and misters we were very comfortable. Wait staff was on point. Happy hour deals were a steal. We had a variety of drinks, all outstanding. My favorite was the mojito. We ordered the guac, pork wings, flat bread and fish tacos. Yep a ton of food and ate it all. Order the pork wings and make sure you have a fork full of the pickled carrots and onion with each amazing bite. It will change your life.

oyx40_ofvWZgcmmrYbgriQ.text: Fantastic food, atmosphere and service! The pork chop was perfectly prepared and the tortilla soup was amazing. The salmon and duck were just slightly overcooked but had great flavor.

pceKrWm6xC4HyoIj4_gUhw.text: Fantastic happy hour all day on Sundays and Mondays. The food isn't cheap like you would expect for happy hour but drinks are cheap. The food is worth the price. Must try prime rib sliders with carmelized onions and horseradish cream and au jus; green chile pork; queso with green chile pork - too die for. Tried the green chile macaroni and cheese and it was just okay. Must get the prime rib sliders.

2Cz3SXFxoRX-kByT_xDsLA.text: A great place. very pleasant atmosphere and good service. A dish I would avoid: Cioppino. This is a kind of bouillabaisse. Could not find all the ingredients mentioned in the menu. Too much of the potato filler [about one third of the dish]. $30 - way too high for that.

DKrEUWOC_tCEMvdk0l2BfA.text: The food was great, the service was awesome and we loved the open kitchen.  I'd just think the food was a tad overpriced.  We would definitely come back.  We really loved the interior.

RXWonT1Iv9vWvB1in7fEcg.text: The name Roaring Fork is a misnomer.  My fork never actually roared, but he did kick up quite a ruckus.  At the beginning of the meal, he just laid there idle next to spoon, knife, and little brother; 'roaring' salad fork....not a peep out of the four of them.  I think he was plotting his sinister moves on my entree while watching me wolf the bread basket and chef's free appetizer, his presence not required.  But then dinner arrived and it was showtime. He busted out.  Viciously attacking our Waldorf chicken salad, he literally left me breathless. I was like Michael Phelps, sipping what little amount of air I could gather between bites. It all happened so fast. The entire meal a blur.  Two Waldorf chicken salads and two waters came to forty-two bucks, fifty with the tip.  But to see that little bastard in action was well worth the price of admission, even though he did remain conspicuously silent throughout his little shit-show.  I think he might be related to Michigan Frog....only roaring for the owner or something.

SO-mAvTg_rRsOksRsMxStw.text: Great service! Highly recommend trying the green chili pork! Big a** burger was also delicious. Came to the table a little under but was quickly fixed. Would rather it come under than over. Only negative comment would be the distracted hostess when I first entered. Was talking with a couple servers about something one their phone. Otherwise a wonderful experiance will definitely be returning.

ne_1kFRraHnYQxmYGgNCZA.text: Me and my man went here against his strong dislike for any sort of "fancier" restaurants. We were both pleasantly surprised. The service from start to finish was outstanding. Our waiter was attentive and patient. He was informative and engaging. The food, was like eating a portion of heaven. From the fish tacos to the brisket and mashed potatoes and the root beer float. It was a most enjoyable experience. The total cost was also reasonable. Not an every day adventure for sure, but we will definitely return!
